title: Super stay at Casablanca
text: Our Casablanca stay was most excellent. From the morning breakfast to the having the room made, from the door man always smiling to open the main doors and valauble advice from front office ... it made stay easy, friendly and secure. Special shoutout to Jeffrey at Front Desk for all his great advice and guidance!

title: Wonderful hotel
text:
This is a wonderful hotel, steps from Times Square and easily accessible to all that one would want to do. Despite being very close to Times Square it was very quiet and peaceful.  
The staff are wonderful - they are friendly and go out of their way to help.  They genuinely seem to want you to have a good time.
Their breakfast is far nicer and more robust than most hotels included continental breakfast and they have a lovely lounge where one can have breakfast and relax through out the day.
The bedrooms are comfortable with surprisingly large and well appointed bathrooms.
All in all a lovely stay and where I will stay on future trips to NYC.

title: Times Square Gem
text: My husband and live in NYC. We had tickets to a broadway show and dinner reservations at Tony DiNapoli. We appreciated the warm hospitality at the reception desk. Well appointed boutique hotel with an excellent location! The snacks, coffee, tea, water and continental breakfast were a huge plus! They will provide a small refrigerator free of charge if you ask for one. My only constructive feedback is that our Queen bed was really a full. We still managed and had a great stay!

title: This Hotel Has It All!
text:
The Casablanca has become our new favorite place to stay in NYC! What a gem. I'm almost afraid to say how good it is, because I don't want it to become too popular!
Anyway, we have stayed there a few times now, and we love the fact that it's a small boutique hotel with a location practically in the middle of Times Square, yet so quiet. The decor suits the name, and the rooms are spacious for NYC, and beautifully clean. We still can't believe that there's a 24 hour snack bar in the Rick's Cafe lounge area, with seltzers, coffees of all kinds, snacks, etc--all included in the room price.  Plus, you get a wonderful continental breakfast with hard boiled eggs, cereals, rolls and croissants, yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels (which they will gladly toast for you), oatmeal (which they will happily cook up for you! ) What more can I say? This hotel has everything we could possibly want when visiting the Big Apple. We wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.

title: Charming!
text:
I have really liked this charming hotel. The lounge looks like country villa in Europe, very cozy.
The staff is great, accommodating to your every need.
Location is terrific! The Broadway theater was really a few steps away. We have also enjoyed the restaurant next door, Tony's. 
I would definitely returned.

title: Wonderful "Home away from Home"
text:
I chose the Casablanca Hotel as our home away from home to celebrate my grand daughter's 16th birthday.  We couldn't have been more pleased!  For our 5 play extravaganza, the location was perfect.  We loved Rick's Cafe and made several new friends, as we stopped in for a cup of tea, breakfast, or a quick snack.  Such a lovely benefit and place to relax and unwind.
A very special thank you to James, who gave us excellent advice and even  helped book a late addition play.  The lovely ladies at breakfast remembered that my grand daughter liked blueberry bagels and held one back for her to enjoy.  We felt so lucky to feel as if we were part of the family!  We will recommend to all our friends!

title: Ruhiges Hotel an bester Lage
text:
Wir haben 3 Nächte in diesem Hotel an bester Lage verbracht.
Trotz des sehr zentralen Standortes ist es im Hotel erstaunlich ruhig und man kann sich gut auch mal eine Weile zurückziehen.
Sehr geschätzt haben wir die Möglichkeit des Frühstücks mit verschiedenen Süssigkeiten, Bagels, Obst, Saft sowie Tee, Kaffee & heisser Schokolade.
Snacks und Getränke sind ganztags gratis verfügbar!
Das gesamte Personal ist aussergewöhnlich freundlich und hilfsbereit.
Wenn es etwas zu kritisieren gibt, dann ist es das doch sehr kleine Badezimmer.
Wir würden das Hotel wieder wählen.

title: “I think this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship”
text: Casablanca is an absolute gem!  Having worked in hospitality for over 20+ years, I am aware of what it means to have pride in your service.  From the first step into the property to the last step out the door, it was a wonderful experience. Great hospitality. Wonderful service. Clean rooms. Steps from Times Square. A delightful experience all around. Thank you for a wonderful, memorable stay!

title: Feeling at Home in the Heart of the City!
text: I have stayed here 5 times in the past year, and I LOVE it!  Great location, and great place with an AMAZING staff!  They actually make the effort to know who you are and help you with anything you may  need.  They are kind, considerate, professional and accommodating and all for an excellent price (especially for a Boutique Hotel).  I always feel at home here and will keep coming back!

title: Casablanca Hotel Rocks!
text: The hotel was in a great location relative to Times Square and the Theatre District, was very traditional and very clean. The staff was very friendly and attentive, and we also enjoyed the small cafe in the hotel for drinks and snacks.We would definitely stay here again!

title: Great hotel!
text: Great stay in a suite with 2 doubles and pullout sofa bed. Loved the breakfasts, snacks and water/soft drinks available during the day. Never a queue or wait for breakfast or for the lifts. Everyone was so friendly and the complimentary bottle of wine for a birthday was great! So quiet and peaceful yet so close to Times Square. Highly recommend!

title: Loved it!!
text: This boutique hotel is perfectly situated right near Times Square and has top-notch service! The second floor free snack area that’s open 24-hours a day is such a great asset! We would definitely stay here again — especially since we got a free room upgrade!!

title: Great Hotel
text: 5 day family trip to NYC.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Really liked that the room had a ceiling fan.  Parking garage is right next to hotel.  Hotel is right on Times Square and near subway and bus stops, as well as many restaurants.  Very impressed with Casablanca!

title: A highlight of our trip, great service and an oasis in the middle of midtown
text:
This was the first time we had stayed here and had a really awesome experience. We normally stay in Hilton properties with our family but the one in NYC was under construction this time. The Casablanca has so much more going for it, so this is where we will be staying in the future. 

The first difference is the service culture displayed by the excellent staff. James at check-in, and John on the door and evenings were particularly pleasant. The ladies serving breakfast and housekeeping were top notch as well.

The second floor lounge was a stand out. We spent a lot of time here for a quick mid-day break or at the end of our days decompressing. They serve a very nice continental breakfast of hard-boiled eggs, pastries, bagels, toast, oatmeal, cereal and yogurt with juice, tea and several types of coffee. They keep the area open all day and have energy bars, chips, water, soda, tea, hot cocoa and coffee. There is a lot of cozy areas to eat and never was completely full.

The hotel is Moroccan themed but not overly so. The room was a nice size for our family of five as we had two full beds and a pull out sofa. The beds/sheets were comfortable and everything was very clean. The sofa bed was not quite as comfortable but my teenager had no issues on it. There was a privacy door to separate the two rooms. The shower had good water pressure and we just cracked a window to get rid of the steam.

The location is really prime as it was only 1 block off of Times Square where you will find a lot of action, theatres and restaurants but also the hub for many subway lines. It is exciting and loud but surprisingly the hotel was very quiet only a few steps away. We treated it like an oasis to recharge with a midday power nap or a relaxing way to review a fun, busy day in NYC. 

The Casablanca is moderately priced but everything in NYC is relatively expensive. Looking back we felt that it was one of the highlights of our trip, gave us the best service (compared to the airlines, restaurants, etc) and was perfect for our needs. Therefore it was a good value and we will be back.

title: A relaxing hotel in centrum New York
text: From the moment we stepped into Hotel Cassablanca in New York, we were enveloped in luxury and warmth. The staff greeted me with genuine smiles and impeccable service, making me feel like a valued guest from the start. The room was not only spacious and beautifully decorated but also spotlessly clean, providing a comfortable haven after a day of exploring the city. The location couldn't be better, with easy access to all the attractions New York has to offer. The amenities were top-notch. We can't wait to return to Hotel Cassablanca for another unforgettable stay!"

title: Great Stay in New York
text: We love the Casablanca Hotel. The staff are so nice and friendly, and the accommodations are very nice. It is a small, older, boutique hotel, so of course, the rooms are on the smaller side, but they are efficient and very clean. The staff never hesitate to answer a question or help you out, and the second floor lounge is a great place to get some work done while your "roommates" are still sleeping, and there is a great coffee machine. One suggestion that I would make is to do a little more to ensure safety at the front door when the door-person is not present. It would be good to have key access only in the later evening hours, and key access to the elevator at all times. It is located in an extremely busy area of the city, and it would make it feel just a bit more safe if there were some safeguards to prevent people who shouldn't be in the hotel from entering. With that being said, there was only one time that no one was present when we entered. Despite the location in Times Square (which isn't our favorite area to stay), it is one of our favorite hotels in New York.

title: Why Stay Anywhere Else in NYC?
text: There aren't enough superlatives to describe my stays here. Each time (at least 8 times) I have stayed there , I have found more to Love. I praise its location...steps from Times Square, and never hearing the buzz from it in  any of my guest rooms. The staff treat me like family.The front desk staff couldn't be friendlier. The door staff are never without a smile. The morning breakfast is super; the staff even know/anticipate that I want my sesame bagel toasted. The cappuccino/espresso machine produces unbelievably good coffee beverages. The rooms and bathrooms are spotless and daily service to them is seamless. The Library is open all day...and often I find myself there at lunch having a cappuccino and a banana or granola bar. Its a perfect place to unwind from a busy day walking the city. This is a small, wonderful hotel...and I wouldn't call it a boutique hotel because that , to me, connotes a certain attitude. This place has no stiffness or stuffiness...just a friendly, warm welcoming ambience.

title: We loved this hotel!
text: My husband and I stayed at Casablanca in March ‘24 for my birthday weekend.  The hotel was quaint, and the hospitality was superb.  Clean, great location, and cozy accommodations.  The hotel is small, which makes the experience even more personable. We will definitely stay there again!

title: March 2024 NYC Trip
text: The staff is the best staff at any hotel.  They are so friendly and accommodating.  I would highly recommend this hotel the next time in NYC.  Great location and very clean.  Awesome job by all staff Front Desk, Night Staff, Cleaning Crew, etc....very nice to have drinks and snacks available 24/7 if needed.  Thanks to all for your hospitality and if we are back in NYC, we will be staying here.

title: An oasis in NYC
text: This boutique hotel is a treasure in NYC. The staff could not be more accommodating and nice. The rooms are great and the lounge which is available all the time is the perfect place to relax and regroup. James at the front desk is the perfect ambassador for the hotel!

title: our favorite hotel
text: Casablanca is our go to place when we come to nyc.  can't beat the location--by theaters, restaurants, Bryant park.  but best is the service and the atmosphere.  the lounge is open 24 hours so meeting up there after shows helps to top off the day.

title: Casablanca hotel....Amazing!!!!
text:
Fantastic hotel, a Staff that cannot do enough for you, fantastic location in Times Square.
Would highly (very highly) recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a fantastic time in NYC.
Walkable to so many exciting places, great bars, restaurants, tourist attractions. It's Times Square need i say more!

title: Peaceful Oasis in the Heart of Time Square
text: What a great find in the heart of Times Square.  The staff were all so accommodating and helpful; the rooms were immaculate and very comfortable.  It was like a peaceful oasis in the midst of all that is Times Square.  Rick's Cafe was a great place to unwind in front of the fireplace after being out in the cold and rain.  Road / sidewalk noise unnoticeable in our guest room.  We've already recommended to friends and will make it our home base when we return to NYC.

title: great staying at Casablanca
text: a great sweet cozy hotel, right by Time square,  staff is super friendly, rooms in reality are better than pictures... (they need to improve their photo techniques...  hahaha), i enjoyed staying with them, and definitely will come back again, my home in New York.

title: Great hotel!
text: Our first time in NYC.  Quiet so close to Time Square!  The lounge is great.  A quiet space to have a coffee and snack.  Room was nice, staff was amazing.  No complaints and I complain a lot.  Wife loved it as well.  We wouldn't stay anywhere else now if back in NYC.

title: Another fantastic stay in the Big Apple
text: Our stay recently was incredible. They greet you when you walk in, "welcome home".   That's exactly how we feel.  I have lost count of how many stays we have had at this hotel, but I will never stay anywhere else.  James at the front desk was so personable.  Always nice chatting with him.  The attendants in Rick's Cafe were always so friendly and helpful.  My only request would be to bring back the wine and cheese in the evening!

title: Book it and Enjoy!!
text: I chose this hotel in its proximity to the Al Hirschfeld Theatre as well as the rave reviews on Trip Advisor.  Any review would pale in comparison to actually staying here.  The initial welcome reception never waned throughout our stay.  The staff are genuinely there to make your stay a most pleasurable experience.  Our room was lovely, bed supremely comfortable, bathroom clean, finely designed, well stocked with towels and gorgeous bath products. What put our experience over the top was the common room on the second floor where they serve a continental breakfast.  It's a great 2 rooms, comfy lounge chairs, fireplace, games, books to review and a well stocked table of snacks and beverages available at all times!! Book it and enjoy!!

title: Exceptional hotel with character just steps from Times Square
text: I chose Casablanca Hotel because it is a smaller hotel with only 6 floors, making it easy for me to utilize the stairs instead of the elevators. This hotel is such a gem. We were able to check-in early AND received a free room upgrade! Hotel location is amazing. Staff members were all super personable and helpful. Room and all common areas were exceptionally clean. The resort fee was worth the money just for the bottled water alone. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to family and friends, and will also be staying again.

title: Perfect for Family Travel
text: All the staff were friendly and helpful. The ladies who handled breakfast (included with the room) were great at keeping things,like the tasty pastery, stocked.  They even cut the oranges for you.  :)  We particularly liked having the lounge to bring back dinner and a bottle of wine on evenings where we didn't want to sit at a restaurant after a long day of exploring the city.  Rooms were clean, location was amazing, staff great.  We will stay here again for sure!

title: Amazing, helpful staff, lovely hotel, great location
text:
Really friendly staff from James on reception (massive thx for all your top tips) to the ladies in the breakfast room - you guys all looked after us soooo well

The hotel is right in the middle of Times Square - perfect location for exploring NY.

Rooms are spacious and comfortable 

We really liked the small hotel experience :-))

We will definitely be back

title: Great hotel with history 🙂
text: Great hotel with interesting history. While the style may seem a little dated, it oozes character and emphasises the history as the former Hotel Metropole (Great Gatsby and Herman Rosenthal case). The location is fantastic, mere steps away from Times Square with a wealth of restaurants & entertainment venues. The staff are welcoming, helpful and informative. The hotel provides a free continental breakfast and has a comfortable lounge with free drinks and snacks. The biggest benefit is this is a low rise building, I have vertigo so it was ideal. The rooms were spacious and well appointed, with comfortable beds. We really enjoyed staying at the Casablanca and hope to return one day.

title: Unbelievable service/hospitality
text: I've stayed in every type of hotel you can stay at, in various parts of the world. While I have had good/great service at some other hotels, NOTHING compares to what you get at this location. What the rooms kind of lack in overall size, the people who work there are what make it such a great experience. They bended over backwards to make our stay was as comfortable as possible, and they succeeded. I never write reviews about service unless it's terrible, but again, it was so good that it has to be recognized. Keep up the good work!!!!!

title: Awesome birthday trip
text: I come to New York for my birthday every year and stay for one night to see a Broadway show. I had an amazing trip this year. Everyone was so pleasant and my room was gorgeous. When I checked out they let me keep my bag there for the day until I was ready to head to the train station. And then they even gave me a free bottle of wine to take home since it was my birthday. This is my new favorite place and will absolutely be back next year 😊

title: Excellent, cheers!
text: Stayed here on a Thursday to Sunday long weekend. The staff are absolutely fantastic, couldn't do enough for you. Our room was a standard one and more than good enough. The real win though, well apart from the Hazelnut Coffee, was the bed. It was tremendously comfortable. Will deffo recommend this hotel to others.

title: Lovely Hotel in Times Square
text: I loved this boutique hotel. Located in times square but location was still quiet and safe. The Hotel is beautiful and staff go above and beyond to help with anything you need. They have free snacks and drinks in the lobby always available. I would definitely reccomend this place when in NYC

title: Top notch service at a charming hotel.
text: We check out of the Casablanca tomorrow and I don’t want to leave. The staff is top notch. They are always available for personalized service with a smile. If you’re looking for a hotel with history and charm, you’ll find it here at the Casablanca. The 2nd floor snack/coffee lounge was a lovely place to unwind after hours of exploring. The location is perfect if you want to be near Times Square. With all that the hotel has to offer, I can’t wait to return.

title: Delightful
text: It’s like home, with great service and attention to all our needs. We frequent ed the cozy lounge and fireplace after long evenings out,  and  warmed up by the fire with the wonderful snacks and hot drinks for our convenience.  We had a big selection of coffee,  tea bagels, pastries, eggs and cereals, fruit and juices before we headed out each day. The staff is delightful!

title: Casablanca Hotel- an oasis just steps from Times Square
text: The Casablanca hotel is a beautifully serene oasis just steps from Times Square. The staff were friendly and professional. We really enjoyed the sitting lounge with its lovely fireplace and beverage/snack bar after hiking the streets of New York all day!

title: Amazing
text: An absolutely charming hotel! Right in the middle of times square.  Staff is very attentive and helpful. Ricks cafe is a terrific place to sit and unwind. Hotel is close to everything...restaurants and broadway shows. Would definitely come back!

title: Perfect location and nice room
text: The room was very nice and they provided enough robes and slippers , much better than hotels in CA. And the location is perfect! 这家酒店位置就在时代广场旁边，出门右转再右转就到了。房间很舒服，各种洗漱用品和房间用品很丰富，装饰别具特色，给人一种老电影里的感觉。另外他们提供24小时的零食和饮料，早餐还行，能吃饱。

title: Quiet oasis, steps away from Times Square
text: Quiet oasis, just steps away from bustling Times Square, with two sets of subway lines close by (Bryant Park/42, & Times Square/42), struck just the right combination of friendly welcoming and convenience.  Our king bed room was relatively large by NYC standards, and while having no “view” - looked out over a small inner courtyard, - we rarely heard anything inside or outside.  We had all we needed (e.g., small table, 2 chairs, dresser, night tables with lamps, and a closet), and slept well all 4 nights.  Staff were very friendly and helpful -  both at ground level (e.g., when we left or returned, getting a cab at departure) and in the breakfast/snack area on the second floor.  Overall, a great value.  We’ll be back!

title: Wonderful Oasis Just Off Times Square
text: My wife, daughter and I spent two nights here last week because it showed up is a map search as highly rated and right around the corner from the theatre where we were seeing a show. We couldn't have been more pleased with everything about the hotel, from the universally friendly staff to the beautiful rooms to the second-floor lounge with all-day snacks to the quiet despite the noisy neighborhood. To top it off, the price was very reasonable for New York City. We will definitely be back! Highly recommended.

title: Book here!
text: Staff was above and beyond courteous. Hotel and room was spotless. Breakfast was excellent. Location was literally at Times Square and a stones throw from theaters. Went to dinner at Osteria Delbianco and was amazing! I cannot wait to go back!

title: Location, location and fab facilities
text: Really comfortable hotel with good guest facilities and located in such a convenient area. Walk to all the highlights you wish to see in the fab city of New York and gain the insights and care of the staff waiting to welcome you to this excellent hotel.

title: Great people, great location
text: The staff were consistently outstanding.  They were quick with a smile and genuinely interested in making your stay an outstanding experience.  Broadway theatres are steps away as is the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  That hustle and bustle is all left behind and unheard once in the hotel.

title: Location, Comfort, Food
text: Excellent location 2 doors down from Times Square, yet quiet.  Extremely comfortable beds.  Nice breakfast included, as well as 24/7 snacks, which are substantial. Nicely decorated, great service.  This will be my go-to hotel should I ever be lucky enough to visit NYC again.

title: Oasis near Times Square
text: Location was fantastic and the room was quiet. Staff were great - they were helpful at breakfast and I asked the front desk about the history of the hotel and got great stories. There was cold snap while I was there and the radiator in the room wasn't enough but I slept fine with extra blankets.

title: So close to the action but nice and quiet! EXCELLENT SERVICE
text: This hotel is by far our favorite stay so far in NYC! We go to NYC once a year and have stayed several locations and this one is best yet. The service is outstanding and the room was spacious. We absolutely love being able to relax in Rick's Café before and after a busy day in NYC. Our favorite thing to do is grab some Los Tacos down the street and bring back to eat.  OUTSTANDING STAY and we highly recommend to anyone searching for a nice, quiet spot but SO CLOSE to everything.

title: home away from home
text: The Casablanca Hotel is lovely, with fabulous staff, clean and comfortable rooms, and a beautiful breakfast lounge called Rick's Cafe, which is available all day, with snacks and coffee and tea. The doorman and the front desk clerk are welcoming and helpful. The staff in Rick's Cafe are extraordinarily kind, efficient, and friendly. A special thank you to Hilarissa who is extremely gracious and made us feel completely at home every morning.

title: An Easy Go-To in NYC
text: In a nutshell, the great staff makes for a great stay.  Aside from that, the property's location is amazing, and I spent a good amount of time in Rick's Cafe unwinding and enjoying the amenities.  I specifically requested the quietest room available (something often not really feasible in NYC, much less the Times Square area), but my room was wonderful and quiet, and made for a perfect respite from the city.

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: Very comfortable boutique hotel steps from Times Sq. Well equipt room was average size with large bathroom. Well decorated, friendly staff with a continental breakfast and 24 hour snacks and drinks available. We will definitely be back on our next visit to NYC.

title: Great location and ambiance
text: You would never believe that the Casablanca Hotel is steps from Times Square. It has a European feel and and is so convenient if you're in NYC to see a show. Wonderful friendly staff, beautiful roomy rooms, and in Rick's Cafe breakfast is included and coffee, tea and snacks are available 24/7. This is my go to spot in midtown.

title: Our Home Away from Home!
text:
Like coming home!  My wife and I recently spent a night at the Casablanca when we took in a Broadway show and had dinner near Times Square.  This is our second stay at the hotel this year (and we have three more visits planned).
As always, the staff was so friendly, the room was impeccably clean and comfortable, and the lounge was the icing on the cake!  We so enjoyed having a coffee and snack near the fireplace and we really enjoyed the variety of offerings at the continental breakfast in the morning.  Small in size but grand in comfort and convenience, the Casablanca is a treasure in Times Square.

title: A home away from home in the heart of Times Square
text:
A home away from home in the heart of Times Square. Seconds from broadway, restaurants and Times Square. 
Incredible staff, always welcoming and friendly plus they remember your name. Service is outstanding and rooms are spacious, highly recommend the suite. The continental breakfasts and snacks in the lounge area are an added bonus to an already outstanding hotel

title: Simply the best!
text: We love this hotel. It is centrally located for the theater district; easy taxis or subway to everywhere else. It's so nice to get out of a show and know you are just a short walk from "home". And what a welcoming, comfortable home it is. Rooms are NYC small, but adequate, with comfortable beds and windows that open to control winter overheating. Rick's Café on the second level offers snacks 24/7 and a very good continental breakfast. It's a lovely lounge with real fireplace in winter, open round the clock, so you can gather with others in your group for conversation and relaxation. We've also brought take out back here to eat when it fits best with plans. We've stayed here many times now and the hotel has maintained its high standards throughout the years. We've recommended to other friends who are now hooked. We'll be back!

title: Superb boutique hotel
text: December 2023 was our second visit to the Casablanca Hotel.  We selected this hotel for our first visit (Dec 2022) on the strength of the reviews and we were not disappointed - thus our return. The staff is top notch and ready to help with any request, especially those who work at Rick’s cafe.  The cafe is our favorite part of the hotel - a cozy lounge on the second floor where the continental breakfast is served and snacks, drinks, coffee and tea are available throughout the day.  It’s a great place to unwind after a busy day in the city.  The location can’t be beat  Broadway is maybe 100 ft away and the subway is not much farther.  Most theaters are within walking distance as is Central Park.  The rooms are comfortable and well appointed.  We will definitely be back when we return to NYC

title: Should I Keep This Gem of a Hotel Secret??
text:
My husband and I had tickets for a Billy Joel concert, and decided it would be best to stay overnight in the city. I did my research before we booked this hotel, and it exceeded all my highest expectations. We loved the cozy, comfortable atmosphere and the beautiful Moroccan inspired decor. Our Premium Queen room was more spacious than the usual NYC hotel room, and the elegant black and white tile bathroom was beautiful. The part we loved most, though, was Rick's Cafe on the 2nd floor. It's like a comfy living room, with lots of tables, couches and chairs, a fireplace and free snacks, water, coffee, sparkling water, soft drinks, etc. all day.  You can hang out with a group of friends and not worry about the noise bothering other guests. 
Also, how many boutique hotels in NYC give you a lovely continental breakfast? We never imagined how many options there would be, and were very surprised to find anything we could possibly wish to eat. There were hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, (which they prepare for you), cereals, yogurt, sweet rolls, toast, bagels (which they happily toast for you), fresh fruit, three kinds of coffee, and more!  We will never think of staying anywhere else when we come to the city. We even met some nice people who have been coming there for over 16 years. That truly says something about a hotel. Everything in our room was immaculate, and the staff just couldn't do enough for us. I am going back there in March with some female relatives for a Girls Weekend theater trip, and I know my family members will be just thrilled with staying there!  Maybe I shouldn't even be writing this review, since it might be better to have the Casablanca Hotel be a well-kept secret!

title: Happy New Year 2024
text:
Once in a lifetime perfect New Year’s Eve. This was my 3rd stay at the hotel, first time getting the New Years Package.  The hotel continues to deliver. Great shower, nice towels, linens improved since last stay and great pillows. We splurged for the king suite, was perfect for the 4 night stay. Location is perfect- can walk everywhere. 

New Years package was as complete as it could be. Great party paraphernalia, music, balloons and great staff. Lovely dinner and breakfast. The VIP walk to the front of the ball was unexpected and the rooftop viewing of the ball drop was perfect!!  Anyone wanting to check the NYC ball drop off their bucket list should consider this location. 

The best part of this stay.. are the staff. All are friendly, kind and really work hard for all of us to have a good time.  Bravo to all of them.

title: Top notch
text: Extremely friendly and accommodating staff - clean and well kept - lovely breakfast included - stayed here several times and always a wonderful experience- very good size room especially for right at Times Square !  Lots of nice decorations

title: Best accomodation best new years
text:
From the moment we started planing our stay all the way from Melbourne Australia everybody from Casablanca hotel were so helpful via email and over the phone. 

This has to be hands down the best place I have stayed in my travels period! 

All of the staff members make you feel like you are in your own place, the friendly and helpful attitude was second to none. 

The hotel itself is small and charming and located in the heart of Times Square with a brilliant adjoining restaurant 

We stayed for the New Year’s Eve package and weren’t too sure how it would be as it sounded too good to be true prior to arrival but it honestly blew all of our expectations how fantastic the experience was

It is definitely somewhere I would like to stay again and I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in New York definitely 5 stars isn’t enough to  this place. Left the place speechless and wish we could stay there longer

title: Love this hotel!
text: I love this charming boutique hotel.  The pictures tell the story but the front desk  people were also wonderful.  It's spanking clean, tastefully decorated, has an  excellent continental breakfast in a lovely sitting area, and the maids are also excellent.  I'm crazy about this hotel!

title: Excellent!
text: We were impressed with this small, quaint hotel from the time that we walked in. The gentlemen at the door and the front desk greeted us warmly and got us settled into our rooms quickly. We requested a couple of accommodations that they quickly fulfilled. They answered any questions that we had with professionalism and a smile. Loved the rooms and the hospitality and told them that we would return!

title: Outstanding Hospitality
text:
What can I say, I asked James when I first spoke with him by phone from Australia, about the New Year's Eve package - 'how do I know this isn't a scam, as it sounds to good to be true'
Well, my stay at The Casablanca, as a solo traveller was more than too good to be true. Everything was absolutely fabulous from the start to finish of my six day stay....
So do yourself a favour and experience the welcoming warmth and outstanding hospitality from John, James, Lewis and others at The Casablanca!

title: Excellent stay and customer service
text:
We had a Mini Suite w/2 Full Beds + Sofabed booked for a 3 night stay between Friday 22 December and Monday 25 December 2023.  Prior to us traveling the Reservations Manager Brian contacted us to explain that the hotel was having some emergency building work and that this had affected our room.  Brian was brilliant, he communicated with us throughout the process of arranging alternative rooms for our party (2 adults, 2 older teenagers).   

The hotel prides itself on customer service and this was apparent throughout our stay, everyone was polite, friendly and eager to help us on our first trip to NY.   

The hotel is in an excellent location just off times square.  It felt safe and secure which was particularly important to us.

title: Truly Above and Beyond
text: As other reviewers have noted, if NYE in Times Square is on your bucket list, this is the place to go!  It was certainly on ours and the Casablanca exceeded our expectations - and then some! It’s not just the location or the ambiance or the attention to detail - yes, all of those were outstanding. Beyond that, it’s the people there who made the experience all the more memorable for us.  We’ve all traveled all over the world, and the level of service we received here is something we’d never experienced anywhere else. You all made us feel like family.  John, James, Brian… special thanks to you!  And Brian, thanks again for moving our reservation when we couldn’t make it last year.  The entire Silveira/Pagola family appreciates all of you, and we hope to see you all again!

title: A+ staff!!!
text: We initially had an issue with the first room having an unpleasant odor, but once reporting it we were moved to another room which was good…. and we were offered a free bottle of champagne and assistance in moving our things. The entire staff was so  nice! The most courteous pleasant people I’ve ever interacted with at a hotel. Including the Ritz! It’s an older hotel so for instance our bathroom door didn’t close all the way - a 6 inch gap. Not a big deal for my daughter and I but I could see it being a problem for others. I didn’t like how I couldn’t adjust my room temp, but there was a nice ceiling fan above the bed and you could open the window in the room safely. I wish there had been a gym but in a boutique hotel they’d not always available. I didn’t get to try the included breakfast. Overall the people working there made this place great!!

title: Top notch customer service
text: This was my second stay at this hotel. I chose it again primarily because of the top notch customer service received at my first stay and the location to Times Square can’t be beat. This was especially important this time because I was there for the New Years celebrations. They really go out of their way to make everyone feel at home and provide the best experience possible. I will never stay anywhere else when visiting NYC!

title: GM John the Gem and his staff are top notch
text: The staff at casablanca was top notch for our new years stay. You don't have to work many jobs to know that leadership makes all the difference when it comes to performance and morale, these guys are the best at what they do. The GM John who I'll refer to as John the Gem made me and my now fiancé feel at home during our stay. You can tell John and team enjoy what they do and it shows. Thanks for helping make our new years/engagement memorable.  We will definitely be back in the future.

title: New Year's Eve Weekend
text:
We had a great time staying New Year's Eve Weekend.  The whole experience was great.  The hotel, the room and especially the Staff were the best.  Thank you for a great time.  

If Time Squire New Year's Eve is on your bucket list this is the place.

title: Exceptional hotel, staff and service.
text: Beautiful hotel with staff that was attentive and friendly. Felt more like family than staff. Walking distance to Rockefeller Center, shows and Bryant Park. New Year’s Eve package was amazing. Good food, entertainment and dancing. Ball drop on the roof was magical. Will definitely recommend and we will go back to this hotel.

title: Highly recommended
text:
Always great to stay at The Casablanca! Staff are super friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble for them.
The rooms are lovely and the location is perfect! 
Tony's Italian restaurant is attached and serves the best pasta ever!

title: New Years must-do
text: The whole staff is very attentive, and the service during our stay for New Years was absolutely top notch. If you ever come to NYC during that time, it has a wonderful view of the ball drop from their rooftop. Would recommend to anyone!

title: Perfect hotel
text: Six of us stayed here for 5 nights over Christmas, third time staying at this hotel for two of us and the first time for the remaining 4 people. We all agreed you can not fault this hotel on anything. The staff are so helpful the rooms are spotless and the customer service is exceptional. We had 3 rooms between us and all rooms are equipped with everything you need. Rick’s cafe is a godsend everything from continental breakfast to snacks throughout the day. Rooms are so quiet even though it’s steps away from Times Square. Would highly recommend the Casablanca hotel it’s just amazing.

title: Great experience
text: We had a great experience at the Casablanca Hotel. The staff are very friendly and professional. They went out of their way to make us feel at home during our stay. The hotel is very clean and aesthetically appealing in every way. The cafe is an added bonus with a continental breakfast and access to treats throughout the day. The location is perfect for all things related to Times Square from the theater to eateries and shopping. We will be back!

title: Would definitely recommend if planning to attend theaters
text: Excellent location - literally 50 feet from Times Square and 10 minutes walk to many theaters.  Very friendly staff and nice rooms.  Rooms are amazingly quiet given the location. Nice continental breakfast and all-day snacks in a lovely living room type space.

title: Wow, fabulous, amazing hotel, great location, staff are superb! Highly recommend.
text:
Amazing Mother and Daughter time at Casablanca Hotel celebrating my daughter’s 21st birthday. We will be back! Second time for me and the hotel didn’t disappoint me. 

The front desk staff, wow, where do I start. They are all fabulous, nothing too much trouble, from booking restaurants, helping with travel arrangements, giving advice etc. My special shoutout has to go to James. Sorry we missed you and didn’t get opportunity to say bye. 

If you are looking for a central hotel in Times Square look no further, you will not be disappointed, Casablanca is amazing and the staff are fabulous.

title: Greatest boutique hotel in NYC
text: After staying at different hotels in NYC over many years I have found a true gem!  I will never have to search again.  This will always be my hotel of choice.  First of all I must say that the customer service is 100% top notch with special thanks to James, Gary, and Christian for making our stay so wonderful and welcoming.  All of the staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating .  The room cleaning staff are also friendly and accommodating.  The hotel is very clean and the attention to detail is amazing.  The location can’t be beat and it’s very quiet and inviting.  The second floor lounge area has a wonderful continental breakfast and there are always snacks, soft drinks, coffee, tea and water available 24/7.  You can order room service provided by Tony’s Di Napoli (right next door) and enjoy it in the second floor lounge.  The will also make arrangements for car service to and from the airport if you choose to do so.  This boutique hotel  has the best service, staff and location of any!! Thank you again for making a stay in NYC a wonderful, memorable experience!!

title: Great Hotel and Great Location
text: Fantastic boutique hotel with the greatest location.  We stay here every time we are in New York city.  The staff are fantastic and you are mere steps from Time Square, but still in a quiet location.  They have a great lounge on the 2nd floor that provides a Continental Breakfast and is open all the time with non-alcoholic drinks and snacks.  Amazing.

title: A Jewel in the Jungle
text: Great hotel and staff. Convenient to all things NYC. Friendly staff provided continental breakfast and snack room open all day. Clean room and well appointed. We are not seasoned NYC visitors but of the times we have been this was our favorite. Front desk was very helpful in making needed arrangements.

title: Girls Trip in NYC at Christmas
text: This is our 2nd girls trip to NYC & at the Casablanca!! We LOVE the hotel & staff.  We can't say enough about this place. The staff are top notch professionals, courteous & very accommodating to your needs!! The hotel is the cleanest I've ever seen & the beds you will melt in. We also love Rick's Cafe for the continental breakfast & snacks throughout the day!! The location couldn't be better. Even though it's steps away from Time Square you hear NOTHING!! It's a great location for all the attractions...can't wait to go back!! What a great way to start off the holidays!!

title: What a place!!!
text:
The place is amazing, the staff couldn’t do enough for us! 
It’s just off time square, but you would never know when you’re in the building. 
They offer a continental  breakfast, which is cool, and saves you a fortune eating out every day. 
The beds are the best I’ve ever slept in….the 30,000 steps a day may have helped. 
I would recommend anyone going to manhattan must stay at this place.

title: Girls Trip to NYC!
text: Best Hotel stay ever! I will be going back again! The staff was excellent, the room was clean, and the food was fabulous! Great location, we were able to walk so many places. Steps from Times Square, and close to so many Broadway shows.

title: Holiday Shoppers
text:
Staff is professional and accommodating at all times. Entire facility is immaculate and well maintained. 
Excellent location in the center of mid-town. Close to all major subway lines as well as centrally located to all major attractions.

title: Perfect Location - Perfect staff
text: Enjoyed our stay.  Definitely would return as the staff was very friendly and attentive. We were in town to see some shows the Casablanca was a short walk to both Harmony and A Beautiful Noise (loved both shows!) Hope to be back soon.

title: Friendly and top notch service, there's no other place to stay!
text: There is no other place to stay in NYC than the Casablanca. Located at the heart of Times Square, it is convenient to everything. The staff is top notch and the accommodations are perfect. When staying here, you don't feel like a numbered reservation but more like a friend with the hospitality provided and friendliness of the staff. From booking a car from and to the airport for us, to giving us recommendations on activities and restaurants, the staff is always helpful, cheerful and willing to help. At the continental breakfast provided, Maria provides top notch service, always with a smile. Already looking forward to our next stay at the Casablanca!

title: Fantastic!
text: All of the staff were clearly enjoy working there! They are very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean. It has such a warm and welcoming feeling. Having the continental breakfast daily was great and there were staff working in the breakfast room. Great location where you can walk everywhere. We highly recommend this hotel!

title: Superb location, excellent personnel, overall good deal!
text: We’d stayed at the Casablanca before, thus the return! The personnel are competent, friendly, and eager to please. The facility is accommodating and historic and superbly located. (We walked to every show we attended.) The ‘gathering room’ is welcoming and has snacks and coffee and tea and cold (non-alcoholic) beverages available throughout the day. Breakfast offerings are diverse and plentiful. We will stay there again on our next visit.

title: The Library Collection, Delightful And Unique!
text:
The Library Hotel Collection provides us with our best and most memorable stays in NYC. We've stayed at The Giraffe, The Elysee, and, most recently, The Casablanca. Each is wonderful with delightful amenities, yet each is unique in appeal.

First, the staff in each hotel is everything that hotel staff should be. Everyone goes above and beyond for the guests' comforts.

Not only is the staff helpful and gracious, but they are delightful to talk to, knowledgeable and helpful.

Some of our favorite things: the theme in decor, the amazing lounges where one can read, watch TV, play games, relax with wine. Wow!

Further, we learned about Henry Kallan who oversees the Collection. We learned that he visits each hotel weekly and knows the names of all of the staff. We'd love to meet him to talk and buy him a drink.

title: A jewel of a hotel!
text:
The Casablanca offers a quiet, charming, utterly welcome retreat in the heart of Midtown, steps from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  

We've stayed at the Casablanca twice now, and it's now our first choice for visits to the city.  With friendly staff, rooms larger than many in Manhattan, and an inviting lounge with a vintage vibe that offers a good continental breakfast until 10am, and snacks and (non-alcoholic) drinks all day, there's a lot to recommend this small jewel box hotel!  After a brisk day walking the city, sitting in the lounge by the fire with a cappucino or a sparkling water is a lovely respite.  

Rooms are attractive and nicely appointed.  They don't include refrigerators, which would be a nice perk, but I haven't found the absence a problem.  Most rooms don't offer much of a view, but they are scrupulously clean and astonishingly quiet for  Midtown, and those things matter far more to me!

The location is terrific - it feels like EVERYTHING is close. Times Square is a half-block away, Bryant Park is around the block, and the theatre district is just a few minutes walk.  Madison Square Gardens and Penn Station are a 10-minute walk, and there's a subway station a block away.  

For dining, the Casablanca adjoins Tony Di Napoli's family-style restaurant, which has great food and a lovely bar for an after-theatre drink.  And just past that is the Mermaid Oyster Bar, offering a lovely seafood menu.  And of course dozens of other options surround the immediate area.

title: Amazing place to stay close to everything
text: We stayed at Casablanca for our anniversary weekend and we had an amazing time. Their location is close to everything, right in Times Square and we were only a two minute walk from Broadway. Staff were courteous and attentive to our needs. They even provided us with a space heater after we let them know that our room was colder  than we had hoped. Their breakfast that is included was also super convenient and had great options. Would definitely recommend and would stay again next time we are in NYC!

title: Great Broadway and Times Square location with no noise
text: This weekend we flew to NYC and decided to stay near Times Square so we'd be close to the Broadway shows that we were planning on seeing.  We first saw the show, Harmony (created by Barry Manilow and Bruce Sussman), which was amazing and so heavy hitting to the current times we are living in.  Then the next night we saw, A Beautiful Noise (Neil Diamond story) and had another fun night that was uplifting with songs that you grew up with.  Our trip was based around these two shows so this hotel ended up being perfect.  Both theaters were within walking distance and literally three buildings down was Times Square.  We actually couldn't believe how quiet it was in our room at night time and how dark our room was so we were able to sleep peacefully.  Now if you like to sleep in, you might hear some of the people walking out of their rooms in the morning, but that is about it.  This is an older boutique hotel with some classic charm and a fabulous staff.  Their staff is very friendly, informative and just kind, which sometimes can be hard to find in NY.  The front desk staff are also the concierge so they are very informative and any of the doormen are willing to help you in any way they can.  On the second floor they have 24 hour coffee, bottle waters, chips and usually some granola bars of some sort.  This isn't fancy, but you won't find other hotels offering this stuff for free so it was great to grab a snack in the mornings before exploring all the nook and crannies that NYC has to offer.  Oh, also since it is the holidays, Bryant Park is right around the corner with all their holiday shops to do a little Christmas shopping.   Again, this is a great location and the place had character, would definitely stay here again.

title: Little Gem for Theater Goers....
text:
My wife and I went to NYC a week ago for a couple of Broadway shows, some good dinners, etc.  Most of the properties in mid town were looking to charge $600+ per night.  I stumbled across Casablanca Hotel on W 43rd ST on the internet, saw some positive reviews and decided to give it a shot.  We were really glad we did.  The room was a little small, but it's Manhattan.  It was clean, well stocked and properly serviced on a daily basis.  The front desk staff and doormen were always pleasant and conversational.  And the rate per night was extremely reasonable.  

It's *really* close to Times Square, which was a little concerning, but it wasn't a problem.  We were on the 5th floor of the hotel and couldn't hear any street noise.  We also loved the second floor lounge where a light, continental breakfast was served in the morning and fruit, water, sodas, etc. were available 24/7.  We will definitely return on our next trip and we were told upon checkout that we now qualify of the "friends and family" discount when we return.  

Great property!!

title: Great little hotel
text: This was the cleanest, friendliest hotel I have ever stayed in.  The staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable.  We felt at home in this lovely hotel and the location (next door to 3 awesome restaurants and close to Times Square), free breakfast and 24hr available snacks & coffee was a big plus. I'll definitely stay here again when visiting NYC.

title: Great staff, comfortable lounge and charming rooms
text: Absolutely unreal hotel. Classic charm coupled with an incredible staff. Steps away from the absolute madness that is Times Square, yet you walk inside and it’s like you step into a different world. It’s very obvious that the staff cares about their jobs and the customer because I was greeted each time I walked into the hotel and they remembered my name and room number when I checked out. I was there for a weekend with my family and Greg, James, and Stanley took great care of us and gave us really good food recommendations. We went to see the show & Juliette which is essentially across the street from the hotel and we had dinner at Tony denapolis. Perfect stay, we can’t thank you all enough.

title: Perfect place to stay, relax, see it all, and be a true “guest” with a true “host” (team) and great location too!
text: A weekend with 2 grandkids and we all loved it. Wonderfully unique place, very comfortable rooms, every staff member was gracious and friendly, terrific location near Times Square, lots to see, do, within walking distance, and the free breakfast in Rick’s cafe was so really good! Been to NYC lots but this was the best. This is the place to stay from now on. Period!

title: Home Away from Home
text: This hotel is so warm and friendly.  It's like home away from home.  I travel for work every week and staying at the CASABLANCA makes it so much better.  Friendly front desk staff - excellent breakfast and Rick's cafe make it nice for a hot tea or coffee at the end of a long day.  The rooms are comfortable and always super clean and great products.  Feels like you are in a far away place but you are right in the heart of Times Square which makes it so easy to get anywhere.  And nice to see the bright lights !

title: Wonderful, quiet, friendly hotel in the heart of the theater district!
text: Great find right in the heart of Times Square!  Remarkably quiet rooms for the location!  Had a lovely, nice sized but reasonably priced suite.  Extremely friendly staff clearly working hard to please and accommodate any requests.  Small lobby and older hotel but very clean and had all the amenities including free water bottles they happily replenish, robes and slippers and Lavazza coffee.   Will both recommend and stay again!

title: Amazing New York stay
text: This place is the best, The Guys make you feel like you are family, The lovely Maria up in Ricks cafe was amazing to with my wife's peanut allergy, in fact the whole staff are a credit to the owners and I shall be returning in May with my daughter and would not stay anywhere else but here. See you all soon and John you have a team to make you proud all go above and 5 stars is to low

title: Great hotel in New York.
text:
A fantastic boutique hotel, located just 80 metres from Times Square! It is walkable distance to all other central-Manhattan tourist sights and to public transport. The hotel has a quaint Casablancan theme throughout it.
It is close to a number of restaurants and the theatres.
The rooms are clean and very quiet. A light breakfast is provided in the resort fee. Tea, coffee and snacks are provided at all other times.
We had a Premium King Bed room and it was spacious (large by NY standards).
All of the staff were friendly, helpful and courteous. 
Their website is an accurate reflection of what is actually there.
I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Must stay!
text: The hotel is charming and the staff are incredibly welcoming, helpful, and friendly! Check out the outside patio by the dining room - it’s adorable!! And, the location is around the corner from Times Square. As a bonus, you can access rooms via the stairs (if you don’t like elevators or enjoy the exercise).

title: Classic charm and cozy spaces
text: This was our second time at Casablanca Hotel and it was just as beautiful and comfortable as it was the first time. The best part, though, is the staff. So friendly and helpful! Best place to stay for walking to Broadway shows and great restaurants.

title: Location, location, location
text: This hotel is very amazing, location is great! we loved the complimentary breakfast, and the staff providing it was super helpful.  Everything was clean and upon arrival, the staff was very helpful with recommendations.  The only downside about this hotel, is it was very noisy at night on the outside, which of course is not their fault.  We even tried to leave the AC on all night to drown out the noise, it helped a little.

title: Nice place in Times Square
text: The hotel is really nice. Staff was very friendly, incredibly helpful. We liked how quiet it was, despite only being a short distance from Times Square. The room was rather small, which was a bit disappointing, but the breakfast/snack area was a nice spot to stretch out.

title: Time Square
text: Great location close to Time Square, Theatres, restaurants and subway etc.  Friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast provision and snacks and tea/coffee available throughout the day. Rooms were clean, comfortable and tidy.  Would recommend staying here if visiting New York.

title: My Go-To in NYC
text: I love the Casablanca Hotel, it's my go-to when I am in NYC for a show.  The staff are amazing and make your stay personable and special.   The included continental breakfast and all day snacks and drinks makes everything so much easier.  Rooms are comfy and clean.  This hotel has both character and service, nothing more you can ask for!

title: Hidden Gem in NYC with Exceptional Customer Service
text: The service at this hotel is extraordinary.  The staff are exceptionally kind and helpful.  The resort fee, which at most NYC hotels provides nothing, grants you access to a floor full of beverages and snacks -- as well as a lovely place to hang out.  The rooms -- standard for NYC -- may feel small.  But, the location -- steps from Times Square -- will make up for it.   This is a hidden gem in the City.

title: Wonderful staff and hotel.
text: This was my first trip to New York City.  The location for the hotel was great, rooms were very nice, amenities plentiful and the staff was excellent and appeared to love working there. We even received a surprise in our room for a birthday celebration along with a personalized letter. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

title: An oasis of calm and efficiency within 50 paces of Times Square
text: The Hotel was a true oasis of calm end efficiency within 50 paces of Times Square. The staff were faultless and the lounge was well stocked and peaceful. It was an absolute delight throughout to be staying there and a very sad moment when we left

title: This hotel totally deserves its 5* rating
text:
After a lot of research we booked a 5 night stay at this hotel with 4 other couples from England to celebrate a significant birthday.  From the moment we arrived we were met with some of the most friendly and helpful concierge staff we have ever come across.  They gave such great advice and helped with requests.  Whilst our room only had a view into a central courtyard it was clean and quiet.  The bathroom was wonderful and with complimentary shower and shampoo samples.  The maid who cleaned our room was incredible and it truly felt like a new stay every day.  Free water in the room and a good sized safe also helped.

Apart from being so close to Times Square (although once inside the hotel you felt as if you were in your own world) the other selling point to us was the complimentary breakfast and drinks/snacks throughout the day in a large social area.  The breakfast staff couldn't do more to help with porridge orders, toast, pastries etc and you have help yourself coffee, tea, yoghurt, fruits etc.

Our group of 10 all agreed we will return to New York and will only book this hotel again and we have been telling others about it too.  This is a real gem that is down to the staff employed there - Wonderful.

title: If you are thinking about it just book!
text: Casablanca is such a great hotel! The moment you walk in the staff makes you feel at home. We felt so safe coming “home” every night to someone greeting us at the door. You can tell the staff truly loves what they do. Room clean, decent size for NY, breakfast (light), 24/7 snacks.  HUGE shout out to Jeffrey at the front desk, Luis at the door, Elvis in housekeeping and Maria in the Rick’s Cafe. These members made such an impactful positive experience to our NY trip. We wished we could have brought them home!  Thank you to Greg, Dmitry, and Tayvon for also helping us out it was truly appreciated. Will definitely be booking again.

title: Wonderful hotel - great staff
text: We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at the Casablanca. It is close to everything in Times Square. The hotel is Moroccan themed, rooms are exceptional nice with on-site continental breakfast available, but the best of all was how helpful and friendly the staff was,  especially James and Dimitri.  They went over and above to make our stay fantastic!  We will definitely stay at the Casablanca again when coming to New York.

title: Cozy, comfortable Casablanca hotel
text: We had a wonderful experience overnight at the Casablanca Hotel. The beds were great, the bathroom was on the larger size, and it was quiet considering how close we were to Times Square. Sadly, we did not get to try out Tony’s as it had shut down the kitchen before we got there, but my hubby and 3 year old enjoyed the breakfast at Rick’s Cafe the next morning. I loved the theming of the movie Casablanca and wish we had more time to stay at this hotel. The staff were friendly, and helpful. They held our bags at the bell stand while we did a little sightseeing before we left for our cruise. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone though I would make sure they were aware that it is a smaller hotel without a restaurant in it (there is one connected through a door). It did not negatively impact our trip as we rather hit the pavement for all that NYC had to offer.

title: Gem in the heart of Broadway
text: This gem of a hotel is next to Tony's Di Napoli in the heart of Broadway yet feels quiet and secluded.  The Casablanca themed hotel includes Rick's Cafe for guests' breakfast and snacks, and our suite was convenient and comfortable.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: Lovely hotel in central New York location beside Times Square. Comfortable room that worked perfectly for our family of 4 - as advertised. Staff were helpful, yet unobtrusive. Perfect service. Complimentary breakfast ticked the box too, got us ready for the day

title: Quiet, comfortable, convenient hotel.
text: Great hotel in the middle of Times Square.  It's intimate, quiet with friendly staff.  We stay here at least once a year.  Rick's cafe offers a light breakfast, snacks and coffee all day.  The rooms are spacious.

title: Tranquil Oasis
text: Fabulous hotel situated less than a minute from Times Square, when you enter the hotel a tranquil oasis awaits. Staff were all amazing and friendly from all the front of house including James & Dimitri, to the 2 lovely ladies serving breakfast and the cleaner's. We stayed in a petite queen room on the 4th floor, it was quiet and peaceful with the comfiest of pillows, bathrobes & slippers. Rick's Lounge was a real bonus with access to tea, coffees, water, juice & snacks 24/7 and a lovely place just to chill. Hotel is close to the subway & within walking distance to all major attractions. If in doubt ask the front desk who are more than happy to help.

title: Quality Hotel in the heart of Manhatten
text: A great hotel with warm and friendly staff. The rooms are very well appointed quiet and very clean but best of all is the location in the heart of Manhatten. It was so easy to get abound the city. The lounge facility was a great place for our group to meet and chat about our day...and breakfast was fab

title: Delightful, friendly boutique hotel mere steps from Times Square
text: We have stayed at the Casablanca Hotel several times in recent years and always have a 5 star experience.  The staff is as friendly, welcoming and helpful as you could ask for. We are treated like old friends whenever we stay there.  The rooms are comfortably sized and the bathrooms are especially nice.  It is an older hotel that could possibly use some 'refreshing', but we are still very happy to stay there each time we visit Broadway.  The theater district and Times Square are so close by, making this an incredibly convenient place to stay.  We enjoy the simple but tasty breakfasts in the second floor café each morning (included in the room rate), and the same café serves as a comfortable lounge to relax in during other times of the day.  We highly recommend the Casablanca Hotel.

title: The great escape
text: Location is the key with all broadway outside the door and Tony's restaurant next door.  Second floor lounge both indoor  and outdoor space is great for meeting up with friends before and after events.  Also 24 hour latte machine that is actually  good.   Breakfast included is served here.  Small staff gets to know you and helpful.  Rooms are small but well appointed  with closet.  A nice place for your escape.

title: Great Stay just off of Times Square
text: Stayed our first two night here on oir 7 day trip to NYC. The staff was extremely friendly. The 1st floor dining area with coffee, water, tee, soda and fruit included is a great place to chill out after walking through NYC all day. Seems a bit pricey at first but we really feel that it is worth staying here for two nights during a teip to the big apple.

title: A perfect stay in New York! 🤩
text: Perfect location for sightseeing.  Very friendly staff who were happy to help in any way possible.  Room was cosy, clean and comfortable.  Breakfast was enjoyable.  Ricks Cafe was a bonus to be able to relax and enjoy drinks and snacks. One evening we had a pizza delivered and enjoyed eating in there after a long tiring day.  It felt like home from home.  Would definitely recommend.

title: Still like it, but missed a few amenities!
text: We love the Casablanca.  It’s clean, quiet ( if your room doesn’t face the street). The staff is friendly and welcoming. BUT- we were so disappointed that they discontinued a few things that kept us staying there.  No more wine and cheese, no more cookies all day.  Now it’s potato chips and apples.  Not the same!!  We may have to reconsider where we stay next time!!

title: Lovely Times in the Square
text: Brilliant Hotel and staff in the heart of New York's Times Square, without the hustle and bustle. This was a very memorable stay whilst our daughter got married in New York, due to unforeseen circumstances at very short notice the Groom needed a waistcoat, John in reception removed his and let him have it for the day, brilliant customer service, thank you

title: An Oasis in NYC
text: Small, Boutique hotel in times square area….but so unlike Times Square…like an Oasis of calm in a zany area of New York City. Having stayed here four times, I wouldnt stay any other place in the city. Room rate includes a morning breakfast in their 2nd floor library….same location open all day for a soda, cappuccino, coffee, cookies , fruit…..and just relaxing. The staff in the library, front desk, room staff and door men could not possibly be nicer!

title: An exceptional Hotel with an outstanding Personnel
text: Exceptional service by everybody. Very pleasant staff at reception. Very comfortable “family room” at Rich’s Cafe with service around the clock. What topped it all was the General Manager who supported us personally when we had a difficult health issue. Will always come again.

title: My favorite hotel in NYC
text: This is our third stay at this hotel, it never disappoints. Service is outstanding, Rick's cafe is always a treat, and the staff in the cafe goes above and beyond. Rooms are small, as all in NY are, but are well appointed, beds are comfortable, and it's quiet! I'd make this your first choice if you're looking for convenience, comfort, and quality.

title: Must stay
text:
Lovely friendly staff, very helpful. 
Great public area to relax with complementary snacks and drinks
Great position near Times Square without the noise
Definitely stay again if need close proximity to main sites
Lovely historical building

title: Tolles Personal
text: Es war wie auf den Fotos, wir fühlten uns wie in Casablanca. Eine tolle Atmosphäre. Habe noch nie ein freundliches Personal gehabt. Danke noch mal an den concierge der mir mit dem Geburtstagsgeschenk geholfen hat. Die viele Zeit die er sich genommen hat um alles zu klären und mir dann auch noch einen Tisch im besten Steakrestaurant in New York zu reservieren. Vielen Dank. Wir hatten einen wunderschönen Geburtstag. Ebenso die Hilfe mit  den U-Bahnen und Taxis. Wir hatten trotz Regen einen wunderschönen Aufenhalt in New York und kommen gern wieder

title: Great place to stay
text: Excellent location in the theater district.  Very clean and quiet. Very good restaurants nearby.  The hotel staff is very helpful and very friendly.  The lounge on second floor lounge is open all day and is well stocked and relaxing.  The staff will book transportation to and from the airport.  We will always stay here.

title: A must stay
text:
WOW! Just WOW!! From the staff, to the service, the cleanliness, and kindness, the amenities and phenomenal decor, and location, nothing was left to be wanted. James at the front desk was full of knowledge and gave us the best recommendations. He even booked tickets for us since we aren’t all tech savvy. And the LOCATION!!! Everything is within walking distance. We came to see the NYC Ballet and Aladdin. We shopped at Macy’s, Harry Potter, Saks, North Face and so many more places. Don’t think twice. This is the absolute best experience. 

Breakfast is delicious. The staff make your oatmeal and toast your bread to perfection. And the coffee machine is like none other. All the options. 

We traveled with grandparents, mom, and ten year old. 

Oh! And we all felt super safe with the police station on the same block.

title: Lovely small hotel in an ideal location
text: We stayed at the Casablanca on the recommendation of a friend who had stayed recently. A really nice characterful small hotel in a great location close to Times Square. We were made to feel very welcome by the wonderful staff who made our stay so enjoyable. The midtown location is ideal for those who want to walk the city and attend Broadway shows, and its location makes it perfect for popping back in during the day to rest your feet and to make use of the 24-hour coffee, cold drinks and snacks in the cosy public room (Rick's Cafe). Our room was really quiet, and we weren't disturbed by the sound of the 'city that never sleeps'. Thank you to all the staff at the Casablanca for a great stay.

title: Great
text:
Great experience in a great location.
Very clean, good continental breakfast as well as drinks and snacks during the day.
Very helpful and attentive staff. Request was fulfilled in minutes.
We will recommend and hope to stay again.

title: Wouldn't stay anywhere else!
text: My husband and I first found the Casablanca -- by accident, really -- when we visited NYC last year. I just returned from a short trip with my mom and cousin to celebrate a 40th birthday, and we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. This boutique hotel has it all -- everyone is friendly; breakfast, snacks, sodas, and coffees at Rick's Cafe are included; the location can't be beat; the beds are supercomfy; there's a charm and a history that no big-name hotel can offer. No one in my family will ever stay anywhere but here.

title: Traveling with friends from Germany
text: The location is excellent. There is an excellent Italian restaurant right next door. The staff was friendly and helpful. Room was clean and was serviced daily. Priced as one would expect in NYC. The waitress at breakfast tasted my bagel each morning. The breakfast was good for a continental  breakfast. Bryant Park is within east walking distance as was Broadway and Rockefeller Center.

title: No flexibility or concern for client changes
text: Had to check out a day early...no refund was given or even considered.  I had to leave a day early do to my work schedule changing and the airline happily changed my ticket, and I checked out at 8:30 am, but they told me I would have to pay for the second night regardless.

title: Great experience
text: Our stay at the Casablanca Hotel was fantastic! Great location for our theater trip. Within walking distance of all the Broadway shows. The staff was wonderful!!! We will be staying here again on our next trip.

title: Awesome hotel.
text: Great hotel. Like the old days where guests were treated right. Only place my wife and i will stay. Next to times square, and Tonys restaurant. Excellent staff; clean rooms, excellent service. Cannot beat it.

title: Home Away From Home................
text:
This is the first time I have been to NYC in about 7 years.  What an amazing experience at the Casablanca Hotel!!  I booked a room for one night for my birthday.  From the moment I entered the lobby the staff was so kind, helpful, friendly and accommodating.  Traveling solo, safety is a priority, and the location and hotel guest agents definitely made me feel at ease.  In addition, the hotel gave me a room upgrade and a bottle of wine in my room for my birthday.  So thoughtful!!  That was so appreciated.  This is the highest level of customer service I have ever experienced in a hotel.  It is quite apparent the hotel guest agents enjoy their job and truly care about the comfort of their guests.  Very positive attitudes.  I will return as well as recommend this sweet hotel to all.  Thank you so much James, Greg and others!

Best,
Michele M.

title: Friendly Staff
text:
Hotel has a great vibe. Staff are personable and helpful. Cosy feel. Good breakfast.

Rooms are comfortable with a large bathroom.

Great location close to Theatre district, MOMA, Bryant Park, Metropolitan Museum of Art.

title: Beautiful little boutique hotel!
text: Beautiful little boutique hotel right in the heart of Times Square!  I went by myself for a business workshop and could not find a hotel room in company policy, until I stumbled across the Casablanca.  I was not disappointed.  Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable, from where to eat, to how to get around the city.  My room was immaculate, if not a little small, but it is NYC and I was alone.  Only thing missing was a small fridge in the room, but honestly I didn't have leftovers so I barely noticed I didn't have one.  I didn't realize it at the time of booking, but I was directly across the street from the offices I was attending my workshop in.  I would stay here again over a larger chain.  It was a pleasant and memorable trip.

title: Location and breakfast
text:
Location, location, location!
The breakfasts were awesome. Buffet style with fresh pasteries, boiled eggs and NY bagels that staff Staff would toast for you. 
All the staff were exceptional. The concierge were helpful and were a pleasure to deal with. The manager would come out in the morning and chat with us. Definitely would choose the Casablanca again.

title: You will love it here!
text: Can’t recommend this place enough!  Perfect location for Broadway shows and Times Square attractions. Very walkable to Hells Kitchen, Rockefeller Plaza, Bryant Park, NY Public Library and so many great bars and restaurants! As said in other reviews the staff is amazing and always so cheerful.  We asked, and it’s because they love working there!    Ask them about the buildings history!   Ricks Cafe was perfect for a quick breakfast or an afternoon snack, all complimentary!  It was the perfect spot for relaxing on a rainy NY day.  Rooms (suite style) aren’t huge but plenty of room for three adults. By then end of our stay we felt just like part of the family!  You won’t be disappointed!

title: Perfect location for a Broadway honeymoon
text:
My partner and I stayed at the Casablanca for our honeymoon, and I am so deeply glad we did. Our week in New York was fun, but also calamitous: most notably, Tropical Storm Ophelia brought record-breaking amounts of rain to the city all week, and I woke up sick with two days left in our trip. Through all the ups and downs of our stay, the team at the Casablanca ensured that we were, above all else, comfortable. I will forever be grateful for their hospitality.

One of the reasons we chose to stay at the Casablanca was because of its location, and that paid off for us each day. We couldn't have chosen a better place to set up home base for this trip, chiefly because we planned for our honeymoon to be Broadway-heavy. We saw at least one show everyday, some of which we had tickets to before we got to New York, and some of which we got day-of tickets for at the TKTS booth in Times Square. This hotel is literally just steps away from Times Square. A couple blocks from the TKTS booth, and within easy walking distance of almost any Broadway show you could hope to see.

Transit options are also very nearby with one large train (subway) station just one block over and another a block in the other direction, as well as numerous bus stops in the immediate vicinity.

You might think the hotel would be loud, being so close to Times Square, one of the noisiest and most chaotic places in the known world, but my experience was that our room was very quiet. We had no view to speak of; the one window served as the entry point for the air conditioning unit, and it let some natural light in from a small inner courtyard. This could certainly be a detriment to some, but not having a view was fine with us. We needed the room to stay cool, quiet, and comfy for us to be able to rest between excursions, and it was absolutely perfect for that.

There is a small breakfast spread in the lounge each morning, and I loved popping down to grab a banana, a hard-boiled egg, and a bagel -- the staff are happy to take it into the kitchen, toast it, and deliver it to you -- with some peanut butter. The same lounge remains open throughout the day with a small selection of snacks and drinks for guests to take as needed. We deeply appreciated being able to grab a cold Diet Coke out of the mini fridge after walking around town.

Every time we returned to the hotel from a trip out, the staff welcomed us back. When we left, they reminded us to take an umbrella; they had several umbrellas ready and waiting for guests to use throughout the rainy week.

Perhaps my only complaint about our business with the Casablanca Hotel is that I booked directly through their website, months prior to our planned arrival, on a "pay 50% now, pay 50% later" kind of rate, but I was not charged at that time. The initial payment was not charged until about 6 weeks prior to the visit, and the second half was supposed to be charged 30 days out.
