With both payments so close together, and with no notice that the first half of the payment had not and would not be pulled until a much later time, I was caught off guard by the timing of the payments. The manager I spoke with said they changed their approach to charging guests because the pandemic had made cancellations so much more common, which I completely understand. I think this was simply a communication problem and could have been resolved by updating the language on their website about the likely timing of the charges.

I am truly so grateful that the place we chose for our stay was as comfortable and kind as the Casablanca Hotel. I hope we can return one day in the future, but in the meantime, I look forward to recommending it to all my friends and family.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Hotel Casablanca was amazing, all the way from unique decor to the personal service provided by all the staff.  The 24 hours Rick's Cafe was a great addition to the stay, to be able to grab a refreshment or snack anytime we wanted.  I can't say enough about the service the staff who provided invaluable advice when we were looking for great places to eat or places to go.  This is an awesome and boutique hotel to stay at and would not hesitate to go back.

title: Was just fabulous..
text: Beautiful hotel nothing was a problem ! Only seconds away from time square loved it ! All staff friendly and wellcoming , clean and tidy , loved our room!thankyou all hopefully return in the near future !

title: Great Hotel
text: Casablanca was such a great hotel and a great location!  Just off Time Square and so quiet at night.  I was shocked!  The staff was so friendly and helpful!  We loved every minute and won't ever stay anywhere else.  We attended 5 Broadway shows and they were just a short walk away.

title: I loved the interior design, the second floor library with food and coffee, the friendly staff!
text: I had a wonderful stay and will be back. One of the best features is that the almost the entire second floor is, in fact, a wood panel library with coffee (espresso!) and snacks for free 24 hours per day and in the morning really high end pastries  as part of a continental breakfast. Lots of comfortable shares and tables to sit and work. And a charming, small outdoor terrace. The staff were consistently friendly (how do they find people like?!). I love the Casablancea theme and well done interior decorating. By the way, the bathrooms are gigantic and the rooms large, which is often not the case in a boutique hotel. Will definitely be back.

title: great choice
text: This was my first visit to this hotel and very much a success. We had a suite and found the space excellent.  The only drawback might be the lack of counter space in the bathroom.  It is an older facility which is reflected in the decor but very comfortable.  The free breakfast in the lovely sitting room is a great addition. It's also open all day for smacks and chatting.  No cooked food but very adequate and much appreciated. Worried location might be noisy but it was fine,  Since our room only had sealed windows with opaque flim, we had no visible connection to the outside. But the best thing about this hotel is the staff. The people were just terrific...kind, efficient, helpful, generous.

title: Lovely stay, amazing staff
text: The location of the hotel is great, seconds walk from Times Square.  Our room was nice, not the biggest, but plenty spacious enough to call home for 5 nights.  The best thing about this hotel is the staff.  From the moment we arrived, until the moment we left to get in our taxi to the hotel everyone was so helpful, friendly and really made you feel welcome.  When you walked back in to the hotel from outside, they made it feel like you were back home. I cannot speak highly enough of all the staff that work at this hotel, they are truly what makes this hotel special.  The second floor communal space is great, with opportunity to unwind and get a coffee or snack.  Overall a fantastic place to stay, will definitely return.

title: The staff is AWSOME
text: This is a small hotel, maybe 6 floors, but their service is TOP NOTCH.  I could not have asked for a nicer staff that was always ready to help.  The room we had wasn't huge, but it was adequate for NY size rooms.  The bathroom was large!  The location is steps from 43rd & 7th & Broadway (Times Square) around the corner from Good Morning America.  The subway station is about a block away, there are restaurants everywhere; next door, across the street and with a block or two.  Would recommend this hotel.   If you need anything just ask the staff and they will do their best to accommodate.

title: Perfect!
text:
The friendliest staff I've ever come across, with a perfect lounge serving delicious breakfast, and all day (and night!) snacks and refreshments. Love the decor, comfy beds, great bathroom. We were treated to a birthday bottle of champagne and delightful note. Couldn't recommend this place highly enough! Also, great location for shows, and really surprisingly quiet.
Loved it!!

title: The Epitome of Comfort and Convenience!
text:
I have been staying at the Casablanca Hotel when I travel to NYC for over 20 years. I love this place. Entering the lobby, a sense of peace, tranquility and happiness just settles over me. The staff is friendly and accommodating, but not in an overbearing way. I think I have stayed in just about every room they have, and they are all comfortable.  Some are quite small, but it's New York - who's going to spend it sitting in a hotel room?! Plus, Rick's on the 2nd floor lets you spread out, kick back, and there's plenty of room. The location is simply splendid - I can walk to the Eastside, Westside, uptown, downtown...wherever! And if I don't want to walk, the Subway's nearby. The hotel is close to Broadway, Restaurant Row and all sorts of places that tourists and locals love. Even with all the hustle and bustle of Times Square, the Casablanca is quiet. As with everything else, particularly in NYC, things have changed a bit. No more piano music on Friday nights or happy hours, at least during my recent visit, but that's ok. Breakfast is good, snacks and beverages are available 24x7, Rick's is a great place to rest up and reflect on the day, or plan for the next day. I have stayed in plenty of other hotels in NYC, boutique and chain, but I keep coming back to the Casablanca. I almost didn't want to leave a review because it's a small place and when my secret's out I'd hate to NOT be able to get a room when I need one :-).  

The only "bad" I'd have to say is that cabs can be in short supply on its block on W43, especially in bad weather / rush hour / etc (it's New York!). But just leave enough time, take the subway, or schedule an Uber/Lyft. Or walk down to 6th Avenue and hail a cab there! It's New York!

title: 20th Wedding Anniversary Trip
text: Having never been to NYC the staff and location of Casablanca made our anniversary trip amazing! The accommodations were great but the staff was even better. Definitely made it a trip we will always remember for years to come. If you are considering a trip to NYC this is the place to stay!!!

title: Excellent location for theatre lovers
text:
Excellent location for theatre lovers and very close to the MoMA and the Broadway Museum. I always love boutique hotels. The staff are all very friendly and welcoming.  Rick's café is a lovely place to read or spend social time. They offer snacks, fruit, coffee/tea 24/7. It was nice to get back to the hotel after being out all day and stopping by to chat in a bright open space. I have been staying at this hotel for the last 15+ years. The only thing that I was disappointed in was the room. It needs a facelift. The window AC blows in ones' face, the room looked tired was damp. Perhaps other rooms have been updated. My husband said something at the desk but the person didn't suggest we change rooms so perhaps they all need refreshing. 

I hope that the hotel will update their rooms because I use to love staying here.

title: First Extended Hotel Stay was Fantastic
text:
This was my first extended hotel stay for a vacation. 5 days, 4 nights. This hotel was fantastic. It's QUIET (these smaller rooms don't offer a view, which they state on their site, but unless a cop car was on alert, I didn't hear any outside noise in my entire stay), quaint, classy, convenient, and economical: You don't spend too long in spots you don't want to be, nor does it take longer than you'd like to get where you need to go. There's a simple but spacious cafe that takes up all but one computer room on the second floor to get all-day snacks and beverages, and it's only a few steps to get to the lobby, so it's great to either walk up quickly to get something or stop there for a coffee and finish going downstairs.

I got a petite queen room, and for a bigger, taller guy like myself, I was more than impressed with how much room I had for the price regarding the bathroom, closet, doorway, and central space (though the space to sit on the toilet is extremely tight, so fair warning there.) While I didn't spend much daytime in the room, if I had experienced a day where I would have been too exhausted to do anything and just wanted to stay in, the room was nice enough to validate doing so. I can imagine a couple making a room like this also work for a short stay.

The concierges were all very cordial and helpful. The only time I had an issue was when the base of the shower head was leaking when showering, which they promptly fixed (it's also a very nice shower, too.)

You're also right in Times Square, Broadway, 7th Avenue, and walking distance from stuff like the Rockefeller Center, with ample access to transit.

title: An Oasis among all the busyness.
text: We loved our stay! The hotel is close to lots of attractions but is a nice calm place to come back to after a busy day. The breakfast was a wonderful start to each day and we liked having the space to meet up with family in Rick's cafe too. Staff was so wonderful and helpful. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Birthday Get Away
text: This was our third stay at The Casablanca. Experienced great service as always. Staff was most accommodating working around flight cancellations and delays. Assisted with arrangements for ground transportation to and from airport as well as transportation needs during our stay. Attentive staff at Rick’s Cafe as well. Tony’s DeNapoli right next door is a real treasure. This is my go to hotel in NYC.

title: These guys are good......and what a location!!!
text:
Location 10/10 if you're looking to be in the heart of the midtown action.  Literally steps into Times Square and Theatre-ville.
From the moment we checked in, the customer service, the time the team make for their guests, the room cleanliness, the lounge and breakfast area, just all wow factors, when we compare against other places we stayed in NYC.  Highly recommend the Mini Suite with king bed & sofa that we stayed in.  Great space in that room, very comfortable.
Big shout out to all the front desk team and, the superb ladies assisting with breakfast each morning - great customer service guys, nice one....

title: A great choice
text: I would not normally stay in the Times Square district as I find it too hectic but this was my partner’s first time in the city so the location was ideal. This is definitely not a budget choice but you simply can’t go wrong with the Casablanca. Location, service, comfort - it ticks all the boxes. Nothing at all to criticise. My only comment is that they could possibly take the Moroccan theme a touch further e.g. Moroccan  or 1939s/40s music in Rick’s bar rather than British and American pop. There is a linking door to Tony’s Italian restaurant next door - I am not sure what the relationship is but we found this eatery very noisy and crowded and the food nothing special. But the hotel itself is a real gem and the staff first class. Brilliant!

title: Another great stay at the Casablanca Hotel.
text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel years ago, and had a great experience, so when my daughter and I were in NYC last weekend so she could walk in New York Fashion Week, we decided to stay there again. Although the hotel is very close to Times Square, it is extremely quiet and tucked away from the crowds and busyness. My daughter's show was at Sony Hall, which was a quick walk away, and very convenient. We appreciated the quiet atmosphere, included breakfast and snacks, and the most comfortable beds EVER! The staff is kind and welcoming, and we look forward to staying at the Casablanca Hotel the next time we are in NYC.

title: Wonderful Stay
text: Excellent location, excellent staff, excellent hotel.  We were steps from Times Square and the theatre district, but still the hotel was an oasis from the chaos and noise of Times Square.  We easily navigated the city from the nearby and convenient subway station.

title: Really nice boutique hotel close to everything
text: Enjoyed our three night stay.  Staff was friendly and efficient.  Small room was comfortable with great AC and good shower.  A simple continental breakfast was included.  The hotel has a nice gathering area on floor 2 if you want to hang out.  Snacks provided too.

title: Great location, accommodations and 5 star staff
text: The hotel is very comfortable and the location can’t be beat but the best thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone is friendly, welcoming and wants to help. We had 3 flights cancelled over 2 days, my husband got sick and they went above and beyond 5 stars to make sure that our stay was lovely. The staff in the breakfast area always greeted us with a smile. A special shout out to Louis who was just so helpful and genuine. Thank you all!

title: Incroyable service - endroit très propre
text: Le service était excellent, la propreté de l’endroit aussi. Les petits déjeuner parfait pour débuter la journée du bon pied ainsi que tout les breuvages et collations disponibles 24/24 et sans frais. Situé à 1 minute de marche pour être sur Broadway en plein Time square

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We loved the location, so close to the Broadway shows and the places we visited.  The staff was so very kind and it was wonderful to have a place to rest and some snacks during the afternoon when we needed it.

title: Fabulous stay in New York
text: We had a great stay at Casablanca Hotel. The location was perfect being 30 seconds walk from Times Square, but it was tucked away in a fairly quiet spot. The lovely lady on breakfast was so nice, hospitable  and friendly. She really went above and beyond! The availability of snacks all day was fantastic.

title: We loved it!
text: Friendly and helpful staff, quiet rooms, great location near Times Square and very reasonably priced.  Good breakfast and the 24 hour lounge with drinks and snacks a definite plus.  Highly recommend and plan to return.

title: NYC Visit to see US OPEN
text:
We enjoyed our stay!
Friendly staff, good hotel restaurant, great 2nd floor lounge!
The room was small but clean and quiet.
Fabulous location next door to Times Square.
Great Oyster bar next door.
We will definitely come back

title: Beautiful Oasis in the Heart of Times Square
text: Sitting inside this beautiful, quiet boutique hotel, you would have no idea that loud Times Square was just outside the door. We had a wonder stay here and felt welcomed and pampered from the moment we entered.The staff was kind and courteous , and the surroundings are lovely and surprisingly quiet. What a treasure! We will stay here again! Tony’s is wonderful, too, and we will eat there again!!

title: Great experience
text:
We were so happy with our experience.  The staff were so helpful and so accommodating.
Being so close to Times Square was great.  When you need a little down time the 2nd floor was perfect.  We will be back!

title: Our new hotel home
text: Truly was like coming home! Clean, funky, boutique style hotel with great staff and amenities for a very reasonable NYC price. Continental breakfast was plentiful, filling and full f choices, as was the all-day snack selection. Request a room in the rear of the hotel (no view, but very quiet). Times Square is just steps away. Is out “go to” hotel for midtown stays!

title: Great on multiple stays
text: Our family of 4 has stayed at this hotel on more than on occasion and it has been very consistent.  The staff are excellent and the service is great. The only negatives are that the rooms and furniture are a bit dated (AC units are noisy), but that is also part of the theming and charm.  This is a great family spot, especially the suites. The lounge is a nice plus for drinks and snacks 24/7.  Overall we have enjoyed our stays and will return.

title: Great Stay!
text: What a wonderful place! This was a birthday trip-wine and a birthday card were waiting in the room. Despite being so close to Times Square, it's very quiet. Great centrally located hotel in proximity to theaters, MoMA, Bryant Park, the subway. All the staff are very helpful. Tony's next door is a wonderful restaurant. This was my second time staying here and I'll be back again!

title: Broadway Perfection Personified
text: Not  a hotel, but your "home in NYC." SIMPLY THE BEST, all within steps of Times Square. The staff, especially front desk and the ladies in the 24/7 guest lounge and breakfast suite, are flawlessly like welcoming family.

title: 5 stars plus more!
text: The Casablanca was even better than I was expecting!  I was looking for a boutique hotel with true New York style, and Casablanca definitely checked all the boxes..   Our suite was perfect for the 3 of us.   The staff was so accomodating.   We especially loved Maria at Rick's Cafe.   She even toasted our bagels for us!    And.....location, location, location......it was literally 1/2 block from Times Square.  We enjoyed eating at Tony's restaurant next door, which was also great.   And thank you, James, for your helping us with our questions about getting to the airport.

title: Perfect boutique hotel in Midtown
text: What a wonderful repeat stay at the Casablanca! Room was not ready so we went upstairs to the breakfast room to get coffee. We had just missed breakfast. A server came out and said we have pastry leftover. Would you like a bagel, almond croissant, or chocolate croissant? We said yes, and she brought out croissants for both of us. After a drive from Boston, it was welcomed! We checked our luggage at the front desk and returned later to find a happy anniversary card and a bottle of champagne in our room. Every time we left, they opened the door for us, every time we returned they opened the door for us and said Welcome back. It is our home away from home! It is so convenient to everything. We parked the car next-door for $30 a day. Never took it out. The only place to stay in New York City!

title: Awesome location and service - Highly recommend
text:
The location just off of Time Square is a perfect base for a family exploring the big apple.   From arrival to check out the service and people were friendly and all round awesome.   The room was exactly as described and we found it comfortable for a family with 2 teens.  

There is a resident's lounge on floor 2 which gave us space to spread out when in the hotel.   The range of snacks and drinks was good and was great value for the amenities charge levied. 

We really enjoyed our four-night stay, and would not hesitate to recommend it.  Will be our first choice if we visit New York again.

title: Excellent thoughtfulness.
text: Excellent care and thoughtfulness for an extremely tired traveler. I arrived mid morning after more than 15 hours of travel including 2 air flights and 2 security checks. I had hoped that I could rest in the lounge until a room was ready  -  but one had already been prepared for me as they were forewarned. Thank you to the staff.

title: Super Hotel. Sehr sauber und an guter Lage
text: Tolles Hotel an guter Lage am Times Square. Trotzdem sind die Zimmer ruhig. Sehr freundliches Personal. Toller Aufenthaltsraum mit grosszügigem Angebot. Sehr gutes Frühstück. Sehr sauberes Hotel. Eignet sich auch gut für Familien.

title: Casablanca thumbs up
text: Our favorite place to stay in NYC- only a few hundred feet from Time Square so convenient to do many places and subway stops.  Yet also very quiet and once inside, removed from the chaos outside.  Great staff; lovely decor; always appreciate the open good and coffee; very reasonable rates.

title: Great location, exceptional staff, comfortable
text: We got 5 star treatment at Casablanca Times Square. From the doorman, bellman, front desk check in, breakfast staff, to the cleaning staff, everyone was so welcoming and kind. There was nothing we wanted for during our stay. The beds were comfortable and they thought of all the little comforts and extras. It is in the perfect location, just steps from Time Square. I would stay again and highly recommend!!

title: Perfect location but still quiet in our room, very personable and friendly staff
text: Location!!!! It is in the center of it all and despite all that it was super quiet in our room. The rooms are a bit small but very clean, comfortable beds, and great bathrooms. The tiling work in the bathroom was gorgeous.  Free (good quality) snacks, coffee, and water bottles are available on the second floor.  Staff were very personable and friendly. My five year old keeps asking if we can go back to the hotel where they open the door for you. He was also gifted with a little orangutan stuffed animal at check in that he loves.

title: Great hotel
text:
We love the Casablanca!  It really is like home away from home! Everyone on staff is so kind and helpful. The room was very clean and had everything we needed. The breakfast that they offer is a great start to the day- many healthy selections, and nice choices for everyone and very plentiful. The manager John is a great guy and aims to please the guests.
Stay there- u won’t be sorry!

title: Weekend in NYC
text: They helped us organize transportation from the airport and treated us like family. Best hotel in NYC! Free breakfast and treats throughout the day. Rooms were very comfortable and well maintained. The entire hotel was spotless and I never say that in reviews.

title: Such a Lovely Place
text: I had a lovely stay at the Casablanca. Clean place, charming rooms, polite and attentive staff. Location was great, as it was walking distance to the Broadway shows I was there to see. They provide unlimited complimentary Clif bars in their cafe, which as a vegan was a huge plus. No complaints for my first stay in New York!

title: Casablanca Hotel a real gem
text:
A gem of a boutique hotel just a few steps to Times Square.
The carpets in the bedrooms could do with an upgrade,and the our conditioner was rather noisy.
There are no fridges in the rooms but they will bring ice if you request it.
There are free toiletries provided with a hairdryer ,ironing board and iron.
The beds and pillows were very comfortable and there were plenty of fluffy towels.
There are free soft drinks and water provided all day with tea and coffee,fruit snack bars and crisps, in the second flour lounge , but the hotel does not have a licence to sell alcohol.
This is all included in the resort fee with a continental breakfast.with yoghurt tea and coffee.
There are  hardboiled eggs for breakfast, the staff will heat oatmeal porridge for you and toast bagels with cream cheese.
We found this breakfast perfectly adequate and there are diners nearby if a full breakfast is required.
All the staff are so very pleasant,friendly and welcoming, and will do everything to help you.
We really enjoyed our stay and would stay at the Casablanca again if we visited New York.

title: Really Nice Stay
text:
My Wife and I stayed at the hotel for our anniversary. Not really on the day. 25 years!  Checking in was easy and the two people we interacted with were really nice. Our room was small. I knew that going in but, it was nice. It was clean and everything was up to date. The one thing I would recommend to the hotel is; put a thin small table under the TV so we have a place to charge the phone and make coffee in the morning.  We ate dinner at the Hotel restaurant. Again, really good. A lot of food, nice waiter really a nice night. 

One of the best places I've stayed in NYC.

title: Amazing!
text: If you could give six stars, I would have given six stars.  Excellent location, best service I have experienced in the last decade, clean rooms.  This is an older building,, which I loved, modern and new.  It is smaller which is very hard to find SMACK IN THE MIDDLE of everything.  Lovely breakfast choices and all day snacks.  Comfortable beds, felt like home.  Won’t stay anywhere else in NYC.

title: Small Size Big Punch
text: Wow.  I travel to NYC frequently and usually select based on rate/location.  My first time at this hotel, and they have spoiled me for anywhere else.  SERVICE.SERVICE.SERVICE.  The staff are lovely, answer emails about arrival/departure times quickly.  The second floor lounge (Rick's Cafe) was well stocked with a cappuccino machine, drinks, snacks and the continental breakfast was a great way to start the day with again, helpful, friendly service.  My room and bathroom were a great size for NY (I had a queen deluxe) and the location was perfect.

title: Great hotel, perfect location.
text: Excellent boutique hotel located a few steps from Times Square, very professional staff, nice room with very good bed (important for me as I have some back issues), nice sitting room for breakfast and drinks/snacks 24h, Tony's italian restaurant perfect !

title: Great location to see New York City.
text: The hotel is conveniently located within walking distance of Times Square, MOMA, Central Park, and the shows. The staff was so efficient in helping us find restaurants or walking directions to our destinations. very happy with the cleanliness, snack, and beverage offerings and the little breakfast.

title: A special hotel, steps from Broadway.
text:
The minute I came in the door, I was greeted and directed to the desk. The small lobby is quaint, and simple. The desk was right in front of me, so being directed was a welcomed courtesy. The check in was simple, I was told about the really nice food on the 2nd floor. 
That was also a pleasant surprise. The hotel is set in what I think is a beautifully restored old townhouse, and they offer a lovely continental breakfast and all day snacks. I loved the breakfast room with its period furniture and cozy atmosphere. My room was simple, comfortable and immaculate and very reasonably priced. I highly recommend it.

title: Nice Times Square Boutique Hotel
text: This is a very accommodating small hotel conveniently located near Times Square. You can walk from the train station; the newer Moynihan Hall at the Amtrak train station is clean and air conditioned. The hotel is small and a little tight, but the staff make a real effort to reach out to the guests. The breakfast area is welcoming and clean.  The rooms are small but clean with decent water pressure.  The prices are lower than higher rated boutique or chain hotels, making the value proposition attractive.

title: Better than the 5 stars off Central Park.
text: The staff there was top notch.  Better than we got at the Plaza or the Peninsula and at 1/4 the price per night.  The second story space was a treat, the hosts get it.  Was so nice you could get a bag of chips or a water late at night.  Beds were super comfy and room was immaculate.  I would stay there again over some of the $1500 a night 5 star places off Central Park.

title: Excellent
text: Great Stay!  Safe, Clean, and wonderful location for our planned activities.  Super friendly and helpful staff especially with our heavy luggage from the curb to our room.  Really appreciated being able to access our room earlier than guaranteed due to availability.  The cafe is comfortable and useful with a computer, printer and nice music.  We will definitely stay again.  Thank you!

title: Great Hotel!
text: This was the perfect hotel to explore New York with my family.  Clean, comfortable but what really stood out was the staff.  Everyone went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable.  Thank you, we will be back.

title: error in bill
text: Booked my reservation by phone and was told the total was $480 for 2 nights. I asked if that included tax and other fees and was told "Yes".  When I checked out the bill included over $100 in taxes and fees on top of the $480.  Simply told that I was given incorrect info

title: Wonderful Experience for Family of Four
text: LOVE!! Traveled with myself, husband, and two teens. Due to the size of the rooms, we decided on booking two rooms for the four of us and it worked out great. I can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. 1) Location is perfect for tourists who want to do touristy things. Even though it was just down the block from Times Square, as soon as we stepped through the doors of the hotel, all the noise and chaos melted away and we were in the peace and quiet again. Amazing! 2) Don't be turned off by the resort fee. This will pay for itself time and time again with water bottles, breakfast foods, hot chocolate, coffee, snacks, fruit, and again - peace and quiet. Not only is the lounge area clean and well-kempt, it is always stocked, and is tucked away from everything else. There is even an adorable little outdoor seating area that was perfect! 3) Because of the smaller size of this hotel, there was never a wait for the elevators, our rooms were cleaned very early in the day, and it was nice and quiet. 4) Service was excellent. Always a smiling face at the front desk and staff were able to answer any questions we had. We had stayed at The Library Hotel years ago and loved it so we were hoping Casablanca Hotel would be just as great - we were not wrong. If you are on the fence - just book it. You can't go wrong!

title: Gem in the middle of it all
text: The service at this boutique hotel is second to none. John (bellman/front door) was so helpful and always went the extra mile. Everyone on the second floor eating area was so kind and attended to everything we needed. The rooms are on the smaller side, but honestly you spend so little time in your rooms in NYC that it doesn't really matter. The second floor library area was helpful if you ever felt like the walls were closing in on you in the room. Our daughters went down there often to have some space. The location is perfect, just a half of a block to Times Square, right in the middle of it all. We highly recommend this hotel.

title: Wonderful and Convenient
text: We had a great stay at Casablanca Hotel during a quick trip to New York.  We were walking distance to the Gershwin Theater where our friend's daughter was performing in Wicked.   We were close to the subway, restaurants, and everything we needed.  We easily navigated the subway to get the Ground Zero Museum.  The staff was attentive and helpful.  We enjoyed the lounge and had breakfast there.  It was wonoderful to have water and snacks available at any time.  We would stay there again!  We learned that other friends who also live in California had stayed there which we did not know before going!

title: Lovely hotel
text:
The hotel was lovely, well positioned and the breakfast/snacks that were available were an added bonus.
The staff were welcoming, we enjoyed our stay & would definitely stay there again
The hotel was spotlessly clean

title: This small hotel has it all.
text: This was our second stay at the Casablanca and it never disappoints.  The staff is always friendly and helpful.  The rooms are clean and well appointed and the second floor cafe has complimentary beverages and snacks throughout the day.  The location is perfect for seeing a show and there are many restaurants nearby.

title: Best of the Best!
text: This little gem of a boutique hotel is far superior to any others around, and even shines within its own hotel collection! It continues to be an oasis in the middle of Times Square, that provides peace, tranquility and all the comforts of home! Immaculate clean, best staff and management ever, wonderful amenities, comfortable, warm and welcoming in every way! It doesn't get better than this!

title: BEST HOTEL IN TIMES SQUARE
text: This an excellent hotel. It is centrally located in the heart of Times Square, but is very quiet once inside the hotel. It is an intimate setting, and the staff are very pleasant and accommodating. Many of them have been there for years which is a good sign. We have been travelling to NYC 3 times a year for a number of years and would not stay anywhere else.

title: Very nice get away weekend near Braodway.
text: The room was comfortable and clean.  Everyone treated us really well.  The breakfast nook was very nice and there was a nice variety of food available.  The location is great for theater goers.  We have stayed several times and had good experiences.  We will go again.

title: Amazing Hotel and Staff!
text:
My wife and I visited NYC for our 20th anniversary.  Neither of us had ever been to New York, and I found the Casablanca Hotel on Google Maps (searched for hotels close to Times Square with good ratings).  I wanted to stay at a more unique hotel vs a Marriot or major chain hotel.  
Our room was ready for us when we arrived.   All of the staff were extremely helpful and polite.  Our room was immaculate.  We didn't have a huge room, but it didn't feel cramped.  We had a large closet, a dresser, bistro table and chairs, king size bed, and full bathroom.  The beds were nice and soft also.  
The cleaning staff straightened up the room daily, and made sure we had clean towels as well.  The hotel has a continental breakfast, which wasn't huge, but everything we had there was delicious.  There's a quaint outdoor sitting area we sat in each morning (a lot more seating was available inside).  As for the location of the hotel - it's perfect!  It's about 20 yards from Times Square.  It's central to most everything.  There's even a very good restaurant attached to the hotel, Tony's Di Napoli.  We had dinner there our first night in town - it was delicious!  Make sure to go there hungry, they have family style portions - so they're huge!   We absolutely loved our first trip to NYC, and we would absolutely plan to stay at the Casablanca Hotel if/when we go back.

title: Perfect location for me!
text:
I stayed at Casablanca Hotel this past weekend (June 23-25)
A friend had monetized staying here and I thought it was worth a try since it is so close to the theaters I was going to visit.
And, the location was perfect for me for that reason.
I like to walk and walking to me from MOMA and The Metropolitan Museum was a great and easy walk.

The light breakfast and available water bottles throughout the day were appreciated
The staff in the dining area, reception and door people were friendly and helpful.

My room was comfortable. It was humid weekend so having working a/c was great.
The room was dark, however. I guess older buildings are like that.
Next time I stay, I will ask for a room with a window that faces the street instead of a building ( if there is such a thing in this hotel)

I have stayed at the sister hotel, Hotel Elysee several times and that location is better for visiting the “Museum Mile”museums

Again, as a solo traveler with ticket to an evening play, I wanted the security of a  lose walk back to my hotel

title: Lovely Hotel
text: Lovely small hotel in the Times Square/Theater District. Rooms were very nice and quiet. And they were as described in the web site. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The continental breakfasts in Rick’s Cafe were generous and food was available there all day. Staff there was also very helpful. I’d happily stay there again.

title: Gem of a boutique hotel
text: Have stayed at this gem of a hotel multiple times and never disappointed.  Rooms are NY small, but adequate and always pristine.  Definitely a quiet haven in mid-town.  Close to everything.  But it is the staff that makes the experience so special.  Attentive to all our needs in a very professional but engaging way.  Will definitely be back.

title: Don’t keep looking… just book the hotel!
text:
I have just recently completed my 5th stay at The Casablanca Hotel. 

I have had the pleasure of many trips to Manhattan from Australia and stayed in many different hotels in the city and I can promise you that once you stumble across The Casablanca you needn’t look any further. 

Firstly the location cannot get better. Steps from Times Square and within a very short stroll to Bryant Park, 5th Avenue & Grand Central. The hotel is also located beside ‘Tony’s’, one of the best Italian restaurants in the city. 

The rooms are a good size for Manhattan, quiet & always impeccably clean. Rick’s cafe - on level 2 is open 24/7 and a great area to regroup, converse with other travelers & plan for your next day. 

However, the thing that keeps me coming back stay after stay is without a doubt the staff. Every member of staff is always impeccably presented with an incredibly high attention to detail. A special mention to Luis on the door who helped me with me offensively heavy luggage & Cristian on the desk for greeting me with a smile every time I walked in but the biggest mention to Dimitri who is hands down the greatest asset to the hotel. Talk about cool, calm & collected, The way he he single handedly keeps the hotel running and personalizes himself with the guests is not something that can be taught. The Casablanca is very lucky to have someone of his caliber on their staff. 

Don’t keep looking… Just book the hotel!

title: Charming hotel with great location
text: The Casablanca is an older hotel with a great deal of charm.   It’s location right off Times Square is hard to beat.  The central location makes it a great base for sightseeing during the day.  And it is an easy walk to some great nightlife including Carmine’s and Sardi’s restaurants, the Birdland jazz club  and numerous Broadway theaters.  The staff was friendly, helpful and professional.  The $25 resort fee includes a generous and varied continental breakfast in Rick’s Café along with fresh fruit, snacks and soft drinks available all day.

title: What a Gem of a Hotel
text:
We go to a lot of Broadway shows and are always looking for a better hotel, and we have finally found it at the Casablanca.  First off, the staff is unfailingly pleasant and polite and nothing is a problem.  Their suggestions were on point, their directions were accurate and saved us a lot of time, and it is such a joy to walk in and feel welcomed no matter the time of day.

One of the greatest advantages is the hotel is located 20 yards from underground parking, and the hotel subsidizes; which is fantastic.  When we turned down 43rd, during rush hour, we were sure we would have to go blocks to get a good location.  What a dream to turn in the parking lot, open the trunk, and 1 minute later be in the lobby.  This was particularly nice as our arrival date was the day the Canadian smoke was blanketing the city.

The rooms were comfortable, the water pressure strong, and the fridge cold.  One of the great features of the Casablanca is a second-floor lounge/sitting room with a Continental breakfast but it is particularly nice, late at night, for free snacks and coffee.  

The hotel's location cannot be beaten as we were within hundreds of yards of all the theaters and walking distance from some of the best restaurants in Manhattan. Next door to the Casablanca is the Brooklyn Diner which is an old-school institution serving fabulous breakfasts and fare...we ate there every day.  

If you are a theater buff and do not want to spend $1000/night on a hotel room, The Casablanca is a great option.

title: Casablanca great hotel next to times square
text:
Casablanca hotel lived up to its reviews--its was clean and very convientantly
close to Times Square.. we loved dining at Tonys Italian restaurant next door
the staff and doormen were eager to assist with bags or getting a cab.
highly recommend.

title: Location, Location!
text: The Casablanca is a sister hotel of our favorite, The Giraffe.  For this short visit we wanted to stay closer to the Theater area. The location is perfect and they follow with exceptional staff. There are snacks available all day with a continental breakfast. The hotel is aging but well cared for, however, the rooms are very small.

title: Perfect for theater trip
text: Extremely convenient for theater fans - one block off Broadway and just minutes to walk to major theaters and restaurants. The hotel is centrally located - only a 15-20 minute to Central Park or Lincoln Center or the Hudson River park and the High Line. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. My petite queen room was very small but comfortable and completely quiet. We appreciated Rick's Cafe with 24/7 complimentary coffee, tea, sodas, and water, and took advantage of the modest breakfast before we began our day - bagels, pastries, fruit, hard boiled eggs, yogurt. Will stay there again on our next theater trip.

title: The best  hotel in Times Square!
text:
Amazing hotel in the perfect location! This is my third time staying here and I wouldn’t stay anywhere else. We will celebrating our son’s graduation from high school. There was a nice note for him in our room upon our arrival mentioning his accomplishment. 
The continental breakfast was great every morning and the staff was so helpful and kind. We will be back!

title: I'll Be Back
text: I am reluctant to relate how wonderful the Casablanca is lest it be full when I want to travel to New York and stay there.  Just say I have been many times and have always enjoyed my stays.  The staff is terrific, attentive, competent.  Location good if you are doing a round of Broadway plays.  I will stay there again and again and again...

title: Perfect Girlfriends' Weekend
text: A friend and I met in New York for a recent weekend and stayed at The Casablanca Hotel because it was close to everything we wanted to do.  From the moment we arrived, everyone on the staff was incredibly helpful and friendly -- from storing our bags because our room wasn't ready to recommending the perfect spot for a pre-theatre drink and snack.  We couldn't have asked for a better place to spend the weekend.  We agreed that we would definitely both stay at The Casablanca again if we ever find ourselves in the city.

title: Excellent service at this city centre hotel
text:
The location of this hotel, close to Times Square and on 43rd Street was a perfect location for our weeks stay. Although our room on the third floor was small, and without any view, this was more than compensated for by being perfectly serviced each day and scrupulously clean. All the staff went out of their way to be as helpful and friendly as they could and in particular mention should be given to the girls on hand for the buffet breakfast.
We would certainly stay here again, and in fact, look forward to a return visit.

title: Highly recommended
text: I recently spent 3 nights at Casablanca during a work trip to NYC. It was lovely to start and end my day in such a beautiful, calm, and friendly environment. I loved the Moroccan decor throughout, and appreciated having a nice lounge area and private work areas available at all hours of the day. The staff was very welcoming and helpful, especially the women in charge of breakfast, who always greeted me with a smile and prepared delicious "custom" oatmeal for me every morning. The hotel is only a block away from Broadway/Time Square, yet it feels amazingly serene once you walk through those doors.

title: Casablanca hotel stay to see Broadway shows
text: The people who work there could not have been nicer. The room was adequate quiet, close to everything and clean. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.  The hotel is about 100 years old, which added some amazing charm. It was close to all of the bustle of Times Square yet without any of the noise. Especially nice snack area where guests could get coffee tea, sodas, fruit, protein bars, 24 hours a day. Additionally, in this area a lovely continental breakfast was provided every morning. Most hotels I’m aware of John offer this amenity.

title: WONDERFUL STAY!
text: My friend and I had an amazing stay!.  The suite was comfortable, very clean and perfect for our stay.  The entire staff, especially Dominic and Tavon were so gracious and patient.  We will definitely stay again.

title: Perfect hotel in a great area for theatres
text:
The Casablanca is a wonderful small hotel and we couldn’t be more pleased with the our stay.   The staff was very attentive and gave us wonderful advice on where to eat and how to get around New York. 
Having the second floor bistro that offered around the clock snacks and drinks was such a plus. 
We had the hotel arrange transportation to and from JFK airport and that company was also terrific.
We will definitely return to The Casablanca hotel and highly recommend staying there.  
And by the way we never heard any outdoor noise.  It’s very quiet.   The rooms are small but very clean!

title: Best customer service
text: The customer service and friendly vibe was phenomenal. Every single staff tried to make our stay as enjoyable as possible and went above and beyond with every little request we had. They assisted with car reservations to and from the airport, placing balloons and birthday notes in the room prior to arrival, daily taxi rides, local food recs, free snacks and refreshments, umbrellas for raining days…on and on.

title: Great find!
text: Wonderful stay.  We stayed at Casablanca over Memorial Day weekend.  The staff was outstanding.  Room was clean and comfortable.  We were so surprised to come back at the end of the day to find our room had been cleaned and we had fresh towels and glasses.  Seems like that went away with Covid.  It was such a nice surprise.  The breakfast that is offered was very nice and again the staff in the lounge were outstanding.  We would absolutely recommend this hotel and would stay again.

title: Great Hotel!
text: Great Hotel! Quaint & Cozy! Staff was very friendly and accommodating. We put it was our anniversary on the reservation and they surprised us with a bottle of sparkling wine on ice!! Nice! Room very clean and comfortable. Continental breakfast was perfect! Highly recommend this hotel! We will be back! 🙂

title: Best customer service experience ever
text: Best customer service ever.  Attentive, polite, go out of their way to make you have a perfect stay.  Wonderful location -  John and staff make you feel welcome the moment you walk in the door.  Perfection!

title: Amazing hotel, location and staff!
text: The Casablanca hotel is truly amazing.  We stayed there several times about 16 years ago and when we decided to take another trip to NYC there was no questions of where we would be staying!!   The staff is so wonderful and friendly.  The location is right by Times Square, it is a quick walk to Broadway.  The room we selected was a mini-suite which gave us extra room to spread out and relax.  It is also centrally located to lots of restaurants.

title: Book Casablanca - especially if it's your first time in New York!
text:
It was the people at Casablana who made our stay so special. Particular thanks to Brian and Dimitri who patiently dealt with our ever changing reservations, due to travel disruptions, with humour and attentiveness.

The hotel location was perfect for our first time in New York - within easy reach of Broadway, Central Park, Grand Central Station, Bryant Park, Fifth Avenue, The New York Public Library, The Empire State and our absolute favourite - The Summit. We visited with our elderly mother - aged ninety and in a wheelchair - and we did the lot! Her lifetime dream.

The hotel itself was a home from home with the lovely relaxing 24 hour lounge - a refuge to refresh and revive ourselves after busy sightseeing. The rooms were clean, tidy and spacious for a Times Square location - with the luxury of a bathtub for aching feet. Everything needed was on hand and room service were happy to help with any special requests. Of course there can be some noise - you are in the centre of the action - but there are quieter rooms. That said, we felt a tranquillity here away from the hub-bub yet so convenient.

We ended a great five days at Tony's Restaurant next door where the same warmth and friendly service was offered with a particular celebratory dessert and serenade to my mother which completed a fabulous stay. 

I would definitely recommend the personal attention, professionalism and kindness of this well-located hotel - especially if New York is new to you.  It is also close to The Rum House, if you like rum and jazz - which we do!

title: Quiet, Clean & Quaint
text: We stayed here for 2 nights and had zero complaints! Staff were friendly, room was clean, breakfast was yummy and the hotel was quiet. Such a convenient location right off of Times Square and the perfect spot to rest after a busy day. Staff made sure that all of our needs were met and went above and beyond to make our stay great.

title: Excellent moderately priced hotel just a few steps from Times Square
text: Great location for theater; Lincoln Center is close by as well (20 minute walk, or a short subway ride).Very reasonable prices for New York.  Very convenient continental breakfast -- hard boiled eggs, cold cereal, fruit, yogurt, bagels, croissants, orange juice -- more than adequate (and it's included in the price of the room).

title: Gold Standard in Customer Service
text:
Casablanca continues to be the gold standard in hotels and customer service!!!

John and his team, especially Demetrious, are the definition of the best!  From remembering our names, giving our daughter a stuffed animal to always having a smile on their face, simply the best.

The mini-suite was the perfect size for a family of three.  The breakfast and snacks made it easy to kick off the day.

Room and staff were beyond expectations!

I do have two recommendations; bring back the wine and cheese in the evening.  Not so much for the food but it was a great way to get to know people from all over the world.

Secondly, hand out logoed water bottles at the start of each stay.  Ask employees to use those rather than using plastic water bottles that are thrown away after one use.  This is better for the environment and a souvenir for the guests.

We have stayed here before and this will continue to be our pick for future trips.  

Lori, Jeff and Grace

title: The Casablanca Hotel
text: Literally, just steps from Times Square. Rick's Cafe is a quiet place to have a light breakfast, or coffee in the afternoon. The room was comfortable. We didn't spend much time in the room. A lovely place to stay.

title: Would recommend
text:
Good: Wonderful staff. Great theming. I loved the lounge and courtyard. Snacks and breakfast were nice to have available. The room was a good size for NYC and it was clean. Location is ideal.

Not so good: the sink drained slowly and some of the linens were stained.

title: Best hotel in NYC, by far.
text: This location is incredible.  1/2 block off Times Square.  The moment you walk into this hotel, it is as if you have left the city and are in a calm, serene place far, far away.  Very relaxing.  Step out the front door and you are in the heart of the action once again.  Great breakfast and snacks available all day.  Expresso/cappuccino machine available at all hours and very much appreciated.  Everyone is very nice.  Clean and well-appointed rooms.  Can't recommend this hotel too highly.

title: Birthday trip to New York
text:
I travel a fair bit with my work but rarely leave reviews but with the Casablanca I felt compelled to write a review and thank them for a wonderful few days. Their level of service is second to none with a location you couldn’t wish better for if you like the hustle and bustle of Time square. 
They provide a unique service which is complimentary tea and coffee (priceless in New York) with mugs and fresh milk, not just your run of the mill vending machine. Added to this a complimentary breakfast, bagels, fruit, croissants etc which I can’t emphasise enough is unique for this corner of the world.
The rooms are clean and tidy and throughout the hotel the Casablanca theme runs true.
I truly can’t recommend this hotel highly enough, a real find amongst the plethora of chains and luxury hotels.
Thank you again and I promise we shall return!

title: BEST hotel in all of NYC!
text: This is our second stay at Casablanca Hotel in Times Square and it was like coming home!!  We absolutely LOVE this hotel!  The room is clean, comfortable, and has such charm to it!  The 2nd floor is so comfortable with snacks and drinks available all day. We enjoyed just recharging there after a long day of walking, or first thing in the morning at the delicious continental breakfast provided!  The staff is truly what makes this hotel the best in NYC!  From the minute you arrive, to the time you have to leave...this staff gives their all for you!!  A very special thank you to Dimitri, Luis, John and Christian who just went above and beyond to make sure we were having the perfect stay!  You all are amazing and we can't thank you enough!!

title: Location location
text: Wonderful spacious room for New York. Great large shower, seperate sitting area, comfy bed. Bottled water and toiletries replenished daily. Our room was very quiet, given the AMAZING LOCATION! The staff on the front desk and door were just lovely too.

title: Amazing Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Times Square
text: Wonderful! Staff here were attentive to every need, friendly to the extreme, and the amenities and location were perfect. We have stayed here before and would recommend the Casablanca Hotel to anyone and everyone. It is our go to place when in NYC.

title: Comfort and Quality.
text: A very comfortable quality hotel all round. Rooms were excellent, beds and room facilities fine. Breakfast was more than adequate and snacks/drinks available throughout day.  Location hard to beat. Just off Times Square and subway station a few minutes walk. The staff were top class from front of house to cleaning and catering. We are grandparents and we took two of our grandkids who thought the Casablanca was really cool. I think the plumbing is due an overhaul soon. no major problems, but taps and showers a little unpredictable. A real pleasure to return to the Casablanca each day knowing its welcoming, clean and safe. We have recommended the hotel to family and friends and would definitely return.

title: Just what was needed and wanted!
text:
The Casablanca employees make this hotel! Everyone from the front desk to the doorman and the breakfast attendants were wonderful to deal with. Polite, courteous and always wanting to help.
Rooms are nicely appointed and comfortable. Good water pressure and plenty of hot water. If you’re looking for views, this isn’t the place, but the charm overshadows it all. We’d love to come again.

title: An outstanding visit!
text: Traveled from ATL to NYC to see Phantom one more time before it closed. Haven't stayed at the Casablanca in a number of years but it's just as I remembered. In addition to a great location, the hospitality and customer service is second to none! The staff wishes you a good day as you leave and always welcomes you upon your return. It's a joy to stay at this hotel and I will be back. I took my grandaughter on this trip, first time to NYC, and she couldn't agree more. She will definitely return, with or without me. You owe it to yourself to check this place out.

title: My Favorite Hotel
text:
The Casablanca Hotel is a wonderful home away from home. The incredible staff is what sets the hotel apart from any other. Everyone makes you feel welcomed and is genuinely interested in making your visit to New York City unforgettable. The location is perfect
Fir getting to and from any of the landmark sites. There are lots of excellent restaurants nearby also. I’ve stayed at the Casablanca twice now and I hope to do so again soon!!
It’s truly my favorite hotel !

title: A home away from home.
text: We have loved the Casablanca for years. We stayed four nights in a deluxe Queen. The rooms are not large but very well appointed. The bathroom was very nice. There is also a good size closet. The most important things about the Casablanca are 1) the friendly and wonderful staff 2) the great location - you are near Times Square but the hotel feels like an oasis 3) the wonderful lounge on the second floor. The continental breakfast is very generous. The attendants are helpful - they make sure you have what you want - like toasting your bagels. The lounge is also stocked with fruits, cliff bars and water. There are plenty of places to sit and tables and chairs as well. I cannot say enough about the Casablanca. We love it!

title: Location Location location
text: the hotel staff was friendly , location was perfect for seeing the show and the restaurants on the block where great.  Our room was clean and fresh, plenty of water and toiletries. Ricks cafe  was a great breakfest and quick snack meeting place

title: Great front desk!!!
text:
Front desk staff were wonderful...funny, resourceful, accommodating!!
(especially...Jeff).
We have stayed here before...and the theater is super convenient to everything.
However, our check in process was entertaining...and worth mentioning as they were helpful and enjoyable!!

title: Best hotel stay EVER!
text: I don’t normally write reviews, but this was probably the best hotel stay I’ve ever had.  EVERY employee at The Casablanca Hotel goes out of their way to make you feel welcome.  Not being very familiar with the city, they offered help with subway choices, food options…your name it.  And not in a contrived way…every effort to make our stay the best it could be was genuine and authentic.  It’s clear there is a professional camaraderie amongst the employees, and they genuinely like to help. Additionally, the hotel is SUPER convenient to Times Square, and really very quiet once your inside….you’d never know Times Square was just around the corner.  Central to theaters, food, transportation.  I look forward to coming back!

title: Charming Hotel
text: Lovely Boutique Hotel! Great location close to everything, yet quiet and comfy. Extremely clean with nice amenities.  The staff was always so kind and helpful as well. I would highly recommend to anyone staying in NYC!

title: My Goto Hotel in NYC
text: This is my home when visiting NYC.  Great location.  Great Service.  Reasonable prices.  It has very much a European boutique hotel feel, meaning a small lobby and a very comfortable lounge where a light breakfast is served and refreshments available 24/7.   Also, similar to a European boutique hotel, it's old so the heaters are the old radiators and there are times the boiler controlling the availability of hot water goes down.  Maybe that adds to its charm?

title: Wonderful place to stay
text: What a wonderful surprise! The location is perfect for proximity to shows and good places to eat. Rooms are very comfortable and the second floor area (Ricks Cafe) provided continental breakfast and snacks throughout the day. The entire staff was awesome. We will try to stay here every time we venture into NYC.

title: Perfect place to stay right off Times Square!
text:
Absolutely beautiful experience beginning to end! Being a smaller hotel the attention you receive as a guest is fantastic!! Very personal and friendly. The location was perfect for being right off Times Square so very close and accessible to all the action but also far enough around the corner to get a break. 😜
We used their car service from LGA so that could not have been easier. The rooms and lounge are very comfortable and nostalgic. Definitely loved the free beverages and snacks throughout the week. This has by far been my favorite place ti stay when visiting the Big Apple!

title: Fabulous Retreat!
text: As 2 older girlfriends spending a weekend in NYC, not only is the Casablanca a perfect choice because of its location, it is truly a b&b feel hotel in the ♥️ of Manhattan.  We felt safe inside its doors even though we were steps away from Times Square. The coziness and cleanliness of the entire building was first rate and staff was attentive and helpful.  We logged over 25K steps for the weekend, and coming back later in the day for a break before dinner to sit and have a tea or drink in the breakfast/sitting area was also a nice extra.

title: Wonderful place to stay in NYC
text: We love the location- close to all the action but out of the madness.  Everyone on the staff is exceptional- reception personnel, Rick's Café workers, maids.  All went out of their way to make you feel both at home and valued.  The selection at the continental breakfast was wonderful.  And the fruit and snacks available all day was a bonus.  The room itself was very comfortable and not to small.  A much nicer experience than the big chain hotels.

title: Great Experience
text: Frankly I was slightly shocked when I walked through the front doors.  I was expecting a BIG NYC entrance.  Where the other hotels focus on lobby, Casablanca focuses on experience.  Do yourself a favor, and stay here at least one night.  The hotels service, and charm is unbeatable.  Dont forget to check out the private garden near the cafe.

title: This place earns its rating
text:
My family stayed here during a Spring Break trip, and we loved it. My wife and I stayed at Hotel Elysee many years ago, so we were familiar with the collection. More than a decade later, they still live up to the high ratings that each hotel maintains. 

My kids loved the lounge (especially my daughter who loves cats and enjoyed the numerous cat statues throughout) including the games and piano. Breakfast was nice - it's continental but great for a light start to the day - and being able to grab a snack or drink throughout the day was great. 

The staff were all extremely welcoming and helpful. At breakfast, the helped us navigate what options were safe for our son (dairy allergy) and offered to toast our bagels daily. Everyone at the front desk was very friendly. It rained several days we were there and, while we were prepared with our own umbrellas, front desk staff always offered one of theirs.

We stayed in the suite so we'd have a little more space and I was very glad we did. Having the extra room made it feel much more comfortable than a standard room in Manhattan. Location is also outstanding if you plan to spend a lot of time in and around Times Square.

We only had two very minor complaints:  1. The shower curtain was very short and difficult to keep in the tub so the floor got a bit wet during showers. 2. Being an older building, the heat is provided by radiator which made the room extremely warm at times. We simply opened the windows and had the fan/AC run a bit to cool it down.

Overall, I can't recommend this place enough.

title: Good to Be Back
text: Although we hadn't been to NYC for several years due to COVID, it was like returning to an old friend when we stayed for four nights while attending plays on Broadway. Unfortunately, the evening wine and cheese party is still a casualty of the lack of help they experienced during the pandemic. Everything else seemed to be just the way we remembered it. With everything they set out for breakfast (available up to 10 am), it makes a mid-day meal unnecessary. The only other thing that seemed changed was that all the other guests we ran into were American whereas we had always enjoyed speaking with the many foreign visitors that previously had populated the hotel. Maybe that will change in the summer. All told, it was just as we always enjoyed - a few steps from theaters and a welcoming and helpful staff.

title: Love the Casablanca  - friendly, cozy and charming.
text: My husband and I love the Casablanca in NYC. This was our second stay there. It met all our expectations. The location is perfect. We were able to walk both uptown and down - to Central Park, the NY Public Library, Grand Central Station, the Guggenheim, the Met, Museum of Natural History to name a few highlights. Took an easy metro ride down to catch the Staten Island ferry and walked all the way back. The highlight of the Casablanca though is the wonderful staff - everyone just lovely every day. And it is fantastic to have 24 hr access to fruit, tea, coffee etc at their own little cafe. That is unbeatable. We will definitely be back.

title: LOVE LOVE LOVED OUR STAY!
text: Fabulous stay! Everything was just perfect!!! From the library to the staff to the complimentary water bottles in the room. Clean and beautifully decorated rooms with nice breakfast offering. Wonderful to have the fireplace and coffee brewing around the clock. So relaxing and felt at home - the front desk attendant said we were now one of the family at checkout!

title: A consistent hotel
text: Everything was perfect. Centrally located the staff is amazing . Easy to get take-out from Tony’s. Clean and welcoming boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square makes it easy to get around and enjoy the Big Apple

title: Pleasant, Inviting, Relazing
text:
Friendly, helpful, courteous personnel.
Always ready to help with questions, offer assistance with information about resources and help with any arrangements.

Please always keep that wonderful "hazelnut coffee" hot and ready!

title: What an incredible find!
text: Amazing hotel! The staff couldn't have been more helpful. The second lounge felt like home. Plus it's in such a great location- close to Times Square and the theatre district. You can walk just about anywhere.

title: Comfortable, great professional staff, breakfast selection is perfect.  Location is killer!
text: Hard to find a nice hotel close to Time Square that isn't crazy expensive and that has great service.  Not fancy, but comfortable, with super-friendly professional staff.  Breakfast selection was perfect for what we like:  fresh fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, sufficient pastries.  Just fits the bill for what we look for in a small, comfortable hotel.

title: Comfortable oasis in the city.
text: Felt like coming home after a busy day in the city.  The second floor lounge and free coffee was a perfect place to unwind. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and always available to help.  Parking was right next door and discounted for guests.

title: Perfect
text: The staff were so friendly and welcoming- facilities were fantastic. The hotel and rooms were spotless and I would certainly go back and recommend.The breakfast was really nice had everything you could want.

title: A great place to stay!
text: The staff are remarkably and memorably warm, welcoming, and professional. The refreshment area was icing on the cake - it was well stocked, and it provided a comfortable and quiet place to rest. Location - perfect. Metro station is a short walk away.

title: Terrible
text: Dirty, no central air, very old, bathroom old, paint chipping, carpets filthy, not at all as pictured.  no help getting cabs or even opening the front door. Just a terrible experience overall. NEVER GO THERE!!

title: Favorite hotel in NYC
text:
Casablanca is the best!
Great rooms and location but the star of the show is Ricks Cafe!
Love this place! It’s like an oasis in the middle of Times Square.
It is our favorite hotel in NYC and plan on coming back for restaurant week in August!

title: New favorite hotel!
text: Perfection!  From check in to check out, I was absolutely thrilled with the attentive service and great character.  The hotel is just a few steps from Times Square, so the location is incredible for Broadway shows, subway access, and great dining & drinks.  Every single staff member we spoke with was kind, engaging, and warm.  I come to NYC a few times a year and never typically stay in the same place more than once, but I will absolutely be making Casablanca my home base for all future trips!

title: Spacious and comfortable and great staff
text: We were in New York for a theater visit and wanted a hotel within walking distance of the plays we planned to attend. This hotel is a gem in a great location! The hotel is small (a plus) but the room was spacious--especially compared to some of the newer hotels in the city. We got to the hotel a little before check-in time so hung out in the lounge, which had complimentary drinks and snacks available in a very comfortable area. When we got to our room we were surprised by a bottle of sparkling wine: my husband had let them know it was my birthday, and this was a gift from the hotel. We were amazed that our room and bathroom were attended to every day: this simply doesn't happen any more! We would go back to Hotel Casablanca in a heartbeat and have recommended it to friends who have stayed there in the meantime. We highly recommend!

title: Home away from Home in New York
text: Small hotel with wonderful location just off Times Square.  Attentive staff, helpful, friendly, efficient.  Beds super comfortable.  Rick’s Cafe is a delightful spot to take a break with coffees and snacks.  (Wish they would bring back the wine and cheese that was eliminated during COVID).  Wonderful restaurants in every direction including Tony’s di Napoli next door which also provides prompt room service.

title: Fives stars plus stay!
text:
We absolutely loved our stay at the Casablanca hotel. Every single hotel staff member was so friendly and helpful.

The location was great, so close to Times Square but the hotel itself was so quiet, like a retreat off of the hustle and bustle of Times Square.

We took full advantage of the continental breakfast every morning and going down for our pastries, bagels and coffee became part of our daily routine.

It’s an old school hotel, we had to get someone up to adjust the heating when we were melting the first night, but we fell in love with its charm.

I would definitely stay again and in the words of our 7 year old daughter “best hotel ever!”.

title: Welcoming and comfortable midtown hotel
text: On our first stay since COVID, we found Casablanca still to be an oasis of quiet just steps from Times Square and the theater district. An outstanding and unique feature is "Rick's Café" , a large comfortably furnished lounge on the second floor. A wide variety of hot and cold beverages and snacks are offered here 24/7. (Cappuccino machine to my husband's delight!) At breakfast time, these are offerings are expanded so that you can get a good cold breakfast here. Rick's is a great place to gather during downtime in your NYC visit, or to wind down after a show, etc. Rooms are comfortable and clean. (We always have to adjust the temperature by opening a window.) We have found no better hotel in NYC when coming down for shows.

title: A lovely, quiet retreat steps from Times Square
text: This was our second visit, and the Casablanca will be our choice in the future when seeing a Broadway show. We drove into the city this time, and there's a parking garage next door to the hotel ($30 per night with the room). The Casablanca is an old and elegant boutique hotel with an intimate feel. The staff couldn't have been nicer. We enjoyed a light breakfast (toasted bagels and fruit) in the second floor lounge. Our room was small but comfortable. We walked a few blocks to the theater and enjoyed the Times Square scene in the way home. Will definitely be back.

title: Will always be my first option.
text:
Right in the heart of Times Square.  The staff were incredibly welcoming, friendly and helpful.  The room was clean and classy.  We missed breakfast but I’m sure it was also very nice.  
It will be the first place I call on my next Broadway vacation.

title: Better than the reviews!
text: Quietest room in NYC. Staff are the most friendly and helpful. Our two bedroom mini suite was just the right size for three people and it had all the amenities. And only 1/2 block from Times Square. And $30 garage parking nearby!

title: Can't Miss For Everything Broadway.
text: Staff are absolutely wonderful, professional and friendly. They know everywhere to go. Rooms are very well appointed and the bathrooms are huge.  Continental breakfast and happy hour snacks are just enough to keep you going. Coffee is world class. The Casablanca is ideally suited for Broadway plays as all theaters are walkable as are great restaurants. The best theater we found was right across the street for Y Juliet. Original exterior but a totally modern interior with actual modern bathrooms! Stay here, rates are very reasonable and you'll save a ton on cab fare.

title: Excellent Accomodation
text: This is my all time favorite place to stay in NYC….it feels like home….great location steps from Times Square but out of the way of  the Times Square bustle….reasonably priced rooms, great friendly staff….spotlessly clean rooms and bath…and a breakfast included each day in “Ricks”on the 2nd floor….coffee, tea and goodies also all day in same location…..small hotel part of Library collection…..I cant understand why anyone would stay at the big, impersonal chain  hotels in NYC!

title: Very happy to have found the Casablanca Hotel
text:
Welcoming and accommodating to highest degree. The room is well appointed and comfortable, the towels are luxurious.  The front desk staff are tops. 
 Thank you Christian for answering all my questions and providing a smooth reservation process. 
An added plus is the second floor lounge provided a relaxing and inviting atmosphere.

title: casablanca jan 2023
text: Staff was super friendly and helped immensely with my mother who had an accident before our trip and required a little extra attention. There was a 24 hour cafe with snacks and drinks so you were never left feeling abandoned.

title: Perfection around every corner
text: Perfect. Third stay and my go to NYC palace. This time I stayed with a friend in the suite. Between having a fridge and the breakfast provided, we only had to go out to eat once a day. Staff all amazing. Most magnificent espresso machine ever. Not a penny paid on Starbucks

title: Great hotel for families
text: Great Times Square location, friendly and helpful staff,  great value. I appreciate the breakfast and snacks at Rick's Cafe. This hotel is a perfect place for families to stay. The junior suite is very spacious.

title: Fabulous Staff
text: The Casa Blanca is a small (47 rooms) hotel just about a block off of Times Square. It is an older hotel and could benefit from updating.  Our room was very clean. Great shower.  The staff are FABULOUS.  So very helpful. Greeted every time we were in the lobby.  Arranged reservations for the delightful restaurant next door when I was not able to reserve online.  My husband and I in NYC to celebrate my birthday.  A complimentary bottle of champagne was in our room with a nice birthday greeting.  2nd floor stocked with snacks, tea and coffee. Would stay here again. The staff made our weekend most memorable.

title: Don’t Miss this Gem
text: Great staff - that’s the key.  Rooms very nice, location great, nice included continental breakfast, great hotel character. The fireplace in the lounge area was great.  The lounge area was a fantastic touch - great place to relax.  Will definitely return!

title: Unforgettable Magic !
text:
Stop scrolling for other hotels and book your stay in New York at this extraordinary place now.
We can't stop talking about how wonderful The Casablanca Hotel is, its location, its amenities, its Family of Staff who are pure gems - enthusiastic, kind, professional and go above & beyond. Most importantly you will remember always how you FELT staying at The Casablanca  - and we feel elated, like we struck something really lucky and it will stay with us always. Without hesitation...we will return, again & again !

title: My go to for NYC!
text:
I own a luxury BnB in the 1000 islands and I was suitably impressed. Past guests of mine recommended this property and I am so glad I kept the card!
Perfectly located, steps from time square, world class shopping and restaurants, and parking right next door and reasonably priced.  All staff knows their stuff and are very good at their jobs. Room was well appointed to obtain that five star rating. Guest lounge was great and well worth the $25 charge for selection quality and convenience. Price point was also good for this boutique hotel. 
Really cannot find anything negative to report and will definitely be back and recommend to all my guests.

title: In the Heart of Times Square
text: Charming boutique hotel. Worth the stay just for the location in Times Square. In walking distance to Broadway shows and most of the places we wanted to visit. Conveniently next to a parking garage and Tony’s Di Napoli restaurant, which we highly recommend.

title: Nice quiet nest on the edge of Times Square
text:
We’ve stayed at the Casablanca twice in recent months and will gladly return on subsequent New York visits. We initially chose it for its midtown location and short walk to the set of subway lines at the southern end of Times Square.  When we stay in New York, we rely on the subways and these take us with minimal transfers most anywhere on the East or West side. Our only concern when first reserving was noise, but the hotel is unaccountably quiet. We stayed both times in a deluxe queen room, which has a comfortable bed but characteristically for New York is not large.  Given the small rooms, what sets the hotel apart is the second floor space they call Rick’s Cafe that is used for the continental breakfast, but serves us during the day like a large living room complete with coffee and snacks. If we need a break, that’s where we head. 

Hotel staff deserve applause. Whether front desk, providing breakfast service, or housekeeping, staff have been extraordinarily responsive and in unfailing good humor. Casablanca’s combination of staff, location, and facilities will keep us coming back.

title: Friendly staff in a beautiful hotel
text: The staff was incredible, as were the location and the amenities.  We arrived at the hotel at 10:00 am the day after Christmas, expecting to just leave our bags until our room was ready.  But they had our room ready, and checked us in.  They also offered us breakfast!  Also, be sure to have a meal at Tony's next door.  What an amazing restaurant!

title: Christmas in New York City
text:
Our stay at this charming boutique hotel was as delightful as I remembered from past visits.  The entire staff were exceptional and treated both myself and my daughter with such thoughfulness after having our 6 day mother/daughter pre Christmas trip extended an additional 6 days due to flight cancellations.  Special thanks to John, General Manager who welcomed us back sans luggage after spending the better part of one day at the airport waiting to fly home only to be told our flight had been cancelled once again.

Having stayed at the Casablanca in past years I did not consider staying anywhere else when planning this fun filled trip.  I was not disappointed.  Everything was as I remembered pre-pandemic with the light continental breakfast available each morning, snacks offered all day, comfortable rooms and cleanliness throughout.
