Its central location right off Times Square is within walking distance to  restaurants, theatres, shopping, Bryant Park with its ice rink and Christmas Market, Rockefeller Centre and Central Park as well as many other walkable sights.  The welcoming staff when you return to the hotel made the day complete.

Our unplanned Christmas day in New York City was exhilarating with it being spent amongst 1,000's of visitors like ourselves enjoying the joy and wonderment of this exciting, beautiful city at this special time of the year.  Thank you, thank you, thank you to everyone at Casablanca who contributed to making this a Christmas to remember.  Happy New Years to you all!!

title: Peaceful Perfection!
text: They never disappoint in delivering a little slice of peaceful paradise in the heart of the city! Immaculate clean, superior staff, high end amenities, quiet, relaxing and as comfortable as home! Could not ask for more!

title: A Hidden Treasure!
text:
Outstanding location, service, and amenities in the heart of Times Square!!!
We had lots of room and were able to walk to our Broadway show.  The food at Tony's was fabulous!
A+++++++
Wonderful staff--all friendly, helpful, and accommodating!

title: Great hotel with fantastic personal service!
text: We visited the Casablanca Hotel for 5 days over the Christmas period and were looked after incredibly well by John and the team for the whole stay. The hotel is spotlessly clean and tidy and the rooms are a good size with extremely comfortable beds. Breakfast is simple but adequate and you have access to snacks and drinks 24 hours a day. The location of the hotel is superb for access to Times Sq and many of the other attractions in the area. Tony's Italian next door (access via the hotel lobby) is fantastic and a must visit with some of the biggest potions I've ever seen! All in all we would definitely visit again and would like to say a big thank you to all the guys that assisted us whilst we were there, you are a credit to the hotel!

title: NYE Package was Fantastic
text: Reading the reviews of this hotel initially I thought perhaps a lot of over zealous people had stayed here! But honestly, the staff really is THAT good. The whole stay was fantastic. We were here for their NYE package, and everything was so amazing! The dinner was fantastic, the entertainment was amazing, the attention to detail by everyone involved was second to none. Staff took us down to the street in a VIP area, the rooftop view of the ball dropping, the entertainment - it was all so great and fun. I would stay at this hotel again for sure, as you can access it from 6th Ave (normally on trips to NYC I avoid times square because of crowds). The NYE package is really the best way to have this NYE experience in the city.

title: Beautiful
text: Everyone  very pleasant and room very clean. Beautiful  experience. I would recommend. Staying there. The experience  was better than I imagined.  We had a lovely time. People  worked there awesome.  🥰🤗

title: Great place
text: I was expecting a hotel like the others when I booked it but we realized right when we pulled up in the cab this would be different. we were met outside and someone got our luggage out and brought it and stored so we could get start exploring at 9am (till our room was ready) but first they told us on the 2nd floor that breakfast was still serving and there would always be coffee, hot tea sodas, water, etc and snacks 24/7 in a fire placed lit lounge. The lounge had tables and chairs, couches and was cozy. This place went from another hotel to a more personable hotel. Everyone was sweet and helpful. The room was clean and slept great. This place is right on Time Square. I would recommend this place to anyone.

title: Wonderful place!
text: It was one of the best hotel experiences we have ever had. And we have traveled all over the world. We were there for NYE and the staff did everything to make it the most memorable event. I highly recommend this place and we hope to stay there again in the future.

title: Pre-Christmas Visit and Shows!
text: We took our 6 y/o son on a trip to NYC for his birthday before Christmas.    We saw the Rockettes, The Lion King and did some sightseeing around the Time Square/Rockefeller Center area.     We LOVED Casablanca Hotel and would recommend it 200%!      We were able to have them store our bags at the time of our arrival (well before check-in) and after we checked out the next morning until our train left.   The 2nd floor lounge area was a wonderful place to regroup and get some snacks.    We were very impressed with how quiet the hotel was at night, despite its close proximity to all of the Times Square action.     The front desk staff went above and beyond with our son, and even remembered him the next day and picked up the same conversation again!    They were very personable and professional.  Highly recommend!

title: Best Place to Stay in NYC
text: The Casablanca is a great centrally located hotel. It is near Tines Square and the Broadway Theaters. The hotel and rooms were very clean and the staff was always very friendly and helpful. Rick's Cafe is a great place to sit and relax or bring takeout back to sit and eat. Having the free drinks and snacks in the cafe was really nice. The. continental breakfast was nice and good too. We will definitely stay here again  and would definitely recommend it as the place to stay in NYC.

title: Awesome
text: We spent from Dec.27 through Jan 1, 2023 at the hotel  The staff are over the top amazing.  One of the staff even walked us to the subway station so we could go to the 9/11 Museum.  New Years eve apples, meal and after dinner drinks were excellent. Excellent view of the ball dropping without being in a crowd.  Can not say enough good things about the staff and amenities of this hotel..Marilyn and Chuck

title: Goldilocks!
text: This hotel is not new or shiny. In fact, it is aging gracefully, and a little tired. But it is perfect. The location (just off Times Square); the generous, and comfortable, lounge offering free refreshment 24/7; and the relaxing colonial style are just the beginning. What really makes this place stand out is the staff: Every single one we came across, friendly (and not obseqious), really helpful, prepared to go the extra mile.

title: Nice boutique hotel
text: My wife and I stayed here in mid December for 3 nights. We stayed here 6 years ago in December also. We paid about $500 a night for a queen room. The room was small as most rooms in NY are. We stayed on the 6th floor which was a little cold in the hall and they only had one of the two elevators working. The location is great as it is around the corner from Times Square. The employees are great also but they don't seem to have enough of them like everybody else in NYC.  Ben, the bellman, always has a smile on his face and is very helpful. Juan, the maintenance man, fixed my safe among other things. Johns Pizza, Tonys Italian, STK steakhouse, and the Brooklyn Diner were 4 of the better places to eat at. Casablanca used to be the #1 hotel in NYC on Trip Advisor but has slipped a little bit since we stayed here before but is still a nice little boutique hotel if you want something smaller than the other larger hotels in the area.

title: Boutique hotel for families.
text: A multigenerational family of 6 stayed in 2 rooms over Christmas. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Their lounge area on the second floor was in constant use by guests. Traffic was horrible this close to Times Square and could delay your getting to theaters, etc, so plan ahead.

title: The perfect place to stay when visiting midtown Manhattan
text: We spent eight nights at the hotel and were 100% pleased with our stay.  We have, in fact, already booked a return visit.  The location is perfect -- on 43rd Street between 6th & 7th Avenue, within walking distance of all of the sites in midtown Manhattan and just a short walk from Times Square and the subway.   All of the staff at the hotel were so helpful and friendly.  Every morning we told them where we wanted to visit and they provided us with directions for walking and/or subway stops.  We enjoyed breakfast (bagels, croissants, hardboiled eggs, etc.), snacks (power bars) and beverages (water, soft drinks and hot drinks) in Rick's Cafe (included in the hotel charges).  We had 24-hour access to the cafe/lounge.  It was very cozy and we would have enjoyed the patio if the weather had been milder.  Our room (501) was quiet and the bed was very comfortable.  We couldn't have asked for better service from the cafe and housekeeping staff.  We stayed on the fifth floor and typically took the stairs.  The elevators are fairly small so this might not be the best place to stay if you have mobility issues and use a wheelchair.  As I mentioned before, we have already booked our next stay and I can't wait to return to the Casablanca Hotel and see all of the friendly faces of the staff who went above and beyond to make our stay wonderful.

title: Old world quiet and attention one half block from the mayhem of Times Square
text: There is no better location, 1/2 block east of Times Square on 43rd but away from the noise. Three subways stops under two blocks away serve all trains. Penn Station (LIRR to airport) an easy 1/2 mile walk (or direct bus). Comfortable bed, creaky floors, surprisingly roomy with attentive staff and excellent common room for breakfast, coffee or a snack. Included breakfast consists of hard boiled eggs, yogurts, bagels (toasted upon request), pastries, coffee and tea. Cliff Bars, potato chips and bottled water available 24 hours (and free!).

title: Great staff and location
text: My wife and I stayed at the Casablanca at the beginning of December and have to commend the staff ( Jeffrey and Brian ) for being so accommodating in regards to several reschedules we were forced to make.  The hotel is in a perfect location if you want to walk around the heart of city to sightsee or to take in a play.  Tony DiNapoli's restaurant is literally next door and has great food.  The hotel is well kept and the amenities like soft drinks, water and snacks are available 24x7.  There is a parking garage  2 doors down and they offer a discount for hotel residents.  This is the 2nd hotel we've enjoyed in the Library Hotel collection due to their locations and welcoming staff.  Would highly recommend.

title: Absolutely superb!
text:
Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. From the time we checked in, the staff could not do enough for us. We were made to feel so welcome. Rick’s cafe is a bonus where there is lovely hot coffee, tea etc to wait you after a cold day out in the city. Also the light breakfast was lovely.   A couple of maintenance problems which were fixed immediately! It’s cosy, friendly and just perfect if you don’t like the huge hotels. 
Ideal location. Apart from taking the hop on, hop off bus, we walked everywhere we wanted to visit. 
If we visit NYC again, then this will be our only choice of hotel.

title: Wonderful Oasis
text: Staying at Casablanca Hotel for our sister Christmas trip to NYC was the best choice we could have made. The staff was very friendly and super helpful in every way. The room was larger than expected and had a beautifully tiled bathroom. Rick’s Place was a perfect place to enjoy our lite breakfast or to relax after a day exploring the city. An added bonus, the staff arranged a car service to pick us up at the airport and also to take us back there to return home. That was so helpful not to have to make those arrangements on my own. Thank you Casablanca Hotel for a wonderful stay in NYC. We will stay there again!

title: We will never stay anywhere else!
text: This perfect little boutique hotel was wonderful.  The staff went out of their way to be helpful and make our stay enjoyable.  The lounge area on the 2nd floor was a wonderful respite with round the clock coffee, tee, drinks and snacks.  Breakfast was minimal but good, with staff cutting fruit and toasting bagels for you.  The room was clean, bed comfortable and overall pretty quiet.  Be sure to eat at Tony's, Lobster and Burgers, O'Donoghue's and Brooklyn Deli all within walking distance.

title: Beautiful hotel great location friendly staff
text: Hotel was very clean and beautiful. We had called ahead to ask if they could hold our bags before check in and they said absolutely. When we went to the hotel to leave our bags there, they said that our room was actually ready and we could check in 3 hours early so that was awesome! Great experience and I would definitely come back! Great location, right in times square and staff was so so friendly.

title: There's nothing better than the holiday season in NYC!
text: Although this was my first time staying at the Casablanca Hotel, It won't be my last! Everything was nearly perfect from the minute we arrived, until the evening we had to check out. Our room was a suite, so it was very spacious. It's the first hotel that I've been to post-covid where they offer room service daily-a big plus! The breakfasts and 24 hour snacks from Rick's Cafe were fantastic, and ample. The staff from front desk, to housekeeping, to food service were exemplary. Everyone went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and welcome. I truly can't wait to come back again next year. I would recommend the Casablance Hotel to everyone/anyone who is looking for all the comforts of home in NYC. Also, I forgot to mention that you can easily walk to so many fun places from this location, and it's close to many subway stations as well. One last thing-I highly recommend Tony's Italian restaurant next door for a delicious family dinner.

title: Happy Return to NYC
text: This hotel is our favorite in NYC for the location to the Theater District and the homey atmosphere. We happily returned this December after the the COVID hiatus.  It was wonderful to see familiar and friendly staff faces after three years.  Many thanks to Margaret, Maria, Christian, Jeffrey, and John.  Merry Christmas.

title: Feels Like Home!
text: The Casablanca is our favorite hotel in NYC!  Rooms are always comfy and clean and the staff is the most friendly you will find!  The second floor is a wonderful relaxing hang out are and always stocked with coffee, fruit and power bars.  Couches, chairs and enough room for your friends and family to just chill.  One more thing is, the convenience to Times Square and all the action is right there yet when in your room, you hear none of the commotion!! Tony's restaurant right next door is the BEST!!

title: Home away from home
text:
I’ve stayed in hotels large and small all across the world. This is the first one that I can honestly say I will return to over and over. 

It’s perfectly placed for going to a show. Right in the middle of everything. Trains to anywhere you want to go are a block away. There are fantastic food options within a 10 minute walk. From Michelin stars to Joe’s pizza and everything in between. It somehow manages to be quiet and blissfully comfortable despite being right by Times Square. 

This place would be worth it for JUST those reasons. But let me tell you about the staff. Oh, my. What a group of absolutely charming, kind, thoughtful, and genuinely warm people. They go above and beyond in every interaction and make a point to let the guests know that they are home when they are here. I worked in customer service for a number of years and I have a fairly high bar. These folks lept right over that bar effortlessly. 

The room my wife and I stayed in was small but comfortable, spotlessly clear, with every want or need taken into consideration. Bed and pillows very comfy and warm. The cafe on the second floor makes the entire experience go up another level. Everything was decorated for Christmas and was a great space to sit down and eat some takeout or delivery food, or just sit and look at the fire or watch TV for a bit. There is an espresso machine, water, juice, and snacks available for free if you’re feeling peckish. There are Christmas carols playing quietly on the speakers right now as we sit waiting to go to the airport and we both wish we had a few more days. 

If we could give 10 stars, we absolutely would. Don’t think twice about staying here, just book it. 

We will definitely be back in the spring. Thank you to all of the folks here, we felt the love and we’ll see you soon!

title: Our favourite hotel in the world
text:
We have stayed here now 5 times and would never stay anywhere else in New York, 
The hotel is so well located on Times Square that everything is in walking distance, but what
keeps us coming hack is the exceptional service from John and his team, nothing is too much for them, we
always get a hello from anyone we come in contact with.
A light breakfast is very welcoming and I hear the cheese and wine is making a comeback soon 
after stopping during the pandemic.
The Casablanca is worth every cent and we have already booked for December 2023.
Keep up the great work Team Casablanca

title: Great customer service.
text: This was my daughter’s spring break from UCLA, 2020. As we all knew nobody was going anywhere and everything shut down. I had booked a king suite and a queen deluxe room for 4 nights. I contacted the hotel and they were swift to respond. They sent me letters and an email regarding extending our reservations until December 2021.  Well another variant popped up and I’m on immunosuppressants. So my husband and daughter stayed just two night and then came back to our home in PA. We usually take Amtrak up. Now we have 2 more nights and the reservation manager and general manager let us take those two nights through March of 2023. Which was just used. The reason I am going in depth about customer service and payments that were paid in advance is because I have read a lot of reviews complaining about this very thing. The only thing that I can say negative, which is on me because I picked the dates that it wasn’t available , is not getting the suite. Everyone from reservations to concierge was pleasant and had no problems about having to keep changing our dates.  The rooms are a little small but that’s NYC for you. I expect that. You need to know where you are going so you aren’t upset about price or size. What you.can get in NJ will be bigger because it’s NJ! I would gladly stay at this boutique hotel again. And customer service was seamless. Thank you.

title: Perfect Choice
text: So many things about this property were perfect!  The location right by Time Square and the fantastic restaurants, stores and theaters nearby to name a few. But inside the hotel were the biggest gems - great room, awesome snack and breakfast bar with a sitting area and AMAZING staff.  You cannot go wrong with this hotel - would definately book again!

title: Casablanca: Your New York Family away from Home!
text:
December 4, 2022:
Casablanca is timeless and a must stay for the most memorable New York stay.  You are withing walking distance of Famous NY Icons: Times Square and Macy's, Birdland Jazz Club; Brooklyn Diner and Tony's Di Napoli Restaurant right next door !!!!! 

Once again, (stayed in 2018) my Husband Rob and I have had the priviledge and pleasure of 'coming Home to our Casablanca Family in New York.  
Rob and I stayed in 2018 and immediately knew Casablanca was going to be 'our' place in New York whenever we have the blessing to be able to visit. 
First impressions are always so critical for any Guest, and once entering through the beautiful wood glass and brass doors, your senses are immediately wrapped within the welcoming warmth and ambience of the unique Moroccan theme. 
The grand staircase leads to a beautiful mezzanine foyer, leading into a beautiful lounge-dining room lit by a roaring fire in fireplace tiled richly in the mosaic style of Morocco. 
Original tapestries, bronze animal statues a library, a piano, brass table lamps all add to the warmth and ambience.  The breakfast buffet room also boasts a library and a sideboard filled with lovely complimentary drinks, both hot and cold each day. 
Breakfast served daily boasts juice, yogurts, cereals, bagels and delicious pastries.
A beautiful wrought iron and wood staircase up to each floor compliments the Elevator. 
Guest Rooms are so beautifully cared for with love and professionalism and have the same welcome, rich ambience of the Casablanca- Moroccan Theme. 
Linen & Towels are beautifully luxurious.
Complimentary bottled water refreshed everyday along with tea & coffees bring that home away from home feel, being able to make a late night or early morning cuppa.
China coffee mugs and glass wine glasses add to that luxury honouring of each guest. 

Yet, all this would be worth nothing without (save for) the wonderfully welcoming and professional Casablanca Hotel Staff.  The Casablanca Staff 'Family' from the House Keepers & Maintenance Team, through to the Breakfast- Hospitality Team, Concierge Team and Managerial Team bring that wonderful quality of making each Guest feel like they are the most important Guest visiting, valued and welcome where nothing is too much trouble within their gift of Service. 

Rob and I need to particularly acknowledge the outstanding Staff on duty for our stay from Saturday November 26- Saturday Dec 3) 

Jefferey (apologies if spelt Geoffrey) & Stanley a huge and sincere Thank You to both of you who were so heart-warmingly welcoming, professionally kind and in the end gave us so much patience yet also sense of peace among the chaos and stress of none of our Australian VISA cards working.  
Jefferey, you assured us that banks are so cautious now, so they actually see this kind of thing happen often for their overseas Guests.  (Australian bank had blocked our VISA card (despite us going into bank personally to ensure overseas transactions box ticked) 

Jefferey, Stanley your offers of cups of tea upstairs in the beautiful lounge room by the roaring fire, during the hour it took to sort the whole thing out was so comforting.  At no time were Rob & I made to feel embarrassed because of their professional compassion & expertise in sorting the issue out (of course personally we were mortified this had never happened to us before) 
Ben, Thank you as our Doorman and Concierge your support was wonderfully welcoming too and brought our bags to our room.   It continued to be a pleasure and a joy seeing him Farewell and Welcome all of we Guests as each of us went out on the Town and again when we returned back to the warmth and cheer of Casablanca. Lewis (Louis) Noël & Joseph, you each added to this lovely tradition. Thank you.

As the week progressed, each successive Duty Managers and Concierges continued to bring joy, peace and guidance on everything from Restaurants to Tours, Subways to Broadway.... Huge and sincere Thankyou to you Johann, Joseph, Lewis & Temao (apologies for spelling) & a couple of other Managers throughout the week who we are so sorry but didn't get your names......

Of course, integral to any Holiday Stay are the Housekeeping and Hospitality/Kitchen Team. 
Huge Thank you to the Housekeeping Staff who kept our room so beautifully cleaned and welcoming each day. 
One of our most heartening daily rituals was to go down to breakfast. Maria, Margurite (Gabbi) & Issa welcomed us with a bright smile, genuine kindness and sincere interest in our Day to come, our Families, our NY trip and our Holiday plans. Each Guest had the gift of their presence and service where nothing is too much trouble.  Thank you for our beautiful steaming hot chocolates and warm bagels every morning, Maria, Gabbi and Issa. 
Stanely and Jeffery, on Saturday, it was so wonderful to have you both on our Check Out. It completed our New York Holiday to have you our 'New York Family' to Farewell us till next time and we will be back!!!!!

Our Valet Car that was organised by Casablanca was equally luxurious and our Driver Nahdeen (apologies spelling) giving us a lovely conversation in the way to JFK Airport it completed our Holiday in such an honouring way. 

We write this Review to honour each of you who in turn are a credit to not only Casablanca yet also your Families Friends and Colleagues. 
Rob & I hope that your General Manager will acknowledge each of your exemplary contribution to the global Hospitality Profession. 
May each of you receive Staff Awards & Acclamations.
In Kindness & Deep Respect
Shalom
Wil & Rob Jones Queensland Australia :)

title: A hidden gem!
text: This hotel is a hidden gem! It is small and older, but very clean and the staff is super friendly and helpful! The complimentary drinks and snacks, as well as the light breakfast, were great, I utilized the espresso machine several times during our stay! If you are looking for a quiet place that is literally steps from Times Square, this is the place!

title: Great as usual
text: Fantastic as always. Happy to be back and snack. I miss the real breakfast offering but I guess what can you do. Great location. Great people. Great lounge. Room nice. Happy to return. And this sentence is to meet the 200 characters. Ha

title: Great trip to New York for broadway, food and fun.
text: It's reasonable, reliable, and the staff is just great!  Rick's Cafe is so nice in the morning, afternoon and evening !  It's a great location to Times Square, shopping,  restaurants, museums and just walking!!

title: A gem near Times Square
text: Staff were very friendly, competent and helpful.  Location is steps from Times Square and convenient to theater district and mid-town.  I would definitely return the next time my wife and I decide to take in a few shows on Broadway.

title: I chose the right hotel!
text: An awesome stay - My first visit to New York City and boy, did I choose the right hotel!  Everyone was so nice, and the hotel was charming. Location was great, just about a block away from Times Square. We had a premium king room which was very spacious - included a small safe in the roomy closet. Bed and pillows were very comfortable; had a little trouble with the a/c at first and got it resolved immediately.  I requested a tea maker and coffee maker for my room but never used it because it was so convenient to go to Rick's Cafe and have coffee/tea/water 24-7.  For my gluten free friends, during the day there were protein bars (not gluten free) but they had fruit and chips.  For breakfast they had hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt.  Also lots of (not gluten free) pastries - but they did have some gluten free bagels that they warmed in the microwave for me and I appreciated that.  One elevator was out of service, but it wasn't a problem - allowed us to talk to other guests a bit more!  I will definitely stay here again on my next visit.

title: Covid has taken its toll
text: Iv visited Casablanca several times and loved this hotel but things have slipped since covid and the little extras that make it special are gone. It’s a brilliant location but cutbacks across the board are noticeable. There is not the variety of food at breakfast, no turn down service, no wine and cheese in the evening and no music on a Friday night. The staff are friendly and helpful but there are far fewer. New York itself has taken a step back and the smell of pot in the streets is sickening. Tony’s however is still as good as always and gets 5 star rating, never saw staff to work as hard with a smile at all times, food excellent as usual.

title: Superbe hotel de charme à Time Square
text:
Nous avons vraiment apprécié notre séjour au Casablanca Hotel.
Ce petit hotel est plein de charme et idéalement situé (à moins de 100m de Time Square)
Il y a une vraie atmosphere dans cet hotel et au bout de quelques jours on peut discuter avec les autres guests.
L'espace convivial au 2eme étage permet de prendre une boisson chaude ou froide 24/24 ainsi que de grignoter quelques snacks. Un vrai plus après une longue journée de marche dans New YorK.
Les chambres ne sont pas très grandes, mais dans la norme de Manhattan. Par contre le calme est total, alors qu'on est à quelques mètres de Time Square.
Au niveau localisation ,c'est idéal. En plein coeur de Manhattan et tout près de plusieurs lignes de métro.
L'accueil est extrêmement chaleureux et, comme l'indique la devise de l'hotel, on se sent vraiment comme à la maison (loin des grands hotels très impersonnels). Notre fils adolescent a beaucoup sympathisé avec l'équipe de l'hotel (notamment Dimitri)

title: A quiet gem located steps away from Times Square
text: I would absolutely stay at Casablanca again!  The staff was very attentive.  I had told them the occasion for our stay was my 60th birthday, and a bottle of red wine was waiting in our room upon arrival.  The room was very clean and nicely decorated, The hotel  is conveniently located just steps away from Times Square, and has a parking garage right next door, with very a very affordable rate of $30 for hotel guests.  Despite it's close proximity to Times Square,  the hotel was almost free of street noise.  There is a nice continental breakfast included with stay.  I loved this place!

title: An Oasis of Calm
text:
We were guests at the Casablanca November 5-8, 2022. 

Our room wasn't ready yet when we arrived. As we waited in Rick’s Cafe, it was after breakfast was provided, a woman came out from the back and said let me see what I can do. Soon we had a plate of pastries, coffee and juice.

Management members kept checking in on us and aided us in getting settled in our room. I use a walker and am crippled by arthritis.

Throughout our stay, we were greeted and always asked if we needed anything. 

Our visit was a success thanks to the caring staff of the Casablanca. It has a prime location for going to Broadway shows. The hustle and bustle of Times Square is just steps away but the Casablanca is an oasis of calm. We look forward to a return trip this spring.

title: Sweet Midtown hotel with well-trained and attentive staff
text: Sweet Midtown hotel with the most friendly and well-trained staff. Rooms (we had a double queen) are spacious by NYC standards; bathroom was roomy, with large mirror and beautiful tile work. Our room was very clean; beds are super comfortable and I slept so well. Wish we had had a view of the city, though. Rick's café on the 2nd floor is a respite for socializing and grabbing a cup of good coffee and a snack at any time of day.  (The café really substitutes for lack of lobby space downstairs.)   We walked just a few steps to get to our Broadway theater (the Hudson), a huge benefit. Overall, an excellent experience. We'll be back.

title: Great escape from the chaos of Times Square
text: Great friendly staff who can’t do enough for you. It’s a great escape from the chaos of Times Square. The cafe offering breakfast and soft drinks and snacks all day was a great addition. The hotel has a lovely feel to it and we had a great stay. The hotel had been recommended to us by two unconnected people who had stayed their in the the past and they were spot on.

title: Location, location, location
text:
This is my second review, my first stay was pre covid.  It is all about location. After arriving at Penn Station, it is a short walk to the hotel. The cost is reasonable for NYC.

The Pros: Located just off Times Square - it was an easy walk to everything we planned. We were given an early checkin-in, that was unexpected and just lovely. The snack room and "lite" breakfast were excellent. All good quality food and lots of options. Coffee was delicious. The woman running this area was delightful and very kind.  The pillow are great. The shower was strong and hot. Lovely bathroom soaps, lotions, slippers and thick fabulous towels. Good size bathroom.  

The cons: The hotel has become a bit tired but they are woking to improve that. There is one scary elevator - it works and I didn't come to any hard or get stuck. The linens do need to be upgraded. During my first stay they were crisp and just lovely - they are now worn and tired. The only odd occurrence was we had been granted a 1230pm check out and at 12noon we gat a call sternly asking us to vacate the room. 

I would recommend a stay here, there are far more pros then cons and post Covid everyone is getting their sea legs back. It is my NYC go to place and I will be back.

title: Not fit for purpose!
text:
I should have heeded the reviews that said that this is not good but as I have previously had such good experiences in both The Library and Elysee I presumed that Casablanca would have the same standard but alas not so. I should say that the staff were not the problem they offer lovely service with a couple of condescending reception exceptions. Basically this hotel needs a complete overhaul or should be shut. There are 2 elevators one which is out of order and the other was out of order on numerous occasions during our four day stay.
This led to people climbing old dark stairways exasperated. When THE elevator did work it was scary and definitely not for the faint hearted!  We had amazing weather for November and this meant that the air con was imperative however the mini suite had antiquated window units which were terribly noisy and brought food smells to the room. The resort fee includes breakfast and snacks in Ricks Cafe which was okay but a pale comparison to the pre covid cheese and wine experience which was the signature of Library Hotels. This is NOT a boutique hotel experience!

title: Cozy Theater District Hotel
text:
The staff is so friendly and accommodating.  The bathroom was updated and they provided an excellent make-up mirror, which is important to me. Comfortable bed, clean rooms. Very nice common area and continental breakfast. When we had an issue with a fridge we asked them to send up, they sent us a bottle of wine. Nice touch.
Our only issue is the hotel is in need of a fresh renovation. They were working on one elevator to update it, so only one was in service, and it also had issues some of the time.

title: First time at Casablanca
text: Enjoyed our stay at the Casablanca.  My complaints are that one of the elevator’s was being replaced and the other one was old and slow.  Location is ideal, location is in Time Square. Complementary continental breakfast was a nice way to start the day.  The complementary coffee and specialty coffees available all day long was also nice.

title: Location location and lovely.
text: Very nice and Cousy place, location is amazing. The breakfast and all day cafe is wonderful. Highly recommended. The elevator is scary but they wore doing some renovation I think. I enjoyed the stairs so much. The front desk need to work on their smile a bit, but nice gentlemen and helpful.

title: Mother/Daughter Trip
text: Second stay here this year. The location just can't be beat, literally steps from times square. Police Station within the block. Only negative would be the elevator situation.  Only one working this visit so long wait times and intermittent periods where needed to be reset. Understand the need to upgrade and maintain as the building is old. The staff really is what the hotel is made of, I just can't praise them enough. Always a smile, a good morning, good evening, and how can I help you. Just superb.

title: Old Style New York Ambience
text: Clean, comfortable, charming. Small in a good way. It really felt like an old, classic, New York building. Personal service and welcoming front desk. Would recommend to any one. Of course, the location can’t be best for doing touristy things. Go to the Brooklyn diner right next door!

title: Great service and location
text:
Like all central NYC hotels, the ambient noise is quite high, but that is a small price to pay for the location of this hotel, which is just off Times Square and within very easy walking distance of 5th Avenue and all central amenities/attractions.
The front office staff are genuinely very nice, efficient people and outshine the majority of staff I have encountered in some of the top hotels around the world.
Nothing was too much trouble, and they had a wealth of local knowledge.
There is a nice lounge/cafe to take coffee and snacks during the day.
The hotel is linked to "Tony's Di Napoli" restaurant next door, which is something of an experience and well worth a visit. Main courses are definitely for sharing (essential to book)
I have already recommended friends to stay here.

title: SUPER 8 MOTEL QUALITY
text: We stayed 6 nights at the Casablanca from October 10-16, 2022.  We loved the location which was central to everything in Manhattan, and the staff were polite.  However, we were less than happy regarding the disarray of the room which several repairs should have been done for the price we paid.  We felt as if we were staying in a Super 8 Motel.  For one, the shower head must be broken because it fell every time we tried to adjust it.  We would tighten it as tight as it would go but within a minute it would fall again which was frustrating.  There are several repairs that should be done including replacing the bathroom door due to the bottom of the door being damaged.  The wall in the bathroom was damaged, discolored and cracked.  The gold light fixtures in the bathroom had rust spots all over them. The wallpaper was coming off the wall and damaged in several areas in the bedroom area.  The caulking repair done in the bathroom was not done properly and looked bad.  The comforter and sheets on the bed had holes in them.  The room was very bright at night when we turned out all the lights, so it made it difficult to sleep.  There was too much light coming in from the bedroom and bathroom windows even with the blind down in the bedroom.  There should have been a curtain to block the light in the bedroom.  Additionally, we were surprised to see that there was an air conditioning unit in our room since it is not shown in any of the pics of your rooms online.  Plus, the vent below the AC unit was damaged.  I have attached pictures of these issues.  Also, we felt also that this room could have been updated for the price we paid.  The décor in our room appeared to be from the 1990s over 30 years old. Lastly, the information we received after booking the room stated that the $25 per night resort fee included sodas.  However, there were no sodas ever offered, and I was told that you don’t offer sodas any longer.  This was disappointing as I do not drink coffee in the morning.  My husband received a discount for booking multiple nights, so I we were given a subpar room because we received a discount. We did not complain because we were trying to enjoy ourselves and we did not have time to move to another hotel because all of the king rooms at the Casablanca were booked up for the entire 6 days.  We would not stay here again unless the rooms were in better condition because management or staff should have done a better job of repairing the things I mentioned before someone stayed.

title: Excellent Hotel , Outstanding Customer Service
text: My husband traveled to New York with our grandson for a family wedding, when they checked into the hotel <which they allowed early check-in>The customer service was outstanding, upon check out my husband needed a bungee cord for the luggage but could not find one in any store around the hotel, so he called the front desk to inquired if they had some string, not only did accommodate his need, the representative arranged the luggage for my husband<WoW>now if gets better my grandson left him Nintendo Switch in the room upon check-out, the hotel immediately send him an email alerting him it was left in the room and if he was not near the hotel to return and pick it up, they would gladly mail it to us. Well they did and my grandson was so excited when it arrived in the mail.  I can say we will always stay at your hotel when we are in New York , your customer service is outstanding, you went out of your way to make my family feel WELCOME.  THANK YOU

title: A Quaint Hideaway
text: This hotel is situated across the street from NASDAQ and a short walk to Time Square.  So yes, it's convenient.  The hotel has private access from the lobby to Tony's Di Napoli Italian restaurant.  The hotel features a 24 hr coffee/snack bar for guests to help themselves to teas, coffees, and drinks plus fruit and snacks.  The service area is spacious and comfortable.  The room felt more like a casual living room.  The continental breakfast is in the same room in the morning.  The room was comfortable and I would stay here again.

title: The Casablanca was everything a hotel should be...clean, accommodating and knowledgeable.
text: Right from the start the staff treated us very well.  We arrived early from our flight and they stored our luggage so we could sight see.  They gave us directions to several places and a map.  They called us when our room was ready and from that point on they were there when we had any questions.  The room was clean and the snacks provided were wonderful.

title: Overnight in NYC
text:
I came by myself to NYC for an overnight visit.  The room was very comfortable.  I had a Petite Queen which was a good size for one person but would be a little cramped for more than one (which they also advise on their website.)  The bed and pillows were very comfortable and I'm very picky.  Shower was good and there was a small table with two comfortable chairs in the room which was handy.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  I appreciated not having to pay for a bottle of water.  The included breakfast was simple but enough to get your day started.  The lounge area was very comfortable - lots of tables and coffee/tea 24 hours.  
The hotel is also steps (literally) from Times Square which was amazing.  I can't wait to go back.

title: 1 week stay Oct 2- Oct 9,2022
text: This was our 3rd time staying at Casablanca Hotel in Times Square - excellent as usual - we will stay there again on our next visit - would not even consider another hotel in NYC.  Room was spotless, bed very comfortable (we had a King room this time).  Light breakfast was great and convenient - bagels, croissants, cereal, yogurt, etc. We had an inside room so was very quiet at night.  Staff very helpful and courteous.  Within walking distance to many sights...subway station very close to hotel.  Rick's Cafe had 24 hour coffee and snacks available (very important to us).  The only thing I can suggest is to bring back the afternoon wine and cheese reception you used to have - now that covid has decreased greatly, maybe this is possible?  I would recommend this hotel to anyone who enjoys small botique hotels

title: Like coming home
text: Excellent as ever. Our 3rd time here and it is like coming home. Love it!!! Breakfast is back to normal now. Yogurt, pastries, bagels etc. everywhere lovely and clean but it is the staff that make this place. Always helpful without being intrusive. I want to keep this place secret really!!!!

title: Charming!
text: This was our second visit to  Casablanca. It’s a charming hotel, with a complimentary breakfast. We were running late checking in and appreciated the proficiency of the receptionists in getting us checked in and to our room quickly.  We had a room with two double beds, but even with that, the room was small. We had to put our open suitcase in the hall next to the door to the room. Beds were very comfy with nice bedding. The bathroom was also small, with little to no space for toiletries, so toiletries also had to go in the bedroom. We didn’t need the A/C but opened the window for fresh cool air.  Even tho the hotel is next to Times Square, and with the window open, it wasn’t noisy.  The complimentary breakfast is adequate, but not elaborate. But, given that you are in NYC, and want to be hungry for lunch and/or dinner, you don’t want a big breakfast, at least we didn’t. We were just there for 2 nights, so we didn’t ask them to clean the room. This is a really unique hotel if you want to be down inTimes Square, and near the theaters.

title: All night construction site
text:
As the Casablanca is right on Times Square, we were prepared for it to be noisy, but we didn't bargain for construction work that went on all night directly outside our window, or for the gap in the window where an air conditioning unit had been retrofitted and the sliding glass panel removed, allowing noise from the construction work and the delivery depot opposite, as well as the smell of fried onions from the food truck servicing the night workers, directly into our room.
We mentioned it as we went for breakfast, the Casablanca breakfast being very minimalist, and were told that we should have called them as they had a 24 hour handyman, which of course we had no idea about, but even then the disturbance would have ruined our night's sleep.
We have always had good experiences with Library group hotels in the past so this came as something of a shock.
I tried to add a photo but it would not upload.  We also have video of trucks leaving the depot.

title: we will be back
text: Having stayed many times in some big name hotels near Theater district... I think we now have discovered home! Stayed for six nights at Casablanca Hotel, we were enchanted by the warm friendly people who work there...and its a half block from Times Square! A very unassuming entryway greets you from street...but that is the only unassuming aspect of this hotel. This is not a glam new high rise hotel but a small  intimate, well maintained gem, part of the well know Library Collection of Hotels.Casablanca  has a Moroccan decor and it is definitely "old School"but in a relaxed, informal way. The rooms are spotlessly maintained (better than most big chain hotels) and everything in the room actually works....somebody cares! There is no street noise at all at any time....The breakfast (7-10) which is included in the room cost is on the 2nd floor above the reception area... hot coffee, cappuccino , espresso, warm milk, juice, yougurt, boiled eggs, bagels ( toasted or untoasted), creme cheese, scones, muffins, croissants ( including chocolate), fresh fruit, soda and bottled water...and best of all a very friendly person who makes sure all foods  and everyone is happy.This quite large breakfast area is then open all day with fresh coffee, cappuccino, espresso, fruit, granola bars, water and soda!...a great quiet place to unwind and do some computer work.New York Times available at no cost on their wifi network.in short this is oasis...home away from home......BTW..great Belgian restaurant and bar (BXL) a few doors down from hotel...open till 2 AM for drinks and friendly atmosphere...didnt try food but suspect Mussels are great! We cant wait to return!

title: Thoroughly enjoyable stay.
text:
We had previously stayed at the Library Hotel but wanted to be nearer friends in Times Square so chose this hotel. The staff are every bit as friendly here - always ready with a smile and greeting. Front desk staff were available to help at all times - even with our pick up at 4am.

It is amazing how quiet this hotel is, considering it is right in the middle of the madness that is the Times Square area - but it manages to be calm and tranquil even so.
 
Within easy walking distance of so many places - and also Times Square, Bryant Park and Grand Central subway stations, if you are travelling a bit further. 

It does not have a shiny, new, modern feel - if that's what you want then it's not for you. But it is clean and the decor matches the theming of the film Casblanca - even down to the wifi code!

Breakfast is basic but again, the staff are so very friendly. There are plenty of diners nearby if you want a more substantial breakfast.

Highly recommend.

title: Amazing
text: We checked in a few days ago and I wanted to make sure I wrote a review before we left on our cruise.  From the time we checked in the personal care has been amazing. Our king room is quite nice with a nice bathroom.  It is my husband’s birthday and when we arrived we had a nice bottle of red wine with two glasses waiting.  The continental breakfast is adequate with hard boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, pastries, bagels, cereal, juice and delicious coffee espresso too if you like. All day long there is fruit, water, special water, snacks, tea and coffee. We have stayed at many hotels in New York and this by far is our favourite.  We can’t say enough about how the entire staff greet everyone always with a smile and a greeting. We will definitely be back. If you are on the fence trying to make a decision about this hotel don’t look any further.  Casablanca is top notch with their customer service.

title: Cleaner than my home
text: When I say that any place was cleaner than my home...that is saying something because I keep a very buttoned up abode! Casablanca is not fancy, but it is very comfortable and maybe one of the quietest places I have stayed. I slept better in that room than I have in months. It was incredible because it is literally not even 1/2 a block from Times Square. We were in #510, so see if it is available for your stay. You won't be disappointed in Casablanca.

title: Weekend trip
text: This was a great hotel in an excellent location. We were within walking distance of everything we wanted to do in NY: Broadway show, time square, and food. The staff were extremely nice. The room was very clean and comfortable and had slippers which is always appreciated. The breakfast is light (bagels, pastries, fruit, etc), but there’s plenty of food nearby. Would definitely stay here again.

title: First Stay at Casablanca
text: Having passed this hotel many times during visits to NYC we finally decided to stay for 4 nights.  We had a unique experience that put Casablanca high on our return to NYC hotel stays. The cleanliness, superb friendly staff, library siting room, location to Times Square made this the perfect place to stay.

title: The best boutique hotel in NY
text: I came here 10 year ago and now I am back. The hotel is still the same, and it maintains its wonderful atmosphere. The position is perfect, in Times Square. Rooms are clean. Staff is so kind and helpful. The common room is so useful, to feel at home even in NY

title: Would definitely stay here again
text: Love this hotel… everyone working there is friendly n very helpful.  Our room was small but it’s what I expected.  Second floor has complementary water, coffee, fruit n snacks.  And lots of tables n chairs to relax.  If you are visiting NYC to see plays… which we were… the location is perfect. We walked everywhere!  Thank you!

title: Could be the best place to stay in NYC
text: Staying at the Casablanca was literally the best hotel experience we have had in NYC ever. Jeffery and Ben were amazing, and we felt so incredibly taken care of. We loved the lounge, which was so helpful to recharge, grab a snack and relax. Rooms are very clean, and comfortable.  Convenient to all theaters, restaurants, shopping. Can walk pretty much anywhere. I can’t think of staying at another place the next time we visit. Outstanding place to stay!

title: Everything you need just around time Square
text: Cosy little boutiquue hotel just around time square in style of the old Humphrey Bogart movie. The rooms are not big - hey you are in New York - but functionabel and clean and have everything you need for your stay. Service is very friendly and always helpful. Refreshments like coffee, tea, soft drinks and water are available 24 hours free of charge. The breakfast is rather tiny (we miss the bagels we got there last time) but the coffee is great

title: Girls Get Away
text: My daughter and I went on a weekend  "girls get away"  to Ny/Boston. We went to MSG for a concert. The hotel was lovely and quaint. The staff was awesome.  So helpfu with sights and directions, very  kind. The location was  fantastic. The breakfast and snacks were great especially after a long day of sight seeing and  walking.  We highly recommend this hotel and we will be back!

title: Another Most Enjoyable Stay!!
text:
Having stayed several times at this little gem of a hotel before the pandemic, it was great to return and be warmly welcomed back by staff who remembered us.
Nothing was too much trouble for them.  Our room was cosy and very clean and the buffet style was just as we remembered it - scrumptious!!
We'll definitely be back next year!!

title: Nice Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Times Square
text: We were very pleased with our recent stay at the Casablanca.  Though the hotel is older and the furniture shows some wear, the rooms were modernized, clean, and well presented.  The location, just a half-block from Times Square, can't be beat, with a short walk to Broadway theaters and many good restaurants.  The biggest selling point is their attention to customer service.  Every issue or questrion we had was handled immediately and most courteously by their staff.  We interfaced with many different staff members during out stay and all were equally pleasant and helpful.  We also appreciated their arranging a car service for airport pickup and dropoff...a nice touch.  We would definitely stay here again!

title: Charming hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff.
text: Charming hotel, nicely decorated, quiet and tranquil despite being just a few yards from Times Square. One of the few places I could find with two (very comfortable) queen beds in one room. Enjoyed the comfortable lounge. Very friendly and helpful staff. Pricey, but I would happily stay there again. I would not bother with hotel transportation, though, as yellow taxis are fixed rate to/from the airport, equally comfortable,  and less than half the price.

title: Would definitely book again
text: Beautiful hotel with a warm atmosphere.  The room felt like a house, not a hotel. Upon entering our room, we could smell the clean sheets. Small touches like water bottles, robes, slippers, and even a makeup washcloth made us feel welcome. Pricey, but not for NYC. We will definitely book again. My favorite NYC hotel so far.

title: It's New York
text: I picked this hotel because of proximity to Broadway Theaters.  Never having been there I didn't know what to expect.  Couldn't have been more perfect.  Literally a block from Time Square and a 10-15 minute walk to both Broadway Theaters. The staff at Casablanca were so very helpful.  We had dozens of questions about directions and they were very patient at answering all of them.  The room is not big but most important....quiet for sleeping after a long day of exploring this fabulous city.

title: Excellent Service
text: I do not have the words to adequately convey just how wonderful the hotel is and most importantly the staff. We will only stay at the Casablanca when we visit the city Not only is the staff polite and helpful the location can not be better.

title: Wonderful choice next to Times Square!
text: We stayed here in 2017 and again at the end of August! We are so glad we did! The staff was wonderful, the location par excellence, and Tony's was right next door for a nice Italian dinner! I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND Casablanca Hotel!

title: Great location - an oasis near Times Square!
text: This is an excellent place to stay for getting around the city! The staff is so accommodating and make you feel right at home. Rick's Cafe is open 24/7 for breakfast, snacks, fruit and drinks throughout your stay. We walked to a broadway show and to dinner several times and the subway, train station and bus terminal are also within walking distance. All in all we highly recommend the Casablanca!

title: Great location, clean, quiet rooms
text: Absolutely loved this hotel. It is just a few steps away from Times Square and many great restaurants. The rooms were very clean and quiet. The second floor lounge was perfect and we even ate take out food up there. Highly recommend.

title: NYC Getaway
text: The hotel was a quiet and relaxing contrast the fast paced Time Square just steps away. The room was well equipped and quiet. Friendly and helpful staff was a welcome complement to a great weekend stay.

title: Great for family birthday visit
text: We reserved six rooms to celebrate an important birthday.  Having the "social room", Rick's Cafe, available is perfect for a place to visit.  The light breakfast, coffee machine, and snacks were a big hit.  Tony's of Napoli restaurant was accommodating for a large group dinner.   The hotel 1/2 block from Times Square and close to Broadway theaters.  The rooms are nicely decorated with the Moroccan theme, and are very clean.  Bathroom looked brand new.  The management and all employees were exceedingly helpful.  I highly recommend this boutique hotel.

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Staff was AMAZING!!! Perfect location for Broadway shows and restaurants. Rooms were clean and well appointed. Ricks Cafe' was super convenient for 24/7 light refreshments. Great value on room rates. We would definitely recommend to family and friends especially if you are seeing a Broadway show.

title: Staff was super friendly, A/C was outdated
text: Wasn't impressed with the window A/C's in the room which are hard to control and very loud.  No bar in the hotel.  Beds were small, full size I believe.  The staff was super friendly.  The snack bar was okay, continental breakfast was subpar.  No view from the rooms, spend the bucks and stay at the Marriott, where you at least have a view.

title: great people
text:
The people and service are great. If you are a light sleeper don't get an outside room next to the street. Our sheets were so old they had holes in them. Elevator did not work a couple of times and had to take the stairs. The pictures on the website are deceiving as they don't represent the people or current condition of what you see .
The location is great to times square and the theaters for Broadway shows. Tony's next door is very good.

title: Amazing hotel.  Everything was perfect.
text: We have been all over the world and stayed at some of the best hotel chains, and for the money this might be best hotel we have ever stayed it.  Friendliest staff, 24 hour snack room, nice rooms, and could not have a better NYC location.  We messed up our reservation and they took care of it and were accomodating with everything we needed.  Will stay here every time I go to NYC.  They could charge double and I'd pay it.....although I hope they don't.

title: The Casablanca Ain't What It Used To Be
text: While I have stayed at The Casablanca many times over the last several years, this was my first trip since COVID. Therefore I was curious to see what changes, if any, had been made hoping that the hotel still had the same amenities as pre-COVID. Sadly, it does not. I guess the good news is that at least the hotel is open and you cannot say that for every business. But while The Casablanca remains a charming, small, hotel with an ideal location and friendly employees, sadly it lacks many of the things that formerly made it one of the best. For example, Rick's Cafe on the second floor offers an ideal respite from the hustle bustle of the city and a great place to crash after a busy day. Its daily Continental Breakfast offering, however, has been scaled back to what is now described as "light" and its nightly wine and cheese reception with weekly piano entertainment  (a great time and place to socialize and make new friends) has been eliminated altogether. I am not sure how much of this is due to staffing, supply, sanitary, and budgetary issues, but the hotel is now charging a daily Resort Fee that one would assume would cover such "extras". Alas, it does not. While the hotel does not have an on-site workout space, it previously had a trade with a local, nearby health club where a guest could go at no extra charge. During my recent stay that amenity was not being offered. When I checked in, the person at the Front Desk knew nothing of the prior arrangement. It was only later in the day, when I spoke with someone else, that I learned the health club had closed and that, as a result, the hotel no longer offered this guest service  as a part of a stay. The hotel has nicely appointed rooms with comfortable beds and nice bathrooms with daily housekeeping offered,  Something that, sadly, you no longer find at many other hotels.  Be sure to request an interior room as they are generally quieter.  All in all, I enjoyed my stay at The Casablanca, but the hotel ain't what it used to be. Then again, what is???

title: Fantastic
text: I love the intimacy of the hotel. The staff was terrific. I love Ricks  Cafe. I hope that one day they will bring back the wine bar and piano player. The location is perfect td or shows and restaurants.

title: Amazing Hotel in the heart of NYC
text: What a phenomenal hotel! Located 30 seconds from Times Square, the Casablanca has everything you could ask for. They upgraded our room for free - we had booked a Petite Queen - and provided stellar service. The room was clean and quiet, we were able to park without a problem next door, the staff was sublime, and their second floor lounge took the cake. The courtyard was cute, breakfast simple but delicious, and they let me play the piano which always makes me happy. The decor was out of this world and so appropriate for a hotel with this name. Being a stones throw away from everything, including Broadway, was wonderful. I’d do it again in a heartbeat! Highly recommended!

title: Great hotel in the heart of Times Square
text: This wonderful property has the feel of many European hotels with rooms and elevators that tend to be on the smaller side.  That's really part of the charm, it's an old property that has been well maintained and the staff is absolutely wonderful. Rick's Cafe on the second floor is open 24/7 for water, soft drinks, coffee, etc. and in the mornings for an attended continental breakfast.   You are within blocks of many of the major theaters and mere steps from Times Square. Of course, multiple highly rated restaurants are nearby.

title: Perfectly acceptable but no more
text: I took my wife to New York for a weekend of fun (a show, dinners, maybe grab another show, museums) .  We stayed at the Casablanca, largely on the strength of Tripadvisor reviews.  I was slightly, though not entirely disappointed.  I had expected an above average experience and this was merely average.  The staff were very nice, accommodating, and knowledgeable and the room was clean, but it was tired, the decor in the hotel generally was tired, the continental breakfast was, let us say, "the usual suspects" and on a par with any Hampton Inn.  You see what I mean?  I had looked for and selected this hotel in the belief that it was a bit above the mark. It turned out to be just about chinning the bar.  Also, traveler tip:  if you want to be walking distance to the shows, go further west than the theater district, not right on top of Times Square.  It's just so crowded all day that it's hard to walk around.

title: Best Hotel to stay in Times Square NY
text: Excelente servicio. Este hotel es nuestro lugar favorito para quedarnos en familia, en Times Square. Desde cada empleado del mostrador, mantenimiento y el gerente, son muy amables, atentos y excelentes seres humanos. Descanso bien en este hotel y me siento segura con mi esposo e hijos. Yo lo recomiendo por completo. Son varias las ocasiones que nos hemos hospedado y la calidad y consistencia del servicio, siempre son; a otro nivel.

title: Not a Review I Really Want to Write (I like this place)
text:
I've stayed here twice; it's got a nice feel to it and is close to Times Square with an Italian restaurant adjacent to it without needing to step outside to get there. Bedding is comfy, room's are clear, decor is Casablanca-chic, toiletries are very nice. 

So; it's a lovely place to stay, as long as your room doesn't have windows facing E. 41st or Madison Avenue. There's construction there that goes until midnight, and starts up again at 6 a.m. And I'm told it's not uncommon in the summer for locals to turn up a stereo system at 2:00 a.m. which is SO LOUD there's no way you can sleep through it. 

Also, during my latest stay (last night), I'd gotten into my nightgown and was prepping for bed when I tried to turn on the overhead fan (no luck), and tried to turn on the TV (also no luck).

title: A hotel with as much character as Broadway
text: The hotel is in a great location steps from Times Square. The staff were always friendly and helpful. This hotel is not a cookie-cutter big chain type hotel. It had a lot of charm and atmosphere and a nice hang-out in Rick's cafe on the second floor, with snacks and soft drinks 24 hrs a day.

title: Staff great, room/amenities poor
text: Staff were excellent. However room and amenities were poor. We were in 606 which has to be the smallest hotel room I have been given in numerous trips to USA. No fridge in room. Breakfast also very limited.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: We love this hotel. It's the only place we stay when coming to NYC. You can't beat it for service and location. You're right off Time Square so Broadway and restaurants are in easy walking distance. There's even a convenient parking garage right next door. The lounge is a nice place to meet with your group. They provide cold bottled water, drinks, hot drinks (fancy coffee machine) and packaged snack foods throughout the day and have re-started a small continental breakfast. Even better, with all of that, they're still reasonably priced.

title: First time in NYC
text: Just amazing!   The Casablanca team is the best in NYC and I would recommend the hotel to everyone and everyone!   The location, service and room was terrific.  Thank you for making our stay so special.

title: Awesome
text: Awesome as always. Quiet, cool on the hottest day of the year and great location next to Time Square. Really like the second floor for meeting friends with peace and quiet. I come heard every time I come to NYC.

title: An oasis in the city
text: An oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the city! Loved having snacks and water available all day. The rooms were nice and the hotel staff were always available to answer questions or make recommendations! The hotel even left umbrellas at the door on a rainy day!

title: Wonderful Experience!
text: Charming boutique hotel with parking right next door and they validate! Professional courteous staff. Hotel was very clean, quiet and the continental breakfast was wonderful. Will definitely stay there again. Great location in Times Square near Broadway shows! Highly recommend! We’ve enjoyed other hotels in the Library Collection

title: Ideal location, home away from home
text: When we arrived, the desk person announced “welcome home!”. Little did we know he was predicting that “this is our first stay at this hotel would lead our decision to make this our home base for our future NYC trips” . He was right! Literally a few dozen steps to Time Square, the hotel was quiet. The complementary light breakfast and snacks all day were perfect for grab and go. The rooms are small, to be expected in an original building but plenty of space to lay out luggage and move around.

title: Another perfect stay in this fabulous hotel.
text: A fabulous and friendly hotel. Every single member of staff is a delight. The hotel is very close to Tines Square and the theatres , but once you are inside you’d never know. Really quiet and peaceful. There are refreshments available all day, and a lovely little outdoor seating area that is perfect for sitting with a restorative cup of tea!

title: An amazing oasis in Times Square!
text:
Our first time staying at Casablanca but definitely not our last. One of the BEST hotels we ever have visited. Customer service is amazing. 

There are some great people that work here. A special shout-out to Dimitri, Ben, and  of course John. 

Don’t think twice just book it! We were nervous about where to stay our first time in NYC and especially didn’t want something 100 stories tall. This was the perfect choice. A wonderful oasis to relax and recharge between our adventures in the city! We can’t thank you all enough for making our stay incredible.

title: The Casablanca is wonderful!
text: Excellent, knowledgeable staff!  Facility has all the vintage touches of Casablanca bud is fully up to date.  Loved the inner courtyard--so quiet!  Hotel is perfectly located to Times Square and very easy to get to other parts of Manhattan. Can't wait to stay here again!

title: Small gem!!
text: This hotel is a small gem!  It is right off the craziness of Times Square but was able to provide an oasis.  The lounge area with 24/7 snacks and a light breakfast was a great place to hang with family when you needed some down time.  The rooms were nice and not too small (I assumed all NYC hotel rooms would be tiny) .  I highly recommend The Casablanca Hotel!!

title: Cozy, Hospitable, Charming!
text: I love this hotel! Every single staff member was friendly & helpful. Within close walking distance to Broadway. Clean!! Lounge is sunny, plenty of room, comfortable has free beverages, fresh fruit and snacks 24/7 and nice brkfst. Tony's next door is outstanding. I'll never stay anywhere else ~ can't wait to come back next year!

title: Amazing Stay
text:
From start to finish, our stay at Casablanca was amazing. The staff were truly authentic nice people and very accommodating. The location of the hotel is prime. The beds were comfortable, and the rooms was bigger than I would have expected for this location. 

Also, the second floor had a comfortable quiet seating place if you just wanted to chill out for a moment and have a good cup of coffee.

I would like to thank the staff for being such professionals. We don't get to New York that often, and you helped make our trip spectacular.

title: Wonderful experience in NYC
text:
The hotel staff was fabulous.
Rooms and amenities were top notch.
A delightful time!
Location was excellent (close to Times Square).
Second floor open area was a great option 24/7.
We'd definitely stay there again.

title: Great Staff!
text: Loved your staff! Everyone there is friendly, helpful and had a healthy dose of humor. The location is fantastic. Breakfast could use a few more options, but what a charming little dining area! The hotel rooms are a little dated but clean. I wasn't able to get captioning on the TV in my room and something seemed off with the remotes. I didn't complain about this, though, and I suspect the staff would have fixed the problem had I done so.

title: Old hotel located near Times Square.
text:
It was ok, but not sure I would stay again.

We really liked the location being so close to Times Square and Broadway.

Ricks Cafe was a nice concept.

The staff were friendly and helpful.

But…it’s very dated so you need to be aware of that. The lifts seemed very unstable and jumped around a lot. But really the deal breaker for us was the air conditioning. It was a very old unit and the noise it made was like a jet engine. It became a balancing act between heat and noise unfortunately.

title: We'll be back
text: Great clean room, convenient location just off Times Square, excellent service, comfortable bed with a variety of pillows, nice touches with snacks and espresso machine in the second floor lounge area.

title: Excellent
text: Wonderful service! Great location to Times Square and Broadway. We were extremely impressed. The snacks were a great touch. Everything was clean and well maintained. Service was above and beyond. We would go again in a heartbeat.

title: Anniversary Get Away
text: A great place to stay near Times Square.   The staff was very friendly and eager to assist.  The second floor continental breakfast and 24 hour snack selection was fantastic.  Plan to stay here on our next trip to the city.

title: Just... wow!
text:
I can't say enough good things about this hotel.  Stayed mid-June for three nights to celebrate my wife's 50th birthday and our 20th anniversary.  

Location: middle of the theater district. Despite that, quieter than expected.  We walked to everything.
Staff:  Warm, friendly and helpful in a way that did not feel rehearsed.  I would have liked to have told this to the manager personally.  A happy staff like that doesn't happen unless folks at the top are doing the right things.
Room:  charming, warm, and larger than expected for NYC (I had a king/accessible).
Rick's Cafe:  like my room, warm and inviting.  I was surprised at how it kicked each day off to a happy start.

I think the short explanation is, you can make some magic happen in a 45-room hotel that you can't in a 245-room hotel.  Confession:  I'm "frugal" (that sounds so much better than cheap!) and the kind of traveler that would have stayed at the Westin to save $50 had this not been a special trip.  The stay at the Casablanca has changed how I'll hotel shop in the future.  This was part of our experience and not just a comfy bed and a clean room.  I'm looking forward to a return visit!

title: Good, and perhaps soon great again
text: I've enjoyed the Casablanca several times before. Good staff, comfortable and quiet rooms, and great location. Alas, the breakfast is not as good as it used to be, so here's hoping it improves. The outdoor patio is nice for those using it, but it's disruptive of sleep for everyone whose room windows open onto it (I'd close it for that reason). And the blinds don't work to keep out the sun very well. (These last two are old problems: Why not yet remedied?) Here's hoping for improvement on my next visit—and I will indeed come back.

title: Covenience and quiet midtown/Times Square hotel
text:
Staff friendly. Check in efficient. Room spacious, its NYC remember, & clean (we were in a Jr suite). Greeted with a wave and/or a "hello" upon leaving and entering hotel. Terribly convenient to Times Square. theaters, shopping and had 2 restaurants on either side of hotel (Tony's and The Brooklyn Diner). Second floor was lounge, snack and continental breakfast area. There's also a quiet, small enclosed courtyard off the lounge which is an added bonus.
Safety is a big concern as grab bars were on the walls next to the toilet and 2 in the bathtub/shower combo. Word to the wise AND to hotel management, make sure they are secure as these are suction- cupped and I fell in the tub grabbing onto the bar that was loose. No broken bones, just some bruising and embarrassment. Otherwise, an excellent vacation to NYC staying 3 nights at this hotel.

title: Disappointing
text:
The Staff was super as always. 
Our room was very warm/stuffy. AC not working correctly.  Staff did fix. The sink in our room did not drain properly. We lived w/this. Very disappointed in Ricks Cafe.  We always looked forward to spending time there.  Very meager offerings.No happy hour - staff said ‘due to Covid restrictions’. Other hotels have happy hour. Hotel is cutting back sadly. 
It did not feel special this time. We always come in August and are reconsidering. We were disappointed.  Staff still the best.

title: 6 day wonderful NYC vacation
text: Casablanca had a wonderful location for our activities. We had tickets to 3 different theaters and we were able to walk easily. Our teen daughter was with us and she wanted to be in Times Square and we were steps away from the action. Although we were so close to TS the room was super quiet and never heard any noise at night. Central Park was about a mile and we enjoyed walking to take in the city. Staff was always helpful and so kind. Wonderful trip!

title: Not great
text: Elevator was slow, bumpy and unpleasant. Carpeting worn. Breakfast was inadequate. Staff was nice. Generally hotel was dated and for the price we should have stayed at the nearby Marriott. Disappointed that hotel was not the elegant boutique we hoped fir.

title: Wonderfully located in Times Square!
text: We spent three nights in late May at the Casablanca, in a generously sized double-queen room.  Staff was both helpful and friendly, and the location is perfect for access to the subway, busses, theaters and Times Square.  Would stay here again any time!

title: Stay HERE !!
text: Literally steps away from Times Square and everything New York. Rooms were clean and spacious.  Staff was super helpful and anything you wanted you just needed to ask.  FREE continental  breakfast saved us alot of money as it was enough to hold us till lunch.  Two places to eat on either side of Hotel.  We arrived on a Saturday and had no reservations to eat,  I called the Italian place called Tony's and they told me they were full.  I happened to mention that I was staying at Casablanca ands the hostess said we have priority and they WILL fit us in!!!  Details of place is great down to the Persion rug mouse pads at front desk !!     A super oasis to return to after each days adventure.    STAY HERE

title: Highly Recommend!!
text:
Perfect location smack in the middle of Time Square.  Very welcoming and accommodating staff.
Rooms small but had everything we need, were clean and decorated nicely.  Enjoyed the continental breakfast at the cafe alolng with the all day and night snacks that were available at our convenience.   All in all, we had great trip and will most definitely plan to stay here again on our 
next visit.  Thanks to all who helped make this a wonderful stay in NYC!!

title: Senior Trip with family crew
text: We visited with two adults and two teenagers.  Perfect central location, unbelievable staff that remembers you when you come and go, really nice size room, and quiet hotel.  We love coming back to a small hotel after exploring the city all day.

title: Casablanca a hit in the heart of New York City
text: Everyone was very nice, helpful, professional. The room was very comfortable and quite...just steps from Times Square. 24 hr snacks and light breakfast were very good and could easily be your morning meal.

title: Fantastic hotel
text: The staff was amazing and the hotel. Very helpful and for to know us during our stay. The hotel was extremely clean and cozy. Close to the theaters and New York Public Library. The little garden oasis off the lounge was perfect in the morning.

title: A perfect stay!
text: Another wonderful stay in this little gem of hidden luxury and peace! The staff does not get better than here! The value is incredible and the location is ideal! You don’t get better than this anywhere!

title: Pleasant environment
text: Very friendly staff!  We enjoyed The cleanliness  and enjoyed the great coffee and tea! We also Enjoyed the snacks and the DVD library.  The staff was very helpful and answered all our questions. I likes the scents of the soaps and shampoos

title: Warm inviting hotel with super fantabulous awesome staff!
text: The Casablanca Hotel is small and a little older, but that's just what we were looking for!  The hotel being small meant my family got more attention. The location is perfect. The hotel vibe is warm, friendly, helpful and inviting. The more modern hotels seem cold, sterile and rushed to me. ALL members of the staff were personable. We got time and money saving tips from the lounge lady  and the front desk guy. One guy, I guess the doorman, was really outgoing. He helped us decide what attractions we wanted to see, gave us directions and suggestions after talking with us long enough to know what our interests were!  We are from small town North Carolina, so we truly enjoyed patient friendly people in this hotel who wanted to share their city and diverse cultures with us.

title: We will be back!
