text: Friendly and helpful front desk staff.  Comfortable, clean room.  Nice social space - Cafe - staff there was excellent too!  We were able to relax with friends in the garden before shows.  It was nice to have snacks and beverages available all day!

title: Great for our family!
text: Great experience!  Staff was always friendly and quickly helped with all requests.  We were traveling with our 2 kids (7 & 9) and our room was perfect, 2 beds plus a living area which gave us plenty of space to spread out.  Loved Rick's Cafe, huge plus having bottled water/coffee/snacks on hand when needed. For a family trip, location could not be better as it is right off Time Square and the subway stop making it easy to get anywhere in the city.

title: A hidden gem in the theater district
text: The friendly and professional staff make me feel very welcome. It’s clean, well appointed and centrally located. Rick’s Cafe is open 24/7 serving snacks and a continental breakfast. I especially like the espresso machine.

title: I Love This Hotel
text: I love that hotel !!  The staff is very attentive. Very clean hotel. Even though we were on Times Square, we did not hear any traffic or noise at all. Our teenage boys even liked it.  Got a welcome call to the room to make sure everything was satisfactory. We had an issue with the remote not working and they were up in minutes to take care of us. Highly recommend this hotel. I NEVER leave reviews but had to do it for this hotel.  They even remembered my name !!  Felt like home.

title: Great Location, Fantastic Hotel!!
text: Great location, staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The only negative is they don’t have an ice machine that is available for their guests. The staff must get the ice, which they gladly did. The room was vey comfortable and clean, but it is the typical NYC hotel with somewhat smaller rooms.  Next time we are in NYC, my wife and I will certainly stay there again.

title: Excellent hotel in the Theater District
text:
The hotel was extremely clean.  Front desk staff was friendly and helpful.  Rick’s Cafe was clean with pleasant staff as well.
Rooms were small but very clean.  Free bottled water daily in the rooms.  Window unit ACs allowed us full control over the room temperature and also blocked outside noises.  Beds and pillows were very comfortable.

title: Loved this hotel
text: Great location.  Big rooms compared to other NYC hotels.  Free snacks all day.  Service was great!  Boutique hotel with lots of character.  Loved the decor on 2nd floor which was Rick’s cafe.  If you need Uber you’re better off walking to another street bc it’s on a very congested one way street.

title: One of my most favourite Hotels In the World but with reservations.
text: One of my most favourite hotels in the world with brilliant staff who give you their fullest attention. However we felt that there were a few savings that detracted from the previous visits. Charging $25 per day resort fees is understandable but the benefits do not stack up. We used to get a period of time where we had wine and cheese at the end of the day and caught up with other guests reflecting on their day's experiences. Also breakfast has been scaled back to the bare minimum, even a few cereals would make it more palatable at a little expense to the hotel. We still love the hotel but sadly not as special as it used to be.

title: Quaint hotel in great location
text: Wonderful charm and character in this small hotel in a great location! Truly a hidden gem. Staff was very friendly and helpful! Easy access to Times Square and Broadway without the noise and crowds of a large chain hotel. I highly recommend.

title: Great location and great staff!
text: The first night we went to our room and it smelled like fish. We went to the lobby and they upgraded us to a king size room at no additional charge. Staff was very friendly and always offered to help.

title: A sweet little hotel in NYC
text: We enjoyed a few nights in the Casablanca, and the best part was the people -- caring, friendly staff everywhere. This is a sweet little hotel, and you'd never know you were steps away from Times Square until you go outside. It was convenient and easy to get around the city from there.

title: Will be back!
text:
Great location, right in Times Square with the theaters nearby. The Casablanca is a little dated but exceptionally clean and the beds are comfortable.  The staff is welcoming and friendly. 
Rick’s cafe provides a small breakfast in the morning and water, coffee and soda are available all the time. There is also an excellent Italian restaurant next door.

title: Great stay just off Time Square
text: This delightful little hotel is like an oasis in the chaos of Time Square. The rooms are quiet and comfortable, and fairly spacious (by NYC standards). The staff is very friendly and helpful. Walking distance to theaters and shopping, with lots of great dining options. Will definitely stay there again.

title: Great to be back again!
text: Spent 6 days at the CasaBlanca Hotel in mid May for our annual theatre binge. The hotel was full. Modified complimentary breakfast with oranges, bananas, hard boiled eggs, pastries, yogurt, coffee and tea. The wine and cheese evenings have not returned as yet but there are good snacks- potato chips, granola bars, and a small refrigerator with soft drinks and fizzy water. Wonderful to be back! Museums, restaurants and theatre were great. Always comfortable at the Casablanca and the location is terrific. Very quiet being so close to Times Square. Great service!

title: Relaxing and excellent amenities
text: Friendly and helpful staff made us feel “at home”. Amenities are excellent - robes, slippers, snacks 24/7, breakfast, and our choice of preferred pillows. Location was close to theaters, parks, and points of interest. Favorite place to stay!

title: No place better to stay near Times Square
text: Came back after a few years and had forgot what a great hotel this is. You get wonderful service, a very nice room and Ricks Club is a great place to hang out. But what is so special is how quiet your room is even though you are 200 ft. from all the noise and activity on Broadway.

title: Home, how a hotel should be.
text:
We stayed for 4 nights for the belated Silver Wedding break we were due to take in April 2020, Covid prevented it but the hotel were amazing accommodating numerous re scheduling. A warm welcome awaited at check in and the room was perfect.
Ricks cafe is a true haven and there any time of day, dash in for a cool down  ( it was ☀️) but I am sure in the ⛄️ it would be too. Every time you enter or exit the doors the front of house staff are on hand. When we visit again to NYC 🗽 we will look forward to going “home”

title: Wonderful stay
text: Everyone was gracious and always helpful. We had a fabulous time and will definitely be back. The location was convenient to everything we had planned for our weekend in NYC. Thanks again for a wonderful weekend.

title: Bogey would have been proud!
text: From the moment we walked into the Casablanca Hotel we were charmed. Brian checked us in and could not have been more friendly, welcoming and informative. We chose to end our upstate NY vacation with a night in Times Square, a few feet away from the hotel. We are glad we did. Lovely CLEAN rooms, comfortable beds. We also received a complientary bottle of wine for my brother's birthday and a smal l fridge, which I previously requested. Room is NYC small but not uncomfortably so. 2nd floor has as  free water, coffee, soda and snacks available all day. ALL staff were wonderful! They made our stay all the more special. Can't wait to return in the fall. MUCH THANKS TO THE WONDERFUL STAFF!!!

title: Comfortable and welcoming
text: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room size was small but perfectly adequate. I liked the 24/7 snack and drink bar and the hotel was quite clean. I think that in this part of NYC, the Casablanca hotel is reasonably priced as well.

title: Absolutely wonderful!
text: Eight women visiting NY together! Could not have had a better time! Casablanca was perfect for us!abs! The staff and housekeeping were great, always accommodating us in every way! The 2nd floor was a perfect place to gather in the morning and afternoon and late night too!

title: Family visit to New York City
text: Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.  The room was fine and the breakfast was basic but okay.  Location of the hotel was great.  Easy acces to the subway, theaters, restaurants and local attractions.  We will definitely consider staying at the Casablanca Hotel again.

title: Friendly staff and a great location!
text: We were able to walk to the theatre and several restaurants. The lounge was great to meet fellow travelers and served a nice continental breakfast. They had hard boiled eggs, croissants, yogurt, bananas and fresh coffee.

title: Thank you Casablanca and Tony’s
text:
Amazing location and the best service ever and you must try Tony’s restaurant next door. Fabulous 
Would highly recommend both. Miss you Casablanca hotel and  New York City and can’t wait to get back 💗💗

title: Perfect for a family stay in the Big Apple!
text: The room was comfortable and cozy.  What made the whole trip was the staff!  So sweet and helpful with directions, transportation, deliveries!  No matter what we needed, the team there was ready and willing to help.  Felt so safe and that was most important for me traveling alone with my kiddo.

title: Above and Beyond
text: The proximity to Times Square is great, but what really sets this hotel apart is the staff. They remembered our names! The hotel itself reminded us the small boutique hotel we stayed in when we were Venice, Italy. A great and memorable vacation!

title: Cute little hotel
text: Such a quaint little hotel! The rooms are very nice, they have a continental breakfast and snacks and pop available all day! The staff were awesome! So helpful and friendly! And they also have a car service for transportation to and from the airport! Highly recommended

title: Excellent
text: Just spent four nights at the Casablanca hotel in New York City and it could not have been better.  The Casablanca is a beautiful small boutique that provides a personalized experience that beats any of the large chain hotels. It is clean, has character, is in a great location and provides great value for the cost.  As with many travel experiences it is the staff that made our visit so special .  Each and every person we interacted with could not have been more helpful and pleasant. I highly recommend the Casablanca for your next visit.

title: Had a great time!
text: Great location, good facilities and for these days, unusual warm and friendly hospitality.  Ideally situated in mid town, with Times square and Bryant park literaly around the corner. Surprisingly calm and quiet at night. We would definitly recommend a stay at the Casablanca!

title: Nice, quiet hotel convenient to everything!
text: Friendly, helpful front desk. Quiet safe older hotel in the middle of Time Square. Comfortable bed and pillows.  Best perk is free good snacks and soft drinks on 2nd floor.  Free continental breakfast too!  Close to all subway lines.  Highly recommend!

title: Loved this hotel!
text: We are raving to everyone about the Casablanca!  Our suite was beautiful and very quiet.  Could not believe we were so close to Time Square.  We loved Rick's Cafe and the options available.  Loved Tony's next door! Loved everything!  Even the small old elevator had it's own charm!  Shout out to Ben, Brian and Nicole for being so welcoming.  Would never stay anywhere else in NYC!

title: Helpful friendly staff, B&B feeling hotel
text: Staff was very friendly and helpful.  The hotel was very clean.  Reasonable parking right next door.  It had more of a B&B atmosphere right in Times Square.  We plan to stay there again next time we go in.

title: Oasis in the city
text: An oasis in the city. Beautiful, well maintained hotel, we had a spacious suite, ceiling fans in both rooms which were such a nice touch and made for great sleeping. Nice water pressure in the shower. Just off of Times Square but so quiet. Very lovely staff, friendly and helpful. Cafe on the second floor was nice- stocked with snacks, water, soda, coffee and an espresso machine. Has a lovely little outdoor area you can sit too. Would be amazing if they had a light breakfast ( I think they did preCOVID). We will definitely stay here again when we return to the city.

title: Absolute Gem on Times Square
text: An absolute gem of a Hotel right on Times Square. Hotel has amazing staff, always friendly and helpfull. Rooms are very quiet considering the location and decor is really really nice. A good touch is the free snacks and coffee/ sodas all day. Only negative is the pull out sofa in the mini suite may need an update soon, its seen better days:-).

title: A Haven in NYC
text: We stayed for 5 nights and loved it!  Located just off Times Square, the staff was friendly and helpful and the building was quiet even through it is located in a very busy area.  It is a very handy location, easy to stop in to rest in between activities.  Rick's Cafe, which is part of the hotel, offers free refreshments in a large space where one can sit and read or play games (they are available for use) or even just chat.  The only downside is the inability to directly control the heat in the room, but opening windows solved the issue for us.  For many people this may not be an issue, but being from MN, we liked the room a little cooler at night.  Will definitely  come back!

title: N.Y.C.with Grandma
text:
We loved staying there.We felt very safe,and the entire staff could have not been more helpful.
No matter who we saw they always said hello and hows your day going.
The bed was like heaven,after walking all day. We ate at Tony's and the Brooklyn Diner.I would say the only down side were the snacks.The last time they had so many things to choose from.But I know times are tough now.Great service,and we felt safe.

title: Oasis in Times Square
text: Clean, convenient, helpful and extremely accommodating staff. We loved the common room/lounge. Made us feel at home. This place is a classy oasis in the middle of Times Square. We'll definitely be going back.

title: Clean, Quiet, Perfect
text: I stayed here for a work trip in Midtown and can’t recommend it enough as a home base. Quiet, incredibly clean, comfortable beds, spacious closets, and the nicest staff. Incredible location if you’re seeing any Broadway shows.

title: Vacation
text: I’m not a review writer but this place deserves one. When I arrived in the city there was something going on and I was unable to get down the road to the hotel, cops wouldn’t let us by (after a very long drive) called the hotel and they immediately came down the road, chatted with cops and saved us. Everyone was so welcoming and nice. The room was a really good size (king size room). Everything was nice and clean. The guys at the front desk we’re always helpful, and gave great recommendations (not to mention very nice to look at 😊) The location is perfect, we went for theatre and our longest walk was 8 minutes. Rockefeller center and Central Park are 10-15 minute walk. Their little cafe has water and soda cans always stocked, wonderful coffee, and some awesome (healthier) snacks. Just perfect in every way! You won’t find a better place to stay in the city.

title: This was my second stay and I will gladly be back for a third.
text: The service here is excellent. The staff are very welcoming and accommodating. They even left me a little birthday treat in my room. The 24 hour lounge is very convenient and the location can’t be beat. I’ve stayed here twice now and was happy each time.

title: Best Hotel in Times Square
text:
If you want to be in / near Times Square, I cannot imagine staying any place other than the Casablanca Hotel. This is a truly wonderful, small hotel with amazing, attentive staff. 

The room was clean, the bed comfortable, and the size of the room was just right. 

The second floor lounge is a great respite (with coffee and snacks) if you need some additional space when you on premises.

Although I am not a fan of Times Square, this hotel is extremely close to all of the theaters - and ½ block to a subway entrance. 

Just stay here - you won't regret it.

title: Great location, super staff!
text: Great location, super staff!  Located next to Times Square, Casablanca was located close to Broadway plays and subway stations.  Very walkable to these locations.   The staff was very nice and accommodating.  The room was surprisingly quiet, well maintained, cozy.   There isn't much of a lobby, but Rick's Cafe on the 2nd floor was wonderful.  Open at all hours it provided free non-alcoholic drinks and snacks to guests. It was a pleasant place to have a wonderful latte and read the morning news.

title: Sisters trip to NYC
text: This was my third time staying at the Casablanca and it never disappoints! It is a quiet oasis in the midst of the chaos of Times Square. The staff is very friendly and goes above and beyond to meet your needs. The included snacks and drinks at Rick's Cafe were super handy. We stayed in the suite with two double beds which was perfect for my sister and me, and gave us a living room area to relax and hang out with my NYC-based daughters. Highly recommend Tony's di Napoli right next door for dinner. Their penne primavera is an all-time favorite for me!

title: Theatre weekend stay with perfect location.
text: spent 4 nights here- lovely experience.  Staff all very friendly and helpful, greeted me by name as I came and went.  Since it is just off Times Square- the location is fab .  It did not seem noisy even though in the middle of it all.  The second floor coffee/tea and snack lounge very nice to have a quick rest and nibble, comfortable and well spaced seating.  Bed quite comfortable and use of slippers and robe in room made it very homey.

title: Hidden Gem
text: The Casablanca is a hidden gem in NYC.  The hotel may be small but the staff was extremely helpful and friendly, the location was awesome and the rooms very clean.  They also have an area on the second floor where you can relax and enjoy all day refreshments.  This wasn’t the first and won’t be the last time I stay at this hotel.

title: Home away from home
text: This hotel and all their staff were amazing.  It's right on the edge of Times Square, walkable to the Theater District and major train stops.  The room was clean and spacious; we had a suite with 2 full beds and a pull out sofa in the living room, very comfortable for our family of 4.  It was surprisingly quiet despite its proximity to the chaos of Times Square.  We loved the 24/7 Rick's lounge for snacks and drinks and a place to unwind.  We were able to check in early and after we checked out, they held our luggage while we finished up some sight seeing.  When we came back to claim the bags they asked if we needed to use the restroom/Lounge to freshen up and said that "It's still your home," which I though was really sweet.  It really did feel like a haven from the frenzy of NYC and I would absolutely stay here again and highly recommend!!!

title: Some peace in a busy city !
text: Awesome experience… staff was beyond great wish more hotels had great customer service as we had here. Rooms were super clean, snacks and drinks were better than some of the expensive hotels! Will return.

title: Perfection!
text: Wonderful hotel! Perfect location, intimate/quiet/cozy for being just a few steps from the center of Times Square, full of character, loved the snacks that were available 24/7, the best pillows ever (hoping I can buy a couple), extremely friendly & helpful staff, Tony's Italian restaurant right next door and Brooklyn Cafe close to the other side. I see no reason to stay anywhere else in NYC.

title: Amazing
text:
Stayed one night due to flight delay.  Got a room short notice through hotels.com. 
Great staff! Great location! 
Snacks and coffee all day. Definitely worth it. Right in Times Square. 10min walk to Central Park.

title: I’d stay here again !
text: Great location, kind staff, very relaxing.  Having a restaurant right next door accessible thru the lobby  was convenient on a rainy night.  Only downside was no heat control in room. Very warm, had to open window for some air

title: Perfect Broadway trip
text:
This is a gem in great location. We walked everywhere. Our end room was perfectly quiet, day and night.  The second floor lounge had a comforting fire on snowy days and welcome drinks and snacks anytime. Beds and bath were clean and comfortable. Staff was so welcoming and kind. Tony’s next door was great dinner spot. Also it is hard to find rooms  with two queens in nyc. That was priceless for mother/daughter Broadway trip!
I cant wait to go back. Only minor inconvenience is lavk of individual room temp control.

title: Perfect place for a theater trip
text: The second floor living room/lounge is a gem, great space to hang out with friends.  The staff were all wonderful and accommodating.  I was in NY for a theater trip with two dear friends and the Casablanca was the perfect place for us to stay.  We will definitely come back.  We had the mini-suite and it worked really well for the three of us.

title: Winter Get Away
text: My wife and I enjoyed our stay. The location was perfect for us to see a show at the Town Hall theater. We both felt that the hotel was very nicely decorated and the hospitality room on the second floor was inviting.  We sat in front of the fireplace with a glass of wine.

title: Phenomenal!
text:
Such a phenomenal hotel.

Clean, Classy, Character and a Cosy/Warm atmosphere.

The staff were phenomenal- always friendly and helpful.

The 24/7 unlimited help yourself snacks and drinks buffet in the lounge is genius.

It makes sense this place was voted in the top 15 best hotels in the whole of the USA!

Keep up the incredible work and thank you so much for everything- we’ll be back.

Reuben and Szilvi (UK) :-)

title: Very Professional Staff
text: We organized a meeting for one of our clients and reserved 10 rooms over several days at the Casablanca. Everyone was very pleased with their room and with the services offered by the hotel.  The staff was very patient, responsive, professional and kind throughout the reservation process. We will return to the Casablanca again.

title: NYC Overnight
text: My wife and I stayed one evening at the Casablanca. Great stay from check-in through departure. Room was cozy and comfortable and very quiet. The little cafe and lounge were perfect. We'd definitely stay again if we're back in the City.

title: Nice, older hotel in Times Square
text:
We stayed at Casablanca in February, 2022.  We have been to NYC many times and chose to stay in Times Square because we were scheduled to see a few shows.  Casablanca has been on my list for many years due to its consistent high ratings. 

Positives:  nice, helpful employees!  Free sodas, tea, coffee and snacks 24/7.  Close to theaters for Broadway shows.  Safety (hotel locks front doors in the evenings).

Negatives:  Older hotel.  Elevators are small and SLOW.  

Yes, I’d recommend this hotel if you aren’t looking for something modern. Personally, I think we will likely skip staying in Times Square in the future, but not due to the hotel.  We prefer staying in quieter locations.

title: THIRD VISIT- ANOTHER GREAT WEEK
text: For this Feb. trip- 6 nights- we decided on a suite. Brian set us up exactly as requested. For us, this is the best possible location- a quick 1 stop subway ride on train 1,2,3 from Penn Station coming in on NJT. While we miss Rick's continental breakfast and wine/cheese afternoons- Casablanca still provides the best spread of sodas, water, chips, nuts, fruit, espresso, coffee. Rain-no problem -umbrellas provided. Super friendly staff as always. Maintenance was quick to respond to radiator clanging. Suite was really nice size with french doors separating living area / bedroom. TV's in both rooms. Be sure to request refrigerator. Pillows too mushy for me- foam pillow provided.  We tried a different diner- Red Flame on 44 th.- went twice for breakfasts. Tony's accessed directly from lobby- we went twice. Get basics from Whole Foods- 2 blocks away. Housekeeping outstanding.  From 3rd- 4th floor- ez walk down steps to Rick's on 2nd floor or out. Looking forward to another week.

title: What a gem
text:
I love NYC boutique hotels and this is as good as any. The service here was impeccable. Every time we were out of the room the staff was so friendly and helpful. 

I should give this a one star so other people don’t go here, but it is truly a five. Guess I have to share with the world!

title: Wonderful stay - great location!
text:
We were so happy to finally get to NYC after having to reschedule twice due to ongoing Covid.  We greatly appreciated the Casablanca management allowing us to twice rebook our non-refundable reservation. 

The room was spacious for a NYC hotel room, comfortable and clean. It was also quiet for being right off of Times Square. 

We enjoyed Rick's Cafe and being able to stop in for breakfast items and afternoon and evening snacks and beverages. The location is excellent with about a 30 second walk to Times Square, a couple minutes to the Times Square/42nd Street subway station, 5 minutes to Bryant Park and 10 - 15 minutes to Rockefeller Center and Radio City Music Hall. 

We enjoyed our stay and would definitely stay here again. 
We

title: Excellent Customer Service
text: Best quality of service I’ve ever had in a hotel! Every staff member we spoke to was pleasant and helpful. Beautiful place in a great location, very nice amenities, and super clean, but really what I’ll remember is how nice everyone was. It was our first trip to New York, and they helped to make it a wonderful experience. I’d definitely stay there again.

title: Lives up to the Accolades
text:
My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights.  We booked it based on price, reviews, and since it was for my wife's birthday and she's a Casablanca movie fan, for the ambiance.  The room was small but nice and clean, and housekeeping was terrific.  Our room looked out over the courtyard which was kind of deceiving since it always is kind of dark, even though it was a sunny day.  

The first night the cable TV was out and we were advised it was a  network outage, fortunately it was back on the next day. They do offer DVD's so of course we watched Casablanca the first night.  

The second floor snack area was nice, and instead of going out to an overpriced breakfast we got coffee, fruit, and granola bars there to tie us over until lunch, and there was always bottled water available.  Like most hotels, you pay a resort fee, but this fee you actually see a benefit from. 

The location is excellent, it was not until we were on a tour that I realized the hotel is within a football field of where the New Year's ball drops!  And there's always some NYPD officers on the corner, so the area is well protected. 

We will consider staying here again if/when we return to NYC.

title: Cozy and comfortable hotel!
text: Great boutique hotel.  Cozy and great service!  Loved the staff!  Loved the sitting area near the fireplace. The location was just perfect for our Broadway getaway!  Room was well appointed and you just can't beat all of the snacks and cappuccinos provided free of charge. And, the hotel is adjoining a great Italian restaurant on one side of it and a yummy deli on the other side    A great stay!

title: Great Find
text: What a great location off of Time Square.  The staff were friendly and helpful.  The room was very comfortable and well stocked as well as the Café room with complimentary coffee and snacks.  Would definitely recommend and will stay there again.

title: Weekend Stay
text: I rarely leave reviews, but I wanted to take a minute to point out what a hidden gem this hotel is. Being right off Times Square, we expected it to be loud and crowded, but the exact opposite was true. Our room was very quiet and peaceful, and the hotel staff was incredibly polite and professional throughout our stay. Being located centrally in NYC, it was great for traveling throughout Manhattan and served as a great homeport for our weekend trip. Would definitely recommend to others!

title: A little gem
text:
Half a block from Times Square, this hotel was filled with old world charm. The staff were very attentive to any requests we made, provided advice for places to eat and how to get about. Ricks Cafe was always well stocked with drinks and snacks and provided a warm place to recover from the cold outside. 
Room was compact, but well appointed, with a good bathroom. We had no complaints about the room. We were met with a complimentary bottle of wine in the room upon our arrival - a nice touch!
Accept that old Morocco is the theme for the hotel and enjoy the atmosphere in modern NYC.

title: Great location and comfortable room
text: You can't beat this location, just off Time Square but quiet and cozy.  Excellent break room stocked with complimentary coffee, tea and snacks.  My only concern was that the room worked on heat from old radiators that were noisy and did not keep it very warm, but it was a good temperature for sleeping and I had my best night's sleep in years.

title: Staying With Your Best Friends
text: If comfortable, friendly and gracious are things you look for in a hotel, then the Casablanca is the place.  The Staff exemplifies all of these, while providing exceptional service.  Even in this challenging time their goal is for the guest to have an outstanding experience.  Casablanca is a centrally located historic hotel with a knowledgeable staff that will certainly try to accommodate your every need.

title: Always the BEST!
text:
Having stayed at 20+ hotels in NYC over the years, I have finally learned not to bother with anyone other than the Casablanca. My last visit was August, 2021, and my next will be next weekend. There is no better home base in NYC for sightseeing!
My visits have spanned over 10 years, so I have obviously experienced the hotel pre-Covid and recently. Things have changed some. The current climate has dictated that. What hasn't changed is that the staff is amazing. Do I miss the breakfast at Rick's lounge and the wine and cheese? Of course! But those things aren't the reason I stay at Casablanca Hotel. (BTW, the offerings they are able to have are more than sufficient to get your day started and offer a hearty snack in the afternoon)
I love the coziness of the boutique hotel experience, the location right next to Times Square, and the staff - the kindest, most helpful and accommodating hotel staff I have ever experienced anywhere in the world. Can't wait to be back next Friday!

title: Talk About Amazing Service
text: I called to see if my room was ready hours before check in and was greeted with the words I’m going to make your day, and the Casablanca did just that. Courteous and engaging staff, beautiful rooms, Ricks’s Lounge with snacks and games, parking and restaurant next door, make the Casablanca the place to be.

title: Frankly my dear, I think they have stopped giving a damn
text:
Having stayed at the Casablanca on 5 separate occasions, always in December,  we have come to expect the great service and hospitality provided by the hotel and its brilliant staff that previously meant this hotel was fairly consistently #1 in NYC on TripAdvisor. This time there were too many changes due to covid that left us feeling heart broken we had returned to this hotel that has always provided us with such magical memories. We have their decoration on our Christmas tree, their mugs in our cupboard and we stayed here after being engaged at the Rockefeller Tree. I know others have similar feelings towards Casablanca/Library Hotels and they need to make returning guests better aware what the current offering is. 

The fab location and cosy, quiet rooms remain. The rates and fees stay the same price as pre-Covid but the daily breakfast offering, the nightly cheese and wine reception and the customer service is gone. 
The Ricks Cafe experience that you were happily paying a premium for in the past has changed beyond comprehension. No one sits in this once social space that was the heart and soul of the hotel. With NYC being packed with tourists the week before Christmas this area sat quiet with no atmosphere, probably due to the fact the current drinks and packaged foods on offer are unappealing and the empty soda cans and plates that were used sit around for hours without being tidied away. The current offering goes no way to replacing what was provided previously for the same money being charged. I appreciate Covid could change the offering but no way should it have been allowed to decimate the experience like it has. If they want to charge the same price but with covid precautions could they not provide individual different breakfast items, small wine bottles or wine for taking to your room, cheese plates that have been made up or bought in or some sort of deal with the Brooklyn Diner or Tony’s?
After checking in we expressed these concerns to the manager John who seemed happy to accept the way things were now with the lesser experience and it simple seemed his returning customers should lessen their expectations that this Hotel once exceeded. It was explained we had received a quote from them direct 3 months earlier advising of a ‘Daily Deluxe Continental Breakfast Buffet’ and a Wine and Cheese Reception every night 5-8pm. This was still being advertised on their website. It seemed this was just unfortunate for the customer and they were in the process of trying to remove all mention that this ever existed. The current available packaged chips, dried fruits and access to a coffee machine that permanently said it needed maintenance was hardly the deluxe food offerings advertised. The minimum ever provided by a hotel should be tea and coffee but even this couldn’t be done right as there was never any Creamer/Milk for the drinks laid out. Staff at reception seem to think this wasn’t needed and we did think that as we are from abroad that this was perhaps our issue but another guest who was American advised us when gathered round the paltry snack offerings that he wasn’t happy as he was having to drink his coffee black and you really need Creamer provided, I also note the review below saying similar so I am glad it was not just us. The manager explained they couldn’t have Creamer sitting out all day (although they did in the past) so seemingly didn’t bother, but said they would now put out separate individual cartons of 50/50 to be used, I never saw this happen in the 3 nights following we stayed. In the past something like this would have been dealt with so quickly but now with the reception/concierge having to do hospitality tasks they just don’t seem to happen. 
After making a lot of these points none that were particularly attempted to be understood or addressed the ‘Resort’ fees were removed from our bill on our request. This no way though made up for the change of experience and lack of service from the Casablanca. I would go as far to say the reception was particularly cold and unwelcoming after raising these points with them, the checkout was a sad quick scan of the computer and not much else said, it felt like the staff were aware we had complained to the manager and it all felt very unprofessional. Staffing numbers generally were low, in the past we are use to staff knowing your name, opening the front door for you and welcoming you back. This time you could come and go without seeing anyone and in effect you were paying for a small cosy room in a great location. Fine for the right money but for $350 + taxes and fees per night I could be staying in a similar location in a more modern room twice the size at Marriott Marquis if all I wanted was a room and a Times Square location. Library hotels need to get what they are offering sorted out or they will watch their hotel’s high rankings continue to decline. Without the service and the previous hospitality offerings the Library Hotels are know for it makes you look at the rooms alone in more detail and at the Casablanca these can be small and start to look quite dated and would not fulfil the price or a returning customers expectations. I sadly cannot see us returning and we will need to begin researching a new hotel for our Christmas NYC visits. 
And as for the Casablanca Hotel… We will always have Paris…

title: Great Hotel but miss the breakfast and the afternoon snacks
text: While the service, decor and location of the Casablanca Hotel is outstanding, we really missed the previously offered breakfast and afternoon wine and snacks. Now they offer a 24 hour snack bar but the choices are very mundane plus the specialty coffee maker didn't work at all during our Dec 10 -14 stay. Troubling also was the absence of creamer for regular coffee most mornings, sure a spare pack of powdered creamer could have been used. Perhaps these are all results of the pandemic and supply chain disruption, but we expected more from The Casablanca

title: BACK TO NY WITH GREAT HOTEL
text: El hotel se encuentra super ubicado para aprovechar el teatro en nyc, el hotel es un gran hotel , aunque me parece que le falta tener servicio de pettit dejuner.  asi como servicio de bar en la tarde.  pero lo mejor y merece un extra aplauso el servicio del staff del hotel es maravilloso, te resuelven todo con una actitud positiva al 100%

title: Great little place in Times Square!
text: Hotel was great, rooms in great condition, clean.  Staff was excellent, everyone was very friendly and helpful.  They go out of their way to make you feel welcome.  Snacks in the lounge were very good, and always well stocked.  Close to all the major tourism locations.

title: Perfect NYC
text: Perfect location and parking affiliation, engaging staff, great 2nd floor lounge and snacks, clean rooms, great water pressure in rain shower head, and centrally located for easy walking to all of our trip activities (we never used a cab or Uber).  Our go to hotel for all future NYC visits!

title: The Best Boutique Hotel in NYC
text: Just a few hundred yards from Time Square is the best boutique hotel in NYC.  The Casablanca Hotel is a mix of Mediterranean culture, superb customer service and a quiet, comfortable room. We have enjoyed the hospitality of the staff many times over the past few years. We wouldn’t think of going to NYC without making the Casablanca part of our stay.

title: Simply the Best
text:
This was not our first stay at The Casablanca and our return was just as wonderful as we expected.  The location is only the start for reasons to choose The Casablanca.  It is less than a minute walk from Times Square, and less than 10 minutes from Bryant Park and the library.

But it is the people who work there that make it the only hotel we will ever consider to stay in when we go to NYC, and it was serendipitous we choose it the first time.  We've never stayed in any hotel where the entire staff is so kind, pleasant, attentive and friendly.  It is not a large impersonal hotel like so many in the area.  The reception and lobby staff greet guests by name, like one would expect only at a small B&B.  Housekeeping is thorough and consistent; no surprises at all.  And as we found with this second visit after a few years away, there is very little turnover in the staff.  That itself is a very good indicator of a nice place to stay.  If the staff is pleased with their working conditions then they will pass that on to their guests, and we can see it and feel it.  It is very obvious they like their jobs.  And that reflects very well on management and supervision.

We very much enjoy going from the noise and lights of Times Square into what we feel is our home away from home.  It is quiet and relaxing inside.  Rick's Cafe is a perfect place to sit and plan a day or discuss a day gone by.  And since it is a smaller hotel one usually sees other guests a number of times in Rick's, and we've had some good discussions and laughs with many of them.  The friendly, pleasant atmosphere permeates the hotel.  And there are very nice snacks and a variety of drinks available all day.  A very nice, efficient young lady, Houda, was obviously very anxious to take special care of guests in Rick's.  And as we saw in other staff members, she is proud of her work and that can only benefit the guests.

We feel the highest compliment we can pay the management and staff is the fact that we will be back, even making up a reason to go to NYC, just to go back for another stay.  There are plenty of hotels to choose from and we will waste no time even considering the others.  It is enjoyable to stay, not just a place to stay.

Thank you, to Mr. Taboada and the entire staff at The Casablanca.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: This is a small boutique hotel right on 5th Ave. You can't beat them for location. They're right next door to Tony D'Napoli's restaurant and a parking garage. The rooms are small but so aren't almost all NYC rooms. They have a wonderful large lounge though that before Covid had breakfast and wine & cheese from 5 to 8pm. Since they can't do that now they have bottled water, soda and seltzers in a cooler 24/7 along with a coffee machine that does espresso, fruit, large bags of chips, nuts and Cliff bars. It's all available at any time. You're always greeted with an hello and a smile no matter how many times you're in and out during the day and they happily store your luggage on arrival and departure which apparently several hotels now charge for. It's just a really nice, friendly, convenient place to stay and their prices are extremely reasonable.

title: Wonderful Find Near Times Square
text: Casablanca Hotel was an oasis of tranquility in the middle of the hustle and bustle of NYC. The staff was very friendly and helpful, from storing our luggage when we arrived early to check out. Rick's Cafe on the second floor was a wonderful place to relax, have a snack and enjoy the fire. Our room was quiet and comfortable. We would definitely recommend the hotel.

title: Love
text: We love The Casablanca in Times Square. Convenient to the theaters. Very friendly staff and very accommodating. We will go back again and again. We stayed in a suite which was vey spacious and great for getting dressed for a Broadway opening.

title: It’s much  more than just it’s location !
text:
This was our second trip to NYC staying in The Casablanca and we were so glad we chose to do so. 

The hotel is located only a stones throw away from the excitement / atmosphere / craziness of Times Square which makes it perfect fo sightseeing, entertainment and eateries. There is also the added bonus of not having far to walk when heading home for the night.

The staff are amazingly friendly and helpful and a particular shout out for Houda who took care of in Rick’s Cafe, nothing was an issue for her to find out she originates from Casablanca made it special. Everyone looked after us friendly greetings on heading out hoping we had a great day then a warm welcome on our return. 

The room was quiet, comfortable and well furnished the bathroom clean and plenty of hot water anytime of day and the accompanying toiletries, towels and bathrobes were of great quality. 

Due to Covid restriction offerings in Ricks Cafe (wine & cheese) on an evening were unavailable this time, but they are hoping to reinstate soon. We still spent time in there with friends chatting and taking advantage of the available refreshments. 

The Casablanca has a connecting door to what was one of the best places we ate in NYC - Tony’s of Napoli great food, lively atmosphere and no need to go outside to get home. 

We think that the best recommendation we can give The Casablanca is that we would return in a heartbeat 💗

title: Fascinating history!  Charming, understated elegance! Incredible hospitality!
text:
My wife and I stayed here Wed & Thu, Nov 24th and 25th.  (Thanksgiving eve, and Thanksgiving night)  We were both absolutely and completely satisfied with this small, boutique hotel, within easy walking distance of so many highlights!  Everyone on the staff was exceptionally professional, courteous, and attentive!  We look forward to a return trip to the Casablanca Hotel the next time our travels take us to New York City.  The general manager, John Taboada, went above and beyond to give us an incredible experience.
One particular example of their attention to detail; we were in a rental car, and parked in the parking garage almost adjacent to the hotel.   As we were unloading our luggage, a gentleman from The Casablanca asked if we were staying at the hotel, and proceeded to take care of our luggage.  Imagine our surprise when we learned that it was the the general manager who had made the effort to come meet us at the vehicle and get our bags into the hotel for us!
We cannot recommend The Casablanca highly enough!
Thank you, all!

title: Wonderful Experience at Casablanca
text: We took our children to New York for the first time and wanted to stay within easy access of the New York tourist must see sites. Casablanca was the perfect spot. The hotel was a clean, charming boutique hotel.  It was a quiet spot but located just off Times Square. Easy walking with small kids to Broadway, Madame Tussauds, Empire, Rockefeller, FAO Schwarz and more. The kids loved Rick's Cafe. Having a 24 hour spot where we could take a break and have a snack was wonderful. However, the best part of the experience may have been the staff. Every single person was friendly and went out of there way to accommodate us. The guys at the front desk were always very helpful and the manager went out of his way to make the Macy's parade a once in a lifetime experience for my kids. I couldn't recommend Casablanca more.

title: Disappointed this time
text: My wife and I have stayed at the Casablanca Hotel before and loved it.  However, this time we were quite disappointed. They used to provide all kinds of goodies at the aptly named Rick's, but this time, there was next to nothing for us. Some chips, Cliff bars, coffee and water--that was all. In the past, there used to be practically a full breakfast, with wine and various treats later in the day. They say that the cutbacks are due to Covid-19, but they could easily enough have provided some yogurt in individual containers, individually wrapped pastries , etc. Disappointing, to say the least. To make matters worse, the elevators were out of commission for almost our entire stay. We are both in our 70s and climbing up and down to the third floor three or four times a day was not our idea of a good time. Sorry to say that we won't be going back to the Casablanca next time we are in NYC. Too bad, because the place is charming and the staff are absolutely wonderful.

title: Sadly disappointed
text:
Had high hopes
The good - big room and bathroom ( latter renovated)
Relatively quiet for the location
Comfortable bed and pillows
Convenient comfortable snack lounge on second floor
But..
Rest of decor - carpets etc a tad tired
The worst was the elevators(2) were out of order for 3 full days!!!
To see older folk struggling up and down up to 6 flights of stairs was unacceptable!
And the reaction at the desk- “ we apologise for the inconvenience “
Last visit I’m afraid!

title: Proximity to everything can't be beat!
text: This little hotel was recommended to us by someone who'd stayed there before ....  Loved the proximity to theatres, restaurants, and shopping.  Walkable!  The rooms were quite nice, and we enjoyed the room on the second floor with fruit, coffee, etc.  Employees were pleasant and helpful.  Appreciated their ability to call taxis and track their progress getting there.  Also utilized their booking of cars to pick us up and deliver us to the airport.  The only drawback was that we'd requested an early wake-up call, which never came.

title: Wonderful Stay!
text: Just returned from a wonderful stay at this charming hotel.  Not only was the staff truly amazing, but I was given a free upgrade upon check-in . Loved how when booking on their website I was able to pick from a menu of items to be delivered to my room.  I chose the tea kettle and makeup mirror which were already in my room waiting when I arrived.  Gotta love that!  The location is excellent as well.  This was my first theater trip since Covid and the hotel was well within a short walking distance of all three shows as well as subway lines when traveling further afield. Another great amenity is the lounge which I've enjoyed at other Library Collection properties and this one did not disappoint.  The convenience of enjoying the included snacks and drinks in a lovely atmosphere after a busy day in the city is a major perk.  Can't say enough about this wonderful hotel and very much looking forward to my next visit!

title: Birthday Celebration
text: I chose this hotel based on the reviews and they were spot on. This hotel is fantastic. The staff is amazing. Beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square.  Wouldn't stay anywhere else on our future trips to New York.

title: Fantastic Hotel - Book Direct!
text: Excellent property - very clean and a great location. I booked through Expedia - big mistake. I was overcharged and was unable to get a refund for the difference. The pricing for the hotel is best through the hotel website.

title: Very Nice Like All Library Collection Hotels
text:
Like all of the hotels in The Library Collection this
hotel had a great accommodating staff and
lots of perks in a comfortable common room with plenty of space for many hotel guests. Room was small and even in nyc i manage to find larger rooms but common room made up for it.

title: Thank you, Casablanca!
text: What a great surprise this small boutique hotel was!  From the moment we arrived  5 hours early for check-in, we were greeted with friendly, helpful, kind employees.  Our room, although small (typical for NYC), was extremely clean and very nicely furnished. We loved the use of the 'club room', Rick's Cafe, where we had fresh fruit, KIND bars, beverages and more at our disposal.  Loved our stay here and will recommend it to anyone who asks!

title: Best small hotel in Times Square
text: The location of this hotel could not be better. It’s a half block away from Times Square. Walking distance to the major theaters and also Restaurant Row. The hotel is exceptionally clean and staff very helpful and friendly. Our room was small, but comfortable and had all of the necessities. The weather was very hot and the window air conditioner, although a bit loud, was able to keep the room comfortable. We found the bed to be very comfortable. Free snacks 24 hours a day, including coffee, water, soft drinks and small bags of chips and nuts. No breakfast food except for the coffee. The restaurant on the ground floor Tony’s Di Napoli is wonderful. Parking is available in a garage next-door that charges $30 a day. We would definitely stay here again in the future.

title: Nice Hotel great location
text: It's a very small hotel with a pleasant staff.  Nice benefits that you don't always see at a NYC hotel especially one so close to time square such as the lounge.  The location can't be beat as you are less than 2 blocks from times square.  We were in a suite which was a good size for NYC and was a very reasonable price.

title: Great alternative to big chain hotels
text: Cute little hotel right off Times Square. Quiet, clean, excellent staff. Comfortable room, free beverages and snacks 24/7. Great alternative to staying in a large chain hotel. Affordable and cozy. Cute sitting area with lots of books on second level if you want to relax; plenty of seating if you want to meet up with other guests.

title: The Hotel
text: It is very difficult to find an ideal hotel that meets all your needs but. Casablanca has location, amazing staff, great choice of rooms and a superb restaurant adjoining. We had a fami!y occasion recently and it ticked all the boxes. But it's location at Times Square is number one. Perfect. The Hotel for me.

title: Perfect Stay
text: My family of 12 people just returned from NYC and we chose Cassablanca Hotel as our home in the city for a few nights. We had four rooms that were cozy, clean and very spacious. It's also located steps from Times Square and the subway. But the best part was the AMAZING staff at this hotel. They go above and beyond and were so friendly and accommodating. We also loved Rick's Cafe on the 2nd floor and it was the perfect spot for us all to hang out.

title: Best hotel
text:
Beautiful hotel in the perfect location. Few steps from Time Square. All main NYC attractions were easy to access from the hotel. 

The hotel is very clean, very nicely decorated; Rick’s cafe is 24/7 available offering snack bars, fresh fruit, water, sodas, flavored waters, tea, variety of coffees, and an excellent place to take your own dood ro enjoy. 

The hotel offers several complimentary amenities besides the cafe, such as computer access, wifi, bottled water in the room, slippers, bathrobes, luggage storage.

Everybody at the front desk is amazing!!!  They are helpful, resourceful, Respectful, friendly, a fantastic group!

The website pictures show exactly how the hotel is; everything they offer, you got it and more. They go an extra mile to make you feel comfortable and enjoy your time there. 

They offer ride service to the airport through an external company which is also excellent. 

This is a hotel that you must stay when you visit NYC! 

Thank you for such a great experience!!!

title: Nice Hotel, Great Location
text: Interesting hotel, I liked the motif. Employees were exceptionally nice and helpful.  Nice sitting room on the second floor with free coffee, non alcoholic drinks and granola bars. Room was a decent size, bed was comfortable.  Extra pillow and light blanket in the closet.  Also complimentary bottled water.  I found the room quiet, but the window AC unit too loud and did not dehumidify well. Overall, i would return but probably not on a summer night if having to use that ac. Very good location, near the middle of everything. We had a good room rate as NYC is just coming back from a tough time.

title: Amazing stay with our family!
text: We had a wonderful stay at the Casablanca Hotel! The location was perfect, and the room was incredibly spacious for a family of four. We loved Ricks Cafe on the 2nd floor and felt like the hotel was both modern and family friendly :). The best part for us was getting to know John and Brian at the front desk who really went above and beyond to make us and our kids feel special and welcome. We highly recommend this hotel!!!

title: Excellent Stay
text: Brought our teenage girls to New York and The Casablanca did not disappoint! What an excellent stay. Everyone was so friendly and helpful with us planning our days. Rick’s cafe was a great place to come after being out all day, just to sit and relax and have a soda, coffee, water and snacks. The beds were extremely comfortable.  We stayed in a mini double suite and there was plenty of room for 4 people. Location is centrally located. Great places to eat with walking distance. We would definitely stay here again and look forward to our next trip when Broadway opens back up.  The staff is outstanding!

title: Promise of a refund - What Rubbish
text:
Having paid in full for a 1 night stay back in July 2020, this unfortunately was cancelled by the hotel due to Covid-19. 
Having discussed my options with the reservations manager, Brian, I received confirmation that a full refund would be processed without question. 
Further emails were sent as the months went by and no money had been returned. 
Some 9 months have now passed since parting with my money and my emails have and are still being ignored. 
I find the hotels behaviour absolutely abysmal and suggest looking elsewhere rather than stay here.
My wife is Moroccan and lived in Casablanca for over 20 years and to associate such a beautiful name place to such a dishonest organisation is a real injustice. 
Please please do not stay at this hotel.

title: Spence Scotland
text: I have been waiting on a refund for our cancelled trip from April 2020. Was told we would get when they opened. Now they are not replying to my e mails. Had stayed there before and really liked it but with this problem will not be staying there again.

title: Best hotel in NYC
text: This is the best hotel I’ve ever stayed before. Location is terrific and the staff is wonderful. The people and the front desk and housekeeping were so nice. I stayed at this place back in Dec 2019, but I just can’t forget it. Hopefully I’ll be there soon

title: Exceptional Hotel in bustling Times Square
text:
This is quite possibly one of the best hotels I’ve ever had the fortune to stay in. 
The rooms are beautifully equipped with an eye on detail and guest comfort.
The staff are all outstanding. Professional, genuinely friendly and obliging in every way to make your staff the best!
The hotel offer drinks and canapés each evening and this is most welcoming after a long busy day out and about. It allows time to mix back before dinner plans.
The decor is second to none. Authentic, stylish and sophisticated. 
One day I hope to return. This hotel is truly exceptional..!

title: Waiting for a refund for 7 months - Customer Service Failure
text:
We were really looking forward to staying here as the property looks great. We began requesting our refund in April (for a stay in June) when the COVID crisis cancelled the trip. The hotel has been closed and the Manager tells me every month when I email AGAIN, that credit card refunds can only be processed by the actual credit card machine in the hotel itself -- not from corporate, not from a sister property's machine, nothing. They are not yet open so no refund. Corporate customer service doesn't even reply. 
This is the level of service expected at the lowest-end hotel chains and at this point, after monthly emails to ask "can you do it now", I'd be hard pressed to ever want to try this hotel in the future, and extend that to the rest of the chain as well.

title: Magical little hotel right in the center of it all
text: Absolutely loved this place. Location is A+, right next to Times Square. Rooms are small, but typical for NYC. We took our 10 and 13 year old here and had a room with two queens right by the stairway down to the lounge area. The best thing about staying at the Casablanca is the complimentary drinks and snacks that are served in the afternoon and evening. Just lovely and so fun to sit out on the blue parrot patio. Our kids just loved it. We loved the Prosecco after a long day of hiking around the city. Staff was very friendly. I won’t ever stay anywhere else when in NYC!

title: スタッフさんはフレンドリーで大変親切！お部屋も工夫されていました。
text:
口コミの評価が良かったので宿泊しました！
スタッフさんは大変親切で、部屋が寒かったら、暖房を調節に来てくれ、ミニヒーターまで持ってきてくれたりしました。
バスタブ付きのお部屋をリクエストしたら、スイートにアップグレードしてくれて、驚きました！お湯も温かく、シャワーもドライヤーもアメニティもきちんとあります。
2階にあるラウンジは空いており、チェックアウト後も紅茶やコーヒーを飲ませていただきました。常時ペストリーとコーヒー、紅茶、ココアなどがあります。
夕方の時間帯（PM5時から8時）には、フルーツとチーズ、クラッカー、野菜スティック、パンなどを食べることが出来ます。
赤ワイン、白ワイン、スパークリングワインを飲めます。
2階のラウンジは広く清潔で、沢山の席があるので、のんびりと利用することが出来ました。
また、ニューヨークに来た際には宿泊したいと思います！

title: lovely place to stay
text: Definitely the best place we have ever stayed in NYC.  The location is perfect for staying near the Theater District.  We found it very relaxing to return from a night at the theater and visit the lounge. We will return!

title: One of the best hotels in NY
text:
All staffs were so friendly and helpful 
The room was compact but clean.
I could not understand the air conditioner.
Breakfast was so good!
All bread was good. I wanna eat those now!!
When I come to NY anytime,I want to stay this hotel

title: Great stay in the heart of New York
text: The Casablanca really deserves its reputation. I guess it’s very small by NY standards, but the experience is superb. Location is spot on, staff attentive without being overbearing, rooms comfortable and homely. Highly recommended

title: Quaint
text:
A hidden gem in a great location and a real bargain for NYC. 
Room was a tad on the smallish side but it's the city. 
Bathrobe,  slippers and a safe in room a plus!
Complimentary cocktail hour, tea and coffee service and a continental buffet breakfast. 
Cozy seating areas.
Not modern or trendy but cute and comfortable.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This hotel gets what it means to serve their customers; Chocolates on the pillow, wine hour and slippers! They know how to make their guests feel special. The location and staff are top notch. We will be back!

title: Great hotel in a great location
text:
The location of this hotel is perfect. Right near Times Square but once in the Hotel you are in a quiet haven and get away from the hustle and bustle. Although our room was small it was very clean with excellent facilities and a comfortable bed. Just what we needed for a 5 night stay. The continental breakfast had a good selection of pastries, breads, bagels, fresh fruit etc. The cheese and wine in an evening was a welcome treat as was the provision of tea/coffee and pastries throughout the day.
All the staff were amazing; they couldn't do enough for us. They also recommended some great restaurants.
I would definitely book this hotel when returning to New York.

title: Sunday in New York
text: Extremely nice and perfectly located hotel with a very welcoming atmosphere. Spacious rooms (for Manhattan standards) that are very well kept. Friendly and most helpfull staff. Definitely to be recommended.

title: Second visit- Perfect week- Outstanding hotel
text: Coming into Penn Station,  Take Subway 1,2 or 3  Uptown, only one stop going uptown,  After staying for a couple of days to check it out in spring, we are back for a week long visit. Bags were held  as we arrived before check in, as we caught a show on our first day.  We stayed in a  King premium  bedroom, inside.  Room is very good size- remember this is NYC,. Confirming reviews that this is a most excellent hotel. Perfect service form doormen, desk, maids and waitstaff at Rick's. This is one property that you actually receive  great deal for the resort fee, wi-fi, day long cappucino, espresso, coffee, snacks. Very nice continental breakfast- with fresh fruit, pastries, cereals, bagels, juice, hard boiled eggs- you will eat here for breakfast every day. Evening vino, cheese, veggies, popcorn. At first our room was cold, but staff adjusted the radiator valve, then occasionally we opened bathroom window- this was no problem, Refrigerator can be ordered- Whole foods around the corner for beers, snack, hard water. Perfect location to major subway lines or buses, Times square around the corner for shows etc- Check out TKS for discount tickets same day.

title: Great room. Great staff. Great location.
text: Yes it lived upto ratings. Great location near Times Square and Theater District. Room pretty large with big bathroom. Looked newly renovated. A bit noisy, but they provde earplugs and sound machine! Staff was exceptional. Price was very reasonable. Can't wait to go back.

title: My go to stay o. NYC
text: I have been staying here once or twice a tear for the past 10 years or so.  Location, price and amenities are second to none. Ricks Cafe, the hospitality room, is something you rarely see i the city. It’s the best kept secret in New York.

title: So happy to be back!
text: Returning to the Casablanca after a couple of years was very much like coming home.  All of the things from service to amenities that we loved are still going strong! The staff always greets you with a smile and are more than happy to help.  Keep up the awesome work!

title: Lovely boutique hotel
text: Right in the heart of the theater district, very convenient to everything we planned to do, with a parking garage right next door (which gives a discount to hotel guests).  Excellent staff, clean, nicely appointed room/bathroom, comfortable bed, and Rick's Cafe, which had snacks and refreshments available at all times.  We stayed in a Premium King and while not a huge room (but large by NYC standards), it was very comfortable for the two of us.  We were on the fifth floor just down the hall and around the corner from the elevator and it was very quiet.  There was ample closet space, a bistro table and chairs, large, comfortable bed, and the bathroom was bigger than I expected with a full tub/shower combo with pretty tiling.  There was even a lighted makeup mirror in the room, which I greatly appreciated, since most hotel bathrooms have terrible lighting for applying makeup.  The channel selection on the tv wasn't extensive, but we weren't in the city to watch tv, so that didn't matter much to us.  Rick's Cafe was a treat--a very nice, comfortable space to hang out at any time of day,  The staff, particularly Jeffrey, were all very friendly, kind and helpful.  One minor inconvenience was that the room didn't have an adjustable thermostat.  The room was overly warm when we arrived, and although a staff member adjusted the valve on the radiator, it didn't help much and we had to leave the bathroom window open to cool the room down.  Otherwise, the accommodation was perfect in just about every way.  I would definitely return.

title: home away from home!
text: Always a wonderful, comfortable stay at the Casablanca!  The minute their "always with a smile" doorman opens the door for you, you are special!  You are happily greeted by James, Stanley or another great staff member!   And when it is time to leave, the best part is you know you will be coming "home" again soon to the Casablanca.

title: Great location and service
text: The location is perfect! You can see Times Square, Broadway shows, shopping, Central Park and access to almost any subway line. The breakfast buffet is a great way to start the day. The wine and cheese reception in the afternoon is a great way to unwind, and meet others staying at the hotel. We met so many people who return again and again to this hotel because of the amenities. Housekeeping kept our room very neat and tidy. And the evening chocolate treat was sweet indeed! The front desk staff is knowledgeable about everything in NY. Their polite acknowledgement of each guest coming or going really made it homey.

title: A gem in Midtown
text: I would definitely recommend this gem located right in the heart of Midtown. Excellent customer service - they can't do enough for you. The location near Times Square can't be beat. And the room was clean and very nicely arranged.

title: Excellent Stay
text: We stayed here for a girls trip and loved everything about the hotel. The 24/7 snacks/coffee/etc and the free breakfast was a nice added bonus. The front desk staff was phenomenal and very welcoming. Proximity to Times Square was convenient and we had NO road noise in our room!

title: Casablanca Hotel
text: We had an excellent stay at the Casablanca Hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and quiet. The cleanliness and decor of the hotel was outstanding. You want for nothing when staying here.

title: Calm Oasis in a Crazy City
text: This was our 5th visit to the Casablanca . We were there to celebrate my 60th birthday with friends and family. From the moment we arrived the staff make you feel special and several thoughtful touches such as a chilled bottle of Prosecco in the room all add to the feeling of being a valued customer. The rooms are not large though are very comfortable and well furnished. The included breakfast and cheese and wine offered daily are superb and the staff that serve these are so friendly and welcoming. A recent addition to the rooms is a small refrigerator which we welcomed. The location of the hotel is brilliant as so close to Times Square just outside the door, however when you enter the hotel it just feels so calm and tranquil with fantastic soundproofing against the general noise in the area. This hotel knows what it wants to be ! If you are wanting an anonymous high tech trendy environment  this is not for you. If you want charming, friendly comfortable and excellent quality, don't hesitate and book ! We found this hotel a few years ago after many years of bed hopping around the city, we have finally found where we want to be when we visit New York.

title: Quiet Hotel
text: Great small hotel, very comfortable and really quiet.  You are in the middle of Time square and our room was completely quiet.  Nice Breakfast. Great lounge and happy hour.  Staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: NYC
text: Wonderful staff.  They were very accommodating and helpful.  Rick’s was a great space for breakfast and evening reception.  We also used this space to relax after a long day if sightseeing.  Rooms were well kept and comfortable.  Great location in Time Square.  We loved this hotel!

title: Great valentines getaway
text: We stayed at this hotel for a long valentines weekend. We choose Casablanca based on its location and reviews. We were not disappointed. The room was very clean and nicely furnished. The staff was exceptional, very friendly and helpful. Breakfast and wine and cheese after five included in room rate. We will look for other hotels in this group for future travels.

title: Great Hotel Near Times Square
text: Close enough to Times Square and subway but far enough away not to be bothered by the noise, etc. We stayed in the mini-suite with a king bed...perfect and plenty of room.  Staff was outstanding as was the breakfast and social hour each day! Highly recommended.

title: What a great find with outstanding service Sooo happy
text:
Booked with a large group for a girlfriends 50th birthday
The hotel went well above expectations.
We were a bit loud at times but they accomodated us extremely well.
I like that what they advertise they actually provide.
Front desk would assist with anything, bookings, recommendations, directions etc nothing was too much trouble.
We have srayed in NY before but I will now only stay here.
To be able to get  a free coffee at anytime throughout the day is great as most NY hotels gave no tea or coffee facilities in the room.
Free cheese and wine was a great place for us to meet and gave a pre dinner drink before hitting the town.
All the sraff were sooo helpful and friendly. One name that srands out  was Stanley
The location is a 1 min or less to times square.
You will hear the occasional police or ambulance sirens but you are in the heart of NY.
Beds really comfortable.
This place was so great I want to go back with another group and family
Best find on our 4 weeks stay 
Thankyou sooo much
You made a great 50th birthday a fabulous experience

title: My 50th celebrations
text:
Brilliant location, fantastic staff, warm and homely, drinks and nibbles a wonderful touch. 
Could not fault this place for how special they made me and my friends feel during a week long 50th birthday celebration.

title: Great location with incredible service and amenities.
text: This was a top-notch hotel!  The staff was very attentive and friendly. The hotel was very clean, with many amenities such as a wine and cheese reception from 5:00 - 8:00 and 24/7 coffee!   Rooms were comfortable and very clean.  The decor was beautiful!  I wish I could have stayed longer.

title: Un havre de paix en plein Times Square
text: Nous étions venus dans cet hôtel il y a neuf ans et y sommes retournés cette année, nous avons retrouvé cette même convivialité que nous avions tant appréciée ! La salle de petit déjeuner / apéro est fantastique avec la cheminée, les livres, les jeux et cette décoration savamment désuète et chaleureuse. Le personnel est particulièrement aimable. C’est une sorte de cocon douillet en plein Manhattan.

title: Just the way a hotel should be!
text: From the moment you walk into the Casablanca Hotel, you are greeted with a warm generous smile. Stanley and James were always on hand to assist our large group of friends, nothing was a problem. Brian coordinated our bookings. John was always around to ensure we were being looked after. Rooms are big enough. They are so quiet given Time Square is on your doorstep. The living space on level 2 was a relaxing, made better by wine and cheese every afternoon, coffee and pastries all day and the fresh continental breakfast was perfect. Thank you all!

title: Fantastic hotel in an awesome location
text: Fantastic in every way! Can not recommend highly enough. You are made to feel like one of the family from the moment you arrive. We were a large group & every need/request was met without hesitation. Staff went above & beyond. Special mention to Stanley, James, Brian & John. We can't wait to return.

title: Tres agréable !!!
text:
La terasse de nuit comme de jour offre un cadre unique à casablanca ! Idéal pour se rencontrer, discuter, inviter ou même le temps d'une lecture solitaire. Nouha est d'une délicatesse et d'un accueil merveilleux.
Je recommande sans hésiter.

title: Excelente opción!
text:
Hotel pequeño pero muy bueno. Esta bien ubicado a media cuadra de time square. La habitación limpia y cómoda, aunque pequeña. Sirven desayuno y tienen un cheese & wine super de de 5 a 8pm que incluye fruta que cae muy bien luego de regresar de los paseos.
La atención esmerada. Vale la pena.

title: Wonderful Birthday Weekend!
text: We went to NYC to see "Frozen the Musical" to celebrate my birthday and also my granddaughter's.  It was my daughter, 2 granddaughters and me.  We loved the Casablanca.  It was so clean and had great amenities! It is our new "Go TO" place to stay.  All of the staff are so nice.  Victor at the front desk was such a wonderful help and so sweet!  (Hey Victor-I hope you get to take your child to see Frozen).  Unfortunately, I can't remember his name but the doorman was adorable.  Always there with a smile, any help and to take pictures. The night staff and the lounge staff were wonderful too.  The wine and cheese, the cookies and the breakfast were all wonderful, plenty of everything.  We did have an issue with our toilet but the night staff had someone there in 10 minutes to fix it and they were so apologetic.  It was a wonderful experience and even my granddaughters felt special and had a blast!  Thank you all to the staff for their warm welcome.  We will be back.  PS we highly recommend Tony's DiNapoli right next door-there is a connecting door but definitely make reservations.  It was fabulous!

title: We like everything about the Casablanca
text: Great location for going uptown or downtown.  Quiet room.  Love the all day coffee/tea and cookies, the breakfast has everything most people would want, and the happy hour.  Room isin great shape as is the bathroom

title: Restaurant
text:
Hôtel merveilleusement jolie !
Le confort y est puis la protection de l'individu qui se rend dans ce lieu si beau . La visite est rassurante pour toute information complémentaire au sujet de ce lieu . C'est propre !

title: Great small hotel
text: Very convenient for trips to go to the theater. Easy to get everywhere by walking or subway.  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Rooms comfortable. but not huge. If you want to stretch out, go down to  the lounge on the second floor where they serve a continental breakfast, have snacks all day, 24 hour espresso/tea, TV, newspapers, daily Happy Hour.  People actually socialize there.  Beats the rat race at the big impersonal hotels. We stay there a couple times a year.  Check out the New Year's Eve Special. We went for that a few years ago and now we keep coming back for long weekends.

title: Great location, best possible NYC hotel experience
text: Our suite was roomy and very comfortable. Big closet, adequate drawer space, more easily accessed electrical outlets than anywhere, good beds. And a nice communal space on the second floor with free breakfast and snacks.

title: Nice hotel experience at Casablanca
text: We have been here several trips and the quality has been consistent.   Great location in heart of Time Square, thu Hotel has a homey vibe where you can relax and unwind with coffee, latte, etc. Nice breakfast and wine and cheese every day.  Comfortable and clean rooms.  Overall, a good value.

title: Great Location
text: We enjoyed this hotel so very much. The location was perfect, the staff friendly and accommodating, and the rooms comfortable. We enjoyed the breakfast . We will be visiting this hotel again! Thank you!

title: Love this Hotel
text: 2nd Time here. Will stay again!,,Everyone was friendly and helpful. Great location in Times Square. Room was super clean and comfortable. Love 2 nd floor with coffee and newspapers. Felt very safe. And next to Tony’s.

title: Thank you Casablanca!
text: We just returned from a wonderful weekend stay at Casablanca. It is our new favorite New York hotel. The staff was friendly and welcoming from the second we walked in until the moment we left. The breakfast and evening reception added to our enjoyment. The location was the so convenient. We will be back!

title: One night stay for an area conference
text:
Stayed with a group of individuals for a tradeshow that we were attending.  The room was a bit smaller than what I am accustomed to (but hey it's NYC... historical and space is at a premium!!) but the location and service could not be beaten. Located a very short walk to Times Square, we made the trip a few times. 

Great bar with food located next door.

The wine and cheese reception was fantastic and the complimentary breakfast the following morning was so appreciated rather than having to go out and find a restaurant before heading to our conference and it was definitely a great value add.

title: Gem of a Boutique Hotel
text: This is my new favorite place to stay in mid-town. Settle into your room, then walk to Bryant Park, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, attend the theatre, etc. Return for their lovely Happy Hour. Jefrey at the lobby door was especially considerate. James arranged for a special greeting and Stanley enabled us to get into our room early. Thank you to all staff.

title: Casablanca in NY
text: Excellent hotel and group! The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. We recommend this property and any of  the Library Hotel properties in NY or  elsewhere as they all share the same excellent service attitude - that you are family.

title: Heavenly Oasis!
text: Another magnificent, comfortable stay in this little slice of heaven in the big city! Warm, friendly, exemplary staff welcome you and cannot do enough to make your stay pleasurable! Rooms are cozy, immaculate and comfortable.  The amenities cannot be topped. Breakfast and wine reception are superb - a true bonus of the stay! Fresh delicious food with wonderful servers! Perfectly located, it is a true first class location in every way. Would never stay anywhere else!

title: my current favorite Manhattan hotel
text: OK, all hotels have pros and cons. But, the cons with this one are nits and the pros are exceptional. Great location, but minimal street noise. Well appointed rooms, bigger than most Manhattan hotels. Decent breakfast spread, even better evening wine and cheese reception. But, the real clincher here is the staff. The friendliest, most helpful hotel staff I have ever encountered.
