If you want to be near Times Square in a place that welcomes you and in which you feel at home, you can't beat the Casablanca Hotel.

title: Amazing stay!
text: Amazing first time stay at the Casablanca. Staff were so friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel was spotless. The 3hr wine and cheese every evening was just what we wanted after a busy day of sight seeing. We will definitely be returning!

title: Casablanca at its finest!!!!
text: Nothing but great things to say about this hotel.  The staff is amazing, pleasant and very helpful.  The rooms are cozy and quaint and extremely clean.  Ricks Cafe offers a nice breakfast and wine and cheese reception in evening.  This is perfect before heading out to dinner.  This was our second stay at The Casablanca and we can’t wait to go back!

title: Great find!  Would try any of the Library Hotels.
text: This was a wonderful hotel to stay in for my first trip to NYC. Being so close to Times Square, it was a convenient location for going to Broadway shows. I loved that they had the three hour wine and snacks. I made sure to have a couple drinks before going out to a show. The espresso bar was also amazing!  Was able to make a cappuccino and grab a bagel before heading out to explore the city for the day. I already have recommended this hotel since returning home two days ago.

title: Home away from home.
text: We love this hotel. It is our home away from home. Perfectly located in the center of the city, it’s a quiet little sanctuary nestled in the middle of all the hustle and bustle. We have thought about staying other places but no place gives you that comfortable feeling of staying with family like the Casablanca.

title: Best Hotel Experience Ever
text: What an amazing stay, while I love the hustle and bustle of the city I also enjoy somewhere to wind down. When you walk into this hotel it's like stepping into a new world, a quaint location where you can instantly relax from the city. The furnishes, decor, and amenities make it worth the stay but the staff puts this hotel over the top. They worked to no end to make sure you enjoyed the experience of staying there. This was truly an amazing hotel experience and where I will be staying anytime I come to the NYC.

title: The quietest, friendliest hotel in New York.
text: I think this might be my favorite hotel in New York. Super cozy. Rooms are classic and comfy. And the lounge, called Rick's Cafe, feels like a home away from home. The continental breakfast and the wine and cheese happy hours are cheery and generous. It's hard to believe you're around the corner from one of the world's most exciting theater districts. Staff is super friendly. Go.

title: Excellent value, quality, and service for the money
text: Super location. Quiet oasis, right near Times Square. Not super fancy, but super welcoming and comfortable. As others have said, staff were very friendly. Breakfast spread was good. Evening wine and cheese a nice touch. A great option for familys and folks who want quality but don't want to spend all their money on a hotel room.

title: Best Hôtel in New York
text: Nous avons adoré le Casablanca. Nous vous recommandons fortement cet Hotel 5*****. D'une propreté exceptionnelle vous serez charmé par le décor et le confort des lits. Le Directeur et les employés feront tous pour que vôtre vacances ce déroule en vrai 5*****. Le déjeuner est inclus et le 5 à 7 est SUPER.  L'an passé nous avons passé 4 jours avant notre croisière. Nous avons opté pour la mini suite et nous avons adoré. Nous serons de retour du 31 Janvier au 2 Février 2020... Nous avons très hâte de vous revoir... Marc,Serge et nos enfants Olivia et Angelina

title: Luogo perfetto per una vacanza perfetta ! Grazie!
text:
Tutto Perfetto!
Camera dotata di tutti i comfort e molto
Pulita, colazione abbondante e varia, personale gentile e sempre disponibile per qualunque richiesta, tutti sempre sorridenti ed attenti, posizione Top, al centro del Mondo e facilmente raggiungibili a piedi molti punti di interesse. Grazie per la meravigliosa vacanza.

title: Casablanca Hotel Stay
text: The hotel was now and the staff was very friendly.  I gave this an average review because I felt that the hotel was just that.  It was nice to have the second floor area to relax and hang out and the staff were outstanding.

title: Home Away From Home
text: Great hotel in a great location.  Superb staff who were professional, efficient and friendly.  Breakfast, refreshments and wine and cheese reception exceeded our expectations.  Room was spacious, as was the bathroom.  We will only stay at the Casablanca on future trips to NYC!

title: Gem just off Times Square
text: This is a homey, very friendly hotel just 100 feet from time square, and 43rd St. The second floor has a very large breakfast and wine area with fireplace multiple TVs and fabulous free breakfast New York Times And evening wine. It is decorated in the Casablanca O’Keefe.

title: Lovely little hotel close to Broadway, Times Square, shopping, and sightseeing!
text: Lovely, comfortable, clean room with a very nice bathroom.  Continental breakfast in Rick's cafe is the perfect way to start the day and the nightly happy hour is very nice.  The staff is so friendly and helpful.  And the location is great!

title: Great hotel but be careful of the health club
text:
This hotel is a little gem in the middle of a very busy area. It is kind of old-fashioned, in a nice way. The staff goes above and beyond to make you feel at home. Every person who works there is so nice and helpful and pleasant.

The room was nice. A little small, maybe. But the furnishings were lovely, especially the spacious tiled bathroom. The room was also surprisingly quiet, especially given the location of the hotel. 

The breakfast was great. The food was really good and there were a lot of choices. Away the room is set up, you end up talking to other guests (if you want to) and that is really fun. In the dining room, the staff was extremely helpful. For example, they went out back to find me a plain yogurt and then to heat up my oatmeal and bring it to me even though I think technically I was supposed to do it myself. They were just really nice.

I had a little issue with the New York Sports Club —access to it is one of the amenities that you get for your $25 resort fee —and I thought I should let other guests know about it. And overly aggressive member, who was sharing the lane with me, kicked my foot so hard that he literally broke my toe. I had to go the clinic and an X -ray confirmed this. Although I told the manager, Michele, in a phone conversation and a letter and sent her pictures, she never returned my phone calls nor indicated that she had addressed the situation. So I’m writing this in order to warn other people to be careful if they go to the health club. I do not think it is well-managed. And how it is managed stands in such stark contrast to the graciousness of the hotel that it is shocking. 

I do recommend that people stay at this lovely hotel. They could not of been nicer to me, getting me ice and so on and making sure that I was OK when I told them i was injured.

title: Great Location and an even BETTER staff*******
text: The staff was just fabulous, young, vibrant, social with never-ending smiles.  The location is perfect, steps from Time Square close to Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, City Library.  Not a five star hotel, but next time I'm in NYC I will stay again, the rooms were small but clean and the 2nd floor lounge open 24-7 was perfect to meet up with fellow travelers, good breakfast and afternoon wine/cheese.  Great value. Thank you to a world class staff.

title: New York weekend
text: Very nice hotel with a great location right off Times Square. the room was clean and comfortable.  Coffee and snacks were available all of the time, with wine and snacks in the late afternoon and nice breakfast in the morning.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: When you need quiet away from times square!!
text:
We love staying at the Casablanca! We have stayed here many times.

You're close enough of the hustle and bustle of times square and all of the Broadway shows but when you need a quiet time to re- generate you just head to the Casablanca!  

They provide a great Continental breakfast and wine and cheese at 5-8 which is just enough before the show!

Rooms are quiet and clean and the staff is very friendly!

title: Always Great!
text: My wife and I always stay at the Casablanca Hotel. Only one time in ten years for our birthdays we couldn’t stay because the hotel was booked. Never again! Quaint, comfortable, impeccable and delicious!

title: Old Charm and beauty, in the heart of New York
text: A beautiful hotel, aged beauty preserved perfectly. With its gorgeous lounge, cute little rooms with creaky floors it feels like going back in time, but with espresso and USB charging and wifi. From the moment you enter, the service is amazing in every respect, Welcoming, comforting and very attentive to your every need. A really lovely stay.

title: NY In NYC !!!
text:
The new year package that the hotel offer is worth every single cent! From the moment you arrive you are taken care of by all the fantastic staff. John the hotel manager sets this standard with his super friendly and helpful manner! 

The hotel is situated in the perfect location for the NY celebrations and exploring NYC plus the view of the the ball dropping is fantastic. 

We highly highly recommend this hotel. 

Thank you, we will definitely be returning! 

Steve & Sarah

title: Absolutely recommend!  Book here and you will not be sorry!
text: Stayed at the Casablanca for their New Year's Eve celebration 2019 to 2020 - an AMAZING experience!  John and his team are FANTASTIC!  Venue is beautiful and right in the heart of the city!  You will not be sorry!

title: WOW! New Year's Eve spectacular!
text: Returned to the Casablanca for the New Year's Eve package. Loved everything about it! All staff is attentive, professional, accommodating, and helpful in everyway.  They have a rooftop view of the ball dropping in Times Square! The package included dinner and a show at Tony's next door.  And New Year's day breakfast at Brooklyn Diner next door.  Everything was perfect. We will do it again! Book early as they sell out.

title: Wonderful experience for New Year’s Eve
text: This is a lovely old-fashioned boutique hotel, just steps from Times Square. Literally - maybe 20 steps. Diner on one side, Italian restaurant on the other. Walgreens a 3-4 minute walk. Rooms charming and although the bathroom was not expansive, it WAS roomy enough for comfort and was beautifully tiled with beautiful fixtures. Service was terrific at the Casablanca and we’d definitely go back to stay there again.

title: Home Away from Home
text: Thank you for your GREAT Hospitality‼️ We enjoyed every minute at your hotel. The staff and management made us feel like family. It is a close knit employee environment. Everyone there loved their jobs. Great Job. Keep up the great work.

title: Excellent Service, Room and Staff
text: Exceptional hotel.  Location is steps from Times Square. First night radiator made news, it was fixed promptly. Wonderful staff.  Boutique hotel that is big on service. Also very quiet rooms and very clean.

title: Once in a lifetime experience - HIGHLY recommend!!
text: I cannot say enough amazing things about this hotel! The staff is wonderful and makes you feel right at home. We booked the New Years Eve package and it far exceeded my expectations. The view of the ball drop on the rooftop is spectacular and they even took us down past the barricades for a few minutes to be right in front of it. Definitely a once in a lifetime experience that I would love to do again. The food from the restaurant Tony's connected to the restaurant is wonderful as well. A special thank you to the GM of the hotel John, he is one of the kindest people I have ever met. You can tell he takes care of his staff and truly cares about them and the hotel guests.

title: Best hidden gem in NYC
text: A small boutique hotel where nothing is too much trouble.  We wouldn’t stay anywhere else in NY. Perfect location, very comfortable, fantastic staff and a wonderful hands-on manager who makes it all work.

title: New Years Eve in New York City at Casablanca was amazing
text: The hotel is a gem in the middle of Times Square.  The staff, room, amenities, etc were over the top perfect.   This was my first trip to NY and the hotel was great.   We had help with near by restaurants, how to get around on the subway and a wonderful New Years Eve party.   Being able to go down on the street to see all of the people and fun without having to stand out there all day was well worth everything.  We had a very quiet room and you would never know you were in the middle of the city inside the hotel.   Cheers!  We will be back!

title: Great place for New Year's Eve
text: We absolutely loved this hotel, and specially booked it for the New Year Ball drop view. The hotel takes care of everything for its guests. The check in was easy and all the staff are friendly and so helpful. Special shout out to Julian and Johan who never failed to answer our questions with a smile. The room was really quiet and all amenities were provided. The New Year Eve party was well organized and all guests were treated to free wine, cocktails and food! The pass they give out are so good as we got to view the ball drop really close. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Home Away From Home
text: This was our second stay at the Casablanca. We live the homey feeling of the lounge area and the snacks available all day long! The wine and cheese reception in the evening is great as is the location of the hotel. Just steps from Times Square but you don’t hear street traffic in the rooms. The staff is very friendly and helpful as well!

title: Excellent View of New Years Eve Ball Drop and accommodations!!!
text: If you are looking for a great place to stay while visiting Times Squares and in particular to view the Ball Drop directly with unhindered view, Casablanca on 43rd Street is an excellent place. ....Very friendly staff, very quiet rooms, (interior facing rooms are great), very clean, excellent continental breakfast, conveniently located. Just a super hotel and just as good as advertised. Their New Year’s Eve event was well organized and super fun. Attending it enables you to avoid the long wait in the big crowds and an up close view of the Ball drop. Thanks to all of the folks working at the Casablanca for a great experience!!!

title: OUR NYC HOTEL!!
text:
This was our third time in this lovely, friendly oasis of calm literally just off of Times Square.   We were greeted upon check in with warmth you only get from the staff at the hotel.   "Welcome back" as soon as we walked through the door.  Also would like to mention James too gave us a great reception when we met later that day.   You just don't get this service at the big hotels.  Our room was  warm and and always had everything you need from the bottles of water to the lovely toiletries and slippers.  Our bathroom was nice size and we had fresh fluffy towels every day.   Very comfortable bed.  Great housekeeping.

The hotel offers continental breakfast which was more than adequate and tea and coffee are served 24 hours in Ricks Cafe which also is a lovely touch but how can you beat the cheese and wine hours????  Lovely touch `as always and a great time to chat and meet people you probably wouldn't normally.

Tony's adjoining the hotel is a  fabulous place to eat and you don't have to take your coat! They have a connecting door.    Be sure to make a reservation otherwise prepared to bee disappointed or have a few hours wait.  The hotel can reserve for you too.

If you want a flash "corporate"hotel then The Casablanca isnt for you but we love this hotel and to be honest while they are doing what they do best this is only our choice when visiting NYC - no question.

Thank you to everyone at The Casablanca - hopefully see you very soon.

title: Excellent hotel especially to watch the ball drop on NYE
text: It is relatively close to subways. The wine and snacks from 5:00 until 8:00 were nice.  Whatever you need the staff is willing to help in any way they can. Location is great to get to the museums or theatres in town.

title: Great Place with the Best Location
text: I love this hotel.  I have stayed at 3 hotels in New York and this by far has been the best.  It's right on Times Square. The staff is excellent.  They have a delicious breakfast and happy hour daily.  It's clean and quaint.

title: Excellent Boutique Hotel
text: The staff is very genuine & attentive. Love the 2nd floor cafe & common area. Very nice extended continental breakfast & happy hour. We celebrated Christmas there & the staff was ever so kind.  There were several guests who had been coming for Christmas year over year. Loyal client base.

title: Brilliant!
text: Our party of four stayed here for 5 nights. The location is brilliant. The staff are super friendly. The rooms and beds are very comfortable. It was lovely to have access to Rick’s cafe. The breakfast is good with plenty of fresh fruit and  coffee and drinks available all day. The evening cheese and wine was a lovely opportunity to meet others. As well as cheese there was crudités, olives and fruit on offer. Having breakfast and some fruit/veg snacks in the evening brought a great balance to the bad eating habits that can take over holidays. We will definitely return.

title: Home away from home, but ...
text:
We are repeated guests at lovely Casablanca hotel, it has become over the years our favorite “home” in NYC .
From the  very moment you town car stops in front of the hotel entrance ...you know you are back home. From bellman,to reception and concierge everyone is happy to welcome you!!  Such wonderful people!!
Rick’s lounge is awaiting with cookies and hot/cold beverages all day long,the “Cheese and wine” hours is the gathering spot for the elegant guests of the house.
Breakfast is my “important” meal and Casablanca never disappoints: one of the cheerful ladies, Hunda (?) from  Casablanca (the real city), took such a wonderful care of my needs that ...I did not want to leave NY !!
What a wonderful staff and service!!
Only a small CAVEAT : for the first time ever, this year we stayed  at Casablanca  in December, COLD season, weather below 0C (32F)  To our dismay,our deluxe room was cold   :(      Someone promptly came in and tried to fix the heating unit;several hours later ...room was still cold. We called Concierge and, again, very promptly, the same bellman arrived and VERY KINDLY offered/ installed in the bedroom a small EFFECTIVE electric heater. He explained that …    :] weather wasn’t cold enough  to turn  the central heating system on!!!   :]   :]    Hum,this to me sounds at least  ...naif.
Is this a wonderful hotel? Yes,for sure.
Would I return in Winter time ?  Probably not.

title: Every once in a while one is fortunate to find a gem that it self becomes one of the best attraction of ones trip.
text:
If one could dream of a quaint hotel that is perfectly located with staff that treats you like friends and are willing to provide one with the attention that makes it feel like home. 
Casablanca has it all and there is no place better place to stay when visiting Manhattan.

title: Mixed
text: The people are awesome. You are right on 43 and broadway but there is NO noise in your room at all. There is no room service. There is no room thermostat. You have to use a radiator control. When you open the door the door hits a chair. I would stay again.

title: We LOVED this hotel!!!!
text: Perfect location, super friendly and accommodating staff, luxurious rooms and complimentary breakfast and happy hour! Casablanca Hotel is an outstanding hotel b in the heart of Times Square. This is the best deal ever.

title: A quiet, charming hotel in Times Square
text: Once you are inside, this hotel is a great respite from the hustle bustle of Times Square.  It is so convenient, the staff is great, the rooms beautiful and the lounge area is so lovely.  It is so nice to stop by and have some coffee, a cookie (or two) in the middle of the day.

title: Excellent
text: We love to stay at the Casablanca.  It is in the heart of Times Square, but is a quiet respite away from the crowds.  Rooms are small but cozy.  Staff are always more than accommodating.  Would highly recommend.

title: Play It Again
text: We love the Casablanca Hotel. It is our first choice when staying in Manhattan. The staff are incredibly friendly. The breakfast buffet, afternoon tea, and open service are not only delicious, but the lounge where they are served is a great place to meet other guests.

title: A hidden gem in New York City
text: We recently travelled to New York in December and stayed in the Casablanca. Unlike large chain hotels, this hotel chain is friendly and personable with the staff wanting to share places to see, visit and some tricks of the city. The hotel room we had was spacious and contained all that you would need on a 3/4 day city break.The 5pm-7pm cheese and wine evening time was very welcome, after a day of walking the city, allowing you to relax and chill. The breakfast did not have a cooked option, but there was enough choice for many diets. The location was very good, just off Time Square. After reading a few reviews on Trip Advisor, we plugged for this hotel. But I would re-emphasise that you are staying in a city, with all the noises that a major city creates, police sirens, fire engines and honking of horns, even at 3am in the morning! The double glazed windows can only shut out so much noise! This is not a criticism, just something to be aware of when booking the hotel. The trade off is being able to walk pretty much everywhere in Mid-Town New York City! Being a special birthday for one of the party, the hotel provided a complimentary bottle of wine in the room, which was a lovely treat. I would thoroughly reccomend this hotel and go back again.

title: Jewel of NYC
text: If the fact that it is practically in Times Square  doesn’t sway you, then the coziest and the brilliant and caring staff should. We stay here 3 or 4 times a year when in NYC and John, the general manager and his staff always welcome us with open arms. It is truly home away from home.

title: Ditto
text:
I can only reiterate all the other reviews and say this is a fantastic little hotel.
The staff will do anything for you. 
The beds are comfy. The rooms clean. The decor pleasant.
An oasis of calm in the madness of Times Square.

title: Another great stay at The Casablanca
text:
This is our 5th stay here .Great location for theater and Times Square. Top notch service.
Good continental breakfast and wine and cheese in the evenings. Small and quiet oasis steps away from Times Square.

title: Home away from home
text: We love NY during the holidays and always stay at the Casablanca.  Friendly staff who we appreciate as they always make sure you feel at home.  Lovely breakfast and cocktail hour; we enjoy Ric's for the casual atmosphere and have met wonderful people who gather together and share tips of what to see and do in NY.  Rooms are always spotless and quiet even though Time Square is right around the corner.

title: A Hidden Gem
text: Such a fabulous welcome and a beautiful clean and stylish hotel - the staff are amazing and so friendly - decor is full of character and having the Ricks Cafe on site for complimentary tea coffee cookies and cakes 24-7 is a great extra - 2 minutes from Times Square but the hotel offers a calm cosy feel away from the crowds and business of the centre - Tony’s restaurant is adjacent and offers a super vibe and amazing food. Our room was a suite on the 5th floor and was very spacious with a large wardrobe area sofa and iron and ironing board - a mini fridge and very comfy bed - I would go back to stay at Casablanca anytime I visited New York in the future and would recommend to anyone looking for something unique and special but want to be close to everything. We walked uptown and downtown with ease as the location is right in the middle of everything.

title: A Hidden Gem
text: A Hidden Gem in the middle of Times Square!  Great hotel and staff !  Loved the snacks and coffees!  I would recommend this hotel  the hotel was very clean and comfortable.  The staff was extremely accommodating!     This is a wonderful hotel.  Do yourself a favor and stay at the Casablanca Hotel.  Wonderful Breakfast!

title: Your private club steps from Times Square
text: The location of this hotel is great for those exploring midtown Manhattan by foot or wanting to take in the many theatres in the area.  The second floor is a lounge where breakfast, an extended happy hour with wine and cheese, and coffee and treats throughout the day are available. The lounge feels like a living room and it encourages guests to mingle.

title: New York Break
text: Recent stay in New York, did not know this hotel before we arrived but were very pleased. Room was comfortable and clean, Hotel is clean, has character, staff really friendly, all day tea and coffee and nibbles all included. Central location for Times Square if that is your thing, although walking distance to most of the main attractions. If using Taxi to arrive recommend Newark rather than JFK if you can, t that is a New York thing.

title: Home in the Heart of Times Square
text: The service was impeccable, from when we first crossed the threshold, tired and weary from our flight and long ride from JFK, to the early morning farewell back home.  Everyone was friendly, helpful, yet professional and efficient!  The front desk staff was amazing with suggestions of where to eat, best transportation options, and things to not miss.  Victor was especially stellar.  I hope our travel plans take us back to NYC so we get to stay @ Casablance.  Thank you for your wonderful boutique hotel.

title: Great experience
text: Friendly courteous staff, starting with the front desk and the manager. The girls in Rick's Café are courteous and work hard to please the guest. Great location in midtown for business or pleasure. Very convenient to the theaters if you plan on attending in plays, you are within walking distance of all the theaters. We will definitely be back.

title: Fabulous Thanksgiving Stay!
text: Great location & staff was very helpful!!  Our family of 5 really enjoyed our stay.  We would definitely stay here again & recommend to friends!  Rick's cafe was a great place to relax.  Let the hotel schedule your car service if you've got more than 4 people coming & going from the airport...worth the $$.

title: Amazing Hotel!
text: Exceptional Hotel with Awesome staff. From check in to check out this hotel is by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in when it comes to customer service. You really feel like family when you are there. Highly recommend this hotel when visiting the City.

title: The best of NYC!
text: Just a great location to Broadway, sites and food.  Great suggestions and tips from the hotel staff.  Can't beat the breakfast to get the day started, and the happy hour before a show or evening event! Will be back!

title: Awesome Place!
text: John and staff were very accommodating and made us feel special. Great Time Square location book this hotel you won’t regret it! We will definitely book this hotel next time we visit The Big Apple! Great place for NYE rooftop party to watch the ball drop!

title: A relatively small but amazing hotel
text:
What a brilliant hotel this was.   ALL the staff were so helpful & friendly and went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable.
There are only 42 rooms but they have all the amenities.   Ours was a good size and had 2 queen sized beds in it.   There was plenty of storage space and complimentary bottles of water provided daily.   The bathroom was well stocked with shampoo, conditioner & shower gel.
A comfortable & cosy lounge is available where a continental breakfast is served (this was included in our price) although should you fancy something a bit more substantial there is a diner within yards of the hotel.   Between 5pm - 8pm complimentary wine & cheese is offered and if you prefer to 'eat in' you can order from the restaurant attached to the hotel - Tony's Di Napoli.   There is a  huge range of different choices on the menu and the food is excellent (you don't even need to enter outside to get to it), booking is strongly recommended.
The hotel is in easy walking distance of Times Square and other eateries.
Would definitely recommend this hotel and very much look forward to staying there again at some point.

title: Excellent accommodation - one issue - rooms noisy
text: I would have rated this hotel a 5 - except for the issue of room noise. The staff were wonderful, friendly and helpful. The room was a good size. Comfortable bed. Excellent location in the heart of the city. The casual lounge on the first floor is a real bonus - felt more like home than being in a hotel. Happy Hour wine and cheese is a nice touch. Really a great experience. Only issue was room noise -  mainly from people walking in the hallway. We were next to the lift as well and that could be heard when everything else was quiet. For light sleepers like me the noise was an issue. I’m a bit torn though as everything else was so good that I’d consider going back here again - but try to get a room away from the lifts.

title: a real gem
text: Location was our initial reason for staying at the Casablanca. However it is the staff and service that will bring us back. Thanks to all for making us feel so welcomed and special. We will be staying here on our next trip to NYC.

title: Great NYC Hotel
text: Your welcome back to the hotel after you check out so don't hesitate to have them hold your luggage and then come back through out the day and visit their lounge if you want a break. Coffee, water and cookies are always there as are clean rest rooms. There's also a parking garage right next door that offers a discount if staying in the hotel.

title: Casablanca consistently great
text: We were impressed with our previous stay at the Casablanca, so we decided to return. A few years later, and the Casablanca continues to deliver. Staff are still fantastic, and the accommodations are still comfortable and cozy. It’s amazing how quiet it can be just a few yards from the craziness that is a Times Square.  Will return if the opportunity presents itself.

title: Family trip to NYC
text: CasaBlanc is very convenient to Time Square.  Rooms are nice.  2nd Lounge with afternoon wine, cheese & breakfast bagels, juice, fruit & coffee was awesome.  Staff is very friendly & helpful.  We will definitely be back.

title: THERE ARE MANY BETTER CHOICES - (BE  FORE-WARNED)
text: Just returned from the Casablanca - booked a 3-night stay mos ago at 5-star Hotel Rates (nearly $600 per night incl taxes & fees).  Bed was comfortable & Room was clean - but, it was located right on the street side of the hotel (43rd St.) - first 2 nights had quite a bit of noise (trucks & traffic from the street) but, we shrugged our shoulders and chalked this up to staying in the "City that Never Sleeps" -  the 3rd night, however, they were doing some type of street (or sidewalk) construction and there was a jack-hammer pounding & pounding & pounding until right around 2:00AM - theyre must not be any insulation in the walls because it sounded like the guy with the jack-hammer was standing right next to the bed. Getting ANY sleep at all was, quite honestly, an impossibility.  I spoke to a Manager in the morning after getting approx 4 to 4-1/2 hrs of rest and expressed my disappointment. He told me that he "had no control" over what the city had going-on outside in the way of construction, etc.  I told him that I certainly DID understand this. However, when I booked this stay and pre-paid at the rate of a 5-star Hotel, I expected that (at a minimum) I would be able to get a decent night's sleep.  I suggested that they should either "Comp" the 3rd night or at least discount it by  50% because it is ridiculous to have a jack-hammer going until 2AM right outside the bedroom window.  He told me that he checked with the GM and they (in so many words) were "sorry" but simply "unwilling" to do anything to alleviate the problem.  This is NOT a large Hotel - the location is quite good - BUT at least 1/3 (maybe even 1/2) of the rooms are right on the 43rd Street side of the building and they do NOT appear to have taken any steps to try to Quiet the Noise - if you want to a Hotel where you can get a decent night's sleep.   There are... MANY BETTER CHOICES

title: COULD NOT BE BETTER
text: Great experience. Stayed here many times. Would not stay anywhere else when in New York. The staff make you feel special. So nice to stop in Rick’s place after a day of shopping or sightseeing for a cup of coffee or a cookie.

title: Highly Recommended for a Relaxing Holiday
text: This is the first time my daughter and I visited New York - and the Casablanca was icing on the cake! The Hotel has so much character and feels more like a private home.  The amazing staff makes you feel right at home!  Am definitely going back!  Thank you for making this mother/daughter trip a memorable one.

title: Absolutely fabulous
text: Absolutely fabulous trip to New York and Casablanca hotel most certainly help with its hospitality comfort  and location. The staff at the Casablanca where very helpful and very accommodating in fact I enjoyed my stay so much I book while I was there, for next year it is fantastic value for money. I would and will recommend this hotel to people.

title: Business ~ Holiday
text:
Full house in NYC.   We were stuck” at LeMeridien for one night and were fortunate in getting a room here for the weekend.   Guests are embraced by an immediate ease and impeccable service!
This is truly an experience exclusively offered at Casablanca.   The calm space, Lovely concierge set-up, immaculate room and professional staff speak to every component ~ every delightful moment.

Our NYC Holiday visit is perfectly complimented by our visit ~ stay at Casablanca.

Will highly recommend again & again.

A “Gem” ....

title: Eldre Hotel med svært god beliggenhet
text: Hotellet ligger svært godt til i New York med gangavstand til flere fasiliteter som bl.a Broadway. Vi ble tatt godt i mot av effektiv betjening. Det var en svært enkel og simpel frokost som var inkludert og få bord.

title: タイムズスクウェアの近く
text: タイムズスクウェアから近いですが、ホテルに一歩入れば、とても静かで快適に過ごせました。コーヒー2Fのラウンジでは24時間コーヒーなどが飲めます。カップに入れて外出するのに何度も利用しました。17時から20時まではワインとチーズの提供もあり、非常に便利でした。海外の方が多く寛いでいらっしゃしました。バスタブがあったのも冬場のニューヨークでは非常に助かりました。

title: Thanksgiving Weekend
text: Always a great experience at the Casablanca Hotel! The level of service is beyond amazing! We have stayed here many times and we are NEVER disappointed! The breakfast and cocktail hour (5 pm-8pm)is included with every stay which is a huge plus.

title: Perfect location
text: Outstanding service, with personell that is always very friendly. Perfect location close to Time Square. Everything is in walking distance. We enjoyed the cheese and wine service a lot. It is a perfect Arrangement to relax after some hours in Manhattan.

title: A Sweet Suite
text: My friend and I travel to NYC the day after Thanksgiving for two nights with our granddaughters. We love staying at the mini suite at the Casablanca! We enjoy all the wonderful treats at Rick's Cafe as well as the delicious breakfast! So convenient to Times Square and all the amazing sights! Also convenient to the wonderful theatre district!

title: Fabulous Casablanca
text: A Hidden Gem I Love Casablanca. Always a warm welcome Casablanca is just off Time Square - You’d never believe it as it’s so quiet. Rooms are cosy clean and the beds are so comfortable. Breakfast a good choice and the wine and cheese reception every evening is very good. Staff are excellent, so helpful - Highly Recommend

title: Charming Boutique NY Hotel
text: We selected this hotel based on other reviewer’s recommendations and were not disappointed. The location couldn’t be better - just a few steps to Times Square, theaters and great restaurants. Our room was not large, but thankfully quiet as we did not have a street facing room. The bed was comfortable and had a surprisingly warm duvet. Fortunately, the bathroom had a window we could crack at night so we didn’t have to run the a/c to cool the room down and we could enjoy the duvet.  Rick’s Cafe on the second floor is a pleasant location for breakfast and complimentary wine and cheese in the evening. There is a small outside seating area that would be enjoyable if the weather is nice. All the employees, from the reception desk to the attendants in Rick’s Cafe, were so friendly and helpful, something you don’t find in the bigger hotels too often. We highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when in NYC.

title: Fantasy Realized!
text: We found this unique, boutique hotel right in the heart of Times Square and within walking distance to all the theaters!!  From the moment we stepped out of the taxi we were greeted by a charming valet and discovered that we had been upgraded to a suite for only $50.  Next discovery was Rick's Cafe on the 2nd floor and the decor was perfect! Finally, there was a bottle of wine and a Happy Anniversary note on the table in the living room.  The restaurant next door is like being in a Woody Allen movie as it is "pitch perfect" New York City!!

title: H
text: We went to New York for me to run the marathon, we chose the Casablanca for its central location, and stayed for 5 nights and I am so glad we chose this hotel, it was lovely from start to finish. It is situated right on Times Square, but once you are inside you could be in the middle of nowhere, it is so peaceful and relaxing, the quirky Moroccan decor adds to the ambiance and tranquility, the decor might not be to everyone’s taste but it really adds to the whole experience. The staff are friendly and attentive without being intrusive, they are extremely helpful nothing is too much trouble. The afternoon cheese and wine is definitely not to be missed, an excellent selection of good quality cheeses etc. and wines available at your leisure for 3 hours, we stayed in one evening, we were exhausted , and just enjoyed the relaxing lounge with cheese and wine. Our room was compact but very comfortable, and clean , plenty of room for clothes etc. with a good size bathroom and a great shower. Tony’s restaurant is adjacent to the hotel, accessible by a door from reception, a great authentic New York restaurant and bar, the food and atmosphere was just incredible, you really need to try it at least once, you do need to book well in advance. The Casablanca is not the cheapest hotel in New York, but it’s location makes up for this, we didn’t have to have a cab to see all the sights, we only had one to go to the world observatory. Breakfast is a self serve cold buffet, all freshly prepared and replenished regularly. A hotel well worth the money, great location and attentive staff.

title: The Best in NYC
text: Best boutique hotel in NYC. Best location if you desire midtown Times Square. We've stayed here 3 times in last 4 years. From moment a staff member opens front door for you, to free water bottles, and the amazing 2nd floor retreat that is an oasis  removing you from the noise and hassle of Times Square. Rooms are tiny but spotless. Hey we ain't in NYC to hang out in our room. Bathrooms are spotless and have everything you need. And did I mention the staff? They always smile always help always friendly they'll do anything. Raining? They have free water bottles. Nothing in NYC is ever free, but here it is. Need an extra pillow? They deliver two to your room within 5 minutes. Free coffee lattes espresso snacks in 2nd floor lounge. And free wine and cheese every early evening. Piano player nights on weekends.

title: Stay there again, Sam
text: This hotel offers value for money, a cosy and friendly atmosphere, conveniently located near Times Square and theatre district. The lounge where coffee and biscuits are served 24/7 and their cheese and wine offering in late afternoon/early evening is an additional and much appreciated "goodie". Highly recommended - which also applies to the adjacent restaurant, Tony's di Napoli

title: My NYC go to!!!
text: Location, Location, Location and the best service and amenities! Walk to many of the key NYC spots yet the hotel feels quaint and private. The beds are comfortable; the service from door to desk to the room is served up with a smile and always helpful. Last but definitely not least the INCLUDED breakfast and happy hour. Always a nice retreat making this hotel an excellent value. I wouldn’t stay anywhere else!

title: Perfect stay
text: Went to NYC for a few days early birthday present, the location of the Hotel makes everything easy plus there are so many opinions so close (it rained one night and we only had to stop out of the front door for food) The beds are so comfy I think I slept better than I do at home

title: 安全
text: タイムススクエアーから１分。ミュージカル劇場からも３分で帰れます。ラウンジは２４時間開いていますが、朝食は改善の余地あります。

title: I’m in love.
text:
I’m in NYC for a conference and, as I brought my husband, I wanted to stay somewhere special.  Paying just a little bit more than we normally pay, I am in hotel heaven.  In addition to a very pretty and comfortable room—and a good-sized bathroom with comfy terry cloth robes!!!—there is a 5 pm “happy hour” in an absolutely lovely room with fireplace, with very good coffee, fruit, cheese, crudités, wine, and so forth.  The guy at the front door greeted me so nicely—he knew who my husband was (he arrived a bit earlier) and told me what room to go to.  Plus, Tony DiNipoli’s restaurant is right next door and you can get half dishes at the bar, instead of the huge family style servings advertised in its website, at the barn which are
delicious.  I’m so happy!!!!

title: Great location. Highly recommend.
text: Two couples stayed in a 2 queen bed room. Plenty of space. 2nd floor seemed to have beverages / snack all hours. Right at Time Square. Great location if coming for a show. Hotel has many amenities and comps. We've already booked the New Year's package. Stay tuned for the review.

title: Truly an oasis
text: In the middle of Times Square, this gem of a property is delightful. You step into this hotel and feel at home immediately.  There are some 40+ rooms so it is small but special. Rear rooms are quieter.

title: Nice hotel but stay in the back ...front rooms are noisy even with white noise machine. The plus to that is that you are
text: Nice room very clean but chose a back room ...front rooms are noisy even with white noise machine everyone very friendly hotel is in the middle of the action Times Square & theater district one block away

title: An oasis in the centre of the city
text:
Hotel Casablanca is a brilliant hotel. Centrally located and only about 30 yards from Times Square. It has a Moroccan and Casablanca film theme reflected in the decor and furnishings. Breakfast is served in Rick’s Cafe and there is coffee and Danish available 24/7. It provides a comfortable place to relax after a busy day exploring the city and before going out in the evening.
I was surprised at how quiet the room was bearing in mind the location. I heard no sirens or city noise during my 4 night stay. The room was comfortable and provided all facilities for a city stay. 
The staff are friendly, welcoming and helpful. I’ve stayed in other larger hotels in New York but often found these to be impersonal. I will be returning to the Casablanca Hotel because it isn’t like that. I liked the atmosphere and the level of kind professional service that I received. Problems were resolved immediately and a car transfer service back to the airport was arranged quickly and proved to be very good indeed.

title: Great Hotel
text:
We arrived here having been staying in Las Vegas for a few nights in a hotel where the room was so large you could have held a party in it. So when we arrived at the Casablanca my first impression was “ this is a small room!”
However any concerns were soon swiftly set aside.
Our room was lovely and quiet, very comfortable bed with a more than adequate bathroom.
Delicious breakfast in Ricks cafe which was open all day also for coffees, teas and cookies. 
Complimentary wine and cheese evenings every night again in Ricks Cafe where we met and chatted with several other travelers  and found many had stayed in the hotel before.
All the staff at the hotel are helpful, courteous and friendly.
This may not be a brand spanking new hotel in NYC but if I have another chance of revisiting the city I’d happily book this hotel again.

title: Very good !!
text:
This place was ideal for our needs. The room was a standard size but very quiet and comfortable. The hotel is around the corner from crazy Times Square but if you want to visit broadway it is perfect. It was unusually cold when we were there so to only have a couple of blocks to the main theatre area was great
The breakfast was the same every day. A small buffet with fresh fruit, cereals, pastries and boiled eggs. The snacks available during the day and the evening drinks were a real bonus. Not only you have a selection of drinks and snacks but it encourages mixing among the guests
The staff were all helpful and friendly

title: Very satisfied 10/10
text: From the moment we arrived we were looked after, our room was lovely and in a very quiet location even though we were situated right on time square.Evening cheese and wine etc was superb (never missed it) and breakfast was also spot on in fact the stay felt like we were on full board.

title: Casablance Times Square
text: The Casablanca Hotel is situated steps away from Times Square - convenient to the subway and all the  area has to offer.  Parking garage is right next door, and the Casablanca rate beats anything you can find in the area.  Staff was very welcoming, and was responsive to any requests we had.  Breakfast in the morning consisted of hot/cold cereals, bagels and pastries, boiled eggs, yogurt, and was enough to get you ready to explore NYC.  The evening reception was also a nice added touch.  Would definitely stay here again the next time we visit NYC.

title: Best location in NYC
text: I have just stayed at the Casablanca Hotel for the second time in two years.  It is an older building with some of the lovable quirks that go with it, but it’s in a fabulous location just steps away from Times Square and many subway options.  I found the breakfast and wine/cheese in Rick’s Cafe to be very handy and having Tony’s Di Napoli next door is great too.  All the staff are friendly and helpful. If I return to NYC I wouldn’t consider any other hotel, but next time I will definitely request one of the rooms away from the street.

title: Cozy place in a crazy city
text: This hotel is very near Times Square, but is quiet, calm, and comforting inside. The beds are very comfortable, all the rooms (private and public) are stylish, and the whole place feels very very safe. Complimentary extras like coffee available 24 hours a day (great for me because I wake up very early), the many breakfast offerings, and the  very relaxing wine and cheese hours make it possible to experience the crazy city and then unwind afterwards

title: Great Hotel!
text: Close to perfect! Very noisy due to construction, cleanliness needs to be improved (the pillows smelled like sweat), breakfast needs more variety (i.e. - gluten free, lactose free milk, etc.) But besides these minor issues, it was perfect!

title: Great location and service
text: This hotel is in a great location with discounted parking right next door.  Service attentive and accommodating.  Room was fine if alittle tired.  Bed not very comfortable but after first night they provided us with egg crate which was helpful.

title: Excellent small hotel
text: My wife and I were in Manhattan for her Birthday to see a show. We had previously stayed at one of the other Library hotels in Manhattan and really liked it. We drove in from New Jersey during the afternoon on Friday. I like to be able to valet park my car so we don't have to look for a parking garage. I was informed that they did not offer valet parking but there was a lot right next door and they provide a voucher that allows you to park 24 hours $ 30.00. This was better than valet parking ! Since it was literally right next door. The hotel is what we usually look for when traveling to Europe, small, clean quiet and comfortable with friendly and accommodating people. My wife and I were very happy and enjoyed ourselves on the first leg of our weekend Birthday trip into Manhattan. The Casablanca made that possible. The only thing that I would suggest is that the air conditioning units get removed from the windows when the weather changes or find a way to seal them better. Although it was comfortable to sleep it was cold in the room. This did not in any way spoil our stay.

title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel
text: There are so many reasons that my friends and I stay at the Casablanca on our yearly Fall trips to NYC ... from the wine and cheese reception each evening to the complimentary breakfast.  The hotel staff are professional and friendly, always checking to make sure our stay is top-notch.  Can't beat the location, just a quick walk to Times Square and the theaters.  We are so happy we discovered this gem several years ago and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in NYC.  Thank you Casablanca ... until next year!

title: Gaslight era gem
text: This small hotel built in the early 1890s is a half block from the corner of 43rd & Broadway, and within EASY walking distance of several theaters, including the New Amsterdam and The Lyric. Ditto for Madame Tussaud's Wax Museum, which is worth seeing. My room was small, but well appointed, with a very new, modern, clean bathroom. My only complaint with the latter was that the pedestal sink left little room for toiletries. My room bordered onto 43rd Street, and, "being in the city which never sleeps," it was noisy. I would recommend a traveler request an interior room. The hotel staff was uniformly friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was served in a very comfy room on the second floor.

title: Great location
text: Great location, professional and friendly staff, fun themed hotel. Easy walk to theaters, Bryant Park, Radio City Music Hall. Hotel is in excellent condition which is true for all Library brand hotels.

title: Great Hotel
text: We stayed over after seeing a show.  The hotel is in a great location.  The staff was very friendly.  There is a cafe in the hotel that always has snacks, drinks and a happy hour, all free!.  Our room was on the 5th floor. I didn't like the elevator, it was small and shaky.  If I stay again I will ask for a lower floor and take the stairs.  Our room was clean and the bed was pretty comfortable.   I would definitely stay again.

title: Love this hotel!
text: This is such a great hotel. The location can’t be beat. The wine and cheese each night is fabulous. A great place to warm up, right by the fire, enjoying some wine, after a chilly day of sightseeing. Impeccable service, as always!

title: Wow wow and just wow😬
text:
Our stay was amazing from start to finish, all the staff were so friendly, helpful and professional. No query or request was too small or too big for them.  We had a family suite and it was large and spacious with the most comfortable mattress topper in the world. It was steps away from Times Square but you can’t hear any noise whatsoever. We used Rick’s cafe which is definitely a fantastic idea from the hotel' the unlimited drinks and snacks were so lush and well worth the fee.
I can’t wait to come back.

title: Fabulous experience
text: A pretty perfect stay. The staff were great — excellent location— comfy rooms and beds. Even the other guests were nice! Breakfast and evening wine were just right — nice, small hotel. Everything was pretty perfect.

title: Times Square oasis
text: A really wonderful hotel, friendly welcoming staff, very clean, comfortable beds and room. Fantastic breakfast facilities, comfortable lounge area. Complimentary wine & snacks every evening, top class! Right beside Times Square so very central to all the attractions of this wonderful city. Really enjoyed our stay here and would love to return some time and would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Excellent
text: Great location, quiet but 1 minute from Times Square. Clean, everything we needed. Would happily recommend and return. Don’t expect a view but this did not matter as with most NY hotels you’re unlikely to get one.

title: Never ever other hotel than Casablanca
text: We liked the hotel very much. Nice clean place, 1 minute from Times Square. Most of the sights can be reached by walk. Everybody is very kind, helpful . The breakfast is even thogh is continental very good, extra five stars for the ladies for the porridge they prepair every morning. You can have a coffee all day long, from coffee machine. They use Lavazza and the coffee is very good for the European taste, which is very rare in the city. All in all the hotel is extremly guest friendly, they really do their best or more for the guests. Definitely offer for everybody.

title: Perfect hotel, perfect location
text: Spent 5 nights in the hotel while staying in New York. The hotel is small, can be found very closed to Times Square. The room we booked was large enough for two, with two queen size bed. Everything is spotlessly clean, they change the bedline every day, as well as the towels. The breakfast is pretty good, with flakes, oatflake, fruits. The best is the italian coffee maker, as the American coffee is not my taste😂. Every afternoon they offer wine and cheese reception with crakers, fruits, cheese, wine and prosecco. All the people working here are extremly friendly and helpful. So all in all I definitely offer the hotel for the stay in NY.

title: Superb!
text: just come back from a visit to this hotel, amazing!! everything about this hotel is superb, all the staff are excellent and very helpful . Breakfast was a great bonus along with cheese and wine in the evening. Still can't believe how quiet our room was even though the location is so close to times square.

title: Always a great place to stay
text: We always stay at the Casablanca Hotel during our annual visit to NYC.  We have never been disappointed. There can be street noise given the location and depending on the room but the service is consistently excellent and the location relative to Times Square and the theaters can not be beat.

title: Everything everyone else said
text: Amazing staff, great Continental breakfast and evening reception with sparkling wine, fruit, cheese, veggies, etc. Charming design, our room was perfect. I was afraid with the location right by time square (very confident for the subway) there'd be a lot of noise, but had no noise problems at all and slept soundly. Order online through their website and they'll get you a $1 bottle of wine!

title: Tick,Tick,Tick....
text:
Just returned from a excellent stay at this hotel.We chose it based on Tripadvisor  reviews and were not disappointed.The location is excellent.The staff are warm, welcoming and helpful.My request for a quiet room was filled.We enjoyed the breakfasts, lots of fresh fruit/croissants/ bagels/ etc.We enjoyed the wine and cheese in the evening and being able to have coffee/tea at any time of day.
Book this hotel,you won’t be disappointed.

title: Great hotel.
text: This is a great place to stay in New York!  Just steps from Times Square yet really quiet.  Generous continental breakfast served in a very comfortable room call Ricks.  We have stayed here before and this visit was just as satisfying as the first time.

title: great find in NY
text: this is now our third or fourth time at this hotel and we've already booked for next year.  consistent service, great breakfast and happy hour.  great location.  and quiet.  can't ask for too much more!  security is great.

title: Super Hotel
text: The Casablanca was recommended to us by friends and we weren’t disappointed. The hotel employees are a credit from the staff on reception, serving staff,  maids, cleaners and bellboy. Nothing too much trouble.  It was a special birthday for me and cards and wine were waiting for us in our rooms. The buffet breakfast was well stocked and all day complimentary tea, coffee and pastries served in Ricks Cafe on the second floor. From 5 to 8;complimentary wine, Prosecco and cheeses, biscuits, fruits and olives were also available.  Great starter before venturing out for dinner.The hotel is well placed just off Times Square although you don’t have to walk far for good food Tony’s  restaurant is right next door to hotel and is super. If you ask the guys in reception they will even show you the secret door to it. Would definitely recommend the Casablanca you won’t be disappointed.

title: Quiet retreat
text: Friendly staff, lovely clean comfortable room plus large shower. Lovely residents lounge with buffet style breakfast, refreshments 24 hours and cheese and wine early evening which was a great touch after a sightseeing day. All in all lovely lovely hotel.

title: Friendly and Welcoming
text: The friendliest and most helpful hotel staff I have ever experienced!  Really quite extraordinary.   Totally welcoming and eager to assist.   Seemed genuinely kind.   And, of course, a very comfortable room also.

title: Historic Gem in Times Square
text: From the moment you are greeted at the door you will be transformed to an era gone by. Very kind, friendly and respectful staff are eagerly awaiting your arrival. Amazing sanctuary in the craziness that is Times Square. The decor is like nothing in the area. Modern is wonderful but classic, historic and transported is so calming and peaceful. And the lovely cocktail hours, the ever available snacks and coffee/tea and the delish continental breakfast are the "icing on the cake". We loved it so much it pains me to write this review as we want to keep this gem to ourselves - but realize it is not fair to the staff or the hotel - Thank you for a wonderful stay!

title: Great location
text:
The hotel has a great location for a city break. Just off of time square.  The breakfast and cheese and wine happy 3 hours Is a nice touch.  Gives you a chance to recharge your batteries. 

The bed was small and the hotel a bit ‘tired’.  I thought it was expensive but maybe that is just New York prices.  

Staff were very friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Thanks

title: Haven in time square
text: A very cozy hotel in Time Square with great service. If that's what you want, that's what you got at Casablanca hotel. After a day of walking, arriving and having good wine and cheese is very pleasant.

title: Great hotel, great location!
text: We had a great stay at Casablanca Hotel. The staff were very welcoming, helpful and friendly. We especially appreciated their assistance when our departure shuttle was more than an hour late to collect us. The room was clean and a good size for New York. We enjoyed the included breakfast and evening wine and cheese. Location was excellent and we could easily walk to most places we wanted to go. Thanks!

title: A gem in NYC
text: Wonderful boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square.....Wouldn't hesitate to stay here whenever we are in NYC....rooms & bath a little small, but better than most in NY...worth the money because of Continental breakfast, wine & cheese hours & all day coffee & tea & cookies!

title: Excellent location, great atmosphere, wonderful rooms
text: My husband and I stayed at the Casablanca for a week while we were in NYC. The location can't be beat. It's close to Times Square, Bryant Park, and many subway stops. The hotel has character and is very well maintained. The staff couldn't have been nicer. We stayed in room 310 which is on the inside of the hotel (away from the street) and it was so quiet! We were surprised since we'd read reviews that it could be loud. The room had a table and two chairs in the room that made for a nice sitting area. It also had a mini fridge. The nightly wine and snacks was a wonderful bonus. We would definitely recommend staying here!

title: Ottimo hotel al centro di Manhattan.
text:
Ottimo hotel al centro di Manhattan e di tutte le attrazioni che si possono vedere nei suoi pressi. Hotel molto carino in stile, con personale molto gentile e pronto a consigliarti sulle varie attività in città. Buona la colazione, ma sopratutto il fatto che dopo le 18.00 puoi fare merenda gratuitamente offerta dalla proprietà. Albergo comodissimo per visitare manhattan a piedi ma anche perchè ad uno sputo da Time Square senza doverti svenare per stare nelle vicinanze della famosissima piazza.
Lo consiglio vivamente.

title: Tolle Lage, direkt am Times Square
text:
Das Hotel ist echt klasse, das Personal ist sehr freundlich und persönlich. Das kontinentale Frühstück gut und reichhaltig und nachmittags gab es Wein, Obst und ein kleines Käsebuffet. Wir hatten ein größeres Doppelzimmer mit Wohnzimmer, das war sehr gemütlich und die Betten waren sehr gut.
Ich kann dieses Hotel uneingeschränkt empfehlen.

title: Favorite Hotel in NYC
text: We stay here Every time We visit our Daughter in NYC. She says it feels like Home and I agree. Staff is Wonderful, and the Rooms are Clean & Comfortable. I love that you can request a mini fridge, memory foam pillows and a fan if needed.

title: Favorite NY Hotel
text: My husband and I stay here twice a year with our friends.  We LOVE this hotel.  Everyone is nice as could be.  The afternoon wine and cheese is fantastic.  Love Rick’s Place!!  A great place to meet up after theatre for cookies and coffee.  The rooms are comfortable and clean.  Love the proximity to Times Square.

title: It's a mystery
text: We stayed here because of the immensely positive TA reviews. But it was a truly terrible experience and since then we've tried hard to solve the mystery of why there are so many great reviews of the place. The hotel is old, the lift rickety, the rooms tired, and the window attached air conditioning phenomenally loud. None of this is uncommon, I know, with the old generation of NY hotels - though not the new generation of NY hotels, many of which are near to this one. But what makes this experience unforgettable - in a bad way - is that they are still renting out rooms on the front of the hotel very close to construction work that carries on through the night. A good night's sleep just wasn't possible - at least for us. And the trouble with the rooms at the back is that they overlook a dark, dank and narrow inner courtyard. The only explanation we could come up with for the positive reviews is that the average age of the clientele while we were there must have been over 50, maybe over 60, and many in this age range clearly appreciate the friendliness of the staff and the convivial atmosphere of 'Rick's Bar' with the wine and cheese evenings. Unlike many NY hotels you don't feel anonymous here, and for many in this age group I guess that's important. But on it's own physical terms it's impossible to recommend this hotel. At least until it's refurbished and the construction stops. When we raised the problems with the hotel they did their best to deal with them and to try and make us happier, but ultimately they can't fix the fundamental issues - the construction noise and the tired nature of the hotel.

title: Perfect choice
text:
You cannot go wrong with this hotel.
Our room was spotless and while not huge you have more than enough closet space. Staff were very friendly especially at the door and front desk but in general very good service all around. Seamless check in and check out. They also arranged for an airport transfer and on check out called us a cab. The location is also perfect. Good restuarants all around and the subway entrance just across the road. New Amsterdam theater also just around the corner. I would highly recommend.

title: Casablanca and Times Square = Best of NYC!
text: Another wonderful visit at Casablanca! We feel right at home when our taxi turns on 43rd street. John and his staff makes everyone feel like family returning ‘home’. Breakfast is delicious and Ricks Cafe never closes! Times Square just steps away! What’s not to love! Thanks again!! We will return soon - we always do! If you want to be spoiled this is your hotel.

title: Great Location and staff
text: We chose based on TA reviews and were generally satisfied.  The location is great right by Times Square but this is also a bit of a drawback as the road outside is nearly always clogged with traffic making getting to and from a bit difficult.  It is also a narrow road so the front facing rooms are a bit gloomy due to being dwarfed by the surrounding buildings. The room itself, we had a mini suite, was spacious and comfortable.  I noted previous review concerns about the construction work but that only affected us for the first night.  There is also a white noise machine which worked well to drown out the traffic noise.  The included continentaly breakfast was good by US standards and the three hour wine and cheese + in the evening also good.  The problem for both was that there was just not quite enough table room so it always felt a little crowded.  The staff were excellent and went out of their way to anticipate and satisfy our needs.  There is also coffee and snacks available all day. Would we stay again - probably not in this location, we would probably go for their other property near 5th Avenue.

title: Awesome quiet hotel in the middle of times square
text: the petite queen is comfortable , quiet with a great shower and even bath robes supplied. It just needs a chest of drawers for clothing .Location is perfect and within walking distance of broadway shows and theatres. Helpful friendly staff.

title: Great location, spacious and great staff.
text: The Casablanca is in a very convenient location off Times Square right next door to many great restaurants and walking distance to many attractions. The suite was very spacious for New York standards and the complementary breakfast and wine and cheese every evening was very much appreciated, adding to the value of the accommodation. My only negative is that the beds are doubles, not queens, and tended to dip in the centre, making sleep a bit less comfortable than desirable.

title: Great location
text: This hotel is a hidden gem. Great location and yet understated from the outside. Inside the vibe is chilled and friendly. A super lounge that is used for breakfast and a great and complimentary wine/cheese supper. Beds are very comfy and we would definitely use again if returning to NYC.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: A quiet hotel right at Time Square, professional courteous staff who "welcomed us home" when returning at the end of our sightseeing day. Clean and comfortable rooms with 24 hour lounge access. I highly recommend this hotel. We had a fabulous five nights and would return again.

title: Great friendly place!
text: Super location, steps from Times Square; friendly and attentive staff; great breakfast service; garage parking available next door. WHAT MORE do you need. Good elevator, patio room, great coffee. Right in the heart of Manhattan.

title: A warm welcome awaits you at The Casablanca Hotel in NYC
text: My husband and I arrived at the Casablanca Hotel six hours before check in. We were concerned about what we would do with our many pieces of luggage, but the hotel employees cheerfully held them for us and invited us to have coffee and breakfast upstairs while they checked on our room. Before we knew it, they said our room was ready for us! And what a beautiful room it was! The photos online do not disappoint plus we were surprised with a bottle of wine and two cards from the staff (it was my birthday and our anniversary). Later that day they assisted us by providing a subway map and directions for some places in the city that we wanted to see. The next day when we checked out, they flagged down a cab for us and helped with the bags. On top of this, the bed we had in our room was the most comfortable one we have ever slept in!  (My husband keeps asking me to ask the hotel what kind it was since he has shoulder issues and this really helped him!). We had only planned one night in NYC and now we wish we had made it longer. We loved staying here and the staff made it so wonderful for us. We will definitely be back!

title: Amazing staff
text: The hotel is just off Times Square. You can book at a Hilton down the street, but it would be a great mistake. This place offers you an incredible experience. All the staff are very knowledgeable and extremely eager to please. They have been trained with a single purpose to make your stay an experience you won’t forget. My husband runs a health center and travels for business, we have stayed at Hilton’s and never encountered this kind of service. From the bellhop who spent 15 minutes fixing my TV to the housekeeper that when asked where the ice machine was located, stopped what she was doing to offer to go get it for me. Being just off tidiness square the rooms are small and so are the elevators, but it’s clean and quiet. Today is our last day and I’m so sad to leave. I know I won’t encounter this kind of customer service elsewhere.

title: Wonderful place.
text: Perfect location. Loved the community room and the delicious breakfast, late afternoon wine and cheese, and late night cookies and tea.  We looked forward to getting back after a day of touring the city and relaxing in that room while visiting and meeting fellow travelers.

title: Wonderfull
text:
We’ve been here two days so far and it is everything the other reviewers said it would be. We came in spoiled having stayed  this week at the #2 trip advisor hotel in Boston, the #1 in Mystic and then to the Casablanca. Rooms are small because it’s Times Square and the elevators are tiny but that’s the end of the negatives and they are really more charming than negative. 

Now here’s where this hotel excels, the staff!!! I can’t even remember their names because every single staff member treats you like family. The ladies in the breakfast room in the AM those in the wine and cheese room  in the evening go above and beyond. The guys at the front desk were fantastic as were the bellhops/doormen. 

Whoever hires and trains these employees is a magician. I have 150 employees and it’s virtually impossible to have all of them be all-stars like this place. We will be back!!!

title: Great Boutique hotel in the heart of the theater district
text: This is a perfect sized boutique hotel in the heart of the theater district. Despite the hustle and bustle of Times Square, this hotel is a calm oasis. Staff is friendly, breakfast is yummy, and location is great for theater-goers.

title: Always a Great Experience! People focused.
text: We have stayed here several times and always feel welcomed by Jeffrey, Johan Asim John and the rest of the front desk and door staff. Many of these folks have been there for several years or more. They are committed to giving you a great experience. The location is convenient to Broadway shows and Times Square. While the area is bustling, the hotel provides a quiet oasis to relax and rest.

title: A peaceful oasis amidst the bustle of Times Square
text: This is a perfect place to stay in NYC - easy access to subways, theatre, nice restaurants, shopping and lovely Bryant Park.  Staff are exceptional and LOVE RICK’S CAFE. Will return again and again to this charming boutique hotel

title: Great boutique hotel just steps from Times Square
text: Casablanca is a great little hotel just steps from Times Square.  The price includes breakfast, afternoon tea/coffee and wine and cheese.  A nice bonus is the staff are very friendly and helpful.  I would definitely stay there again.

title: Charming Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Times Square
text: This is the place for a quiet getaway in midtown. Convenient to all the theaters as well as MSG. Breakfast included at the second floor charming library; it’s also the spot for complementary wine and cheese nightly. Our king room on the 6th floor was quiet and comfy with a large bathroom. Helpful staff at the 24 hour front desk.

title: 5 stars
text: Loved everything about this hotel, location couldn't be better, room and bathroom was spotlessly clean, all staff we came in contact with were extremely helpful, friendly and professional. Great value

title: Another Wonderful Stay
text:
I just completed my 4th trip to NYC and my second stay at the amazing Casablanca Hotel which is a short pitching wedge from all the action at Times Square.  General Manager John T. and his efficient staff go above and beyond to ensure their guests get the royal treatment.  Although this hotel is a quaint "boutique" property, what it lacks in size it more than makes up in style and class.  The marvelous continental breakfast served every morning is super as is the daily late afternoon wine and cheese offering.

A person can't possibly see all on NYC is a single visit or two or three.  I plan on returning in the near future to Manhattan and it is a "No Brainer" that the Casablanca Hotel will be my first and only choice.

title: Best service & location in NYC!
text:
Our first time coming to New York, my family decided to stay at the Casablanca for the whole week of our stay in NYC. 

The hotel provided such brilliant service and were so accommodating and friendly the whole time. Every single member of staff were so lovely and helped us with any questions we had (including best local places to eat - which they were spot on!!) 

The housekeeping made sure our room was spotless every day and was so nice coming back to a perfect & clean room after a busy day of sightseeing. 

Rick’s Café was a relaxing spot to have a cup of tea and also a great way to start the morning with breakfast. Best bagels ever.

All in all, an amazing experience which really made our first stay in NY such a hassle free and pleasant one. Will definitely come back if we ever visit again in the future.

title: A great find!
text:
The reviews describing this hotel as an oasis are spot on!  The hotel is well decorated in a Moroccan theme and a great escape from the frantic Times Square.

The staff are friendly and helpful and clearly worked well together as a team.  

The room was a decent size, well decorated and very clean.  The toiletries were lovely.  Our only complaint about the room was the noisy aircon.

Rick's café was great.  Breakfast, all day refreshments and wine & cheese every evening were very welcome.  And, all included in the price.

Not sure we will be returning to New York anytime soon but if we did we would definitely stay here.

title: 5 Days in New York
text: Great ...Location ..Staff..... Rooms..Beverages.. Location... very pleased with our stay. Helped us with the Fiasco of Thomas Cook going bust, even though we only had a flight booked with TC... and loved the Wine & Cheese Reception every evening.

title: Casablanca NYC
text: Very nice and clean, very comfortable.  Ricks cafe provided tea , coffee and snacks 24-7.  It is located steps from times square and is quiet and peaceful inside.  Like an oasis in the desert. The only negative is that the rooms are very small, they were not a problem for us.  The rooms were clean.  Will definitely come back.  There were a lot of international tourists which is a plus if you like to chat with interesting people.

title: Smartest Hotel for Sophisticated Travelers in Time Square
text: Best service! We have traveled in some of the most expensive hotels in NYC, but the staff at the  Casablanca was superlative. The cocktail hour and breakfast was sublime. We would give this 5+ star reviews!

title: Hotel with some quirks
text:
This hotel has a lot going for it such as very friendly staff, good breakfast included, evening wine reception and 24 hr coffee, tea, snacks and water available. The rooms are clean and the bathroom had been updated.

However, this is an old building and was just not my taste in decor and room size, and the AC unit was loud and blew directly at the bed. The room faced the courtyard and was basically dark all of the time.

We appreciated the good amenities and excellent staff but would most likely stay somewhere else next time.

title: First time in NYC!
text: This was our first trip to NY and was a bit apprehensive. The Casablanca hotel really felt like home away from home. It was in a perfect location....around the corner from Times Square and across the street from the subway. However,  in the hotel it was quiet and peaceful. Did not even feel.as though we were in NYC. They offered a very nice contential breakfast,  snacks through out the day and wine with heavy snacks in the evening.  Already planning our next trip back and mostly because of the Casablanca! Oh...excellent staff!

title: One night visit
text: Stayed one night in a suite with my daughter. Upon entering, we were completely taken care of. Front desk staff very kind and professional. Breakfast offering was very good (one suggestion is to have a sign that offers gluten free bread). We asked for it hoping they did. Wine and snacks in late afternoon was a real treat. Our suite was near perfection. No city noise at all. Location to Times Square and theaters is literally steps away.  Parking garage 2 doors down with a discount. Make sure they stamp your receipt. Can't wait to stay here again.

title: A little Gem
text: This hotel is a lovely haven of calm after you return from a day or evening of adventures, show or shopping. Rick’s lounge is great for a tea, coffee and snacks any time of the day to relax and recuperate. My sister celebrated her 60th birthday the lady’s at breakfast sang happy birthday to her and delivered a cupcake and fruit. A lovely gesture, the hotel excelled my expectations exceptionally good housekeeping, very clean rooms which are good sizes something to suit everyone couples or a family. Comfy bed and pillows a/c and fan in the rooms a/c a little noisy but offers of help ie ear plugs available , but I think we hit the jackpot. The breakfast was good although we purchased our own sourdough bread but they did toast it for us. We could not take advantage of all the cakes/pastries/biscuits on offer due to our diet restrictions. But we asked for extra fruit which we got. Unlimited tea/coffee. I cannot wait to return. A big thank you to all of the staff they are a credit to you. The hotel is in a prime position for all activities and attractions.

title: Another Awed Reviewer
text:
QUIET!  SO QUIET!
CLEAN!  INCREDIBLY CLEAN!

Did I already mention quiet?!  I'm sure that you saw "Times Square" and rolled your eyes, weary traveler, but take my word for it - book this hotel.  Now.

I have stayed in many NYC hotels, even lived there for a while, and it was as quiet as the suburbs in our room (509) every one of the four nights we stayed.  Sure, it smelled a little bit like hot dogs, probably due to our a/c units picking up smells from the air shafts in back of the hotel, but that was an enormously tiny price to pay for the gorgeous accommodation, friendly staff, and can't-beat-it-with-a-stick location.
