The intent of our trip was to see The Cursed Child, which was across the Square a, maybe, two minute walk.

title: Staff extremely gracious. Hotel and room spotless
text: We found the entire staff from front desk to doorman to those serving coffee in the morning to those serving wine and cheese in the afternoon to be sincerely gracious, approachable and eager to make the visit memorable.

title: Lovely Hotel BUT......
text:
This is a fantastic hotel just around the corner from Times Square.  Beautifully decorated, amazing staff, tasty breakfast, free wine and cheese in the evenings.

On arrival we were told we had been upgraded to a suite.  It was fantastic and included a free bottle of wine.  BUT it is at the front of the hotel just across the street from a large office building.  That building is having major refurbishment work being carried out ALL NIGHT.  I guess it is done ALL NIGHT so as not to disturb the office workers.  I cannot begin to describe how loud it was.  In a city hotel, you expect noise from traffic and sirens etc. but this was totally unacceptable.

Due to the air conditioning unit being inserted into the window it sounded like the window had been left open. 

We were there for 3 nights and did manage some sleep the first night due to the long international journey but neither of us had any sleep on night 2.  After complaining, we were moved to a room at the back of the hotel and it was perfectly quiet.

After we had moved rooms, the manager called to apologise but they should have been honest about this when we arrived. They cannot help the noise across the street but this is a fairly expensive hotel and offering a free upgrade, knowing what we faced, was very disappointing.

title: Very good for this price
text: Excellent stay and at a few meters from Time Square. I hardly met a better service in any hotel. Rooms are small but sufficient. Excellent wine and cheese in the afternoon at 2nd floor. Elevators scrambling little :) Overall - good value for money:)

title: Enjoyable stay at Casablanca
text: This is a great little hotel in a central location. The people who work here are friendly, helpful and attentive. I loved the availability of all day snacks. There were tea, cookies and muffins offered in the late morning and wine, cheese and fruit in the afternoon. So nice to have snacks to get you through a full day in NY.  The beds are quite comfortable.  Our room was small but that was fine for a short stay.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Another wonderful stay
text: We stayed at the Casablanca 4 years ago when we came to NY for the first time on vacation. When we were planning our second trip, we knew there was no place better to stay, so we decided to book here again. This time we were meeting friends in the City, so we suggested they stay here too. The hotel is in a perfect location for getting to all the places you want to go when visiting Manhattan. There are multiple subway stations all within a block of the hotel which makes using public transportation a breeze. Times Square is a spectacle like nothing you’ve ever seen, but the minute you walk in the hotel you’d never know that chaos is a block away. Loved that the Police Station is right at the end of the block—for safety as well as a landmark when navigating back to the hotel from Times Square. Rick’s cafe on the second floor is a comfortable, relaxing atmosphere to recharge your battery after being out all day, or to kick off a day in the city.  My only negative comment would be about the construction going on across the street. The construction goes on all night long and is VERY loud—jackhammer, trucks backing up, concrete being thrown into the back of a metal truck, etc.....The first night we were there our room had a window overlooking 43rd Ave, which is where the construction is. The hotel has no control over the construction, but we got no sleep the first night because of the all-night noise.  I’ve never experienced anything like it. We went down first thing the next morning and asked to change rooms, which they graciously and apologetically did. The rest of our stay was perfect. While the hotel can’t control the construction, they do know it is going on, and I feel those rooms overlooking 43rd should be discounted. We paid over $400 to be kept up all night our first night in town. There is no comparison of those rooms to an interior room.  We love the Casablanca and will stay here again when we come to NY for another visit!

title: Great place to stay
text: Staff was very helpful and nice.  Rooms lovely. Great location. Parking in garage next door very convenient. Complimentary breakfast and snacks were good. Pleasant common areas. Nice design of funky space. Convenient check in and out.

title: Hotel with heart In heart of Times Square
text: Great staff and service.  Nice amenities and very good continental breakfast and cocktail hour included. One of the 2 elevators was under repair.  Surprisingly quiet inside. Outside is Times Square noisy and chaotic.  Great if you’re seeing Broadway shows.

title: Noise All Night
text: Somebody was working on 43rd all night for our three day stay. Jackhammers and Dump Trucks all night. Couldn’t muffle the noise with the ac fan and the white noise generator thoughtfully provided by the hotel. Love the hotel not the noise.

title: Would recommend you stay in this hotel as not only was the location great, so were the staff and the service.
text: Great hotel, great staff, very pleasant and eager to help. The location was also great just around the corner from Times Square but still very quiet.   Close to theatres and restaurants. The hotel also has a 3 hour nightly appetiser and wine service so you can relax with a few glasses of wine or bubbles before heading out to the theatre. So nice!

title: Nice but loud.
text:
The hotel is very nice and the people are extremely pleasant, however there is construction being done just outside the hotel. This construction occurs from 10:00 pm until 6:00 am. At times it is very loud.
I realize the hotel is not responsible for this, but it is a disturbance of  sleep.

title: Convenient boutique like hotel with great service!
text: Great location, convenient to Times Square and Theatres. Excellent service by all hotel employees. Nice amenities. Parking available  right next door. Would not reserve petite queen room again due to limited space.

title: Overrated
text:
The Casablanca is just a Nice Hotel, run by a really friendly and helpful staff, it has someway spacious rooms, is centrally located and very clean. All this facts are really important but in order to have all the awards by trip advisor they have a long way to improve. Here are some points that I would like to share and you will decide.
- The furniture and ornaments are dated, it feels like a Grandma’s Bed and Breakfast
- The building is really old and located in a really noisy street
- They offer breakfast, but nothing more than coffee, and cheap pastries and bread, forget about protein boiled eggs is the only thing available, this breakfast is like what you can get in La Quinta Inn 
- There is not enough sitting at the breakfast area
- They have a social Afternoon , a really nice idea but they serve $4 bottles of wine, cheap sparkling wine, cheese and fruit trays from the Supermarket 
- There is not a lot of good places to eat nearby 
- The customers are mostly older couples 55 and above 
- The A/C is a wall unit , not central
Would I return or recommend this Hotel, probably not, which is sad because they have a great friendly staff , and finding good human resource in this business is key for success.
To the administration I will ask them to make some simple improvements:
- Offer better sitting at the breakfast area
- invest in offering a better quality breakfast 
- Offer better quality wines , you can find decent wines for 10 - 15 dollars at Costco and a Prosecco for 10 - 15 also
- KEEP YOUR GREAT AND FRIENDLY STAFF
These changes , without large investments will increase your clients satisfaction and the chance to bring a new type of guest .

title: The Casablanca Hotel is like a step back in time ...
text: Not only does the hotel take you back to Rick's Cafe from the movie, Casablanca, but also the sense of timelessness.  The Cafe is open 24/7 for "snacks", tea and coffee, juices, etc.  Wine & cheese for three hours every day!  A delicious casual breakfast is also served at Rick's.  And it is just steps from Times Square!

title: Great boutique hotel in the heart of the theate district / times square
text:
I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the hustle an bustle of times square / Manhattan.
Great all-round service with a smile from all hotel staff.
The reception and door staff very helpful.
The hotel web site is correct in every way, what is on the site is what you get, No disappointments. :-)
Tony's restaurant connected to the hotel has a comprehensive menu, large portions. Order one main an share for two.

title: NY Perfection
text:
I would reserve the ride service thru the hotel it was a great way to start our vacation.
The front desk staff can answer any questions you have and also recommend restaurants, etc.
When you wake up in the morning take advantage of the breakfast room and also all day enjoy coffee, tea and cookies. A great way to end an evening as well and discuss all the fun things you did that day.

title: Excellent
text: The Casablanca Hotel is an excellent hotel in a a superb location - central to everything and easy access to everywhere. This is our second visit having been highly impressed during our stay last year. This year my husband upgraded to a suite - luxurious, spacious and peaceful - no noise from outside or within ( with the exception of the air conditioning). A lovely bottle of wine was left in the room on our arrival as my husband was celebrating his birthday - a nice touch. Special thanks to staff at reservations for responding so positively to specific requests. The staff at the Casablanca are absolutely amazing - so welcoming, courteous and helpful at every point of every day. Our stay was greatly enhanced by 1) 24/7 availability of coffee/ tea and snacks 2) 5-8pm cheese & wine and nibbles 3) the most wonderfully relaxed atmosphere at breakfast which offered a more than ample selection to choose from. The staff at breakfast and the evening cheese and wine must be commended for their attentiveness and thoughtfulness. A seven day stay in NYC is wonderful but exhausting. The Casablanca Hotel supports your efforts to maximise your involvement by offering an opportunity to rest, relax and recover - fresh to meet the challenges and enjoyment of the next new day. Thank you to everyone - staff and fellow guests - such a cordial and respectful atmosphere prevailed throughout our stay. Such a wonderful experience ;))

title: Your home in New York
text:
I chose this hotel as it was my first stay in New York and (travelling alone) I wanted a hotel where I could ask for advice and feel looked after. On this front, the Casablanca delivers in spades.

The staff are really great and make this hotel a hidden oasis: they are so helpful and are genuinely happy to chat with you about what you've done during the day. I got wet through, when I went to Ellis Island, and it felt like I 'popped home' to get changed before having a late lunch. 

 As many reviewers have said, the breakfast, the cheese and wine and the lounge are all great features and I really appeal/ give a lovely sense of inclusion. I think that NY can be a tough city, if you stay in the wrong place, and I really enjoyed it here.

Whilst I have given 5 stars (because it's great and I loved it), I would echo some of the previous comments about some of  the décor being a little tired (and bathroom, when I first arrived, did smell a bit of drains - it passed). This is all forgivable as it's an old building, with a certain style, and when you stay here you are not looking for a shiny chrome experience, you are looking (and will find) a very special boutique hotel. 

Overall it's quiet as a hotel and the beds etc are very comfortable. My air conditioning was also a bit too noisy (and that would be my one request next time), however, balance this with the homely welcoming feel and the excellent location. Would I stay here again? Of course - in a heartbeat.

title: Superb!
text:
Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Casablanca and we were very impressed with the extremely friendly staff. 
Loved the complimentary cheese and wine from 5pm - 8pm. 
Location was fantastic just round the corner from Times Square. 
Rooms were very comfortable 
Thank you, when we’re next in town we will definitely be back.

title: Very convienent location
text: This hotel is in a great location to access public transportation and transportation to any of the airports.  Central Manhattan  location also meant you could walk many places.  The staff is friendly and very helpful. There is a nice breakfast and happy hour every day although neither varied during our 4 days there so it got old by the last day.

title: Excellent service at the Casablanca
text: Excellent service from very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms did not look out directly onto Times Square but rooms away from the street were less noisy. Beds very comfortable. Breakfast included had a good choice and the evening wine and cheese was very welcome. Enjoyed the piano playing on Friday evening at the wine and cheese.

title: Another Great Holiday at the Casablanca
text: Stayed here first time 6 years ago. We said the next time were in New York we would stay at the Casablanca as everything about was wonderful and our resent stay confirmed it still is a fantastic hotel.

title: Unique property
text:
Excellent location, great customer service , free WiFi/breakfast/ daily wine tasting. Very unique property , comfortable beds , some what noisy since it’s time square. They had free breakfast but I passed since there was no hot item on menu but again , it was free and plenty of pasteries /cofee /cereals.
Overall great property and excellent location.

title: Love this place
text: Great little hotel just off Times Square... love everything about it, from the moment you arrive the staff are warm and friendly, the rooms are comfortable and the breakfasts & social hours are great. This was our second visit and it won’t be our last

title: Liked it so much we came back
text:
We were last here in 2015 so when we chose New York to finish our ruby wedding anniversary celebrations this was an obvious choice.

From the moment you walk in, with a friendly greeting every time you come in, the hustle and bustle of Times Square is forgotten and you are in such a tranquil setting. Beautifully decorated in Moroccan style and all day tea, coffee, crakes etc. 

Our room happened to overlook W43rd so as we were there during Labor Day celebrations ( being Brits we hadn’t realised) was rather noisy. We expected a certain level of noise being near Times Square  and we travel with ear plugs so we were fine. If you aren’t expecting Times Square noise at night it may be worth asking for a room in a quieter spot in the hotel.

The toiletries provided are beautiful and everything is so tastefully presented. 

All the staff were lovely from toasting bagels for us at breakfast to on our last day organising a car to take us to the airport for a set price including tolls and tips and we could pay by card. We believe it was excellent value as it took 90 minutes to JFK and we suspect a yellow cab would have been more expensive.

The lounge is really comfortable. Wine is provided every afternoon from 5pm but if there was a bar available even one you pay for, it would take the place up a notch even more. I am certainly not complaining about the lack of a bar but we like the hotel so much that to be able to get a lunch time beer there rather than go to another bar would be the icing on the cake!

As you can see there is nothing to dislike about this hotel in my view; and my comments are really only about personal preferences.

If we get back to Manhattan ( which we love) this will always be our “ go to” hotel.

title: Excellent Stay at casablnca Hotel
text:
Everything about our stay was fantastic!  Our room was large (from a NYC hotel standpoint), comfortable, quiet and nicely temperature regulated.  It was one floor above the cafe where we had breakfast (very good) each morning.  We also enjoyed afternoon wine, cheese and apetizers each afternoon, and tea in the evening.  It was comfortable and relaxing.  The hotel is situated in the theater district in the Times square area, making it an easy walk to the many broadway theaters.  It is a block away from a subway station as, so travelling by subway to various areas of the city was a cinch!  I used the free pass to the nearby fitness club a number of times, which worked out great.  
Such a delightful stay...  we will certainly be back!  And by the way, the hotel is attached to our favorite italian restaurant, Tony's di Napoli!!!

title: Wonderful hotel right at Times Square
text: We stayed here for three nights on the way to and from Africa. It was wonderful! The breakfast, snack lounge was a great place to unwind, or to rest after a long flight, waiting for our room to be ready. The  service is superb, and the mattresses are like heaven. We highly recommend this boutique hotel. You will love it!

title: Great hotel
text: Very comfortable hotel.  Loved Rick's bar where there are hot drinks and snacks available 24 hours a day including free breakfast and cheese and wine in the evenings.  Rooms was a bit small but well furnished with space for hanging clothes plus drawers and loved the sandalwood and orange toiletries in the bathroom.

title: The perfect Hotel in New York
text: Only a few steps to Time Square. This Hotel is centrally located. Breakfast is included and after 5pm daily wine and nibbles are provided. Staff are excellent and well trained. They make you feel part of their family. Highest recommendation

title: Feels like coming home!
text: Every visit to this hotel is like coming home to a comfortable residence!  I have never been to a better location for 100% customer service.  A visit to NYC can be stressful under the best conditions.  There is nothing like coming home to the Casablanca to relax with a glass of complimentary wine, 24 hour snacks and the friendliest employees in the city!

title: An NYC Gem
text: This beautiful, charming little hotel is located just off Times Square and was perfect for an NYC weekend. The staff is friendly and helpful, but stays out of your way. We found this a lovely retreat after long days out walking the city. The room was comfortable, clean, and stylish. Give the Casablanca a try - you won't be disappointed.

title: Special Birthday in NYC
text: We stayed at the Casablanca for 4 nights recently for a special birthday visit.  What a fantastic location!  Close to all amenities, Times Square, transport etc.  The breakfast was very good, plenty of choice and good coffee(a must for us), there was a morning newspaper too.  Tea, coffee, ice water and snacks available 24 hours was very helpful.  The Cheese & Wine 5-8pm is a great idea as New York can be an expensive place to eat out.  The rooms are very comfortable and quiet given the  central location.  The staff are extremely welcoming and helpful, nothing is too much trouble.  This is a small hotel, which we like, it makes it more personal for us.  Would not hesitate to recommend it, thank you for such a lovely stay.

title: Amazing staff and great location
text:
Yes the location is superb but the hotels biggest asset is its staff who all were friendly, helpful and caring. We stayed last week and married on the Wednesday. The manager was so kind to let me use a room to get ready on the day for a few hours. 

The location couldn’t be any better - just off Times Square so perfect for most tourist attractions such as Broadway shows, Empire State Building and Central Park. 

The only downside of our room was that with the air con on it sucked in the constant smell of Chinese cooking from a nearby restaurant - this doesn’t affect all rooms. 

The breakfast and cheese / wine evenings make us a great touch - I would totally recommend the hotel to others - so much so my friends have booked for November 

A great stay and a big thank you to all the staff 

:-)

title: Awesome hotel!
text:
This hotel was awesome. Great service, friendly staff. They have great coffe available all day!
Also the location is great if you want to be right in the middle of everything. The wifi connection is good, and the fact that you can borrow a computer , and print paper, in the study rooms is nice.

title: Great hotel
text: Just loved it made my birthday special would go back every opportunity Ricks cafe great fruit and pastries tea coffee. Wine and cheese of an evening.friendliest staff I’ve ever met. Practically in Times Square so great to get everywhere on foot.  Fabulous atmosphere calm friendly welcoming

title: Another great stay at the Casablanca
text: Hotel is centrally located to Broadway plays and other tourist spots. Staff is so friendly and helpful. The morning breakfast and evening wine offer a chance to mingle with other guests. The restaurant next door is great.

title: Perfect hotel!
text: Everything about the Casablanca is perfect — and the staff are so extraordinarily welcoming!!! Great location Erin theaters, lovely lounge with delicious food and live piano music on Friday nights. I’ll be back.

title: Favourite hotel
text: Great location. Relatively big, quiet, comfortable room and bathroom. Enjoyed the breakfast and wine and cheese. Excellent service and value. Quality and unique decor. Fun experience in boutique hotel. Hope to be back soon and would highly recommend.

title: Keeping up its reputation
text: Location, complimentary breakfast, wine and cheese hours daily, great staff. The front desk will help with any questions you may have. Need an umbrella? No problem. Taxi, they will get it. Why would you look anywhere else, unless they are totally booked? Then head to The Library.

title: An Oasis on the Edge of Times Square
text: We spent four nights here while seeing the sights in NYC and taking in a couple of Broadway shows, and it was delightful. Just a few steps off Times Square, the Casablanca was a wonderful refuge from the lights and noise of Broadway. The staff were uniformly attentive and friendly, wanting to make sure all needs were met. The lounge, Rick's (of course), was very comfortable, although we had a real issue with the coffee machine, which seemed incapable of producing a hot cup of coffee! A small patio off the lounge was a nice find. The room was small but very clean and comfortable, although we found the bed to be a bit harder than we liked. Overall, a very pleasant stay- I'm sure we'll be back!

title: Excellent hotel in NYC
text: We completely enjoyed our stay at Casablanca.  It was a perfect location, and the hotel was staffed by a superb group of people.  We have already suggested this hotel to others visiting NYC in the future, as we liked everything about it -- especially Rick's Cafe for its convenience, ambiance, and tasty food/drinks.

title: Casablanca is the BEST!
text: Top notch hospitality and attention to detail!  Wonderful Times Square location. And so clean and quiet.  I plan on making this “home” when visiting NYC! The subway is close and it’s in the heart of Times Square. Rick’s Cafe is a wonderful commons area for breakfast, snacks, happy hour, and a late night cappuccino.

title: Oerhört charmigt litet hotell..
text: ..så centralt på Manhattan man kan komma. Nära till allt. Personalen är vänlig, trevlig och hjälpsam. Generös frukost, kaffe med tilltugg är alltid framdukat för gästerna och på eftermiddagarna bjuds det på vin och ost. Små saker som vi uppskattade i en stad där allt kostar pengar.

title: IN MUCH NEED OF UPDATING
text: The lobby was so charming! But our room was very much in need of updating. Curtains were frayed and faded. Sofas were from 1980. Window air conditioning units were loud and barely kept room cold. Street noise extremely loud.

title: Cozy, well located, and GREAT service
text: My wife and I were looking to stay in mid-town (not necessarily close to times square but it did not matter).  The location is great, only one block from the Time Square metro station.  The hotel is slightly older but the rooms are updated and less expensive than other hotels.  The service was great, the front desk was super helpful in getting us through basics like bag checks and the lounge to freshen up after we arrived early for the day before the room was ready.  The fact that snacks are available in the lounge any time, and breakfast included makes this a hotel I will use again for mid-town.

title: Always a great stay
text: The Casablanca never disappoints. It is a gem in the center of a Times Square. The staff, the breakfast,the wine and cheese reception are always top notch. The location puts you in the heart of the big apple.

title: Absolutely Fabulous
text:
Super location —1/2 block away from Time Square, Sondheim Theater across the street, parking garage next door. 
Small hotel hosting superior hospitality—friendly & helpful staff—super clean rooms & very nice breakfast. They did wine happy hour too.

title: A Very Nice Visit In A Great Location
text:
Location.  Location.  Location.  Just steps away from Times Square, this spot was perfect for us - near many subway lines and within walking distance to many attractions (Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's cathedral, Grand Central Station, Central Park, Hudson Yards, and, of course, Times Square).

The complimentary continental breakfast and wine & cheese were great each day of our four-night stay.

All staff - doormen, front desk, and Rick's Cafe - were consistently outstanding, always friendly and helpful.

The hotel itself is old and it sometimes shows.  The plumbing in our sixth floor room was a bit quirky.  The elevators creak.  The window-unit air conditioner was very noisy.  However, the many good things about Casablanca outweigh the few drawbacks.

title: Nice
text: Casablanca hotel is one of the finest hotel I ever stay ,such a warm and cool place to be hang out with my buddy .great location with a view of skyline .buffet breakfast is fantastic and room was elegant

title: Familly stay at Casablanca
text: Good value for money given the location, great room, great service, and really friendly staff. Couldn't fault it and (older) kids were really impressed. I would stay there again if I go back yo New York.

title: Perfect for us!
text:
This is a bit of a lazy review but essentially, read and believe all the good stuff in previous reviews.

We went as a family with two grown up daughters. It was our first time to the US so first time to NYC as well. We were recommended this hotel and I also had followed reviews since we booked it. The key points that made it perfect for us:

* We had two separate rooms that were ideal for us as a couple and our two daughters who shared a room - so glad we did this instead of one big suite and the hotel chose well for us.

* The location was perfect - on the doorstep of so many places we wanted to visit.

* The refreshments - not only a great "free" breakfast but also the wine and cheese is so much more than that.

* The staff - they were so friendly and helpful.

We would absolutely 100% return to this unique little oasis when we visit NYC again.

title: Great location but hotel no the best
text:
We travelled to New York and Toronto and stayed at 4 of the Library Collection hotels (Casablanca, Library, Girraffe and X in Toronto). We enjoy smaller boutique hotels and overall the Library hotels are very nice but the Casablanca was the least enjoyable. It is fantastically located in Times Square. The theme is great but it's looking very old and needs an update. We also got a really bad room 806 I think? (the worst we were told by one of the staff). It had a window to the back with no view and directly next to the main airconditioning system so it was very noisy, particularly at night when trying to sleep. The plumbing is also susceptible to blocking up. We had to have the maintenance guy in to fix it the first day we arrived.

On a positive, the staff were very nice and the other Library hotels were great. They just need to give this one a little TLC.

At over $550/night AUD, $480 USD (certainly not budget or cheap) I'd consider that to be heading toward the 4.5 star level but sadly I'd have to say 3.5 star tops.

title: New York trip
text:
Would highly recommend 
Excellent central location 
Very clean very quiet never heard any noise  
Good facilities excellent staff 
Would definitely go back again in the future
Nothing was to much trouble
Staff gave us great advice

title: A Delightful Quiet Oasis of Old World Charm Beside Times Square
text:
Having visited friends here in the past and envied their hotel choice, we finally got to stay here and we were well looked after.

It's amazing how one can escape the utter chaos and noise of Times Square by just entering the Casablanca, located in a side street, and our room was quiet too.

But it's not just the location that is so useful about this hotel, it's the staff who look after you, move and safely store the bags, get taxis, serve the nice breakfasts and above all replenish the groaning table with free drinks and snacks during the 5-8pm Happy Hour.

There was even a welcome bottle in our room on arrival. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom and toiletries were fine plus plenty of space and a good sized wardrobe. The air conditioning unit was a bit noisy but at least it worked during a sweltering July and we slept well.

We were made to feel welcome and comfortable.

title: Third visit and won't be our last!
text: We have been lucky enough to stay in the hotel three times now and in our room was a card that said 'Welcome Home' and it really feels like our home in NYC. The staff our very helpful and welcoming, we were even given the same room we had last time. We love the bagels and the coffee in the morning, the close proximity of the hotel to major attractions, the calmness away from the hustle and bustle away from Times Square to the lovely wine and cheese reception. Thank you for another fantastic stay and we are already planning a Christmas visit next year,

title: Our #1 Hotel to stay at in NYC never fails
text: We have stayed here many times and it continues to be our #1 hotel in NYC.  The staff is amazing and helpful.  You always feel like an individual, not a number, as at all the big hotels.  The amenities are outstanding-- breakfast, lounge open all day, wine & cheese in the evenings.  Although the rooms are a little small, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom products are great.  The price is great and the location is perfect.  We won't stay anywhere else.

title: Great choice!
text: The location was excellent and hospitality was above and beyond. Rooms were a little small, but the hotel was charming and had great character. There were not many breakfast options, but we aren’t big breakfast eaters, so it was all we needed. In the heart of Times Square. Easy access to everything. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

title: Meu hotel preferido em NY
text: hotel em prédio antigo, porém muito bem cuidado, conservado, confortável e acolhedor. Café da manhã  suficiente e nutritivo. Localização excelente, perto de metrô, praticamente dentro  da Times Square, muitas opções de teatros, restaurantes e compras. Especial mesmo, é o corpo de profissionais que fazem excelente atendimento, dedicados a promover a melhor experiência no hotel e na cidade. O Sr. Brian e Sr. Taboada são exemplos, mas os demais funcionários, que não tenho os nomes no momento, são excelentes e me fazem sentir como se estivesse em minha casa. Já me hospedei outras vezes e, caso volte à cidade, com certeza o Casablanca será minha primeira opção.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: I reserved this hotel for a girls trip weekend in July. The room was spacious and well maintained. Continental breakfast was served daily and had a variety of items. Coffee and snacks were available 24/7. At the daily cocktail hour from 5pm - 8pm, we met travelers from all over the world and enjoyed wine and light refreshments. The hotel is walking distance to Bryant Park, Times Square and Broadway. I highly recommend it!

title: Wonderful Hotel
text: We came to the Casablanca to celebrate our 10 year anniversary in New York. We were delighted when we entered our room to find a complementary bottle of wine to celebrate. The rooms are very clean and have a very homey feel. We both loved this hotel, we can't say enough how friendly the staff are, always happy to help, this made the holiday for us! Rick's Cafe on the second floor of the hotel offers cheese and wine in the afternoon which gives a wonderful break to the day while trudging through the busy streets of New York. We're very sad to be going...but the holiday must end at some point! We will definitely be back, hopefully over the Christmas period. We would highly recommend this hotel not least for the wonderful staff at the Casablanca.

title: Fantastic
text:
I should have reviewed this hotel sooner than I have. 

We went for our 5th wedding anniversary and when we arrived they was a complimentary bottle of champagne and a letter to congratulate us. 

This is a lovely boutique hotel decorated with a 1920’s theme. 

The room was petite but adequate for our stay and the facilities were good. The hotel is a stones throw away from Times Square. We didn’t get a view of Times Sq but it’s only a small hotel with taller buildings either side. 

A complimentary breakfast (continental style) each morning and Cheese and Wine every evening between 5-8pm.

The staff couldn’t do enough for you and they made our stay very pleasurable. 

I would highly recommend to friends and family.

title: Quiet room in great location!
text: Friendly and helpful staff.  Clean and quiet rooms.  Breakfast and wine and cheese reception a nice amenity.  Only one elevator was working so some people were complaining that it was too slow.  I like to use the stairs and our room was on the 5th floor so not a problem!

title: Great hotel in nice Times Square location.
text: Great boutique hotel in center of Times Square.   Staff service great.  Nice included happy hour, WiFi and continental breakfast.   Rooms a little small but often case in NYC.  We were in back and AC systems in other buildings a little loud but otherwise great. Also room ACs a little loud but got used to after a couple nights.

title: The best hotel in New York
text: My husband and I stayed at the Casablanca in 2016 when we got married and returned this year for our 3 year anniversary.  The hotel is just the quietest, friendliest and most welcoming we have ever visited.  The staff can't do enough for you, are willing to accommodate any needs you might have and really go out of their way to make the stay enjoyable and hassle-free.  Rooms are more than comfortable, and the bonus of the communal dining room which serves breakfast, and snacks and pre-dinner drinks/cheese is unlike anywhere else we know.  Would never stay anywhere else now we've found it!

title: Charming and Quiet place to stay in the NYC  Theater district
text: This small and quaint hotel is surprisingly quiet considering where it is located.  Helpful and friendly staff.  The rooms are not the most spacious, but they are clean and comfortable.  The second floor is dedicated to coffee/tea, breakfast, and a comfortable place to sit and chat with others or quietly work.  Lovely.

title: Fabulous
text: My daughter and I stayed here for a quick getaway. We chose this hotel, due to its location and we wanted more of a boutique hotel. It was a scorching hot day when we checked in. The front desk was so helpful and immediately offered us bottled water. The staff was so attentive our entire trip. The doorman addressed us by name as we came and went during our stay. The throwback feel is this hotel was perfection. As soon as you step inside, the bustle of the city disappears. The rooms have window units, which concerned me. Absolutely cooled our room to the point we were chilled on a 100° day. The ceiling fan was a nice touch. We have already booked our next stay!

title: Hotel that Knows its all About the Service
text:
It may not be the biggest or have all the modern conveniences but it makes up for all of that with the little things, like service and friendliness. Never had to wait more than ten seconds for an elevator. Staff always said, welcome home and opened the door and smiled. Rooms were small and but extra clean and quiet. Would never consider staying anywhere else. The wine and cheese in the evening and the breakfast in the morning was extra nice. 

The location of the hotel is also fantastic. Right by Times Square, although that can get intense but there are some good places to eat, in fact the hamburger/steak house right next door is very good. Try the tuna its wonderful. If you don't mind walking a few blocks there is dynamite Mexican place called Anejo.Shopping is good too, Swatch shop right around the corner.

title: A wonderful time in Casablanca
text: The staff was superb, the location is great, the room was lovely, the ambience is warm and welcoming. We had a number of guests who also enjoyed the ambience and staff. Our meetings were served by staff quietly and discreetly since we had professional sports figures in and out.

title: another great 4 night stay in the best hotel in NYC!
text: We just finished another Mom/Daughter Broadway blow-out week in NYC and had another wonderful stay at our absolute favorite hotel in the city.  The hotel is beautiful and comfortable but the staff and the breakfast/wine cheese afternoon make this the only place we will ever stay when we come to the city.  Great location and an amazing staff and the beds are super comfy! I highly recommend the Casablanca to anyone I know that is going to the city. Outstanding!

title: An amazing hotel in the heart of Times Square
text:
We have just returned from a 10 day stay here and I cannot fault one thing about this hotel.

The staffs attention to detail is wonderful and nothing is ever too much bother for them. For example, I informed them that my partner is disabled.Upon arrival we were discreetly shown where a wheelchair is kept if needed (it came in really handy) and the bathroom had had handrails (removable) strategically put up for safety. You always felt as though the staff were interested in you as people and not going through the motion of simply doing the customer service bit. They made you genuinely feel happy when returning to the hotel.

The room, although small, was really comfortable and well appointed. I'd requested an inner room rather than be at the front of the hotel. Therefore, there wasn't loads of natural light, but this really didn't bother us. The beds and the pillows were really comfortable too. I've actually taken the details of the company that the pillows come from as I want some for home!! Maid service was superb and a little weather report card and chocolates placed on your bed each evening was lovely.

Ricks cafe was a haven of a wonderful breakfast each morning and retreat throughout the day and evening. As it's a small hotel guests were chatty and it was nice to compare things that we'd done throughout the day and be given tips/advice on other tings to do. It was great getting in late evening and having the opportunity to sit and have a tea/coffee with sweet treat before retiring for the evening. The wine and cheese time each day was wonderful. It was nice to sit and chat in a lovely relaxing environment before heading out for the night.

I really could continue to sing the virtues of the oasis in the heart of the mad, bustling, packed and noisy Times Square, but I would simply say to you now, just book and find out for yourself. It might not be the cheapest but it's certainly the best and you'll get full value for money during your stay.

title: 居心地良いホテル
text:
１人旅行、到着日から２泊利用しました。みなさんが書いているおとり、ラウンジも使い勝手が良く、立地もびっくりするくらい便利でした！！時差ボケで、なかなかねれなくて小腹が空いても、24時間ラウンジ空いているので、お茶やコーヒーやちょっとしたクロワッサンなどを取りに行けたので、良かったです。少し、高いかな？とも思いますが、観光地で、外に出ている時間も長いので、帰ってきてホッとできるホテルで良いと思いました！
Thank you for everything. I had a very nice stay there. Ill be back soon.

title: This is a sad, depressing hotel
text:
First off, I admit I’m a princess, so take that into account.  We’ve been to the Library Hotel — part of the Library Collection — which we very much liked, so decided to try another of the collection, the Casablanca, in part because it received even better reviews.  For the life of me, I don’t understand how this could be so.

Let me start with the positives:  1.  The staff was very nice and responded quickly to my requests for another towel and, in general very responsive to my needs.  2.  The bed was comfortable.  3. The bathroom seemed to have been recently renovated and, although small, was very adequate.

The negatives, however, left a far greater impression.  The “theme” as the name of the hotel suggests was only vaguely apparent — some tiles in the bathroom, in the elevator and in the lobby along with some poor art work of Casa Blanca constituted the full extent of Morocco.  The elevator — only one was working — was extremely slow to arrive and was jerky in stopping, leaving me grateful I arrived.  The best way for me to describe the room Is “sorry”!  It was dark with one small window in the corner that was mostly filled with an air conditioning unit and looked out onto a “courtyard” but reminded my of a tenement building looking into another hotel room.  The room, although clean, seemed dark and dingy.  Everything was “decorated” in shades of brown.  The air conditioner was extremely noisy and, although it cooled the room, it did not take the humidity out.  On another note, the continental breakfasts, which were included in the price, were extremely minimal and uninspired.

I was extremely disappointed in this hotel.  As I previously stated, it received better views than the Library Hotel and was slightly more expensive.  I will never go there again.

title: Perfect Location, Great Staff
text: Imagine a quiet little hotel, 100 feet from Times Square.  Continental breakfast with fresh fruits and pastries, wine and cheese every evening and a staff that will do whatever it takes to make your stay memorable.  Too good to true?  Nope, its Casablanca!

title: A real gem of a hotel, the "Raffles" of NYC
text:
This hotel has everything going for it, location, comfort and most important outstanding service.
The staff are welcoming and friendly with out being "gushy" and most helpful.  Our friends who met us in NYC were welcome for wine and nibbles. I have never had guests join us for wine and nibbles in the club lounge as a courtesy of the hotel. Our flight was delayed and we missed one night at the hotel. We were not charged for this night.
Our bags were left behind in Frankfurt and the hotel staff helped us to get them.
I can not recommend the Casablanca highly enough as a destination hotel in NYC.
Our most sincere thanks to all staff.
kindest regards
Sue and Rick Todd

title: location great but some rooms are very noisy
text:
a little bit outdated hotel but on a great location. We had 2 rooms .  One room at the streetside was very noisy because every night around 5 o clock some company makes a lot of noise during 1-2 hours
it was very nice to have free wine and cheese at the end of the day.
Friendly personel also!

title: Casablanca Hotel; A Best Kept Secret!
text: My wife and I just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Casablanca Hotel near Time Square.  As I mentioned in my Title, the Casablanca is a "Best Kept Secret".  We discovered this wonderful hotel during our research of places to stay for our trip to NYC.  Well, we were not even close to being disappointed!  The staff starting with the General Manager, John and the wonderful people working alongside him to include Brian, Christian, Tarek, JC, Stanley, Margaret to name a few wrote the book on customer service.  You feel like home while staying at this hotel.  What's more, the stay includes some outstanding amenities like an expanded continental breakfast in the morning and a beautiful wine and cheese happy hour in the evening from 5-8pm.  During the happy hour we had the pleasure of meeting some wonderful folks like Margaret who went above and beyond to make you feel like family.  She and the other young gals hosting the happy hour and breakfast in the morning take pride in their jobs and it definitely shows in their positive and caring attitudes towards all the guests enjoying this wonderful hotel. Of course, one of the best parts of staying at the Casablanca was the fact that you are only a few steps from Time Square and all the wonderful activities it has to share.  In closing, I just want to once again say how much we appreciated the great atmosphere provided by the Casablanca staff.  You all treated us like family and went out of your way to ensure our stay was memorable.  Thanks again for setting a high bar for the hospitality industry.  We will see you again on our return trip to the "Big Apple."  Lee and Shelley

title: Haven of tranquility
text:
We’ve just spent 4 nights in early August at hotel Casablanca. As a family of 4 from the UK this has been an amazing hotel for us. The staff are incredibly kind and welcoming, the food in Rick’s cafe is great and the whole environment is a wonderful contrast to the business (and craziness!) of Times Square! The location is incredible too - so unbelievable that Times Square is only a few steps from the front door!

Our room was lovely also - a family room with two double beds and a pull out, meaning we’ve all had plenty of space to spread out. This is a brilliant hotel for anyone looking to hit NYC for a few days.

title: Location, location, location!
text:
Stayed here for two nights with my 18 year old for a whirlwind mom and daughter visit to NYC, where she had never been.  Always felt secure at the hotel and going to and from there to the normal tourist attractions of the city.  Times Square is just steps away, but far enough away to not be crazy loud.  

The staff is super friendly and helpful for recommendations and info about the area.  Loved having “Rick’s Cafe” open 24/7 for drinks and snacks.  The room was clean and cozy but not cramped.  I would definitely stay here again on my next visit!

title: An oasis in the middle of Times Square
text:
I stayed solo from July 24 to 29.  If you want or need to be right in the thick of things in Times Square, yet have a peaceful place to relax and recharge, the boutique  Casablanca Hotel is it!  My deluxe Queen room was small but not cramped so I recommend the "deluxe" designation for any room you get.  I had one of the interior rooms with a view facing a wall and windows of other rooms to the side across the way.  That was okay since it's not like I spent a lot of time in the room staring out the window.  The a/c is noisy but that didn't bother me since I didn't need it that much so I didn't have to blast the TV to hear over it.  But if I had to, I could have slept with it on all night b/c I'm not a light sleeper.  The bathroom was smallish but I expected that. However, there should be a bar to hold on to as you get in and out of the tub/shower and more "non-skid" protection in the bathtub.  I wear shower shoes because of foot issues so I was okay and held onto the sink getting in and out.  The elevators jerk a little when stopping at different floors but I got used to it since I arrived safely each time!

The hotel is expensive for the size of and the quality of decor and amenities  but New York (Manhattan in particular) is very expensive in general.  If you want Ritz-Carlton style, you will surely pay $1000 or more a night in this town.  Plus, at Times Square you're in tourist central of New York City.  I'm sure all those businesses have to pay high rent to be there so they have to charge you what they do.  I was happy with my room.

The nightly wine and cheese in Rick's Cafe was delightful and you can get coffee, little pastries, cookies and fruit from there all day.  Didn't get a chance to try the continental breakfast during my stay because my conference workshops at the Marquis Marriott 3 blocks away (too expensive for me!) started early and I would just eat fruit I'd taken from the Cafe the night before.  All of the staff were very pleasant and helpful.  Times Square was crazy crowded but as soon as you turn the corner onto 43rd Street and walk a few paces to Casablanca's entrance, it was like entering another world.  I loved it!  I would recommend this charming hotel to anyone who would enjoy the boutique experience over the big corporate hotel chains.

title: Excellent stay
text: Our stay was wonderful right from the beginning.  The concierge greeted us when we arrived and our bags were brought to our rooms after we checked in. The room was very clean and was cleaned thoroughly each day by the staff.  The facility was surprisingly nice for a small hotel venue in the center of Times Square.

title: Outstanding Times Square treasure
text: Casablanca is a beautiful boutique hotel. The staff are super friendly. The place is clean and the room we had was very comfortable and roomy for New York City. It offers a lovely sitting room and offers free breakfast with free wine, cheese and snacks every afternoon and early evening. Water, fruit and cookie treats are out the rest of the time. You can ask for a coffee maker, refrigerator and I believe a microwave to be placed in the room. The hotel is just off Broadway and it is easy to get to a lot of attractions. I booked our room in February and noticed prices dropping at the end of March. The management worked with me and upgraded our room when asked about adjusting the price. Worth every penny we paid to stay here.

title: NYC Cassablanca
text: The Casablanca stay in NYC was again fabulous. The location, adjacent to Times square is central and places you in the middle of the Show districts with easy walking to the shopping, metro and Broadway. The staff are excellent and need to be commended, they are friendly nd helpful and made our two stays a pleasure.

title: Great Times Square Get-Away
text: My husband and I didn't want to drive the hour home from a night of theater and decided to stay someplace close to the theater. The Casablanca Hotel was perfect.  It's a small boutique hotel just steps away from Times Square, yet upon entering you had no idea where you were.  The staff was friendly, hotel was charming and the rooms were immaculate and quiet.   Wine and cheese were served in the charming living area for happy hour and there was a  lovely continental breakfast in the morning.  We will definitely come back the next time we come into town for theater!

title: A jewel in NY
text:
It’s our second time at Casablanca Hotel. This time our 2 teens were with us. The room is not large, but comfortable. Breakfast included was good and the happy hour with wine and cheese is a must. 
Location is perfect. Despite its almost in the middle of TimeSq the rooms are very silent.
And the staff is just one of the best in the world. Our special thanks to manager John, who was born for this job.
We often go to NY and this is the best hotel choice

title: Small compact yet great hotel.
text: Apart from noisy air conditioning we had a fantastic time. Continental breakfast included was a great way to start the day.  As was the free wine and cheese late afternoon.  Staff were extremely helpful with directions and provided extra bottles of cold water.

title: Familiäres Hotel in super Lage
text:
Sehr gemütliches Hotel mit super Service und zentraler Lage. Gutes Frühstück und Happy Hour mit Sekt/Wein und Käse. Wirklich empfehlenswert hinsichtlich Preis/Leistung und Location. 
Außergewöhnlich freundliche Rezeption und sehr aufmerksam.

title: Great Location
text: We had a great stay. We arrived early and they held our bags for us while we toured the city. Great friendly service and a nice smile every time we returned. Great to help with suggestions and directions. Very quiet for being in the heart of Times Square. Steps from everything. We enjoyed the breakfast in the morning and the big hit for the whole family was the coffee machine. The rooms are small but it is NYC.

title: Would never stay anywhere else in NYC!!!!
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights as we were getting married in Central Park during our stay.  From the beginning the staff made this an even more special trip!  They even ensured we had some prosecco in our room to celebrate our wedding!  Breakfast was varied and tasty and the happy hour was a lovely touch to relax after a typical hectic NYC day.  The rooms are bug enough, particularly grid sized bathrooms with effective A/C which was needed!  It is quite dated in style but that just adds to the charm of the place!  Having been to NYC nearly 10 times, we would only every stay here from now on.  
Thank you to ALL the staff who made our stay so memorable!

title: Amazing!
text: We stayed at the Casablanca based on Trip Advisor reviews and were so glad we did. All the staff are amazing and all the little personal touches they put on your stay really make it special. All of the food included in the resort fee was excellent.

title: Always Like Coming Home!
text: Hotel is situated only a few steps from Times Square but also so convenient for anywhere in the city. Wonderful selection for breakfast and the cheese and wine each night is a lovely way to rest before venturing out again. We have been 8 times from Australia and would also stay at the Casablanca when in NYC. The main thing that stands out is the staff! They always go out of their way to assist you and are genuinely friendly and caring. All rooms are clean and comfortable and the mini suite is fantastic if you are staying with children. The front rooms can be a little noisey early morning if there are building works happening across from the hotel but does not always happen. Overall, an absolutely fantastic hotel and we have always came away planning when we can next visit the wonderful staff of the Casablanca Hotel and NYC!

title: Honeymoon in New York!!
text:
We booked this hotel for our honeymoon after reading the amazing reviews on trip advisor. 
The location of the hotel is amazing, right on Times Square and walking distance to lots of major attractions and subway. If you are going to New York and would prefer to be somewhere quieter then I would suggest choosing a different location.
The room we had was cosy and clean and had excellent facilities that most hotels would not offer as standard. The bed was extremely comfortable. My only criticism about the room would be the air conditioning unit could only be used when the window was open. This did not affect us too much as there is also a ceiling fan which we used so we could not hear the street below by shutting the window. Our towels were replenished twice a day which was a really nice surprise and the lady who cleaned our room for us did an excellent job, the room was always spotless when we returned for the day. On arrival we were given a bottle of red wine and a bottle of prosecco from the hotel as a gift for being newlyweds which was not expected and really thoughtful. We also got two bottles of water in our room everyday. 
The hotel offer cheese and wine everyday between 5 and 8pm in the lounge area which is free. We only managed to do this one day during our trip due to other plans. The wine was of good quality and it was a really nice spread of different cheeses and biscuits and fresh fruit and olives etc.  
Everything is great about this hotel but its biggest asset is its staff. We were greeted with a very warm welcome on arrival by Chris who was staffing the front desk. During our visit we met several other members of staff who were also extremely friendly and always made the effort to greet us as we arrived at the hotel and chatted to us about our day. 
We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York, we had a wonderful stay.

title: Great place!
text: I am NOT a city girl and was traveling alone with my 13 year old (her first time in the city). We felt extremely comfortable in this hotel. Everyone was so friendly, and it was convenient to walk to Times Square, HAMILTON at the Richard Rogers theatre, and dinner at Bryant Park Grille. Even Central Park is a walkable destination IMO. This is a great little hotel for those who like a smaller more intimate setting in the big city! We were even upgraded to a suite and given a complimentary bottle of wine as I had mentioned we were celebrating a birthday! The birthday girl was only thirteen but her mom appreciated the gesture!

title: Arrived at 1am and relocated to another hotel at 7am
text:
This was a total disaster for me and my family. The room could not even fit our luggage let alone us.

Never again!

The photos and many other reviews on tripadvisor look nothing like what this place is when you arrive.

title: Vacation trip
text: Very nice hotel. Would recommend to anybody traveling to NYC. The location was great for site seeing. It was very clean, great personnel, good breakfasts and snacks. Just wish we had more time to spend there. There will definitely be a next time!!!!!!

title: Made our holiday x
text: A massive thank you to Brian and all the staff ,we had a suite on 6 th floor ,well appointed and plenty of room for three ladies ,loved availability of coffeee in the early hours,breakfast and especially the cheese and wine including Prosecco at the early evening,before going out in the evening ,a safe haven in the midst of the blackout ,before we knew what was happening ,helpful ,happy ,engaging staff ,thank you to you all for adding to our New York experience xx😘💋🍏🗽🍾🍾🥂

title: Service, service, service!
text: More service than we have had anywhere! Very friendly staff who advised and assisted us with transportation and reservations perfectly! Love the continental breakfast and happy hours hors d’oeuvres. Can’t beat the 24 hr Espresso and Lattes! Furniture and decor is a little worn but everything is clean and has a lot of character!

title: Casablanca is a Great Value
text: Stayed at Casablanca for a business trip.  Hotel was very quiet, rooms were small but very comfortable.  Coffee and snacks are available in the lounge 24/7.  Lounge is a great setup for a meeting or to just sit on your own.  Wireless throughout the hotel was very good.  Staff everywhere were friendly and helpful.

title: Casablanca continues to deliver
text: Second time staying here and never disappointed. When they say “you are family” deliver. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Great value when comparing the amenities offered to other large chain hotels. The staff is extremely attentive beginning with opening the door when you enter.

title: Hot stuff in Casablanca
text: Great hotel in hot New York. So good to get back to this small friendly and comfortable hotel after a hot day in New York. Continental breakfast and cheese and wine from 5-8 pm every night was ideal. All staff were very friendly and helpful.

title: A great hotel in Midtown NYC
text:
The Casablanca is an excellent choice if you are looking to stay in the theater district or near Times Square.  It is a block and a half from the subway station (1 line).  
This is a small, boutique property that has excellent service and clean, comfortable rooms.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Perfect stay in NYC
text:
We love the Casablanca and are frequent visitors.  It has everything we need. It is perfectly located and has a friendly and attentive staff. The beds are comfortable and roomy.  
Most of all, this hotel is spotless.  The housekeeping staff is to be commended.

title: Great Time in New York City
text: The Casablanca Hotel is a great place to stay when visiting New York City.  The staff is wonderful and everyone was kind, professional, and helpful.  They found us great restaurants, the accommodations were perfect, and they made us feel welcomed every time we entered the hotel.  We loved the wine and cheese happy hour and loved the continental breakfast.  The three of us stayed in the two bed suite with a pullout couch; this was perfect.  We will definitely stay at the Casablanca Hotel next we visit New York.

title: Great family visit
text: We had a great time with our family of 5, including three young kids. The staff was great and the service and rooms were great!  The location can not be beat, and the attached restaurant, Tony’s, was excellent. Thanks to all the staff who made our trip memorable!

title: Perfect hotel in a perfect spot
text:
We have just returned home today after 4 nights at Casablanca Hotel.  We had 3 double rooms as holidaying with our grown up children and their spouses.  All staff at the hotel were warm and welcoming and it was a truly delightful stay.  Housekeeping was excellent and breakfast and wine and cheese in the late afternoon was a perfect addition. The hotel although very handy for Times Square was situated on a quieter street.  This will be our “go to” hotel from now on when in New York and would highly recommend it to family and friends.  Do not hesitate to book this hotel if you are looking for a central stay.  

The only downside was one of our rooms suffered with some street noise and we were advised of this at check in.  Ear plugs and sound machine were available.

Thank you to the whole team at Casablanca for an enjoyable stay.

title: Pretty perfect
text: Wanted to stay here for 9 years running and finally did.  It feels like you are in a very nice apartment close to everything.  Inches away from the madness of time square but felt like miles away with how quiet and cozy it was.

title: Welcome Home!
text: Our first experience as we walked in the lobby was "Welcome Home" from the wonderful staff at Casablanca Hotel.  The hotel is so warm and friendly, that we just loved it.  Little extras in the room were a bonus and the wine and cheese in the evenings was much appreciated!  We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to New York City!!!

title: Wonderful visit - highly recommend
text: Just traveled here with my family and was so pleased with this hotel. We traveled with our three young kids and this hotel was perfect. We had a suite and it was so spacious and clean. The bathroom was also very nice. The free breakfast and wine and cheese/snacks was clutch for traveling with kids. The staff was very kind and the location is great. Even though it’s off Times Square, it was not very noisy or crowded, other than normal street sounds. The proximity to transportation was also excellent. Would definitely recommend and visit again.

title: Simply the best
text: Great attentive staff who did everything they could to cater for my special diet (Gluten and Lactose free).  Very friendly.  It was great just to be able to pop back for a free coffee or snack at anytime.  This also is about 20 metres from Times Square so great location.  Rooms are very comfortable and clean.

title: Broadway weekend
text: We’ve stayed several times at Casablanca and it never disappoints.  Great staff, location and breakfast and evening wine .  Snacks and cookies all day on second floor lounge.  Walking distance to everything you need in Times Square area.

title: An Oasis of Paradise
text: A hidden gem in the heart of Times Square!  They’ve mastered providing peace and serenity in the heart of the city that never sleeps.  The accommodations, amenities and most of all, the staff, are second to none! All the luxuries and comforts of home make us return again and again and again! Thank you Casablanca- for another incredible stay!

title: A hidden gem
text: Went to Casablanca based on other reviews. Not the newest, not the biggest, but a cozy place that makes everyone feel like they are at home, with great amenities (like continental breakfast and wine and cheese daily, and an open room with coffee and snacks all the time). Their attached restaurant is wonderful as well (Tony's di Napoli - think a cheaper and maybe better Carmine's).

title: A little gem in NYC
text: Fantastic property in the heart of NYC but without the noise! Discreetly tucked away in a side street off Times Square. Staff are excellent and go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable. Definitely a hotel that's home from home wouldn't stay anywhere else.

title: Happy to be back
text: Fifth time staying here. Lots of charm with the Moroccan decor , great location and friendly staff. Love Rick’s Cafe - great spot to hang out when I’m not out in the streets of NYC. Has a nice little outdoor space

title: Great hotel!
text: . No complaints at all! Highly recommend! Would definitely return.Great location, large continental breakfast with attentive staff. Wonderful wine and cheese. Would definitely return. Price very reasonable.

title: Family one of a kind trip.
text: Outstanding amenities services and staff.willdo it again. Recommend to my friends. Front desk people were unbelievable. Vincent was great. The hotel itself was what I expected and even more. Don’t change anything

title: Excellent
text: We have just stayed at this hotel for three nights. It is amazing. Centrally located near Time Square, superb staff, lovely room and brilliant breakfast. We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It’s central location is a real asset.

title: My husbands 1st time in NYC
text: I have grown up going to New York. Most of my family is from there. My family and I went on a road trip to Time Square and decided to stay at the Casablanca Hotel. I absolutely loved it. It wasn’t overly commercialized and I like that. It is only 5 stories so keep that in mind. You can still have a nice view of the city. I  definitely stay here again when I come back.

title: "Welcome Home!"
text:
My wife Marie and I had the recent pleasure to spend a week at the luxurious Casablanca Hotel Times Square.
Firstly, I must mention the staff - or should I say family - they are all SO friendly, helpful, well-represented, cheerful, smiling (can people REALLY be so happy at their job?).
From our arrival until our departure, we were made to feel part of the 'family' and on our return from our first exploratory venture out with the hotel, we were greeted with "Welcome home!" - a really nice touch.
Situated just a few yards from Times Square on Broadway, the location is unbeatable.
Room was spotless and well maintained.
Free coffee, cookies and pastries are available 24/7 in Rick's Cafe on first level.
Continental buffet breakfast catered for all tastes.
Special highlight is the three hour "cheese and wine evening" each night when guests - many of whom are regulars - meet and socialise whilst being kept replenished with wine, cheese, savouries and dips.
You are not restricted in any way to just one or two glasses either. Delightful staff will approach and offer you endless refills.
Room is turned down each evening and a card with weather forecast for following day is placed in room with a few chocolates - a lovely touch.
Upon our (reluctant) return home we received a message from Casablanca Hotel saying, "Welcome to the family - you are now part of it!" 
This brought a nostalgic tear to Marie's eye.
Yes... we shall return (home) to the enchanting Casablanca Hotel.

title: Great location and great service
text:
We stayed three nights. We found the staff very friendly and helpful through out our stay. The location just off Time Square again fab.
One of the best features was the lounge on the first floor where breakfast is served and is open 24hrs for a coffee and a biscuit. The evening cheese and wine is a very nice touch as well. I must say for a continental breakfast it was great, toasted bagel, cream cheese and boiled egg very scummy....but plenty of fruit, cereals and danish's also available.
Our one downer, and its very much a US thing, the double glazing keeps no noise out!! And being in the middle of NYC.......its 24hrs noise!! Not helped by us having a front room on a lower floor. Large HGV's came and went all night to the building opposite and thought nothing of using air horns at any time of the night!! But it's NYC!!
We picked us a car put it in the garage next door for the last night which was so handy and you get a deal with the hotel!!

title: Top Notch
text: Let me first start out by saying I have stayed in several NYC hotels for business and the Casablanca Hotel was incredible. Centrally located, clean rooms, kind and accommodating staff. They also had extra touches that made the trip so special. I would recommend staying here and would come back and only stay here again. Thank you for the memorable 10 year anniversary visit. You made it memorable and it was amazing.

title: 3 Weeks of Bliss
text:
Love this place.
I have traveled World Wide for over 30 years with my job.
My wife and i love New York and stay at The Casablanca Hotel for around 3 weeks each June for many years. The staff are outstanding, Rooms are great, breakfast is full on awesome.

title: Excellent Reviews Confirmed, True 5 STAR
text: Perfect Times Square location. Coming in from Penn Station, take subway 1,2,3 uptown to next stop, look for 43 & Broadway exit, this will take you Times Square, across the street from Hotel. Bags held until our room was ready while we got drinks at Bryant Park outside bar- be sure to visit the Park- summer or winter, 2 blocks away. Wine & cheese buffet, breakfast buffet as advertised - very nice sit down at Ricks lounge area on second floor. Our Premium King room perfect size and large for NY. Bathroom was spacious. We were in front, early AM construction noises could be annoying, but we are used to getting up early. Noises do come thru window air conditioner- suggest rear rooms may be quieter. No views from window. Pull down room darkening shades a plus for Times Square lights. Super friendly service as all previous reviewers mentioned. We did order the room refrigerator. No ice machine but ice could be ordered. Also ice is always at the lounge area with cookies, espresso , ice water, newspapers. No shows for us this trip, be sure to go to TKTS for same day tickets. One subway ( #7) stop away from Hudson Yards where we went up the amazing Vessel. A few block walk to bus to Met Museum. For meals, same block we recommend Heartland brew pub- steaks, Brooklyn Diner. Tony's and Lobster & Burger also on same block. Casablanca reminded us of all the great things of a European river cruise, like a family B&B. Highly Recommended,

title: Second Time Staying Here - will stay again
text: Great location if you want to be right in Times Square; wonderful breakfast and wine/cheese reception; clean/comfortable room, large bathroom; staff great - we walked from Penn Station on a very hot day, when we arrived to check in, the doorman got us cold, bottled water.  All the staff is excellent; friendly, welcoming.   Definitely a great place to stay in NYC!

title: very good, nice centrally located hotel
text: It was our first stay at Casablanca Hotel but definitly not the last. The staff was very kind and the room very clean -thanks for good housekeeping. The included breakfast was of a very good quality. We enjoyed it much and the staff there was also very helpful. In the afternoon there was a daily wine and cheese reception which was also great.

title: Casablanca hotel
text: Second time at Casablanca hotel, best hotel at all aspects , the staff and the service were great, the location is great near time square, Next time in nyc we definitely take this hotel again Thank you

title: Fantastic Hotel in a Great Location!
text:
I needed a hotel for the last night of my New York stay and wanted to be near the Lyric Theater since I was attending Cursed Child and thought it would be nice to relax in my room between parts. The Casablanca Hotel seemed to fit the bill and the reviews were fantastic so I booked it!

From the minute I walked into the hotel, I was impressed. The staff couldn't have been more gracious and welcoming. In fact, not even 5 minutes after I checked in, there was a knock on my door from the Housekeeping Manager ensuring my room was to my liking and handing me some chocolates as well as a card with the next day's weather. It was a much appreciated little detail! The bellman brought my luggage up shortly after that and it was obvious that he didn't expect a tip (although I did try to give him one). 

The hotel is one block away from the hustle and bustle of Time Square and the Theater District while still quiet and quaint. The rooms seem to be very sound-proof which I appreciated and they were well appointed.

I also loved the cocktail hour with complementary wine, cheese, and fruit which could be enjoyed in your room or in the dining area adjacent to their library. 

One thing to note - this is an older hotel so the elevators are slow and a little rickety. In addition, the room I stayed in had a window air conditioner which did not do much to take the humidity out of the room but did cool it down considerably. 

All-in-all, I couldn't have loved this hotel more and just wish my stay could have been longer!

title: Memorable boutique hotel
text: I , along with a friend, stayed in this hotel for the weekend in June. I discovered and booked through Expedia. It was lovely!!! Room was adequate in space as well as bathroom and well appointed in decor.  Hotel was decorated in Moroccan style befitting its name. Breakfast service daily in mezzanine level with excellent service and food was delicious. Not only this but daily afternoon wine, tea, and hor doevres with excellent waitress service. Was in NYC for a memorial service but this hotel was quite a find. Will definitely stay on future visits.

title: If I can’t get a reservation at Casablanca - i’m not going to NYC
text: I believe this was my 5th visit to this hotel. It’s just a gem in the hub of Times Square - yet incredibly safe. I often travel alone and I never feel unsafe or uncomfortable. Every member of staff is competent, respectful and polite.

title: Fun weekend with friends
text: Casablanca is a great small hotel. This is my 2nd time there & will continue to use when in NY City. It is located in Time Square so convenient to everything.They have a free continental breakfast & afternoon cookies & coffee.

title: Customer Service Extraordinaire
text: This small boutique hotel, located one-half block from Times Square, in the heart of the Theatre District, completely exceeded our expectations.  This was our first time staying at the Casablanca and we both agreed, this is where we will stay for return visits.  The entire staff, no matter their position or responsibility, went above and beyond to make sure our stay was enjoyable.  When booking the room, we let them know we'd be in town for a birthday celebration and attending a Yankees game.  They so graciously had a complimentary bottle of Prosecco and red wine in our room, accompanied by happy birthday wishes!  We also requested a mini fridge for our room. It was installed and ready to go upon our arrival.  You know how some hotels have bottled water in your room for $5 or more a bottle?  Not here. Those were also complimentary and replenished each day, as well as chocolates left in our room each evening.  We weren't certain of the best way to get to Yankee stadium - they gave explicit instructions on the use of the subway, which Metro card to purchase, directions to the closest stop and the most direct route to and from the game (it couldn't have been easier).  The complimentary Continental breakfast each morning was delicious, including juices, cereal, yogurt, pastries and bagels, fresh fruit and eye-opening coffee (the "breakfast ladies" were so gracious and accommodating each morning).  Sadly, we were only able to enjoy a quick glass of wine one evening, but all the accoutrements looked so yummy, we'll be sure to make time for this next visit.   After reading other reviews, we were a bit leery of using the parking garage next door, but again, there were no issues and the hotel staff made sure we received the discount for hotel guests.  A special shout out to Victor (best doorman ever) - he made sure we had everything we needed, no request was too big or too small and his quick bite recommendations were spot on.

title: First class
text: We stayed here for a long weekend and was very impressed with the hotel , the staff were excellent, very friendly and couldn’t do enough for us . Rooms were very nice, clean and comfortable. Location was a few steps from Times Square, would definitely recommend and would stay here again . 1st class!!!

title: Excellent hotel
text: This was our 4th visit to the hotel. Once again really enjoyed our stay. Good facilities in the room. Breakfast and cheese and wine at night both good. Like that you can have tea/coffee all day. We checked out in the morning morning and left our bags but staff told us to use as our home until we needed to leave which was a nice touch. On the corner of times square but an oasis of calm compared to everything happening outside. Would definitely recommend hopefully will be able to visit again.

title: Wonderful quant hotel
text:
On arrival it felt like a oasis in the middle of Times Square. So quiet when you walked in the door! 
The staff are extremely friendly & attentive.
Love the fact you are offered such an amazing array of breakfast, coffee, wine & cheese during the day at no additional cost. Such a lovely touch in the middle of the US!
Tea & coffee making facilities in the room which consisted of a kettle, first one in 5 hotels I had stayed in, in the US this trip. Normally those awful Nespresso machines!
Room clean & all toiletries included in the bathroom.
The only issue I personally had at this hotel was the noise from the window air conditioning unit, issue of staying in the US I guess!
All in all a great small hotel with lovely staff & extra’s which you would not find normally! Very much enjoyed my stay.

title: Wonderful stay in Times Square
text: Great location. Very friendly, professional staff that excelled at meeting our every need. Great recommendations for places to eat within easy walking distance of the hotel. We wish we could have stayed longer!

title: Superb Hotel in the heart of the theater district
text: Great location in Times Square, easy walk to all of the Broadway theaters.  The included breakfasts, all day snacks and coffee, and the 5PM wine and chess etc is a great time saver and oh so convenient.  We ordered dinner from Tony Di Napolis next door, and had dinner at the Casablanca sipping wine etc.  Made it very easy to have a relaxed dinner and still get to our Broadway show.  The staff is very friendly, helpful, and accommodating.  We WILL be back!!

title: A wonderful oasis!
text: The Casablanca Hotel is a gem. Located in midtown Manhattan, it is literally steps from Times Square. Stanley & Victor greeted us and we felt so welcome from the moment we stepped through the foyer. Maria, who assisted at breakfast as wonderful. It is a lovely place to enjoy a NYC vacation.

title: Great Hotel with great location
