text: I loved that the hotel is just off Times Square.  You get all the convenience of the location but do not hear all the hustle of Times Square.  Breakfast is good and the evening wine and cheese is delightful to make the transition from a day of sightseeing to going out to see a play.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Ideal location, very friendly and helpful staff. From the minute we arrived we received excellent service. Having the choice at breakfast was brilliant as was the afternoon cheese and wine. It was also excellent to be able to get tea and coffee 24 hours a day!

title: Excellent Hotel and Services!!!
text: I just spent 5 nights at the Casablanca.  I was traveling with my Aunt and wanted her to have a special first-time trip to NYC.  The Casablanca did not disappoint.  First, prior to even arriving at the hotel, Brian Castro provided a ton of information to help us plan for our trip.  He also allowed us to select from a variety of services, such as arranged transportation, refrigerator in the room, foam toppers and foam pillows for the bed, makeup mirror and so much more!  He knew that I wanted this to be a special trip....and when we opened the door to our suite, a bottle of wine and glasses treated us.  After we had unloaded our luggage, we went back to the desk and throughout our entire trip, had excellent assistance from Johan at the desk.  He helped us set up the Big Bus Tour, made recommendations on where to eat, showed us maps of how to get there and more.  He was truly exceptional as well!  It was a delight to see him at the front desk each of the five nights that we were there.  We took advantage of the morning breakfast, which was light, but everything was neatly arranged and served with such kindness.  We even used this second floor dining area to bring back food and sat at the tables available to have a nice lunch.  And our room, we had booked a suite room, which was nice to have the extra size.  We had one room with two double beds, another room like a living room and then the bathroom.  Was perfect to meet our needs.  If I ever get a chance to come back to NYC, I would not even consider staying anywhere else but the Casablanca!!!

title: Ritz prices and Motel6 rooms and that might be an insult to Motel6
text:
We booked this place because of the excellent reviews. How wrong them reviews were. This place is overrated.
- rooms conditions like earliest 1930’s.
- Dark tiny cold and very noisy room, thank goodness to my sleeping pill, or I wouldn’t have been able to sleep!!
- No coffee maker neither a fridge in the room, this means if you want your morning coffee, you have to put your clothes on, and venture down to the overcrowded breakfast room (POS The ladies there were very nice especially Maria).
- No heat in the bathroom 
- Weak internet 
The prices were very high, and the hotel didn’t live up to expectations. With all of the options in New York, there are much better places for less money.

title: Casablanca Hotel at Time Square
text: Great location & accommodations. It was Central to everything we needed in the Broadway Theater District. The decor was beautiful. The Complimentary amenities were perfect. All in all it was great for our stay in NYC.

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text: Casablanca is the best hotel in NYC. I have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan, and we keep going back here. It is in a great location, right in the heart of Times Square, but very quiet and intimate. Breakfast is included, as is wine and cheese every evening, and a piano player on Friday nights. It is a hidden gem in Times Square.

title: Pros and Cons from Frequent NYC Visitors
text:
Pros include breakfast, happy hour, knowledgeable front desk employees, and cleanliness.  

Cons include dated decor, small rooms, slow and BUMPY elevators, frosted windows, loud air conditioner, resort fee, and no notification for early check-in.  It's a little too far south for most of the theaters.  We also didn't like the fact that they demanded payment up front, months in advance, with Expedia.

title: Outstanding Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Times Square
text: This is the most beautiful hotel filled with characters and charm. As the name suggests the decor is largely Moroccan. It’s quaint but full of character. The staff are exceptional and the customer service outstanding.

title: Best Hotel in NYC
text: ALL the staff were wonderful. Everyone went out of their way to help you.  Fantastic location. I would not look for another hotel when you plan your trip to New York City.  Even my husband said we need to come back here, he never has any input...just goes.

title: Favorite when visiting the city.
text: Love this hotel for convenience, amenities, and staff.  This is our third trip to this hotel and look forward to our next visit.  The breakfast and nightly wine and cheese our outstanding in a comfortable setting.

title: Casablanca Hotel NYC
text: We have stayed at this hotel several times when traveling to NYC.  It is our first choice if available.  We have been very happy with all of the amenities as well as the excellent location, breakfast and happy hour!

title: Location Atmosphere Service
text: Casablanca is perfectly located to Time Square and downtown New York. The hotel theme and boutique style makes you feel at hotel as soon as you walk in! The staff care fir each and every guest, they have return guests and it’s like a family!

title: Amazing staff!!
text: This hotel is a hidden gem right off Times Square. Customer service was EXCELLENT beginning at room booking and continued throughout our entire trip. Rooms were quiet and very clean. The beds were super comfortable!  This is our new go to for our family New York Trips !

title: Great Boutique Hotel.
text: This is a great small hotel.  Feels very upscale yet still has its own personality.  Loved the afternoon happy hour and the continental breakfast.  It feels more like a home in the common spaces than a hotel.  Staff is super service oriented.  We will be back.

title: Wife's 50th birthday trip
text:
If you are looking for a quiet oasis in a storm of activity and noise which is New York then the Casablanca is perfect for you.
I have traveled all over the world in many hotels and this as is close to a home from home experience.
The location is perfect ( just off Times square)
The staff are excellent and will often go that extra mile and they make you feel genuinely welcome and they actually look like they are enjoying their work.
From a great Continental breakfast to mid day snacks, coffee & tea to the lovely wine and cheese early evening treat ( All free) you feel looked after.
The rooms are a good size and are spotless and are cleaned daily with good air con to help you sleep.
i cannot recommend this hotel enough as it ticks all the boxes and it helped make my wife's 50th birthday trip even more special.

title: Friendly hotel and a graet location
text:
This hotel makes one feel "at home". The staff were very friendly and helpful the decor inspires a warm athosphere and small tokens of good will such as happy hour free wine made us feel really welcome.
When in New York we will be happy to come back and stay at the Casablanca Hotel.

title: Still great after all these years
text: We just stayed a few nights at the Casablanca again.  We were supposed to go on a trip with my parents but they unfortunately had to cancel due to my dad's surgery so it just ended up being my wife and me.  This is our 3rd or 4th time staying there and it's still as great as it was the first time.  Staff is SUPER friendly and if you are seeing shows on Broadway, the location is superb.  Love the breakfast every morning and the snacks throughout the day.  Our room was very quiet and everything worked great.  Once my dad heals up, we'd love to get them back to the Casablanca

title: 10 OUT OF 10
text:
I cannot praise this hotel enough.  It is a little oasis in the middle of busy Times Square.  The rooms are small but extremely clean and comfortable.  The staff are amongst the best staff I have ever encountered.  We loved the 'wine and cheese' hour along with the all day coffee and pastries.
The atmosphere in this hotel is truly special and the staff make you feel truly special.  Thank you.

title: Customer Service is their motto!!!
text: Having just returned from a three night stay at this hotel after almost 20 trips to New York, I am speechless! There are no words to describe how wonderful this place is!  From the first phone call to James who made me feel like I was family and welcome beyond words, to arriving to a smiling and “happy to meet me” check in staff person at the front desk, this has been one of the most enjoyable stays ever!  I will never stay anywhere else!  Period.

title: Outstanding Stay
text: This hotel was wonderful and very cozy.  It is located in Times Square. The library room has continuous snacks and drinks. It is a great place to sit, talk, and unwind. The hotel is very clean. The room had a nostalgic look to it, but was not old.  My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: Amazing staff
text:
We have just returned from a 5 
Night stay at the Casablanca hotel. It was a special trip as we were celebrating our 40th anniversary, we picked the Casablanca as it had such good reviews. Check in was quick and friendly but we were so disappointed when we saw the room, it was tiny (even by New York  standard's) and so dark as light from the small window was blocked by the fire escape, the bathroom door when opened hit the bed. We rang down to reception and asked if we could change rooms as we didn't fancy staying in this room for 5 nights, I  had emailed the hotel before we came and told them it was our 40th anniversary but reception said the e-mail wasn't passed on to them. The reception said that they would see what they could do and ring us back shortly. A few minutes later we got a call from Asim the front desk manager who apologised and said he would move us to a superior room for 4nights and we would move to another room the last night even though the hotel was fully booked. This room was much bigger and brighter, he also sent up a bottle of wine and champagne to celebrate our anniversary which was a lovely touch. On our second day Asim met us as we came into the reception area and introduced us to John the hotel manager who asked us if everything was okay and said he would send up an ice cream  cake which was beautiful 
On our last day we changed rooms which was a few doors away and they only difference was it didn't have a street view 
We had a great time in New York in the Casablanca hotel and would definitely go back, the hotel is close to Times square and all the attractions 
Our trip was made special by all the staff from Victor at the door to Ashley and the girls at breakfast to John the manager and especially Asim who made our stay so memorable

title: Honeymoon
text: We chose this hotel for our honeymoon even though 3 seperate travel agents tried to tall us out of it and stay in one of their boring reccomended hotels! And it didnt disappoint i would never stay anywhere else in new york. Fab staff. Fab location. Best coffee in newyork!

title: 5 star staff
text:
The staff is beyond the best!!!! 
Helpful, funny and a delight to interact with.
After 5 night stay, the bkfst gets repetitive; but is tasty.
Wine and cheese delicious and a great way to meet others.
Room and bed were comfortable and there was always hot water for the shower.
We WILL stay again.

title: Fabulous NYC hotel
text: We enjoyed the location being right at Times Square and close to the theaters and local restaurants.. We did not have to use the subway very often, because everything was within walking distance. This was one of the cleanest rooms I've ever stayed in...and I've traveled all over the world. The staff always had a smile on their faces, and eager to assist! Very quiet room. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the afternoon wine and cheese service. This will definitely be my choice of NYC hotel in the future.

title: Lovely Bijou hotel - a quiet oasis of calm in the wonderful madness of New York!
text: Spent 4 nights at the excellent Casablanca hotel at the end of May, our first time in New York. What a treat! A quality and welcoming hotel with  personal touches and a real sense of charm. Attentive and helpful staff, always in hand to assist and advise with a dedication to customer care that was greatly appreciated. Full marks all round, thank you.

title: DON'T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE!!!!
text: Best hotel in New York, a real hidden gem.  They will treat you like family.......no, they treat you BETTER THAN FAMILY.  We had some glitches in our travel arrangements and the Casablanca staff bent over backwards to ensure that our New York trip was fantastic.  If you want the best, stay with the best!!  Casablanca is a wonder home away from home.

title: Safe and clean oasis
text:
This is our fifth stay at the Casablanca Hotel. Why? Location, safety, service and overall staff excellence. 
This hotel is In the middle of everything that is exciting in New York City… You may walk to Broadway shows, Times Square, multiple restaurants, Chelsea, Bryant Park, Murray Hill, to New York public library or to Grand Central Station or take the multiple subways outlets to the uptown museums or downtown area. Yet when you get inside this hotel you feel that you are in a safe, friendly, charming place. It’s a relatively small hotel. There is no reason for you to visit this hotel unless you’re staying there. That brings an element of safety to your New York visit. 
Casablanca offers to its guests complimentary 24 hours tea, coffee and water. Also offer a complimentary basic breakfast and an evening wine and cheese. 
Rooms and bathrooms are very clean. But  over everything they offer help, service and attention to details. The staff makes the hotel the best.

title: FAMILY WARMTH
text: This hotel far exceeds anybody's expectations of a fine NYC hotel - the staff, the service, the cleanliness of the rooms, the decor throughout this hotel, the food, entertainment and first class service well epitomizes the New York City experience!

title: Vacation in the city
text: Friendly boutique style hotel right in the middle of Times Square. Couldn’t have had a better place to stay with my elderly parents and teenaged sons. Great food, personable staff, lots of room to stretch out in when we were tired of the city noise.

title: Perfect Location
text: So close to Times Square, theaters and NYC sights, this marvelous hotel provides excellent service and attentive staff at a reasonable price. The amenities are nice. Especially welcome is the wine and cheese reception offered each night. The staff is friendly, attentive, and made us feel welcome and valued. The rooms are not large but are well appointed and comfortable. The Casablanca has a classic feel and look.

title: 30th anniversary
text:
Great hotel, bit of calmness away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  No sit down restaurant meals here but they do do breakfast, not cooked, more continental.    They lay on pastries and tea in the afternoon and cheese and wine snacks in the evening.
Staff are great, really helpful, not in your face but just the right balance.  
Rooms were fine for us, nicely decorated, clean and tidy. Had everything we could need, for our stay, useful information on the local area as well.  The room was slightly warm but there is ceiling fan and air conditioning.
I would definitely go back here.

title: Our new NYC hotel
text: We LOVE this hotel. Quiet with lots of charm and character in the heart of Time Square. Amazing location if you want to be close to the action on this side of town. The staff was friendly and attentive to all of our needs. Victor was awesome and directed us to where we needed to go every time we walked out the door.We especially enjoyed the morning breakfast and evening snacks. Complimentary water and wifi in the room. We had a late evening flight and left our bags for the day, which was very convenient. Will definitely be back!

title: Times Square
text:
Friendly helpful staff,great for meeting fellow guests at breakfast and cheese and wine evenings love the groups concept but probably select hotel away from Times Square in future trips but that is an individual opinon not a reflection of the standard of the Casablanca
Comfy rooms and beds but try not to get room at front as early morning traffic can be noisy

title: Short New York break
text:
This hotel is in a great location, with a secure entrance and a very professional team.
The hotel lounge furniture was more suited for a conservatory but comfortable enough. 
Breakfast was fruit, yogurt, pastries, hard boiled eggs and toast would be supplied if requested. Plenty of hot drinks and juices, all self service. There was only one morning where we had to share a table with other guests, as breakfast time was so busy.
The wine with cheese and biscuits between 5-8pm is a great idea, not that we really had time to participate.
We would be more than happy to stay at this hotel again and would be more than happy to recommend to other visitors.

title: Excellent location and great staff
text:
A half block from Time Square, and yet an oasis of calm and tranquility.   

As tourists to the city we found the staff friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.   We enjoyed the complimentary cheese and wine in the evening and the continental style breakfast in the morning.  Albeit they do charge a daily “resort fee”.

Our room was small, but spotlessly clean and as we were out most of the day the soft comfortable beds were all we really used it for.  The bathroom was good size, and again very clean.

We ad expected it to be noisy, given location, but we weren’t disturbed at night.

title: Perfection once again
text: One of the best and most unique hotels in the city. Outstanding service, good size rooms, and comfortable lounge area.  There may be less expensive hotels in the area, but it's worth the extra to stay here.

title: Excellent
text:
Perfect location< very nice and very polite staff, Breakfast included and from 17.00 to 20.00 hrs 
free wine and lots of snacks.
The staff at the reception very knowledgeable for directions, book a restaurant, arranged private pickup from and returned to the airport.

title: loved it
text: this will be my hotel in New York from now on. the best ever. great location, lovely staff allways willing to help, biutifull and cleen room, very styleish with butifull decoration. the coffee and cake in the lobby are great.

title: Good Location
text: Staff were very welcoming!  Hotel was clean but  old.  Noisy through wall air conditioner was functional.  Lounge was a wonderful perk. with complimentary coffee, tea, snacks available throughout day.  Great location.

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Great stay and very friendly staff. Especially enjoyed the wine and cheese reception each evening. Rooms were very comfortable and well designed. We had a mini suite which gave us  some additional room.

title: 84 yo woman traveling alone
text: The location is ideal and the decor lovely. As an 84 yo woman traveling alone, I appreciated the attentive service and friendliness of all staff, as well as the time saved in my days by the hotel's very ample breakfast and the evening reception. An emergency meant I had to check out early, and very hurriedly. The manager, front and other staff saw to making itinerary changes for me, and to all other needs during that hectic morning. Throughout my life I've traveled widely and in my experience, the Casablanca is a hotel nonpareil.

title: Great New York hotel
text: I spent a few days in this hotel in May and absolutely LOVED it!  The staff is incredibly nice.  They saw that my daughter was graduating and left us a bottle of champagne in the room!  You can hear a pin drop in the rooms it's so quiet but when you walk out you are in the middle of NY City--right next to Times Square.  They have a lovely breakfast sitting area where there is always tea, coffee, fruit and snacks all day long (as well as a complimentary Happy Hour).  Just a brilliant place to stay (and I'm super picky!)

title: Good find
text: Really convenient, half block from Times Square. Walkable to all theaters and anything in midtown. Once Inside you’d never know. Like taking a step back to slower, quieter times in old NYC. Clean and comfy plus convenient if simple breakfast and happy hour. Only weird thing is opaque windows. Could see if it was light out, but no idea if it was raining or sunny until we headed outSide

title: Great hotel for couples and adults!
text: I will definitely be back to stay at this small, intimate, beautiful hotel. It's quiet (no children), relaxing, and very convenient.  Friendly staff welcomes you every time you come through the door!  The lounge with breakfast, snacks, and wine in the evenings is a wonderful, relaxing place to take a break from walking and sightseeing and the noise of the city.

title: Sweet stay
text: This hotel is a pleasure overall. The staff are all fantastically knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. The room was comfy with a very spacious bathroom. The breakfast was great. My husband enjoyed the free tea and cookies at all hours. They could improve the coffee though.

title: Round up the usual suspects and stay here!
text: Had an issue with threshold between bedroom and bathroom- uneven and a possible trip/fall hazard and not marked - almost did a face plant when I first checked in ... that’s why I did a “not so great” on safety BUT otherwise this place is fun, charming, great staff and in the heart of an exciting part of town, and, of course ...Everybody goes to Rick’s!!

title: Welcome home.
text: A fantastic find in the middle of the NYC theatre district.  Amazing staff who catered to my every need. The day room, Ricks Place is a nice easy going area to meet fellow travelers while enjoying breakfast, afternoon wine and cheese or round the clock pastries and tea.

title: Quiet oasis in the heart of NY
text: Fantastic hotel. Offered a quiet retrieve from the hustle and bustle of NY. Room clean and comfortable, staff couldn’t be more helpful. Complimentary drinks and snacks were ideal. Would stay again if ever back visiting!!

title: It doesn't get any better than this!
text: Perfect location, perfect ambience, perfect hosts. Every single member of staff was incredibly helpful and all had great personalities. Morning coffee and pastries, and evening cheese and wine, was a godsend in this otherwise expensive city. The rooms were very clean and comfortable too. First time here but not the last - I wouldn't stay anywhere else now when in New York.

title: Hidden Gem
text: My husband and I stayed in this quirky, beautiful hotel a few weeks ago and we loved it. The staff are incredibly helpful, the rooms are comfortable and the breakfast in Ricks Cafe was perfect. The location is right next to Times Square and, although busy, this hotel is the perfect little oasis in the city. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and I’m already recommending this hotel to friends. Many thanks to the staff for making us feel so welcome in your beautiful hotel.

title: Best for a reason
text: The Casablanca hotel is a few feet away from Times Square which makes it great for attending a show.  What sets this place apart is the server, everyone is so incredibly helpful and pleasant, I've never seen anything like it.  With free breakfast and a wine/cheese reception nightly you are well taken care of.  The only thing is I wouldn't get a street view room again, the lights and noise from Times Square were bothersome but they offer complimentary white noise makers, light blockers, etc. to help with this.

title: Fabulous
text: Very central location, in heart of Times Square. Very noisy outside but inside of the hotel is very calm. Breakfast was good. We only missed omlete with bacon. We liked so much "happy hour" with wine and cheese. During all day you drink coffe and water, eat some cookies.

title: Excellent location for shopping
text: Snack bar - awesome idea. Comfortable hotel with good service. I like the gym (NYSC) access which is 2 blocks away - fully equipped. Excellent location for access to shops. Very pleased with my stay and would recommend this to others.

title: Great Again
text: Just returned from our third stay at the Casablanca.  Always will be our first choice. Great location, close to theatre and times square but quiet and serene once you are in this boutique property.  Rooms are the usual small NYC size, but clean, quiet and comfortable.  Rick's Cafe is a great amenity to enjoy breakfast, wine and cheese or just kick back.

title: Heaven in NYC
text: My friend and I visit NYC every May.  We always stay at the Casablanca.  We are always treated like family.  Each employee is very friendly and would do anything to help you.  The hotels location is perfect for what we need. We feel right at home.

title: The Best
text: Its the only place where you would stay in New York just the best, close to everything great breakfast and the most wonderful staff and a great room. We have stayed there twice and hope there are more stays to come

title: Convenient and stylishly comfortable hotel
text:
A lovely quaint stylish hotel conveniently located just off Times Square. The Casablanca is a beautifully stylish hotel with all the charms of the past. The hotel was spotlessly clean from the small reception area up to the comfortable and relaxing rooms.
The guys on the front desk were exceptionally friendly and helpful as was the doorman. Ricks Cafe on the second floor was conveniently positioned with a continental style breakfast available every morning, coffee tea and snacks throughout the day and wine cheese and snacks available in the evening, all complimentary.
The room on the 5th floor overlooking 93rd Street was spacious and clean with a good sized bathroom. Ironing facilities and a decent hair dryer which my wife tells me is essential on any trip, are available along with daily complimentary bottles of water and a safe deposit box.
The thing I like about this hotel was its proximity to the busy Times Square being only 50 yards away but turn into 93rd street and the hustle and bustle just disappears.
To eat - Tony’s right next door is a busy reasonable priced Italian and HB Burgers just up the street is also reasonably priced by New York standards.
It was a bit noisy at night hence a 4 and not a 5 star review. This was due not to the hoards of people on Times Square but to the NYPD vehicles parked outside the hotel on 93rd. It did give a feeling of security but why do they have to switch on there siren for a short blast every time they move away! A bit annoying in the middle of the night but on day three we used a ‘noise cancelling device’ in the room which made an ocean wave sound! Surprisingly I slept like a log for the rest of the stay!!
Overall the hotel was excellent and would recommend to anyone who is looking for a hotel with a comfortable, convenient and above all personal touch then this is the place for you.

title: Excellent hotel and great location
text:
This hotel offers excellent customer service. Has a great location, just off Times Square
The staff are all very friendly and made us feel part of their family, they could not do enough for us
The buffet breakfast was very good, not just croissants and pastries but also fresh fruit salad and a variety of breads and bagels for toasting
Also the cheese and wine sessions went down a treat
The room was very clean and the bed was so comfortable

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We visit the city several times a year and enjoy trying different hotels. Totally loved the unique, special
experience at the Casablanca. Even though it is a few steps from Times Square, when you walk into the charming lobby it’s like a hidden jewel. James welcomed us with warm, enthusiastic information about the space. The rooms are small, very clean.  we had the suite which was perfect for 3. Rick’s on the second floor is like a 24 club level for everyone. There is a lovely breakfast with pastries, coffee, juices, bagels, etc and the staff is so nice. Maria was so sweet to toast bagels and serve us with such care. They really wait on you hand and foot making sure you have everything you need and so sweet with special requests (trays for taking things to room, etc). There is a 3 hour wine and cheese time that is perfect between NY activities. The front desk is always ready to help with dinner reservations, anything you need. The location is perfect, great value.  We will be back.

title: Beautiful hotel in a brilliant location
text: Just back from a 5 night stay at this  amazing hotel we were a group of 12 the staff are amazing couldn’t do enough for us always smiling and helpful on the main reception, rooms were beautiful and clean ,plenty of choices for breakfast and free coffee and tea and cakes plus free cheese and wine from 5till 8 after a very busy day sightseeing this was really lovely ,cannot recommended this hotel enough we hope to come back soon xx❤️❤️

title: Stay at Casablanca hotel New York
text: Excellent hotel , served all our needs, would definitely stay there again , it’s like an oasis in a busy part of New York, the room was lovely, staff friendly and informative, wine and cheese was a nice touch.

title: Excellent!
text: Staff was helpful  and ensured a happy experience. Proximity to Broadway and midtown sites was important to us. Ricks Cafe with breakfast, snacks and Wine and Cheese Bar guaranteed a great times. Can’t wait until we go back to New York City!

title: Casablanca Hotel
text: Great hotel in the heart of Times Square. An oasis from city chaos. Old world flavor in a thriving city. Steps away from Broadway and city transportation. Staff are personable and accommodating. Free wine and cheese from 5 to 8. Outstanding hotel. Well worth a stay.

title: Always an Excellent Stay
text: This place is so close to everything, and if you need anything, the hotel staff will take care of it for you.  John (the General Manager) treats us like family every time we stay at the Casablanca Hotel.  That's why we have stayed there every year since 2007 when we discovered this gem!

title: Homey Oasis in the heart of NYC
text: The Casablanca hotel is lovely.. It is steps away from Times Square, yet once you step inside you feel like you are in a small inn. The rooms were nicely decorated with modern bathrooms. We were upgraded from our original choice overlooking the courtyard to a room next to the elevator which was a bit noisy; however when I expressed my concerns we were moved to another room towards the back of the hotel which was very quiet.  The breakfast, snacks throughout the day and cocktail hour were well worth the add-on fee. The staircase leading to the lounge/dining area is surrounded by a beautiful mural. We were only in town for an overnight stay to celebrate our anniversary but felt whisked away to another time and place.

title: Excellent Hotel, with a but!
text: It is the second time that we used the Casablanca Hotel with my family by visiting New York. The location is perfect, the staff great and possibly we will use the same Hotel in our next visit. I would agree with all the extra positive remarks I read in the different reviews apart from one, the breakfast! Very simple!! I travel a lot and have stayed in different Hotels all over the world so I have some experience. I could accept that there is no omelette, I actually don't eat eggs, but no cheese, no ham, no choice of breads. Many pastries full of butter, two different types of butter, nothing lighter and healthier. The marmalades with a flat texture, could be better, The coffee was good, from machine but now this is becoming standard.

title: Dated hotel but fabulous location...
text:
Location is perfect, a stones throw from Times Square. Hotel is extremely dated, everything is old and for the price it just didn’t feel up to speck. Our double room was tiny which is normal for new york. The decor and excessive amount of furniture made it even smaller. Bathroom was tiny and we had to move the bed to close the door. There was a tiny TV in the room and we were extremely disappointed as the website states premium channels yet they didn’t have HBO (we’re all big GOT fans and had to book a room at another hotel for the night to watch it). The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming. The breakfast was perfect for what it was, I don’t understand how such an expensive hotel do not offer a hot menu. However, the selection of cold items was great. 
Overall, It was not worth the price we paid and I feel anyone with high expectations will be disappointed.

title: Great Staff !!!!
text: It is the staff and service that makes this hotel so wonderful . Breakfast and wine and cheese reception is another reason. Both were spectacular !! Would definitely stay here again while in manhattan .

title: Our favorite NYC hotel
text: We love this hotel! It is clean, conveniently located, comfortable, and the staff is outstanding. They are friendly and helpful -- they even recognize us on return visits. We love the breakfast in the second-floor lounge and always encounter interesting people there. The food is fresh, with good choices.

title: Weekend Visit
text: Upon late arrival we had a problem with our driver.  The hotel staff immediately got involved to help us in what was a rather awkward situation and the problem was resolved.  The room was very clean and well appointed and amazingly quiet considering it is so close to Times Square.  The staff are exceptional, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable - absolutely second to none!

title: NYC
text: Enjoyed the Casablance Hotel very much.  Nice and quiet.  Close to Times Square and theaters.  Everyone was friendly and helpful.  Breakfast nice, basic fare.  Evening wine social enjoyable.  Tony di Napoli next door and very good.  Will return.

title: We will be back!
text: This was a wonderful place to stay in NYC! Great location, clean and pristine room, helpful and accommodating staff. This was a birthday weekend. The staff left cupcakes and a bottle of wine in the room. The cafe has refreshments available all day long. I do not have one complaint about the Casablanca. Only praises! Thank you for a n enjoyable stay!

title: great location
text:
location great - just off times square - 30m.
cleanliness - fantastic.
staff - superb. especially all the reception guys.
lounge - no bar but free coffee and snacks 24hs and free wine and snacks 5pm till 8pm every evening.
breakfast - continental but totally ample and very fresh.

title: Excelente localização em um hotel simples
text:
Nos hospedamos no Casablanca Hotel by Library Hotel Colletion por 1 noite .

PONTOS POSITIVOS (+)
•Excelente localização, está 43, a melhor localização que pode existir na região da Times Square ! 
Apenas 1/2 quadra da Times Square, 4 quadras da maioria dos teatros. 
Tem estacionamento ao lado que custa U$30 por 24 horas, metade do valor que normalmente os hotéis na região cobram! 
•Os funcionários são atenciosos !
•Oferecem um “chá da tarde” com queijo e vinho, incluso na diária 
•É muito limpo!
•O quarto é silencioso e escuro para dormir. Que para nós é importantíssimo em um hotel 

PONTOS NEGATIVOS (-)
•O hotel é em um prédio antigo e a decoração foi mantida em estilo antigo, nada moderno! 
•Os quartos são pequenos , mesmo o quarto King que reservamos , e o banheiro também é pequeno com uma banheira muito pequena !
•Não funcionava o aquecedor no quarto e o funcionando do hotel nos levou um aquecedor portátil, de plástico, muito simples, que também não funcionou!
•Não tem piscina nem academia e nem espaço para relaxar, como um living ou lounge... só tem a sala do café da manhã !
•Mesmo sem existir piscina, academia , nos cobram U$25 de resort fee ... sinceramente não entendemos a cobrança dessa taxa, já que não oferecem nada além do quarto ! 
•Café da manhã muito simples, continental

title: Peace in chaotic Times Square
text:
We’ve just returned from a four night stay at this hotel. We had high expectations due to the reviews and it didn’t disappoint. For us, it had the ideal location - right next to the madness of Times Square and within minutes of a subway station. 
Maybe the hotel was quite low on numbers when we were there as we only ever came across a handful of other guests throughout our stay. We are early risers and the 7am start to breakfast suited us very well and we had no trouble with finding a table. We popped back to the hotel a few times on our days out and it was quite handy to pop into Rick’s to get a tea/coffee. The ladies serving in there were always friendly and we found the Continental breakfast varied enough for us, with the staff offering to toast bagels or bread, if required.
The hotel is a bit dark and dingy in places and our room on the 6th floor was particularly so - with no natural light as such. However, the hotel was amazingly quiet, particularly considering it’s proximity to Times Square and as a light sleeper, I was grateful for this. Also, there was very little noise from doors closing and guests walking up and down the corridors.
We took advantage of the DVD library and although the majority of the films were fairly old, we chose three classics (in our opinion) set in New York. 
The doormen were always courteous and were very helpful when it came to storing our bags on our final day. The hotel even allows you to use Rick’s after you have checked out.
To us, this hotel has a family-run feel to it and we would have no problem in recommending this as a place to stay.

title: Boutique Times Square
text: This was our first stay in any Library Hotel and for the most part very enjoyable. We arrived at 6 am from a red eye flight. Ground level entry is a small room with front desk, and the attendant said he would expedite turnover of our room for check-in. We were directed to the 2nd floor to hang out in the lounge (Rick's Cafe) which is open 24/7. The lounge is moderately comfortable with water, coffee, cookies available at all times. Continental breakfast (pastries, bagels, cereal, fruit) started at 7 am. We continued to wait for our room hopefully; the staff was very attentive, and twice during the morning went down to the front desk to check on our room. At 2 pm our room still wasn't ready, and we gave up and headed out so as not to waste the whole day; this was the only disappointment of our stay, hard to believe housekeeping could not have our room ready sooner (to be fair, check-in is at 3, but given checkout is noon...). The hotel is literally steps from Times Square, perfect Midtown location. And Tony's di Napoli, which we always enjoy, is adjacent. After finally checking in late afternoon, our luggage was brought up promptly. We had a premium king room, which was fairly large (even by NY standards). The room faced a small interior space, so there was no view, but also no noise; due to the proximity of other rooms across, we kept the shade closed; as there is only one window, and with the interior room location, there was not much sunlight, so some may not like the dark atmosphere of the room. A dorm-style fridge was very convenient; complimentary bottled water was replenished every day. The small bathroom did not feel cramped. The shower head was nice, and there was instant hot water. We stayed 3 nights, mainly to see Broadway shows, and the staff was very pleasant throughout.

title: The most welcoming hotel in New York
text: This is an older, relatively small, well refurbished hotel with an attractive Bogey/Bergman/Morocco decor and a charming second floor lounge for relaxing and snacks. We had a small suite that was pleasant and comfortable, and surprisingly quiet. The staff is incredibly welcoming and caring. Highly recommended.

title: Not as good as expected
text:
We stayed here for 2 nights April 2019 , the room was clean , towels changed daily and quiet.
I appreciate that getting a room in New York without traffic / street noise is a bonus but it’s nice to have daylight in the room . We had a room on 5 th floor , upgraded apparently as we were celebrating my retirement . One small window looking into a void housing the fire escape . No further on that . The dining room here doubles as communal sitting area etc.
Breakfast may take many visits before finding seating , even if it’s only at a coffee table, it’s way too small for the capacity .
Staff are excellent from reception to room service staff , superb.
Location is good , 1 minute from times sq and Bryant Park . 
Please don’t take this as negative review but very honest finding .

title: Quiet place, great location
text: Great find! Although a half block from Times Square, once inside you would never know you were so close to all the action,. Quiet, comfortable, and great service. We loved the easy access to everything, especially a couple subway stops. But it was a great respite from the action. The breakfast was perfect, and the happy hour even better. Both served in a spacious comfortable setting.

title: Best staff ever!
text: This was our third time staying at this hotel. Staff is amazing, rooms are nice, and the location is perfect. We will definitely stay here on our next visit. It's the perfect location for anything you want to do, see, or eat!

title: Fantastic  Boutique Hotel
text: The location is right in the heart of Times Square and close to all Manhattan attractions. The staff is superb and their customer service is the same. Nightly wine reception in the library  and a morning continental breakfast is icing on the cake. Highly recommend this hotel.

title: Gem in the heart of Times Square
text: This property is perfect...especially, if it is your first trip to New York.  Easy walk to Central Park or to Rockafeller Center.  Bryant Park is beautiful and close to the New York Public Library (definitely worth seeing).  There is just so much to see and do. The subway access is easy or start walking in either direction to begin exploring.  The hotel is very quiet and relaxing after a day (or night) of your special adventure. You won't be disappointed!

title: Wonderful stay at Casablanca.  Higley recommended. Looking forward to coming back again.
text: A great place to stay in the heart of Manhattan. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was quiet with a super King size bed. And loved having a true bathtub to soak in. Rick’s lounge is a treasure.

title: Phenomenal customer service
text: The room was spacious and clean,  the staff could not do enough for us.  The  lounge was great and the best was when a patron started playing the piano during happy hour and about 20 people started singing alone--it was so much fun.

title: Cute and very clean
text: We stayed in a room with one queen bed. It had a small table directly in the room and we were able to get a mini fridge. The bathroom had a stand up shower (no tub). The room was much bigger than what I expected in NYC and it was very clean. Definitely worth the cost.

title: Best value in the city!
text: I enjoyed my second stay here immensely. Perfect location, great staff, quiet room, and the bed was super comfy. All of this and the price was very reasonable. Any time I come back to the city, I definitely will be staying here.

title: Another great stay at the Casablanca
text:
We returned for our fourth visit. The hotel ticks all the boxes and we would not think of staying anywhere else in New York.

We can fault anything. The breakfast and drinks reception are a great touch.

We will return for our 4th visit soon.

title: best find in NY
text: reasonable NY price and you get security, great service, love ambience of personal and public rooms, great breakfast, and although we rarely get the opportunity to participate in happy hour, a great happy hour

title: Kleines feines Hotel
text: Wie schon in der Überschrift erwähnt, ist das Casablanca ein kleines, aber feines Hotel. Wir wurden sehr freundlich empfangen, auch die restliche Zeit war das Personal sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit. Super Lage zum Times Square, trotzdem ruhige Zimmer. Wir haben den Aufenthalt sehr genossen.

title: BEST KEPT SECRET
text: I always stay at Casablanca. I very selfishly hate for it be discovered. My sisters stay there also. My husband likes the fact that I am safe. I like being able to walk to the theater and great restaurants.

title: My second review - another 5 stars
text:
We stayed here four years ago, and liked it so much that we came back.  Unfortunately, my wonderful review did not go unnoticed, and others like it so much that they have raised their prices.  Still worth it though. 

My wife asked during our stay, why is this a four star hotel?  It's not been recently renovated, and the rooms aren't that special?  My answer was that although it's not all new and shiny, everything worked, the beds were good, nothing is "worn out" but it's really the service.  From the door men to the concierge to the housekeeping and the young ladies that serve continental breakfast and pour the wine in the afternoon, everyone is nice, professional and extremely helpful. A five star hotel would be all that and maybe a bit more up-to-date, but you'll also pay twice the price.

On top of that, you are literally steps away from Times Square and a block or two from Hell's Kitchen.  The rooms are quiet - I never heard any neighbors, and they have improved the A/C since last time so that they don't make a racket.  If I had to pick something to complain about, I'd mention the very small, very slow and probably very old elevators. 

Our first trip there was in a standard room, which is typically NYC small and cramped.  This time I splurged on a suite, and it (for me) was worth the extra money.  The bathroom was either extremely well maintained or recently redone.  The furniture, although not new, is all in excellent condition. The beds were neither extremely firm nor soft, but we both slept very well.  Far too often hotel beds are lumpy and worn out; this was not the case at the Casablanca.

title: Haven of hospitality.
text:
We arrived about 0830 on Sunday morning and check-in isn’t until 1500.  We weren’t worried because we have stayed here before.  We knew they would be kind and thoughtful and they didn’t disappoint us.  We received a warm welcome from a couple of dapper chaps at reception and they assured us that even though the hotel was fully booked, they would endeavour to get us into the room as soon as possible.  In the meantime, they invited us to have breakfast upstairs in Rick’s Cafe.  We gave Victor our luggage for safe-keeping and up the stairs we went, happy to read a complimentary New York Times and choose from a wonderful array of cereals, pastries, fruit, coffees and teas and juices.  Yum.  Oh, and hard-boiled eggs.  Top quality, everything fresh, and a lovely young woman toasting breads and bagels, keeping the counter and room  refreshed and tidy.  We were in a blissful state and it couldn’t get better when it was announced to us that our room was available at 1015.
Room 410 is a good size, heavenly king mattress and lots of gorgeous bedding including several types of pillows from which to choose.  They make it clear that your wish is their command and they really mean it.  We met several members of housekeeping and maintenance  who were lovely as well and keep the rooms so clean and organized.
This hotel just makes us happy.  You know those little niggling things that occur in hotels such as a lack of organisation or cleanliness or thoughtfulness?  Well, relax when you enter this haven of hospitality.  The team are one step ahead of you.  They have anticipated your needs and are there to serve.  With sincerity and smiles.
Whoever owns this hotel must have a policy of hiring only kind people and wanting the guests to be happy,  I don’t think I have ever felt this way with any other hotel.  I love it here and am so grateful for their business acumen.  It doesn’t feel like money is the most important thing; guests are. We know there are three other hotels owned by the same company and we are curious to try them.  Undoubtedly they are excellent as well but the Casablanca instils such loyalty in us that it is hard to book even at another Library Hotel.  (But next time we might try.  Maybe).

title: Wonderful stay
text:
We stayed at the Casablanca Hotel for 3 nights before a cruise.
The location was perfect for taking the subway for our visit to the Statue of Liberty and 9/11 Memorial.
We were able to walk to nice restaurants nearby and also to our Broadway play. The only time we used Lyft was to the Met Museum and to the Manhattan Cruise Port.

The staff at the hotel were just as good as others had said in their reviews. They made us feel comfortable and valued.
Our only one small quibble was that the bagels at Rick's Cafe were a bit stale. I made the mistake of not having mine toasted the first morning. Otherwise, there were good choices and the items were tasty. I especially appreciated the fresh fruit.
One of the mornings we went next door to the Brooklyn Diner. It was just OK for the money. The other 2 mornings we happily enjoyed breakfast in Rick's Cafe.

Our room with king bed overlooked the courtyard and was very quiet.
We will gladly stay at Casablanca again if we make another trip to New York.

title: Love love love!
text:
Couldn’t be closer to the heart of Times Square. Rooms are cosy but spotlessly clean and comfortable. 

Rick’s Lounge is absolutely awesome!!! Great to have a few drinks and snacks at the end of the day before you start your night out!

The staff at this hotel are unbelievable!!
I can’t speak more highly of the them!!! Boys you are legends!! The guys went above and beyond to make my birthday special and went to a lot of trouble organising Yankees tickets for us. 

We will be back soon and will be staying again at the Casablanca 100%

title: Excellent Stay at the Casablanca Hotel
text:
I was in New York for only 2 nights / 3 days and decided to stay at the Casablanca Hotel due to its No 1 Position on Trip Advisor. 
The hotel is very well situated within close proximity to Times Square and in Midtown. The check-in was very efficient and my room was fairly decent and comfortable. Enjoyed the evening wine and cheese experience.
Only concern was the noise from the street in the early hours in the morning but overall an excellent experience and worthy of praise

title: A welcoming oasis of calm.
text:
The location of the hotel could not be better - it is just steps away from
Times Square and Broadway. However, when you step inside everything is so tranquil and peaceful. 
All the staff are very welcoming and go out of their way to make you feel welcome and ensure your stay goes well. 
We had booked a petite queen and knew it would be small but it was actually plenty big enough- especially bearing in mind the size of hotel rooms generally in NYC. Also, we had come to do things rather than spend a lot of time in our room.  
We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and the 24/7 snacks and drinks were much appreciated. On a Friday night there is live piano music in the bar.
I would suggest booking directly with the hotel rather than through a third party.

title: Quick Weekend Fun
text: Hotel is close to all the fun, but quiet and cozy.  Clean and every staff member was well trained and pleasant.  Can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city.  The amenities are a very nice addition to the hotel service.

title: A fine hotel with valuable amenities and great staff
text: Great location near Time Square. Lots of subtle adds, but the best feature is Rick's lounge on the second floor which brings guests together, providing breakfasts, all day treats and a wine and cheese happy hour. Service is friendly and our room was well appointed. Great value in downtown Manhattan. Will return.

title: 클래식한 멋을 위한 곳
text: 지인이 추천해서 방문하게 된 곳이었는데 정말 만족스러웠습니다. 이제까지 주로 깔끔하고 모던한 업스케일 호텔들을 선호했었는데, 이렇게 클래식함을 느끼게 하는 호텔도 좋네요. 낡은것과 클래식한것의 한끗 차이를 잘 관리한 호텔이라고 생각합니다. 서비스,룸컨디션,가격 모두 만족스러웠어요.

title: Oasi ....
text: Una bellisiimo soggiorno ed è un hotel che ti piace sempre tornare pulizia profumi atmosfera, ed ecc ne vale la pena andare è soggiornare  non ho potuto gustare i piattima ci ritornero sicuramente.. bravi ragazzi ...

title: Amazing!
text: The rooms are wonderful, clean, ornate, and spacious. The hotel as a whole has a spectacular atmosphere and the old world charm and just walking into the casablanca, you feel relaxed and a wonderful escape from the busy New York City. An amazing stay, wonderful staff, in my opinion, the best reasonably priced rooms in all of Midtown. Love love loved it!!

title: Great hotel
text: Small & very friendly hotel located just off Time Square. A peaceful haven from the hustle & bustle yet close to theatres etc. Excellent service from all staff. Good buffet breakfast & the cheese & wine reception each evening is excellent. Room was cosy. Definitely recommend.

title: Couples getaway
text: We LOVE LOVE this place. Perfectly located and amazing amenities.  Highly recommended for a couples getaway.  The library for breakfast and the wine and cheese reception at night are the perfect complement to wonderful weekend in NYC.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: We did a girl’s trip to NYC and booked the suite. The hotel is small and older, but so clean and the staff were excellent (Moses, John, Dimitri, Stanley, etc.).  There were four of us in a room and it was just fine. The hotel is clean and soooooooo close to Times Square and Broadway. There is breakfast served in the morning and complimentary wine and cheese in the evenings. The staff are exceptionally friendly. Would definitely book again and recommend.

title: NYC for our grand daughter
text:
The wife and I brought our grand daughter to NYC for a HS graduation gift.  Broadway, The Met, 7 line, her dream vacation.
Of course we stayed at Casablanca!  Perfect location, great rooms and -in my opinion, what makes this Hotel stand out from others - the people that work there.
Everyone was friendly, helpful and seemed to genuinely enjoy working there.  The ladies at Rick's Café deserve a mention - always helpful, always smiling.
Bottom line - at Casablanca you really do feel like family.
Pros - everything, the people are icing on the cake
Cons - none

Would I stay there again.  Yes, already trying to figure out when we can go back!

title: Granddaughter’s 21st
text: My daughter, granddaughter and myself spent 5 days exploring New York. We felt completely safe and found everyone so helpful. We visited all the main attractions and booked in advance from England to save time. Well worth doing. I wouldn’t bother with the hop on hop off bus again as we could walk faster. Traffic awfully busy!

title: Location, location, location
text: Perfect location if you want to quickly be in the mix of Times Square. Easy walk (3-4 blocks) from Hell’s Kitchen area, Bryant Park, NYPL. Staff at Casablanca very nice & attentive. Rooms are fine, need some updates. Great amenity choices such as sleep phone system. Location & attentive staff clearly are the reason for the high ratings.

title: Casa Blanca in March
text: We liked how close this is to theatres and the subway. Loved breakfast and wine/snacks happy hour. The rooms were very clean. Ours had no view, but most importantly, it was very quiet. The staff was friendly and very responsive.

title: Great Staff!
text: Furnishings are very old.  Location is excellent and the staff was outstanding.  A special shout out for Victor, bell captain and Maria who prepares the breakfast.  We enjoyed being able to mingle with the other guests which were from all over the world.

title: A gem in the heart of Times Square
text: I have been many times to NYC amd have never noticed this hotel before. It will be my go to hotel in the future. It was comfortable, clean, quiet and the service was perfect. The breakfast and happy hour made the weekend complete.

title: Empfehlenswertes Hotel am Times Square
text: Wir waren eine Woche im Casablanca Hotel zu Gast und wir sind vollauf zufrieden mit unserem Aufenthalt. Die ideale Lage am Times Square ist ein idealer Ausgangspunkt für die Erkundung von NYC zu Fuß und mit der Subway.Trotz dieser exponierten Lage bekamen wir vom Straßenlärm nichts mit. Das Hotel ist etwas älter jedoch gut renoviert, alle Räume sind gepflegt und sehr sauber. Unser Zimmer war klein, wir konnten jedoch unser Gepäck für eine Woche problemlos verstauen.Das gesamte Hotelpersonal war sehr freundlich, kompetent und hilfreich. Im Preis inbegriffen war ein kontinentales Frühstück, Mineralwasser, 24h Kaffee/Teeservice und eine "Happy Hour" von 5:00 - 8:00 pm mit Sekt,Wein, Käse und Knabbereien. Während unseres Aufenthalts waren alle Gäste als Touristen in NYC und alle waren äußerst zufrieden mit dem Casablanca Hotel. Unser Fazit: sehr empfehlenswert und wir kommen sehr gerne wieder.

title: A GREAT Hotel in a GREAT Location
text: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The location is near Time Square, so it was very convenient ... yet is was quiet and peaceful inside the hotel. I like small boutique hotels with lots of character and this hotel has it all. The lobby and eating area were nicely decorated in a classic style. The place was very clean. All (and I mean all) the staff were very nice and helpful. They treated you like a friend that. The continental breakfast was good, I would definitely stay here again,

title: Great location, good staff
text: Good boutique hotel near Broadway and all the various tourist things in Times Square.  Was there with family on spring break - staff was courteous and helpful.  Small rooms, no gym, but pretty good value for money in area, especially considering complementary continental breakfast / cocktail hour.  Wouldn't necessarily stay there for business given lack of business amenities nor gym, but perfect for our needs.

title: First time in NYC and Casablanca
text: This hotel provides the best location , service and comfort. From the moment you walk through the front door and are greeted with ‘welcome home’  to having breakfast and enjoying the wine and cheese this hotel is a pleasure to stay in.

title: Wonderful stay at the Casablanca!
text: Excellent location. Comfortable and friendly hotel. The second floor lounge is very convenient and pleasant. James was especially helpful and sweet! The adjacent restaurant Tony's was also excellent. We wouldn't hesitate to return.

title: Gem in Times Square
text: I had tried to get a reservation here for other trips but they were always booked. Delighted to get a room for a recent trip with my daughter. The hotel is cozy with themed decor. Steps away from Times Square and the Metro. Front desk staff went out of their way to help us with directions. Lounge staff were very pleasant and active in making sure we had everything we wanted whether having breakfast, afternoon tea or evening wine.

title: Very convenient location
text: Close to Broadway and Times Square, this hotel is very conveniently located. Offers a different atmosphere than big hotel chains in the area albeit for a price. Staff very nice and courteous. Rooms are small and are generally quiet because they have windows to a small backyard or the house next door. Air conditioning is basic, consists of window unit, we were advised to open the window if we were too hot. May be an issue in hot summers. Breakfast bar could benefit from additional options (salmon, cheese?).

title: Reputation well deserved
text:
We stayed here in late January. The location is fantastic, just steps from Time Square and its sSubway Station. Given its location, I thought the hotel would be noisy, I was quite wrong. The rooms are not large by chain hotel standards on interstate but for NYC, adequate. Our bathroom somewhat paradoxical was close to the same size as the sleeping area. The room had a sound machine that helped blot out street noise that I found to be delightful. 
Two things make the hotel special. The staff is the most welcoming of any of the many much more "famous" NYC hotels in which I have stayed. Doorman are the face of hotels and this hotel's have some of the best. Ask for advice and they give you an enthusiastic response. The second thing is a continental breakfast is included of good quality. There are also snacks available in the evening at Rick's cafe which actually has a more library like atomosphere located on the second floor. By-by Waldorf. This is now our go to in NYC

title: Fabulous Hotel
text: This hotel absolutely could not be better!  It is a hidden gem, easy to miss, but delightful.  The location was very close to Times Square and walking distance to the Broadway theaters. On entering we were greeted like we were dear friends. When we got to our room there was a bottle of wine, two wine glasses and a personal note congratulating us on our anniversary.  Every afternoon an elegant  service of wine and appetizers are served in their large and lovely host room.  Also, their rates are very reasonable.  They also arranged for our ride to the airport.  We will always have fond memories at Casablanca

title: Steps from Times Square
text:
Worth every penny.  People at the front desk were wicked friendly and helpful.  We loved the 24 hour self serve common area on the second floor.  Great place to meet up with family also staying at The Casablanca.  It is also where they served breakfast in the morning and wine and cheese in the evening.  Just one example of how great the staff was...when we checked out the NYC half marathon had many roads closed including the road the hotel is on.  We were unsure how to get to the airport.  One of the guys at the front desk grabbed our luggage and took us to the end of the road and put us in a cab to the airport.  
Our room was a 2 room suite on the street side.  Great room but it was very loud with car horns and sirens.  Our son had a smaller interior room which they said was very quiet.  If city noise will bother you opt for the interior room.  Either way the location was literally steps from Times Square.  It was awesome to leave a Broadway show and walk back to the hotel.  I would not hesitate to stay here again.

title: “Hidden Treasure...Absolutely Loved It!!”
text: I would stay here again in a heart beat. My daughter and I came to New York to see some broadway shows and see the sights of New York. The location of this hotel is perfect, just around a corner and you are right there in Times Square. We arrived late in the evening from JFK, we chose to take Lyft from the airport and it was perfect. The driver was so friendly and pointed out many landmarks on the way. We arrived at the hotel around 11 pm and were greeted by a very friendly staff. The Bellman brought us up to our room and gave us a nice introduction to what was available to us and all the amenities to the room. We had a bottle of wine and champagne waiting for us, also two bottles of water and chocolates. The room is small but it had everything that we needed, it was clean and the bathroom was beautiful. The shower had great pressure and they provide robes and slippers.   I can’t say enough wonderful things about the staff, the breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese staff were always so accommodating. We ate dinner next door at Tony’s (so awesome as well), we could not eat the whole meal so we saved it and had it the next evening during wine and cheese hour. The gals heated up our dinner for us and served it to us at our table. They also prepare your oatmeal in the morning for you, served with Strawberries and blueberries, they make it so beautiful. You will not regret staying here.  Thanks so much Casablanca for a wonderful vacation.

title: Always again!
text: Fantastic location, nice small hotel, friendly staff. The service in Rick's Café in 2.Floor was great, the atmosphere cosy. The room was small, but cosy and comfortable. Would choose the hotel always again!

title: great mid-town hotel
text: Rooms are spacious, very clean, and comfortable in an older, very well cared-for building (lots of character).  Hotel staff is professional and helpful. Perfect location. Breakfast bar and wine and snack hour in afternoon are convenient, although seating is somewhat limited at prime hours. Very enjoyable stay!

title: Loved it enough to return without hesitation
text: Sorry for a lengthy review, but there is so much to praise here. We used the hotel's outsourced limo service for airport pickup and return. The total cost (including tolls and tips) for both rides was $216. We had used a shuttle service on our previous NYC trips, but a cost comparison showed the shuttle would have cost just under $200, so the difference of less than $20 was well worth the personal and private service. We were delivered to the hotel before 9 a.m. and the staff went out of its way to find us a vacant room so that we could rest after a 10-hour flight. Shortly after entering our room, a maid delivered a welcome back gift of wine -- totally unexpected and appreciated. We noticed the radiator was not working, so I called the front desk and within minutes someone came to adjust it. He told us that if we wanted more heat, they would provide a space heater, which we later requested. Each day, the maid left us two bottles of water, chocolates and a note about tomorrow's weather report. The mattress was very comfortable and we had a choice of pillows. The free breakfast was basic -- breads, cold and hot cereal, pastries, yogurt, juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. No waffles or omelets, but we were satisfied with the food and service. This is a small hotel, so the breakfast room was rarely crowded. If the tables were occupied, people were considerate and quickly left after finishing, and the staff quickly cleaned up. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance of Time Square, theaters, shops, eateries, attractions, and a major subway stop. A police station is nearby, and police cars were usually parked within feet of the hotel's entrance, which made the Casablanca one of the safest spots in the neighborhood. Our room was small, but we appreciated the closet had many hangers and a safe. Bathroom towels were clean and in good shape. Water was hot and pressure was excellent. The facility is a quiet oasis in a high energy city, but the best part of the Casablanca is the people. Always friendly, always thoughtful, always looking out for your comfort. We will stay there again on our next visit.

title: Great Gem near Times Square
text: Charming hotel in an excellent location to theaters and Times Square. The staff is warm and very accommodating. They even reached out before my arrival and arranged transportation. The decor is inviting and while the rooms are not large they are well appointed and comfortable.

title: Only Place We Stay in Midtown
text: We love the Casablanca. The staff is always gracious and helpful--never unctuous or overbearing. The lounge is open and offers goodies 24 hours a day, and is a great place to unwind after the theater. The hotel is small and welcoming. For a theater goer, the location is perfect.

title: My Favorite NYC Hotel
text: Always friendly and helpful staff, great location and a nice breakfast and happy hour in Rick's Cafe.  And considering Manhattan prices, the rates are quite reasonable.  My favorite hotel when I visit New York City.

title: New York City
text: We could not have asked for a more caring, attentive staff from the room attendants, desk staff, and cafe workers. The location was great for all the the attractions. We all enjoyed the breakfast and wine happy hours.

title: amazing service, quiet comfort in heart of Times Square
text: we had a great quick stay at Casablanca. We were celebrating our son's birthday...had arranged upon reserving the room to have cupcakes delivered to our room which was such an awesome touch. The desk staff/bellman were so friendly and welcoming to our boys. Breakfast and happy hour were great. Couldn't believe how quiet the room was for being right in Times Sq. Beds very comfy. We will be returning without hesitation!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Wonderful, safe, quiet, charming hotel in the perfect city location - close to Broadway, Times Square, Bryant Park and everything in-between. Staff was amazingly friendly and accommodating, the continental breakfast and wine and cheese hour can not be beat and we were made to feel safe, cared for and important throughout our stay. I will recommend to all my family and friends!

title: Still Terrific
text: We have visited Casablanca on several occasions and it is great that factors which drew us back after our first stay are still present: a warm and welcoming staff, great amenities, an impressive breakfast and a complementary wine and hors d’oeuvres session in the evening. Coupled with a terrific location just off Times Square and within easy walking distance to Broadway theaters, the Casablanca is easy choice when we visit New York City. I highly recommend it to anyone!

title: Central to Broadway shows
text: Being from Texas, I love having the ability to "host" family from Long Island to join me for happy hour before our Broadway shows and afterwards, being able to invite them in for hot tea and cookies before our goodbyes. Thank you Casablanca for making it all possible!

title: Fantastic
text: I initially thought the price was more than I expected but now I know why. This hotel is in one of the best locations. Just about 1/4 mile from Time Square. There are a number of great selections of restaurants within a block of hotel as well. Can not say enough about the staff. Someone was always there to greet and hold the door for you. Staff recommendations were always spot on. The rooms were very clean. Great wine and cheese selection each evening and coffee and pastries each morning. Honestly the staff makes this place an exceptional value.

title: Latest NYC Vacation
text: Casablanca was wonderful, again.  Warm greeting, easy bag handling, perfect room, steps from Broadway & Times Square and Rick's Café for relaxing and snacks all day.  Pricey, but worth it!  We hope to be back again and again.

title: A gem in bustling Times Square
text: What a lovely little hotel in the middle of Times Square. All the noise and hustle are left at the door when you walk thru the quaint lobby. It’s in a great location - walking distance to many restaurants and Bryant Park.

title: Time Square Delight
text: Very enjoyable place to stay.  The outside rooms on the lower floors are a bit noisy as you hear the street noise but would still stay there again.   The staff was extremely helpful and personable. The bedding was lovely.

title: Sweet suites
text: The suite is sweet! 24-hour espresso, or other hot beverages. Friendly, helpful staff made us comfortable and welcome. Don’t miss the wine and cheese by the fireplace at Rick’s.  We will definitely be back!

title: Great welcome and location
text: This hotel is a great place to choose when visiting NY. Was our second time here and we were just as impressed as before. I particularly liked the breakfast and the evening cheese and wine. All staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. Many thanks!

title: Love this hotel!
text: We’ve stayed here before and woukdn’t Hesitate to do it again!  Staff is very friendly and the extra perks make it wonderful.  The happy hour is great!  They offer an awesome breakfast.  And, the location can’t be beat.

title: Our favorite hotel
text: Staff are outstanding.  We traveled with our 10 year old grandson - his second stay at 5he Casablanca.  He loves it and staff treats all of us with great respect .  We love 5he hotel and it is our go to location

title: Practically Perfect in Every Way
text: Where do I begin. We were late arriving from San Antonio, and literally threw our bags at the front desk so we could make the 8:00 curtain. Wonderful reception and staff. Room was cozy and off the front so no street noise. The simple breakfast was satisfying as was the wine and cheese in the afternoon. The housekeeping staff was friendly and sweet. Just east of Broadway it was a 15 minute walk to Saint Patrick’s and Rockefeller Center.  Great price, wonderful and attentive service, perfect location and nice rooms. We’ll be back here for sure.

title: Lovely stay in Time Square
text: We stayed for one night when our flight home was cancelled. Resort fee covers continental breakfast, all day tea, coffee and pastries and an evening wine and cheese reception which was all really nice. The staff were all very friendly. The room was comfortable and had everything you'd need. Heaters, fans, ear plugs etc are offered if needed. The hotel is on Time Squares door step and a fantastic location for a nights stay right in the heart of everything in NY.

title: Best NYC Hotel I have been sofar
text:
Das Hotel liegt in einer kleinen Seitenstraße, der Times Square ist aber in unmittelbarer Nachbarschaft.

Die Einrichtung ist sehr stilvoll. Das Frühstück war sehr gut. Das Personal ist sehr aufmerksam und freundlich.

title: Lovely stay
text: Stayed for two nights on my way to a work conference. Great spot. Perfectly located for theatre and shopping, comfortable room, helpful staff. The breakfast was spot on, the drinks and snacks all day were very welcome as was the welcoming fire in Rick’s Cafe. So lovely to come in late from the theatre and sit by the fire with a cup of tea and a snack. Only criticisms are that the hotel was a little cold (but it was a particularly cold day) and the bathroom a little small. But really these are minor things compared to the excellent overall experience of staying there. Would definitely stay here again, but if with family I would book a much bigger room.
